sentence: The Alaska Permanent Fund is an appropriation authorized by the Constitution of Oil Revenues, established by voters in 1976 to manage the surplus of the state's oil revenues, largely in anticipation of the recently constructed trans-alaska pipeline network.

name: alaska

sentence: The Permanent Fund has become the rare exception to this, mainly because of the political climate of mistrust that existed at the time of its creation.

name: alaska
sentence: From its initial capital of $734,000, the fund increased to $50 billion due to oil royalties and capital investment programs.

sentence: Beginning in 1982, dividends from the annual growth of the fund were paid each year to eligible Alaskans, ranging from an initial amount of $1,000 in 1982 (equal to three years of payment, since the distribution of payments was suspended in a distribution plan proceeding) to $3,269 in 2008 (which included a one-time amount of $1,200 "Resource Rebate").

sentence: Each year, the state legislature withdraws 8% of the gains, gives 3% to the capital for proof of inflation, and the remaining 5% is distributed to all eligible Alaskans.

name: alaska
sentence: To be eligible for the dividend from the Permanent Fund, one must have lived in the State for at least 12 months, maintain permanent residence subject to authorized absences and not be subject to judicial judgements or criminal convictions that fall within various categories of exclusion or may subject the amount of the payment to civil arrest.

name: alaska
sentence: Like all other American states, Alaska is governed as a republic, with three branches of government: an executive power composed of the Governor of Alaska and his appointees, who heads the executive departments; a legislative power composed of the House of Representatives of Alaska and Senators of Alaska; and a judicial power composed of the Supreme Court of Alaska and the lower courts.

name: alaska
sentence: The Alaskan judicial system has four levels: the Alaskan Supreme Court, the Alaskan Court of Appeal, the Superior Courts and the District Courts.

name: alaska
sentence: Superior and district courts are courts of first instance.

name: alaska

name: alaska

sentence: The Supreme Court hears civil appeals and may, at its discretion, hear criminal appeals.

sentence: Arizona shares the Four Corners region with Utah, Colorado and New Mexico; its other neighbouring states are Nevada and California to the west and the Mexican states of Sonora and Baja California to the south and south-west.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is the 48th state and the last of the contiguous states to be admitted to the Union, obtaining state status on 14 February 1912.

sentence: Due to its large area and variations in altitude, the state has a wide variety of localized climatic conditions.

name: arizona
sentence: At low altitudes, the climate is mainly desert, with mild winters and extremely hot summers.

name: arizona
sentence: Typically, from late autumn to early spring, the weather is mild, on average a minimum of 60°F (16°C).

name: arizona
sentence: November to February are the coldest months, with temperatures generally varying from 40 to 75°F (4 to 24°C), with occasional frosts.

name: arizona
sentence: By mid-February, temperatures begin to rise, with warm days, and cool and chaotic nights.

name: arizona
sentence: The summer months of June to September bring dry heat of 90 to 120 °F (32 to 49 °C), with sometimes high temperatures above 125 °F (52 °C) observed in the desert area.

name: arizona
sentence: The historical record for Arizona is 128°F (53°C) recorded at Havasu City Lake on June 29, 1994 and July 5, 2007; the historical record of −40°F (−40°C) was recorded at Hawley Lake on January 7, 1971.

sentence: Due to the mainly dry climate, large variations in daytime temperature occur in less developed areas of the desert above 2,500 feet (760 m).

sentence: Arizona has an average annual rainfall of 12.7 in (323 mm), which occurs during two rainy seasons, with cold fronts from the Pacific Ocean during the winter and a monsoon in the summer.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona's capital is Phoenix.

name: arizona
sentence: The Arizona Legislature is bicameral (like the Legislature of all other states except Nebraska) and consists of a thirty-member senator and a 60-member House of Representatives.

name: arizona
sentence: Each of the thirty legislative districts has one senator and two representatives.

name: arizona
sentence: The legislators are elected for a term of two years.

name: arizona
sentence: Each legislature covers a period of two years.

name: arizona
sentence: The first session following the general election is known as the first regular session, and the second year is known as the second regular session.

name: arizona
sentence: Each ordinary session shall begin on the second Monday of January and shall adjourn sine die (duration for the year) no later than the Saturday of the week during which the hundredth day of the beginning of the ordinary session falls.

name: arizona
sentence: The Speaker of the Senate and Speaker of the House, by regulation, may extend the session for a further seven days.

name: arizona
sentence: Thereafter, the session may be extended only by a majority vote of the members present in each chamber.

name: arizona
sentence: The majority party is the Republican Party, which has held power in both chambers since 1993.

name: arizona
sentence: The Democratic Party won several legislative seats in the Arizona House of State, bringing Democratic leader Charlene Fernandez to a seat separate from a majority (31-29).

name: arizona
sentence: Senators and representatives of Arizona states are elected for a two-year term and are limited to four consecutive terms in a chamber, although there is no limit to the total number of terms.

name: arizona

sentence: During this forty-year period, it was the only state not to be carried by a democrat at least once.

sentence: (It was the most contested state in what was otherwise a shaken victory for Johnson that year.)

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas () is a state in the south-central United States, with more than three million people in 2018.

sentence: Arkansas is the 29th largest by region and the 33rd most populous American state.

name: arkansas
sentence: Cotton remained the first commodity crop, although the cotton market has declined.

sentence: Because farmers and businessmen were not diversifying and there were few industrial investments, the state was lagging behind in the economic outlook.

sentence: It was only after the civil rights movement and the federal intervention that the African Americans were able to vote.

name: arkansas

sentence: Arkansas can generally be divided into two halves, the northwest highlands and the southeast lowlands.

sentence: Because it is the most populous state in the United States, California is one of the largest energy users in the country.

sentence: California's interconnected water system is the largest in the world, managing more than 40 million feet of water (49 km3) per year, focusing on six major water systems and infrastructure projects.

name: california
sentence: The capital of California is located in Sacramento.The state is organized into three branches of government – the executive power composed of the governor and other members elected independently of the Constitution.

sentence: The state also authorizes voting proposals: direct participation of the electorate by initiative, referendum, reminder and ratification.

name: california
sentence: Prior to the passage of the California 14 (2010) proposal, California allowed each political party to choose a closed primary or primary where only party members and independents vote.

name: california
sentence: In the primary election, the two candidates who obtained the largest number of votes will advance in the general election, regardless of party membership.

name: california
sentence: If, in a special primary election, a candidate receives more than 50 per cent of all votes cast, he or she shall be elected to fill the vacancy and no special general election shall be held.

name: california
sentence: California's executive branch consists of the Governor and seven other elected constitutional officers: Lieutenant Governor, Attorney General, Secretary of State, State Controller, Treasurer of State, Insurance Commissioner and Superintendent of State of Public Education.

name: california

name: california
sentence: The State of California Legislative Assembly consists of a 40-member senator and an 80-member assembly.

name: california

name: california
sentence: The California legal system is explicitly based on English common law (as is the case for all other states except Louisiana) but has some features of Spanish civil law, such as community property.

name: california
sentence: California's prison population increased from 25,000 in 1980 to over 170,000 in 2007.

name: california
sentence: California's judicial system is the largest in the United States with a total of 1,600 judges (the federal system has only about 840 judges).

name: california
sentence: At the apex is the seven-member California Supreme Court, while the California Courts of Appeal are the primary courts of appeal and the California Superior Courts are the courts of first instance.

name: california

name: california
sentence: The administration of the State's judicial system is controlled by the Judicial Council, composed of the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of California, 14 judicial officers, four representatives of the California State Bar Association and one member of each chamber of the State Legislative Assembly.

name: california
sentence: California is divided into 58 counties.

name: california
sentence: The county government provides county-wide services such as law enforcement, prisons, elections and voter registration, civil status files, property valuation and records, tax collection, public health, health care, social services, libraries, flood control, fire protection, animal control, agricultural regulation, building inspections, ambulance services and education services to maintain state-wide standards.

name: california

name: california
sentence: Cities and cities incorporated in California are either chartered municipalities or municipalities under general law.

name: california
sentence: The ten most populated cities in the state are charter cities.

name: california
sentence: Most small cities have a form of council-managerial government, where the elected municipal council appoints a municipal director to oversee the city's operations.

name: california
sentence: The government of San Francisco is the only consolidated county in California, where city and county governments have been merged into one unified jurisdiction.

name: california
sentence: Approximately 1,102 school districts, independent of cities and counties, manage California's public education.

name: california
sentence: There are about 3,400 special districts in California.

name: california

name: california
sentence: The geographical area of a special district may extend to more than one city or county, or may include only part of a district.

name: california

sentence: Among the political idiosyncrasies and the establishment of trends, California was the second state to recall its state governor, the second state to legalize abortion, and the only state to prohibit marriage for gay couples twice by vote (including proposal 8 in 2008).

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is a state in the western United States that encompasses most of the southern Rocky Mountains, as well as the northeastern part of the Colorado Plateau and the western boundary of the Great Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: It is the 8th largest and 21st most populous state in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's population is estimated at 5,758,736 in 2019, an increase of 14.5% since the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The area has been inhabited by Amerindians for more than 13,000 years, the Lindenmeier site containing artifacts dating from approximately 9200 BC to 1000 BC; the eastern edge of the Rocky Mountains has been an important migration route for the first peoples that have spread throughout the Americas.

name: colorado
sentence: The state was named for the Colorado River, which the first Spanish explorers named the Río Colorado ("Red River") for the red silt that the river carried from the mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado territory was organized on February 28, 1861, and on August 1, 1876, US President Ulysses S. Grant signed Proclamation 230 admitting Colorado to the Union as the 38th state.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is nicknamed the "State of the Centennial" because it became a state a century after the signing of the United States Declaration of Independence.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is bordered by Wyoming to the north, Nebraska to the northeast, Kansas to the east, Oklahoma to the southeast, New Mexico to the south, Utah to the west, and reaches Arizona to the southwest at Four Corners.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is known for its vibrant landscape of mountains, forests, high plains, mesas, canyons, plateaus, rivers and desert lands.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is one of the mountain states and is part of the western and southwestern United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is Colorado's most populous city and capital.

name: colorado
sentence: State residents are known as Coloradans, although the old term "Coloradoan" is used occasionally.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is a relatively wealthy state, ranking 8th at the household income level in 2016 and 11th at the per capita income level in 2010.

name: colorado
sentence: Major parts of the economy include government and defence, mining, agriculture, tourism and more and more other types of manufacturing.

name: colorado
sentence: With rising temperatures and reduced water availability, Colorado's agricultural, forestry and tourism economies are expected to be heavily affected by climate change.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is remarkable for its diverse geography, which includes alpine mountains, high plains, deserts with huge sand dunes and deep canyons.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1861, the United States Congress defined the boundaries of the new territory of Colorado exclusively by lines of latitude and longitude, ranging from 37°N to 41°N latitude, and from 102°02′48′′W to 109°02′48′′W longitude (25°W to 32°W of the Washington Meridian).

name: colorado
sentence: After 159 years of government investigations, Colorado's borders are now officially defined by 697 pillars and 697 lines of right demarcation.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado, Wyoming and Utah are the only states that have their borders defined solely by straight demarcation lines without natural characteristics.

name: colorado
sentence: The southwest corner of Colorado is the Four Corners monument at 36°59′56′′N, 109°2′43′′W.

name: colorado
sentence: The Four Corners Monument, located at the point where Colorado, New Mexico, Arizona and Utah meet, is the only place in the United States where four states meet.

name: colorado
sentence: To the west of the Great Plains of Colorado, the east side of the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The outstanding mountain peaks include Longs Peak, Mount Evans, Pikes Peak and Spanish peaks near Walsenburg, in southern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This region flows east and south-east, either through the Mississippi River or the Rio Grande, in the Gulf of Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Rocky Mountains contain 53 actual peaks with a total of 58 that are 14,000 feet (4,267 m) or higher above sea level, known as fourteeners.

name: colorado
sentence: These mountains are largely covered with trees such as conifers and expenditures to the tree line, at an altitude of approximately 12,000 feet (3,658 m) in southern Colorado at approximately 10,500 feet (3,200 m) in northern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Above this tree line, only alpine vegetation grows.

name: colorado
sentence: Only small parts of the Colorado Rockies are covered with snow all year round.

name: colorado
sentence: Much of the alpine snow melts in mid-August, with the exception of a few snowy peaks and a few small glaciers.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Mineral Belt, which extends from the San Juan Mountains in the southwest to Boulder and Central City at the front, contains most of the historic gold and silver mining districts of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Mount Elbert is the highest peak in the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The 30 highest peaks of the North American Rockies are all in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The summit of Mount Elbert at an altitude of 14,440 feet (4,401.2 m) in Lake County is the highest point in Colorado and the North American Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is the only U.S. state that is entirely above 1000 metres of altitude.

name: colorado
sentence: The point at which the Arikaree River flows from Yuma County, Colorado, and Cheyenne County, Kansas, is the lowest point in Colorado at an altitude of 3,317 feet (1,011 m).

name: colorado
sentence: This point, which is the highest point in all states, is higher than the altitude points of 18 states and the District of Columbia.

name: colorado
sentence: A little less than half of Colorado is a flat, hilly terrain.

name: colorado
sentence: To the east of the Rocky Mountains are the plains of eastern Colorado of the High Plains, the section of the Great Plains of Nebraska at altitudes ranging from about 3,350 to 7,500 feet (1,020 to 2,290 m).

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Plains are primarily prairies, but also include deciduous forests, mounds and canyons.

name: colorado
sentence: Precipitation is on average 15 to 25 inches (380 to 640 mm) per year.

name: colorado
sentence: Currently, eastern Colorado is mainly agricultural land and routes, as well as small villages and agricultural towns.

name: colorado
sentence: Corn, wheat, hay, soybeans and oats are typical crops.

name: colorado
sentence: Most villages and towns in this region have both a water tower and a grain elevator.

name: colorado
sentence: Irrigation water is available from surface and underground sources.

name: colorado
sentence: Surface water sources include the Southern Platte, Arkansas River and a few other streams.

name: colorado
sentence: Groundwater is generally accessible through artesian wells.

name: colorado
sentence: The intensive use of these wells for irrigation has led to a decline in groundwater reserves in the region.

name: colorado
sentence: Eastern Colorado is also home to a considerable amount and a wide range of livestock, such as cattle ranches and pig farms.

name: colorado
sentence: Approximately 70% of Colorado's population lives along the eastern limit of the Rocky Mountains in the Front Range urban corridor between Cheyenne, Wyoming and Pueblo, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This area is partially protected from the dominant storms that blow from the Pacific Ocean region by the upper Rocky Mountains in the middle of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The "Front Chain" includes Denver, Boulder, Fort Collins, Loveland, Castle Rock, Colorado Springs, Pueblo, Greeley and other townships and municipalities between the two.

name: colorado
sentence: On the other side of the Rockies, the major population centres in western Colorado (which is not considered the "Front Chain") are the cities of Grand Junction, Durango and Montrose.

name: colorado
sentence: The continental divide of the Americas extends along the ridge of the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado region to the west of the continental division is called the western slope of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: To the west of the continental ditch, water flows southwest through the Colorado River and the Green River in the Gulf of California.

name: colorado
sentence: Within the Rocky Mountains are several large parks that are large high basins.

name: colorado
sentence: In the north, on the east side of the continental division is Colorado's northern park.

name: colorado
sentence: Northern Park is drained by the North Platte River, which flows north into Wyoming and Nebraska.

name: colorado
sentence: Just south of North Park, but west of the continental division, is the Colorado Middle Park, which is drained by the Colorado River.

name: colorado
sentence: The South Park of Colorado is the area of the South Platte River.

name: colorado
sentence: In the southern part of Colorado lies the great valley of San Luis, where are the sources of the Rio Grande.

name: colorado
sentence: The valley lies between the Sangre De Cristo and San Juan Mountains, and consists of vast desert lands that eventually flow into the mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: Rio Grande flows south to New Mexico, Mexico and Texas.

name: colorado
sentence: Beyond the Sangre chain of Cristo to the east of the valley of San Luis lies the valley of the wet mountain.

name: colorado
sentence: These basins, especially the San Luis Valley, are located along the Rio Grande Rift, a major geological formation of the Rocky Mountains, and its branches.

name: colorado
sentence: The western side of Colorado includes the western side of the Rocky Mountains and the entire state to the western border.

name: colorado
sentence: This area includes several terrains and climates, from alpine mountains to arid deserts.

sentence: The western slope includes many ski resorts in the Rocky Mountains and cities west of the mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: It is less populated than the Front Range, but includes a large number of national parks and monuments.

name: colorado
sentence: From the west to the east, Colorado's land consists of desert lands, desert plateaus, alpine mountains, national forests, relatively flat grasslands, scattered forests, mounds and canyons at the western end of the Great Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: The famous Pikes Peak is located just west of Colorado Springs.

name: colorado
sentence: Its isolated summit is visible from almost the border of Kansas to clear days, and also far north and south.

name: colorado
sentence: The northwest corner of Colorado is a sparsely populated area, and it contains part of the famous Dinosaur National Monument, which is not only a paleontological area, but is also a picturesque area of rocky hills, canyons, arid desert, and streambeds.

name: colorado
sentence: Here, the Green River briefly crosses Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's desert lands are located in and around areas such as Pueblo, Canon City, Florence, Grand Sand Dunes National Park and Reserve, the Valley of San Luis, Cortez, Canyon of the Ancients National Monument, Hovenweep National Monument, Ute Mountain, Delta, Grand Junction, Colorado National Monument, and other areas surrounding the Uncompahgre Plateau and the Uncompahgre National Forest.

name: colorado
sentence: The western side of Colorado is drained by the Colorado River and its tributaries (mainly the Gunnison River, the Green River and the San Juan River), or by evaporation into its arid areas.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado River crosses Glenwood Canyon, then through an arid valley of deserts from Rifle to Parachute, through the deserted De Beque Canyon Canyon, and into the arid Grand Valley desert, where the city of Grand Junction is located.

name: colorado
sentence: The Grand Mesa, which lies southeast of Grand Junction, the high mountains of San Juan, a rugged mountain range, and to the west of the mountains of San Juan, the plateau of Colorado, a high arid region bordering southern Utah, are also very visible on or near the southern part of the west slope.

name: colorado
sentence: Great Junction, Colorado is the largest city on the west side.

name: colorado
sentence: Grand Junction and Durango are the only major broadcasting centres west of the Colorado Continental Division, although most mountain resort communities publish daily newspapers.

name: colorado
sentence: Grand Junction is located along Interstate 70, the only major highway in western Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Grand Junction is also along the main west slope railway, the Union Pacific.

name: colorado
sentence: This railway also provides the tracks for the Amtrak Zephyr California passenger train, which crosses the Rocky Mountains between Denver and Grand Junction by a route on which there are no continuous highways.

name: colorado
sentence: The western slope includes several notable destinations in the Colorado Rocky Mountains, including Glenwood Springs, with its resort hot springs, and the Aspen, Breckenridge, Vail, Crested Butte, Steamboat Springs and Telluride ski resorts.

name: colorado
sentence: Graduate studies are available at Colorado Mesa University in Grand Junction, Western Colorado University in Gunnison, Fort Lewis College in Durango and Colorado Mountain College in Glenwood Springs and Steamboat Springs.

name: colorado
sentence: The Four Corners monument, located in the southwest corner of Colorado, marks the common border of Colorado, New Mexico, Arizona and Utah, the only place of its kind in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's climate is more complex than that of states outside the mountain states region.

name: colorado
sentence: Unlike most other states, southern Colorado is not always warmer than northern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of Colorado is made up of mountains, foothills, high plains and desert lands.

name: colorado
sentence: The surrounding mountains and valleys greatly affect the local climate.

name: colorado
sentence: As a general rule, with an increase in altitude comes a decrease in temperature and an increase in precipitation.

name: colorado
sentence: Northeastern, eastern and southeastern Colorado are mostly the high plains, while northern Colorado is a mixture of high plains, foothills and mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The northwest and west of Colorado are mostly mountainous, with some mixed desert lands.

name: colorado
sentence: Southwestern and southern Colorado are a complex mix of desert and mountainous regions.

name: colorado
sentence: The climate of the eastern plains is semi-arid (Köppen climate classification: BSk) with low humidity and moderate precipitation, usually 15-25 inches (380-640 millimetres) per year.

name: colorado
sentence: The area is known for its abundant sun and cool and light nights, which gives this region a large range of average daytime temperature.

name: colorado
sentence: The difference between the highs of the days and the lows of the nights can be considerable because the heat dissipates in the space during the clear nights, since the thermal radiation is not trapped by the clouds.

name: colorado
sentence: The Front Range urban corridor, home to most of Colorado's population, is in a heavy rain shadow because it is on the lee side of the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In summer, this area may have many days above 95°F (35°C) and often 100°F (38°C).

name: colorado
sentence: In the plains, winter hollows generally range from 25 to -10°F (−4 to -23°C).

name: colorado
sentence: Approximately 75% of precipitation occurs during the growing season, from April to September, but this region is highly prone to drought.

name: colorado
sentence: Most precipitation comes from thunderstorms, which can be severe, and large snowstorms that occur in winter and early spring.

name: colorado
sentence: Otherwise, winters tend to be generally dry and cold.

name: colorado
sentence: In much of the region, Mars is the most snowy month.

name: colorado
sentence: April and May are normally the wettest months, while April is the wettest month in total.

name: colorado
sentence: Front Range cities closer to the mountains tend to be warmer in winter due to Chinook winds that warm the area, sometimes bringing temperatures of 70°F (21°C) or higher in winter.

name: colorado
sentence: The mean July temperature is 55°F (13°C) in the morning and 90°F (32°C) in the afternoon.

name: colorado
sentence: The mean January temperature is 18°F (−8°C) in the morning and 48°F (9°C) in the afternoon, although the variation between consecutive days may be 40°F (20°C).

name: colorado
sentence: Just west of the plains and in the foothills, there is a wide variety of climatic types.

name: colorado
sentence: Locations a few kilometres apart may experience a completely different time depending on the topography.

name: colorado
sentence: Most valleys have a semi-arid climate that is no different from the eastern plains, which passes to an alpine climate at the highest altitudes.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also microclimates in local areas that cover almost the full range of climates, including subtropical highlands (Cfb/Cwb), wet subtropicals (Cfa), wet continentals (Dfa/Dfb), Mediterraneans (Csa/Csb) and subarctics (Dfc).

name: colorado
sentence: Extreme climate change is common in Colorado, although a significant portion of extreme climate change occurs in the least populated areas of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Storms are common east of the continental ditch in spring and summer, but are generally short.

name: colorado
sentence: The hail is a common view in the mountains east of the Divide and across the eastern plains, especially the northeastern part of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is the most commonly reported serious weather hazard for the warm season and can cause human injury and significant damage to property.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are subject to some of the largest hailstorms in North America.

name: colorado
sentence: An example is the violent hailstorms that struck Denver on July 11, 1990 and May 8, 2017, the latter being the most expensive in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are part of the extreme west of the Tornado gangway; some harmful tornadoes on the eastern plains include the 1990 Limon F3 tornado and the Windsor EF3 tornado, which devastated the small town in 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: Portions of the eastern plains see particularly frequent tornadoes, both those that have spawned from mesocyclones in supercell storms and those that come from less intense tillage, as in the Denver Convergence Vorticity Zone (DCVZ).

name: colorado
sentence: The plains are also exposed to occasional flooding and particularly severe flash floods, which are caused by both thunderstorms and the rapid melting of snow in the mountains in warm weather.

name: colorado
sentence: The 1965 floods in the Denver River, the 1976 floods in the Big Thompson River and Colorado in 2013 are notable examples.

name: colorado
sentence: Hot weather is common during the summers in Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The city's record in 1901 for consecutive days above 90°F (32°C) was broken in the summer of 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: The new record of 24 consecutive days surpassed the previous record of almost a week.

name: colorado
sentence: Much of Colorado is very dry, with the average condition of only 17 inches (430 millimetres) of precipitation per year on a state-wide basis.

name: colorado
sentence: The state rarely experiences a period when part of it is not to some extent drought.

name: colorado
sentence: The lack of precipitation contributes to the severity of forest fires in the state, such as the 2002 Hayman Fire.

name: colorado
sentence: Other notable fires include the 2010 Fourmile Canyon Fire, the Waldo Canyon Fire and the June 2012 High Park Fire, and the June 2013 Black Forest Fire.

name: colorado
sentence: Even these fires were overtaken by the pine mulch fire, the Cameron Peak fire, and the Eastern Troublefire in 2020, all of which are the three largest fires in Colorado history (see Colorado Forest Fires in 2020).

name: colorado
sentence: However, some of Colorado's mountainous regions receive a large amount of moisture from winter snowfall.

name: colorado
sentence: The spring melting of these snows often causes large flows of water in the Yampa River, Colorado River, Rio Grande, Arkansas River, North Platte River and South Platte River.

name: colorado
sentence: Water flowing from the Colorado Rocky Mountains is a very important source of water for farms, cities and cities in southwestern New Mexico, Arizona, Utah and Nevada, as well as for the Midwest, such as Nebraska and Kansas, and the southern states of Oklahoma and Texas.

name: colorado
sentence: A significant amount of water is also diverted for use in California; occasionally (formerly naturally and regularly) water flows reach northern Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest official ambient air temperature ever recorded in Colorado was 115°F (46.1°C) on July 20, 2019, at the John Martin Dam.

name: colorado
sentence: The lowest official air temperature was −61°F (−51.7°C) on 1 February 1985 in Maybell.

name: colorado
sentence: Despite its mountainous terrain, Colorado is relatively calm from the seismic point of view.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. National Earthquake Information Centre is located in Golden.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 22, 2011, an earthquake of magnitude 5.3 occurred 14 km west-southwest of the city of Trinidad.

name: colorado
sentence: There were no casualties and only a small number of damage was reported.

name: colorado
sentence: It was the second earthquake in Colorado's history.

name: colorado
sentence: An earthquake of magnitude 5.7 was recorded in 1973.

name: colorado
sentence: In the early morning of August 24, 2018, four minor earthquakes caught up with the state of Colorado ranging from magnitude 2.9 to 4.3.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has recorded 525 earthquakes since 1973, with a majority of 2 to 3.5 on the Richter scale.

name: colorado
sentence: The area that is now the state of Colorado has been inhabited by Native Americans for more than 13,000 years.

name: colorado
sentence: The Lindenmeier site in Larimer County contains artifacts dating from approximately 11200 B.C. to 3000 B.C.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern end of the Rockies was an important migratory route that was important for the spread of the first peoples throughout the Americas.

name: colorado
sentence: The former Pueblo peoples lived in the valleys and mesas of the Colorado plateau.

name: colorado
sentence: The Ute Nation has inhabited the valleys of the Southern Rocky Mountains and the Western Rocky Mountains, even to the east of the Front Range these days.

name: colorado
sentence: The Apaches and the Comanches also lived in the eastern and south-eastern parts of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Sometimes the Arapaho Nation and the Cheyenne Nation moved westward to hunt across the High Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: The Spanish Empire claimed Colorado as part of its province of New Mexico before the United States was involved in the region.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States acquired a land claim east of the Rocky Mountains with the purchase of Louisiana from France in 1803.

name: colorado
sentence: This American claim is in conflict with Spain's claim to the upper Arkansas basin as the exclusive commercial zone of its colony of Santa Fé de Nuevo México.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1806, Zebulon Pike led an American Army reconnaissance expedition to the disputed area.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Pike and his men were arrested by Spanish horsemen in the San Luis Valley the following February, taken to Chihuahua and expelled from Mexico the following July.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States abandoned its lands to the south and west of Arkansas and south of the 42nd parallel to the north and west of the 100th meridian to the west as part of the purchase of Florida from Spain with the Adams-Onís Treaty of 1819.

name: colorado
sentence: The Treaty entered into force on 22 February 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Having established its border with Spain, the United States admitted the south-eastern part of the territory of Missouri to the Union as the state of Missouri on 10 August 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: The rest of the territory of Missouri, including what was to become northeastern Colorado, became unorganized territory and remained so for 33 years on the issue of slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: After 11 years of war, Spain finally recognized Mexico's independence with the treaty of Cordoba signed on August 24, 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico finally ratified the Treaty of Adams-Onís in 1831.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texian revolt of 1835–36 fomented a dispute between the United States and Mexico that finally broke out in the war between Mexico and America in 1846.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico ceded its northern territory to the United States with the treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo at the end of the war in 1848.

name: colorado
sentence: Most American settlers traveling west of Oregon, new California gold fields or the new Mormon colonies in the State of Deseret in the Salt Lake Valley, avoided the rugged southern rocky mountains, and instead followed the North Platte River and the Sweetwater River to the South Pass (Wyoming), the lowest passage of the continental divide between the Southern Rocky Mountains and the Central Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1849, the Mormons of the Salt Lake Valley organized the extralegal state of Deseret, claiming the entire Great Basin and all the lands drained by the Green, Grand and Colorado rivers.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. federal government totally refused to recognize the new Mormon government, because it was theocratic and sanctioned plural marriage.

name: colorado
sentence: Instead, the 1850 compromise divided the Mexican Cessation and the claims of northwestern Texas into a new state and two new territories, the state of California, the territory of New Mexico and the territory of Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: On 9 April 1851, American Mexican settlers from the Taos region established the village of San Luis and then in the New Mexico Territory, later becoming the first permanent Euro-American colony in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1854, Senator Stephen A. Douglas persuaded the U.S. Congress to divide the unorganized territory east of the Continental Divide into two new organized territories, Kansas Territory and Nebraska Territory, and an unorganized southern region known as Indian Territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Each new territory had to decide the fate of slavery within its borders, but this compromise only fueled animosity between the free ground and the pro-slavery factions.

name: colorado
sentence: Gold seekers organized the provisional government of Jefferson's territory on August 24, 1859, but this new territory did not obtain the approval of the United States Congress in the debate on slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: The election of Abraham Lincoln as President of the United States on November 6, 1860, led to the secession of nine southern slave states and the threat of civil war between states.

name: colorado
sentence: In an effort to increase the political power of the states of the Union, Congress, dominated by the Republican Party, quickly admitted the eastern part of Kansas territory to the Union as a free state of Kansas on 29 January 1861, leaving the western part of Kansas territory and its gold mining areas as an unorganized territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Thirty days later, on February 28, 1861, outgoing U.S. President James Buchanan signed an act of convention organizing the free territory of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The original Colorado boundaries remain unchanged, with the exception of changes to government surveys.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado name was chosen because it was generally believed that the Colorado River was native to the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1776, the Spanish priest Silvestre Vélez de Escalante reported that the Amerindians of the area knew the river as Rio Colorado for the red-brown silt that the river carried mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1859, a topographical expedition of the American army led by Captain John Macomb established the confluence of the Green River with the Grand River in what is now the Canyonlands National Park in Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: The Macomb party has designated the confluence as the source of the Colorado River.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 12, 1861, South Carolina artillery opened fire on Fort Sumter to launch the American civil war.

name: colorado
sentence: While many gold researchers appreciated Confederation, the vast majority remained fiercely loyal to the cause of the Union.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1862, a cavalry force from Texas invaded the territory of New Mexico and captured Santa Fe on 10 March.

name: colorado
sentence: The purpose of this Western campaign was to seize or disrupt the gold fields of Colorado and California and seize the ports of the Pacific Ocean for Confederation.

name: colorado
sentence: A hastily organized force, made up of Colorado volunteers, left Denver City, Colorado Territory, to go to Col Glorieta, New Mexico Territory, to block the Texans.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 28, New Mexico's Coloradans and local volunteers arrested the Texans at the battle of Col Glorieta, destroyed their cannons and supply carts, and dispersed 500 of their horses and mules.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texans were forced to withdraw to Santa Fe.

name: colorado
sentence: Having lost supplies for their campaign and found little support for New Mexico, the Texans abandoned Santa Fe and returned to San Antonio in defeat.

name: colorado
sentence: The Confederation has made no other attempt to seize the southwestern United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1864, the Governor of the Territory John Evans appointed the Reverend John Chivington Colonel of Colorado Volunteers with an order to protect the white settlers of the Cheyenne and Arapaho warriors accused of theft of cattle.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Chivington ordered his men to attack a band of Cheyenne and Arapaho who camped along Sand Creek.

name: colorado
sentence: Chivington reported that his troops had killed more than 500 warriors.

name: colorado
sentence: The militia returned to Denver City in triumph, but several officers reported that the so-called battle was a flagrant massacre of Indians at peace, that most of the dead were women and children, and that the bodies of the dead had been hideously mutilated and desecrated.

name: colorado
sentence: Three U.S. Army investigations have condemned the action, and new President Andrew Johnson has asked Governor Evans for his resignation, but none of the perpetrators has ever been punished.

name: colorado
sentence: This event is now known as the Sand Creek Massacre.

name: colorado
sentence: In the middle and after the civil war, many discouraged prospectors returned home, but some stayed and developed mines, mills, farms, ranches, roads and towns in Colorado territory.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 14, 1864, James Huff discovered silver near the Col d'Argentine, the first of a multitude of silver strikes.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1867, the Union Pacific Railway laid its tracks west to Weir, now Julesburg, in the northeast corner of the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: On May 10, 1869, the Pacific Union joined the Central Pacific Railway at the Promontory Summit in Utah to form the first Transcontinental Railway.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver Pacific railway reached Denver in June of the following year, and the Kansas Pacific arrived two months later to forge the second line across the continent.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1872, rich veins of silver were discovered in the San Juan Mountains on the Ute Indian Reserve in southwestern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The following year, the Ute people were removed from the San Juans.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 3, 1875, the United States Congress passed enabling legislation setting out the conditions for Colorado to become a state.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 1, 1876 (four weeks after the United States Centennial), US President Ulysses S. Grant signed a proclamation in which he admitted Colorado to the Union as 38th State and earned it the name of "the State of the Centennial".

name: colorado
sentence: The discovery of a major silver lode near Leadville in 1878 triggered the Colorado silver boom.

name: colorado
sentence: The Sherman Silver Purchase Act of 1890 reinvigorated silver mining, and the last gold strike in Colorado, but the most important one, at Cripple Creek a few months later, attracted a new generation of gold seekers.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado women were granted the right to vote on November 7, 1893, making Colorado the second state to grant universal suffrage and the first by popular vote (men of Colorado).

name: colorado
sentence: The repeal of the Sherman Silver Purchase Act in 1893 led to a horrific collapse of Colorado's mining and agricultural economy, but the state recovered slowly and steadily.

name: colorado
sentence: Between the 1880s and 1930s, the Denver floriculture industry became a major industry in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This period was known locally as the gold rush of the carnations.

name: colorado
sentence: The poor working conditions and discontent of the miners led to several major clashes between the strikers and the Colorado National Guard, including the Western Federation of Minors of 1903-1904 and the Colorado Coal War, including the Ludlow massacre, which killed a dozen women and children.

name: colorado
sentence: The coal war of 1913-1914 and the streetcar strike of Denver in 1920 led to the intervention of federal troops to put an end to the violence.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1927, the Columbine mine massacre resulted in the death of six strikers following a confrontation with the Colorado Rangers.

name: colorado
sentence: It is estimated that more than 5,000 miners from Colorado, many immigrants, have died in accidents since records were officially collected following an accident in Crested Butte that killed 59 in 1884.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado became the first Western state to host a major political assembly when the Democratic Party met in Denver in 1908.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 1930 U.S. census, Colorado's population for the first time exceeded a million residents.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado suffered greatly from the Great Depression and Dust Bowl of the 1930s, but a great wave of immigration after the Second World War stimulated Colorado's fortune.

name: colorado
sentence: Tourism has become a pillar of the state economy, and high technology has become an important economic driver.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimated that Colorado's population exceeded five million in 2009.

name: colorado
sentence: Three U.S. Navy warships were named the USColorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The first USColorado was named for the Colorado River and served in the civil war and later in the Asian squadron, where he was attacked during the Korean expedition of 1871.

name: colorado
sentence: The last two ships were named in honour of the state, including the USColorado combat ship that served during the Second World War in the Pacific from 1941.

name: colorado
sentence: At the time of the attack on Pearl Harbor, this USColorado was located at the naval base of San Diego, Calif.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 11, 1957, a plutonium fire occurred at the Rocky Flats plant, resulting in significant plutonium contamination in the surrounding populated areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Since its disappearance by trapping and poisoning the Grey Wolf (Canis lupus) of Colorado in the 1930s, a group of wolves have recolonized Moffat County, Colorado in northwestern Colorado in 2019.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that Colorado's population was 5,758,736 in 2019, an increase of 14.51 per cent over the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's most populous city and capital is Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Greater Denver metropolitan area, with an estimated population of 3,515,374 in 2017, is considered the largest metropolitan area in the state and is located in the Front Range urban corridor, which has about five million inhabitants.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest increases are expected in the Front Range urban corridor, particularly in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: The fastest growing counties in the state are Douglas and Weld.

name: colorado
sentence: The population centre of Colorado is located just north of the village of Crichell in Jefferson County.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2010 U.S. Census, Colorado had 5,029,196 inhabitants.

name: colorado
sentence: The racial composition of the State population was as follows:

name: colorado
sentence: Hispanic and Latin American peoples (of all races) make up 20.7 per cent of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, Colorado's main ancestry groups are German (22%), including Swiss and Austrian, Mexican (18%), Irish (12%) and English (12%).

name: colorado
sentence: People of German origin are particularly numerous in the Front Range, the Rocky Mountains (central-west counties) and the eastern/high plains areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has a large proportion of Hispanic citizens, mainly Mexicans and Americans, in Metropolitan Denver, Colorado Springs, as well as in the small towns of Greeley and Pueblo, and elsewhere.

name: colorado
sentence: The south, south-west and south-east of Colorado have a large number of Hispanos, the descendants of the first Spanish colonial settlers.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1940, the Census Bureau reported that the population of Colorado was 8.2 per cent Hispanics and 90.3 per cent Non-Hispanic Whites.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's Hispanic population has continued to grow rapidly in recent decades.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2019, Hispanics accounted for 22% of Colorado's population, while non-Hispanic whites accounted for 70%.

name: colorado
sentence: English spoken in Colorado has many Spanish idioms.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado also has large African-American communities located in Denver, in the Montbello, Five Points, Whittier and many other areas of East Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The State has a considerable number of Asian-Americans of Mongolian, Chinese, Filipino, Korean, South Asian and Japanese origin.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest population of Asian Americans is on the south and south-east sides of Denver, as well as some on the south-west side of Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver metropolitan area is seen as more liberal and diverse than most states in terms of political issues and environmental concerns.

name: colorado
sentence: There were 70,331 births in Colorado in 2006.

name: colorado
sentence: (Basic rate of 14.6 per thousand.)

name: colorado
sentence: In 2007, non-Hispanic whites were involved in 59.1% of all births.

name: colorado
sentence: About 14.06 per cent of these births involved a non-Hispanic white person and a person of a different race, most often with a couple including a Hispanic.

name: colorado
sentence: One birth in which at least one Hispanic person was involved accounted for 43% of births in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: At the 2010 census, Colorado is the seventh largest percentage of Hispanics (20.7 per cent) in the United States behind New Mexico (46.3 per cent), California (37.6 per cent), Texas (37.6 per cent), Arizona (29.6 per cent), Nevada (26.5 per cent) and Florida (22.5 per cent).

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, the Hispanic population is estimated at 918,899 persons, or about 20 per cent of the total population of the State.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has the fifth largest population of Mexican Americans, behind California, Texas, Arizona and Illinois.

name: colorado
sentence: In percentage, Colorado is the sixth highest among Mexicans, behind New Mexico, California, Texas, Arizona and Nevada.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2011, 46% of Colorado's population was younger than the age of a minority, meaning that they had at least one non-Hispanic white parent.

name: colorado
sentence: Note: Births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnicity and race, giving a higher overall number.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2017, Colorado recorded the second lowest fertility rate in the United States outside New England, after Oregon, at 1.63 children per woman.

name: colorado
sentence: The Title X Family Planning Program and Warren Buffett's intrauterine device grant contributed significantly to the decline in pregnancy.

name: colorado
sentence: Spanish is the second language spoken in Colorado, after English.

name: colorado
sentence: There is a coloradan native language still spoken in Colorado, Colorado River Numic (Ute).

name: colorado
sentence: The main religious affiliations of the Colorado population are 64% Christians, including 44% Protestants, 16% Roman Catholics, 3% Mormons and 1% Eastern Orthodox.

name: colorado
sentence: Other religious breaks are: 1% Jewish, 1% Muslim, 1% Buddhist and 4% other.

name: colorado
sentence: Non-affiliated individuals account for 29 per cent of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest denominations by number of adherents in 2010 were the Catholic Church with 811,630; non-denominational evangelical Protestants with 229,981; and the Church of Jesus Christ of the last-day saints with 151,433.

name: colorado
sentence: According to several studies, Coloradans have the lowest obesity rates in any state in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, 24 per cent of the population was considered obese from a medical point of view and, if it were the lowest in the country, it had dropped from 17 per cent in 2004.

name: colorado
sentence: According to a report published in the Journal of the American Medical Association, Colorado residents had a life expectancy of 80.21 years in 2014, the longest of all U.S. states.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of film productions have been filmed on site in Colorado, particularly in major westerns such as True Grit, The Searchers, Butch Cassidy and Sundance Kid.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of historic military forts, railways with trains still in operation, ghost mining cities have been used and transformed for historical accuracy in well-known films.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of panoramic highways and mountain passes that have helped to highlight the free route in films such as Vanishing Point, Bingo and Starman.

name: colorado
sentence: Some of Colorado's monuments have been featured in films such as The Stanley Hotel in Dumb and Dumber and The Shining and the Sculptured House in Sleeper.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2015, Furious 7 was to film driving sequences on Pikes Peak Highway in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Good Luck Charlie TV series was filmed in Denver, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Office of Film and Television noted that more than 400 films were filmed in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also several film festivals in Colorado, including Aspen Shortsfest, Boulder International Film Festival, Castle Rock Film Festival, Denver Film Festival, Festivus Film Festival (finished 2013), Mile High Horror Film Festival, Moondance International Film Festival, Mountainfilm in Telluride, Rocky Mountain Women's Film Festival and Telluride Film Festival.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is known for its southwest and Rocky Mountain cuisine.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexican restaurants occupy a prominent place throughout the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado, was named the most gastronomic city in America 2010 by Bon Appétit.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, and Colorado in general, are home to a number of national food and beverage companies, leading restaurants and agricultural markets.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado also has more master sommeliers per capita than any other city, including San Francisco and New York.

name: colorado
sentence: The Food & Wine Classic is held annually in June in Aspen, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Aspen also has a reputation as the culinary capital of the Rocky Mountain region.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is known for steak, but now has a diverse culinary scene with many restaurants.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado wines include award-winning varieties that have attracted favourable attention from outside the state.

name: colorado
sentence: With traditional Vitis vinifera grape-based wines as well as cherries, peaches, plums and honey, Colorado wines have won national and international awards for their quality.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's wine-growing regions are home to the highest vineyards in the United States, with most of the state's viticulture being between 4,000 and 7,000 feet (1,219 and 2,134 m) above sea level.

name: colorado
sentence: The mountain climate ensures warm summer days and cool nights.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to two U.S. wine-growing areas in the Grand Valley AVA and the West Elks AVA, where most of the state's vineyards are located.

name: colorado
sentence: However, an increasing number of wineries are located along the Front chain.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, Wine Enthusiast Magazine named the Colorado Grand Valley AVA in Mesa County, Colorado, as one of ten wine travel destinations in the world.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to many nationally recognized microbreweries, including the New Belgium Brewing Company, Odell Brewing Company, Great Divide Brewing Company and Bristol Brewing Company.

name: colorado
sentence: The northern Colorado region, close to and between the cities of Denver, Boulder and Fort Collins, is known as the "Napa Valley of Beer" because of its high density of artisanal breweries.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is open to cannabis tourism (marijuana).

name: colorado
sentence: With the adoption of their 64th State Amendment in 2013, Colorado became the first state in the Union to legalize the medicinal, industrial and recreational use of marijuana (2000).

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado marijuana industry sold $1.31 billion in marijuana in 2016 and $1.26 billion in the first three quarters of 2017.

name: colorado
sentence: The government generated tax revenues, fees and licenses of $194 million in 2016 on legal marijuana sales.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado regulates hemp as any part of the plant with less than 0.3% THC.

name: colorado
sentence: Amendment 64, adopted by voters in the 2012 general election, requires the Colorado State Parliament to enact laws governing the cultivation, processing and sale of recreational marijuana and industrial hemp.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 4, 2014, Senator Bill 14–184 dealing with monitoring the Colorado industrial hemp program was introduced for the first time and was finally signed by Governor John Hickenlooper on May 31, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: On 7 November 2000, 54% of Colorado voters adopted Amendment 20, which amends the Constitution of the State of Colorado to allow the medical use of marijuana.

name: colorado
sentence: Medical use of marijuana by a patient, within the following limits, is legal:

name: colorado
sentence: Currently, Colorado has listed "eight medical conditions for which patients can use marijuana: cancer, glaucoma, HIV/AIDS, muscle spasms, seizures, severe pain, severe nausea and cachexia, or dramatic weight loss and muscle atrophy."

name: colorado
sentence: While Governor, John Hickenlooper has allocated about half of the $13 million from the Medical Marijuana Program Cash Fund to medical research in Budget 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, the Medical Marijuana Program Cash Fund was the "greatest potted silver pool in the state" and was used to fund programs including research on paediatric applications to control the symptoms of autism.

name: colorado
sentence: On November 6, 2012, electors amended the state constitution to protect the "personal use" of marijuana for adults, establishing a framework to regulate marijuana in a manner similar to that of alcohol.

name: colorado
sentence: The first recreational marijuana stores in Colorado and by extension in the United States opened on January 1, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has five major professional sports leagues, all based in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is the least populated state with a franchise in each of the major professional sports leagues.

name: colorado
sentence: The Pikes Peak International Hill Climb is a major climbing race on the Pikes Peak Highway.

name: colorado
sentence: The Cherry Hills Country Club has hosted several professional golf tournaments, including the US Open, the US Senator Open, the US Women's Open, the PGA Championship and the BMW Championship.

name: colorado
sentence: The following universities and colleges participate in Division I of the National Association of Sports Colleges.

name: colorado
sentence: The most popular college sport program is the University of Colorado Buffaloes, which used to play in the Big-12 but now play in the Pac-12.

name: colorado
sentence: They won the Orange Bowl 1957 and 1991, the Fiesta Bowl 1995 and the Cotton Bowl Classic 1996.

name: colorado
sentence: CNBC's Top States for Business for 2010 has recognized Colorado as the third best state of the nation, reaching only Texas and Virginia.

name: colorado
sentence: The Government's total revenue in 2015 was $318.6 billion.

name: colorado
sentence: The median annual household income in 2016 was $70,666, 8th in the country.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2010, personal income per capita was $51,940, ranking 11th in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The state economy expanded from its mid-19th century roots in mining when irrigated agriculture developed, and by the end of the 19th century, livestock had become important.

name: colorado
sentence: The first industries were based on the extraction and processing of minerals and agricultural products.

name: colorado
sentence: Current agricultural products include livestock, wheat, dairy products, corn and hay.

name: colorado
sentence: The federal government is also a major economic force in the state, with many major federal facilities, including NORAD (North American Aerospace Defense Command), the United States Air Force Academy, the Schriever Air Force Base approximately 16 kilometres east of the Peterson Air Force Base, and Fort Carson, both located in Colorado Springs, El Paso County; NOAA, the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) in Golden, and the National Institute of Standards and Technology in Boulder; the US Geological Survey and other government agencies at the Denver Federal Center near Lakewood; Denver Mint, Buckley Air Force Base, the 10th Circuit Appeal Court, and Byron G. Rogers Federal Building and the United States Courthouse in Denver; and a federal Supermax prison and other federal prisons near Cañon City.

name: colorado
