name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is a state in the northeastern part of the United States of America.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the 2010 census, it has the highest per capita income, the human development index (0.962) and the median household income in the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is bordered by Rhode Island to the east, Massachusetts to the north, New York to the west and Long Island Sound to the south.

name: connecticut
sentence: Its capital is Hartford and its most populated city is Bridgeport.

name: connecticut
sentence: Geographically, the state is part of New England, and although its cultural history comes from the region in the modern era, large sections of it are increasingly linked and associated with the three-state region with New York and New Jersey.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state is named for the Connecticut River which approximately bisects the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The word "Connecticut" is derived from various anglicized spellings of -Quonoquett (Conanicut), a Mohegan-Pequot word for "long tidal waves".

name: connecticut
sentence: The first European settlers in Connecticut were Dutch, who established a small, short-lived settlement called Fort Hoop in Hartford at the confluence of the Park and Connecticut rivers.

name: connecticut
sentence: Half of Connecticut was originally part of the Dutch colony New Netherlands, which included much of the land between Connecticut and Delaware, although the first large colonies were established in the 1630s by the English.

name: connecticut
sentence: Thomas Hooker led a band of followers of the Massachusetts Bay colony and founded the Connecticut colony

name: connecticut
sentence: The colonies of Connecticut and New Haven have established basic documents, considered the first constitutions in America.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1662, the three colonies merged under a royal charter, making Connecticut a colony of the crown.

name: connecticut
sentence: It was one of the Thirteen Colonies that rejected British domination in the American Revolution.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is the third smallest state by region, the 29th most populated, and the fourth densest of the 50 states.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is known as the "Constitutional State", the "Nutmeg State", the "State of Provision" and the "State of Steady Habits".

name: connecticut
sentence: It has played an important role in the development of the U.S. federal government (see Connecticut Compromise).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River, the Thames River and ports along the Long Island Strait have given Connecticut a strong maritime tradition that continues today.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state also has a long history of hosting the financial services industry, including insurance companies in Hartford and hedge funds in Fairfield County.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is bordered south by Long Island Sound, west by New York, north by Massachusetts, and east by Rhode Island.

name: connecticut
sentence: The capital of the state and the fourth largest city are Hartford, and other major cities (by population) are Bridgeport, New Haven, Stamford, Waterbury, Norwalk, Danbury, New Britain, Greenwich and Bristol.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is slightly larger than Montenegro.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are 169 incorporated cities in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest peak of Connecticut is Bear Mountain in Salisbury, in the northwest corner of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest point is just east of the point where Connecticut, Massachusetts and New York (42°3′ N, 73°29′ W) meet on the southern slope of Mount Frissell, which peaks near Massachusetts.

name: connecticut
sentence: To the extreme opposite, many coastal cities have areas less than 20 feet (6 m) above sea level.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has a long maritime history and a reputation based on this history, but the state does not have a direct (technically speaking) seafront.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut coast is located on Long Island Strait, which is an estuary.

name: connecticut
sentence: State access to the open Atlantic Ocean is both west (to New York) and east (to the "race" near Rhode Island).

name: connecticut
sentence: This situation provides many safe harbours from ocean storms, and many transatlantic vessels seek anchor within Long Island Strait when tropical cyclones pass off the upper east coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River crosses the centre of the state and flows through Long Island Strait.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most populated metropolitan area in the centre of the state is in the Connecticut River Valley.

name: connecticut
sentence: Despite the relatively small size of Connecticut, it has large regional variations in its landscape; for example, in the northwest Litchfield Hills, it includes mountains and horse farms, while in the east of New Haven along the coast, the landscape includes coastal marshes, beaches and large-scale marine activities.

name: connecticut
sentence: The rural areas of Connecticut and the small towns on the northeast and northwest corners of the state contrast strongly with its industrial cities such as Stamford, Bridgeport and New Haven, located along the coastal highways from the New York border to New London, then north to the Connecticut River to Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many cities in the northeast and northwest of Connecticut centre around a green.

name: connecticut
sentence: Near the green are usually historical visual symbols of New England's cities, such as a white church, colonial meeting house, colonial tavern or inn, several colonial houses, etc., establishing a picturesque historical appearance maintained for historical preservation and tourism.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many of the southern and coastal regions of Connecticut have been built and rebuilt over the years, and are less visually similar to traditional New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: The northern boundary of the state with Massachusetts is marked by the Southwick Jog or Granby Notch, a square detour of about 4.0 km to Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The origin of this anomaly is clearly established in a long series of disputes and temporary agreements that were finally concluded in 1804, when the residents of south Southwick sought to leave Massachusetts, and the city was divided into two.

name: connecticut
sentence: The southwestern border of Connecticut, where it opposes New York State, is marked by a panhandle in Fairfield County, which contains the cities of Greenwich, Stamford, New Canaan, Darien and parts of Norwalk and Wilton.

name: connecticut
sentence: This irregularity in the border was the result of territorial disputes at the end of the 17th century, until New York gave up its claim to the area, which residents considered to be part of Connecticut, in exchange for an equivalent area extending north of Ridgefield on the Massachusetts border, as well as an undisputed claim in Rye, New York.

name: connecticut
sentence: Areas maintained by the National Parks Service include the Appalachian National Scenic Trail, the Quinebaug and Shetucket River Valley National Heritage Corridor, and Weir Farm National Historic Site.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is located in the rough transition zone between the southern tip of the humid continental climate and the northern part of the humid subtropical climate.

name: connecticut
sentence: Northern Connecticut generally has a climate with cold winters with moderate snowfall and warm and humid summers.

name: connecticut
sentence: The extreme south and the coast of Connecticut have a climate with cool winters with a mixture of rain and rare snow, and long warm and humid summers typical of the middle and lower East coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut sees a fairly uniform precipitation pattern, with precipitation and snowfall spreading throughout the 12 months.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut accounts for an average of 56% of the possible sunshine (higher than the U.S. national average), an average of 2400 hours of sunshine per year.

name: connecticut
sentence: The early spring (April) can range from slightly cool (40s to 50s F) to hot (65 to 70 F), while the middle and late spring (late April/May) are warm.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the end of May, the Bermuda High Building created a southern flow of warm, humid tropical air, bringing warm weather conditions throughout the state, with high mean in New London of 81°F (27°C) and 85°F (29°C) in Windsor Locks at the top of the summer in late July.

name: connecticut
sentence: Occasionally, heat waves of 90 to 100°F (38°C) occur across Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Although summers are sunny in Connecticut, fast and moving summer thunderstorms can cause brief flooding with thunder and lightning.

name: connecticut
sentence: Sometimes these thunderstorms can be severe, and the condition on average one tornado per year.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the hurricane season, the remnants of tropical cyclones sometimes affect the region, although a direct impact is rare.

name: connecticut
sentence: The time usually associated with the fall season usually begins in October and lasts until the first days of December.

name: connecticut
sentence: The daily temperatures in October and November vary between the 50s and 60s (Fahrenheit) with nights in the 40s and 30s.

name: connecticut
sentence: In early October, coloured foliage began in the northern parts of the state and moved south and east to south-east Connecticut in early November.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, the southern and coastal regions have more oaks and hickory trees (and fewer maples) and are often less colourful than the northern regions.

name: connecticut
sentence: In December, the highs of day are in 40°F for a large part of the state, and the lows of night are below freezing.

name: connecticut
sentence: Winters (December to mid-March) are generally cold from south to north in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The coldest month (January) has high mean temperatures ranging from 38°F (3°C) in coastal lowlands to 33°F (1°C) in the interior and northern parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Average annual snowfall ranges from about 60 inches (1,500 mm) at high elevations in the northern part of the state to only 20-25 inches (510-640 mm) along the southeast coast of Connecticut (Branford to Groton).

name: connecticut
sentence: In general, any locality north or west of Interstate 84 receives the most snow during a storm and throughout the season.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most of Connecticut has less than 60 days of snow cover.

name: connecticut
sentence: Snow usually falls from late November to late March in the northern part of the state, and from early December to mid-March in the southern and coastal parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The record temperature of Connecticut is 106°F (41°C) which occurred in Danbury on 15 July 1995; the record low is −32°F (−36°C) which occurred in the Northwest Hills Falls Village on 16 February 1943 and Coventry on 22 January 1961.

name: connecticut
sentence: The forests consist of a mixture of coastal forests in the north-east of Oak in the southern regions of the state, up to the high forests of New England and Acadia in the north-western parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mountain Laurel (Kalmia latifolia) is the flower of the state and originates from low ridges in several parts of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Rosebay Rhododendron (maximum Rhododendron) is also native to the eastern Connecticut highlands and the Pachaug State Forest houses the Rhododendron Sanctuary Trail.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Atlantic white cedar (Chamaecyparis thyoides) is found in wetlands in the southern part of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has an indigenous cactus (Opuntia humifusa), found in sandy coastal areas and low hills.

name: connecticut
sentence: Several types of beach grasses and wildflowers are also native to Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut covers the hardiness zones of USDA plants 5b to 7a.

name: connecticut
sentence: Coastal Connecticut is the vast transition zone where more southern and subtropical plants are grown.

name: connecticut
sentence: In some coastal communities, Magnolia grandiflora (southern magnolia), Crape Myrtle, palm scrubs (Sabal minor), Needle Palms (Rhapidophyllum hystrix) and other broad-leaved hardwoods are cultivated in small numbers.

name: connecticut
sentence: The name Connecticut is derived from the word Mohegan-Pequot which was translated as "long tidal river" and "long river", referring to the Connecticut River.

name: connecticut
sentence: The human presence in the Connecticut region dates back 10,000 years.

name: connecticut
sentence: Stone tools were used for hunting, fishing and woodworking.

name: connecticut
sentence: Semi-nomads in the way of life, these peoples moved seasonally to take advantage of various resources in the region.

name: connecticut
sentence: They shared languages based on Algonquian.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut region was inhabited by many Amerindian tribes that can be grouped into the Nipmuc, the Sequins or the "River Indians" (which included the Tunxis, Schaghticoke, Podunk, Wangunk, Hammonasset and Quinnipiac), the Mattabsec or the "Wolf Confederation" and the Pequot-Mohegan.

name: connecticut
sentence: Some of these groups continue to remain in Connecticut, including Mohegans, Pequots and Paugusetts.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first European explorer in Connecticut was Dutchman Adriaen Block, who explored the region in 1614.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Dutch fur traders then sailed on the Connecticut River, which they called Versche Rivier ("Fresh River"), and built a fort at Dutch Point in Hartford which they called "House of Hope" (Dutch: Huis van Hoop).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut colony was originally a number of small separate settlements in Windsor, Wethersfield, Saybrook, Hartford and New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first English settlers came in 1633 and moved to Windsor, then to Wethersfield the following year.

name: connecticut
sentence: John Winthrop the youth of Massachusetts received a commission to create the Saybrook settlement at the mouth of the Connecticut River in 1635.

name: connecticut
sentence: The main body of the settlers came into a large group in 1636.

name: connecticut
sentence: They were Puritans of the Massachusetts Bay colony, led by Thomas Hooker, who founded the Connecticut colony in Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Quinnipiack colony was founded by John Davenport, Theophilus Eaton and others in New Haven in March 1638.

name: connecticut
sentence: The colony of New Haven had its own constitution called the "Basic Agreement of the New Haven Colony", signed on 4 June 1639.

name: connecticut
sentence: The regulations were made without official sanction from the English Crown, and each was an independent political entity.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1662 Winthrop travelled to England and obtained a charter from Charles II which united the colonies of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Colonial colonies of historical significance include Windsor (1633), Wethersfield (1634), Saybrook (1635), Hartford (1636), New Haven (1638), Fairfield (1639), Guilford (1639), Milford (1639), Stratford (1639), Farmington (1640), Stamford (1641) and New London (1646).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Pequot War marked the first major confrontation between settlers and Amerindians in New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Pequots reacted with increasing aggression to colonial settlements on their territory, while simultaneously taking land from the Narragansett and Mohegan tribes.

name: connecticut
sentence: The settlers responded to a murder in 1636 with a raid on a village of Pequot on Block Island; the Pequots laid siege to the Saybrook Colony garrison this fall, and then looted Wethersfield in the spring of 1637.

name: connecticut
sentence: The settlers declared war on the Pequots, organized a band of militias and allies of the Mohegan and Narragansett tribes, and attacked a village of Pequot on the Mystic River, with estimates of deaths ranging from 300 to 700 Pequots.

name: connecticut
sentence: After another major loss in a battle at Fairfield, the Pequots demanded a truce and conditions of peace.

name: connecticut
sentence: The western boundaries of Connecticut have been subject to changes over time.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Hartford Treaty with the Dutch was signed on 19 Sept. 1650, but it was never ratified by the British.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to her, the western boundary of Connecticut extended north of Greenwich Bay for a distance of 32 km, provided that the line was not less than 10 miles from the Hudson River.

name: connecticut
sentence: This agreement was observed by both sides until the war broke out between England and the Netherlands in 1652.

name: connecticut
sentence: The conflict continued over colonial boundaries until the Duke of York seized New Netherlands in 1664.

name: connecticut
sentence: On the other hand, the original Charter of Connecticut in 1662 granted it all the land to the "South Sea", that is to say the Pacific Ocean.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most of the royal colonial concessions were granted for long east-west bands.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut takes its concession seriously and establishes a ninth county between the Susquehanna River and the Delaware River, Westmoreland County.

name: connecticut
sentence: This led to a brief Pennamite war with Pennsylvania.

name: connecticut
sentence: Yale College was established in 1701, providing Connecticut with an important institution to educate clergy and civilian leaders.

name: connecticut
sentence: The congregational church dominated religious life in the colony and, by extension, municipal affairs in many parts.

name: connecticut
sentence: With more than 600 miles of coastline, including along its navigable rivers, during the colonial years, Connecticut developed a history of a maritime tradition that would later produce booms in shipbuilding, shipping, naval support, seafood production and recreational boating.

name: connecticut
sentence: Historical records indicate that the Tryall was the first ship built in the Connecticut settlement in 1649 at a site on the Connecticut River in the present Wethersfield.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the two decades preceding 1776 and the American Revolution, the shipyards of Connecticut launched about 100 sloops, schooners and brigs according to a US customs database maintained online by the Mystic Seaport Museum, the most important being the 180-ton Patient Mary launched at New Haven in 1763.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first lighthouse in Connecticut was built in 1760 at the mouth of the Thames River with the lighthouse at New London Harbour.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut appointed four delegates to the Second Continental Congress who signed the Declaration of Independence: Samuel Huntington, Roger Sherman, William Williams and Oliver Wolcott.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut legislature authorized the addition of six new regiments in 1775, following clashes between British regulars and the Massachusetts militia in Lexington and Concord.

name: connecticut
sentence: There were some 1,200 soldiers from Connecticut at the Battle of Bunker Hill in June 1775.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1775 David Bushnell invented the Turtle, which, the following year, launched the first underwater attack in history, without success against a British warship at anchor in the port of New York.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1777, the British received news of supplies from the Continental Army in Danbury, and landed an expeditionary force of some 2,000 soldiers in Westport.

name: connecticut
sentence: This force then marched to Danbury and destroyed houses and much of the depot.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mainland Army troops and militias led by General David Wooster and General Benedict Arnold hired them during their march back to Ridgefield in 1777.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the winter of 1778–79, General George Washington decided to divide the Continental Army into three divisions surrounding New York City, where British General Sir Henry Clinton had taken his winter quarters.

name: connecticut
sentence: Major General Israel Putnam chose Redding as a winter camp for some 3,000 regular members and militia under his command.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Redding camp allowed Putnam soldiers to keep the reconstituted supply depot in Danbury and to support any operation along Long Island Strait and the Hudson River Valley.

name: connecticut
sentence: Some of these men were veterans of the winter camp in Valley Forge, Pennsylvania, the previous winter.

name: connecticut
sentence: Soldiers at the Redding camp suffered from supply shortages, cold temperatures and heavy snow, and some historians doubled the "Connecticut's Valley Forge" camp.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state was also the site of several raids on Long Island orchestrated by Samuel Holden Parsons and Benjamin Tallmadge, and provided men and equipment for the war effort, particularly to the Washington Army outside New York City.

name: connecticut
sentence: General William Tryon raided the coast of Connecticut in July 1779, focusing on New Haven, Norwalk and Fairfield.

name: connecticut
sentence: In September 1781 Benedict Arnold, who had betrayed the British, raided New London and Groton Heights.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the beginning of the American Revolution, the Continental Congress entrusted Nathaniel Shaw Jr. of New London, his naval agent in charge of recruiting privateers to seize British ships as an opportunity, with nearly 50 operations from the Thames River, which eventually fired reprisals from the British force led by Arnold.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut ratified the American Constitution on 9 January 1788, becoming the fifth state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state flourished during the period after the American Revolution, as mills and textile factories were built and seaports flourished from trade and fishing.

name: connecticut
sentence: After Congress established in 1790 the predecessor of the US Revenue Cutter Service, which was to become the US Coast Guard, the president of Washington entrusted Jonathan Maltbie with one of the seven masters to enforce customs regulations, Maltbie supervising the south coast of New England with a 48-foot sloop named Argus.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1786, Connecticut transferred the territory to the U.S. government, which was part of the Northwest Territory.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state retained land that extended to the northern part of present-day Ohio, the Western Connecticut Reserve.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Western Reserve section was largely established by people from Connecticut, and they brought the place names from Connecticut to Ohio.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has entered into agreements with Pennsylvania and New York that have extinguished land claims within these states and created the Connecticut Panhandle.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state then transferred the Western Reserve in 1800 to the federal government, which led it to its present limits (except minor adjustments with Massachusetts).

name: connecticut
sentence: For the first time in 1800, the shipwrecked in Connecticut launched more than 100 ships in a single year.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the following decade, at the door of the resumption of hostilities with Great Britain that triggered the War of 1812, the shipyards in Connecticut built nearly 1,000 ships, the most productive stretch of any decade in the 19th century.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the war, the British raided Stonington and Essex and blocked ships in the Thames River.

name: connecticut
sentence: Isaac Hull, from Derby, became the most famous naval figure in Connecticut to win a reputation during the conflict, as captain of the USConstitution.

name: connecticut
sentence: The British blockade during the War of 1812 undermined exports and reinforced the influence of federalists who opposed the war.

name: connecticut
sentence: The cessation of imports from Great Britain has stimulated the construction of factories to manufacture textiles and machinery.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has been recognized as a major manufacturing centre, partly because of the inventions of Eli Whitney and other early innovators of the industrial revolution.

name: connecticut
sentence: The war led to the development of rapid clippers that helped extend the reach of New England merchants to the Pacific and Indian oceans.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the first half of the 19th century, whale hunting rose rapidly, with New London being one of the three largest home ports in the New England industry after Nantucket and New Bedford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state was known for its political conservatism, characterized by its federalist party and the Yale College of Timothy Dwight.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most important intellectuals were Dwight and Noah Webster, who compiled his great dictionary in New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: Religious tensions polarize the state, while the Congregational Church struggles to maintain traditional points of view, in alliance with the federalists.

name: connecticut
sentence: The failure of the Hartford Convention in 1814 undermined the federalist cause, with the Democratic Republican Party taking control in 1817.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut had been governed by the "Fundamental Orders" since 1639, but the state adopted a new constitution in 1818.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut manufacturers played a major role in supplying EU forces with weapons and supplies during the civil war.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state provided 55,000 men, trained in thirty full infantry regiments, including two in the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: Coloured troupes, with several Connecticut men becoming general.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Navy attracted 250 officers and 2,100 men, and Gideon Welles, from Glastonbury, served as Secretary of the Navy.

name: connecticut
sentence: James H. Ward of Hartford was the first US

name: connecticut
sentence: Naval officer killed in the civil war.

name: connecticut
sentence: Among the victims of Connecticut, 2,088 were killed in combat, 2,801 died of illness and 689 died in confederate prison camps.

name: connecticut
sentence: A wave of national unity in 1861 brought thousands of tributaries to the colors of each city.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, as the war became a crusade to end slavery, many democrats (especially Irish Catholics) withdrew.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Democrats have taken a position in favour of slavery and have included many Copperheads ready to leave the secession of the South.

name: connecticut
sentence: The intense fight in 1863 for the governor's election was won narrowly by the Republicans.

name: connecticut
sentence: The vast Connecticut industry, its dense population, its flat terrain and its wealth encouraged the construction of railways from 1839.

name: connecticut
sentence: By 1840, 102 miles (264 km) of the line were in service, reaching 402 miles (647 km) in 1850 and 601 miles (967 km) in 1860.

name: connecticut
sentence: New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad, known as the New Haven or The Consolidated, became the dominant Connecticut railway company after 1872.

name: connecticut
sentence: J.P. Morgan began financing New England's major railways in the 1890s, dividing the territory so that they would not compete.

name: connecticut
sentence: The New Haven purchased 50 small businesses, including steamship lines, and built a network of light rails (electrified railways) that provided long distance transportation for the entire south of New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1912, the New Haven operated more than 3,200 kilometres of track with 120,000 employees.

name: connecticut
sentence: As the steam ships proliferated after the Civil War, Noank produced the two largest ships built in Connecticut during the 19th century, with the 332-foot wooden steam wheel Rhode Island launched in 1882 and the 345-foot pallet wheel Connecticut seven years later.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut shipyards would launch more than 165 steamships in the 19th century.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1875, the world's first telephone electoral district was established in New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: When World War I broke out in 1914, Connecticut became a major supplier of weapons to the American army; in 1918, 80% of the state's industries produced goods for the war effort.

name: connecticut
sentence: Remington Arms in Bridgeport produced half of the small arms cartridges used by the U.S. Army, along with other major suppliers, including Winchester in New Haven and Colt in Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut was also a major supplier of the U.S. Navy, with electrical boat orders for 85 submarines, the construction of Torpedo Lake boats over 20 submarines and Groton Iron Works cargo ships.

name: connecticut
sentence: On 21 June 1916, the Navy made Groton the site of its base and of its submarine school on the East Coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state enthusiastically supported the American war effort in 1917 and 1918, with large purchases of war bonds, a further expansion of industry and an emphasis on increasing food production on farms.

name: connecticut
sentence: Thousands of state, local and voluntary groups mobilized for the war effort and were coordinated by the State Defense Council of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Manufacturers faced labour shortages; Waterbury's American Brass and Manufacturing Company operated at half its capacity, so the federal government agreed to abandon the soldiers to work there.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1919, J. Henry Roraback began the Connecticut Light & Power Co. which became the dominant electrical utility of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1925, Frederick Rentschler encouraged the creation of Pratt & Whitney in Hartford to develop engines for aircraft; the company became a major military supplier during the Second World War and one of the world's top three jet engine manufacturers.

name: connecticut
sentence: On September 21, 1938, the most destructive storm in New England's history struck East Connecticut, killing hundreds of people.

name: connecticut
sentence: The eye of the Long Island Express passed just west of New Haven and ravaged the coast of Connecticut between Old Saybrook and Stonington from the full force of wind and waves, even though they were partially protected by Long Island.

name: connecticut
sentence: The hurricane caused considerable damage to infrastructure, homes and businesses.

name: connecticut
sentence: In New London, a 150-metre sailboat was taken to a warehouse, causing a major fire.

name: connecticut
sentence: Heavy rainfall caused flooding of the Connecticut River in downtown Hartford and East Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is estimated that 50,000 trees have fallen on the roads.

name: connecticut
sentence: The advent of the lease in support of Britain helped to lift the Connecticut of the Great Depression, with the State a major centre for the production of weapons and supplies used during the Second World War.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut manufactured 4.1% of the total U.S. military weapons produced during the war, ranking ninth among the 48 states, with large factories including Colt for firearms, Pratt & Whitney for aircraft engines, Chance Vought for fighter aircraft, Hamilton Standard for propellers, and Electric Boat for submarines and PT boats.

name: connecticut
sentence: In Bridgeport, General Electric produced an important new weapon to fight tanks: the bazooka.

name: connecticut
sentence: On 13 May 1940, Igor Sikorsky made a free flight of the first practical helicopter.

name: connecticut
sentence: The helicopter was used little during the Second World War, but future military production made the Stratford Sikorsky Aircraft plant the largest manufacturing site in Connecticut at the beginning of the 21st century.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut lost a few factories in wartime after the end of hostilities, but the state participated in a general post-war expansion that included road construction and led to the growth of the middle class in the suburbs.

name: connecticut
sentence: Prescott Bush represented Connecticut in the U.S. Senate from 1952 to 1963.

name: connecticut
sentence: Bush and grandson George W. Bush both became presidents of the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1965, Connecticut ratified its current constitution, replacing the document that has served since 1818.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1968, commercial operation of the Connecticut Yankee Nuclear Generating Station in East Haddam began; in 1970, the Millstone Nuclear Generating Station began operations in Waterford.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1974, Connecticut elected Democratic Governor Ella T. Grasso, who became the first woman in a state to be elected governor without being the wife or widow of a previous governor.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's dependence on the defence industry posed an economic challenge at the end of the cold war.

name: connecticut
sentence: The resulting fiscal crisis led to Lowell Weicker's election as governor on a third-party ticket in 1990.

name: connecticut
sentence: Weicker's recourse was a state income tax that proved effective in balancing the budget, but only in the short term.

name: connecticut
sentence: He did not run for a second term, partly because of this politically unpopular movement.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1992, the initial construction was completed at Foxwoods Casino at Pequots Mashantucket Reserve in eastern Connecticut, which became the largest casino in the Western Hemisphere.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mohegan Sun followed four years later.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2000, the presidential candidate Al Gore chose Senator Joe Lieberman as a race companion, marking the first time that a major party presidential ticket included someone of the Jewish faith.

name: connecticut
sentence: Gore and Lieberman lost five votes below George W. Bush and Dick Cheney at the Electoral College.In the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks, 65 state residents were killed, mainly Fairfield County residents who worked at the World Trade Center.In 2004, Republican Governor John G. Rowland resigned in an investigation into corruption, later pleading federal charges.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hurricane Irene hit Connecticut on August 28 and the damage totalled $235 million.

name: connecticut
sentence: Two months later, Halloween and the east fell snow on the trees, resulting in broken branches and trunks that damaged the power lines; some areas were powerless for 11 days.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hurricane Sandy had tropical storm winds when it reached Connecticut on October 29, 2012.

name: connecticut
sentence: Sandy's winds have caused storm surges in the streets and reduced electricity to 98% of homes and businesses, with over $360 million in damage.

name: connecticut
sentence: On December 14, 2012, Adam Lanza killed 26 people at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown and then killed himself.

name: connecticut
sentence: The massacre stimulated the militants' renewed efforts for stricter laws on firearms ownership at the national level.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the summer and autumn of 2016, Connecticut experienced drought in many parts of the state, causing some prohibitions on water use.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of November 15, 2016 (2016-11-15), 45% of the state was listed as Severe Drought by the US Dryer Monitor, including almost all Hartford and Litchfield counties.

name: connecticut
sentence: All the rest of the state was in Middlesex, Fairfield, New London, New Haven, Windham and Tolland counties.

name: connecticut
sentence: This has affected the state's agricultural economy.

name: connecticut
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the Connecticut population was 3,565,287 as of 1 July 2019, a 0.25 per cent decrease from the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, Connecticut's population was estimated at 3,565,287, a decrease of 7,378 (0.25%) from the previous year and 8,810 (0.25%) from 2010.

name: connecticut
sentence: This includes a natural increase since the last census of 67,427 (222,222 births minus 154,795 deaths) and an increase due to net migration of 41,718 people in the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 75,991 people, and internal migration resulted in a net loss of 34,273.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to 2005 estimates, Connecticut has moved from the 29th most populous state to the 30th.

name: connecticut
sentence: The population of Connecticut was estimated at 3,572,665 in 2018.

name: connecticut
sentence: 6.6 per cent of its population were under the age of 5, 24.7 per cent under the age of 18 and 13.8 per cent over the age of 65.

name: connecticut
sentence: Women accounted for about 51.6 per cent of the population, with 48.4 per cent men.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1790, 97% of the population of Connecticut was classified as "rural".

name: connecticut
sentence: The first census in which less than half of the population was classified as rural took place in 1890.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the 2000 census, only 12.3% were considered rural.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most of the west and south of Connecticut (especially the Gold Coast) is strongly associated with New York City

name: connecticut
sentence: The population centre of Connecticut is located in the city of Cheshire.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the 2010 United States Census, the percentages of race and ethnicity in Connecticut were as follows:

name: connecticut
sentence: Hispanics and Latinos of all races accounted for 13.4% of the 2010 census population.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most populous ethnic group in the state is the non-Hispanic white, but it rose from 98 per cent in 1940 to 71 per cent in 2010.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2004, 11.4 per cent of the population (400,000) was born abroad.

name: connecticut
sentence: By 1870, native Americans accounted for 75 per cent of the state's population, but this proportion had fallen to 35 per cent in 1918.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2000, 81.69 per cent of Connecticut residents aged 5 and over spoke English at home and 8.42 per cent spoke Spanish, followed by Italian (1.59%), French (1.31%) and Polish (1.20%).

name: connecticut
sentence: The largest groups of European ancestry are:

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2011, 46.1% of the population of Connecticut under 1 year of age were minorities.

name: connecticut
sentence: Note: Births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnicity and race, giving a higher overall number.

name: connecticut
sentence: Religious affiliations of the people of Connecticut from 2014:

name: connecticut
sentence: A Pew survey of the religious self-identification of Connecticut residents showed the following distribution of affiliations: Protestants 35%, Mormonism 1%, Jews 3%, Roman Catholics 33%, Orthodox 1%, non-religious 28%, Jehovah's Witness 1%, Hinduism 1%, Buddhism 1% and Islam 1%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Jewish congregations had 108,280 members (3.2 per cent) in 2000.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Jewish population is concentrated in the cities near Long Island Sound, between Greenwich and New Haven, in the Grand New Haven and in Grand Hartford, particularly in the suburbs of West Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to the Association of Religion Data Archives, the largest Christian denominations, according to the number of adherents, in 2010 were: the Catholic Church, with 1.252.936; the United Church of Christ, with 96.506; and the non-denominational evangelical Protestants, with 72.863.

name: connecticut
sentence: Recent immigration has brought other non-Christian religions to the State, but the number of adherents of other religions is still low.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is also home to New England's largest Protestant church: the first Bloomfield Cathedral in Hartford County.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hartford is the seat of the Catholic Archdiocese of Hartford, which is sovereign over the Diocese of Bridgeport and the Diocese of Norwich.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's economic output in 2019, measured by gross domestic product, was $289 billion, up from $277.9 billion in 2018.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's personal income per capita in 2019 was estimated at $79,087, the highest in all states.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, there is a large disparity in income across the state; after New York, Connecticut had the second largest national gap between average incomes of the highest 1 per cent and average incomes of the lowest 99 per cent.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to a 2018 study by Phoenix Marketing International, Connecticut had the third largest number of millionaires per capita in the United States, with a ratio of 7.75%.

name: connecticut
sentence: New Canaan is the richest city in Connecticut, with a per capita income of $85,459.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hartford is the poorest municipality in Connecticut, with a per capita income of $13,428 in 2000.

name: connecticut
sentence: In December 2019, Connecticut's seasonally adjusted unemployment rate was 3.8%, with an American unemployment rate of 3.5% that month.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1982, Connecticut recorded its lowest unemployment rate in 2000 between August and October, at 2.2%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest unemployment rate during this period occurred in November and December 2010 at 9.3%, but economists expect new record levels of layoffs to be recorded following the closure of businesses in the spring of 2020 following the coronavirus pandemic.

name: connecticut
sentence: Tax is collected by the Ministry of Tax Services of Connecticut and local municipalities.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2012, after New York, Connecticut residents had the second highest national tax rate, 12.6 per cent of income compared to the national average of 9.9 per cent, as reported by the Tax Foundation.

name: connecticut
sentence: Prior to 1991, Connecticut had an income tax system only.

name: connecticut
sentence: Employment income was not taxed, but investment income was taxed at 13 per cent, the highest rate in the United States, without deductions for the costs of producing investment income, such as interest on borrowings.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1991, under the authority of Governor Lowell P. Weicker Jr., an independent, the plan was modified into a system in which taxes on employment income and investment income were equal to the maximum rate of 4%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The new tax policy attracted investment firms to Connecticut; in 2019, Fairfield County was home to 16 of the world's 200 largest hedge funds.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, Connecticut's personal income tax rates were divided into seven tax brackets of 3% (on income up to $10,000); 5% ($10,000 to $50,000); 5.5% ($50,000 to $100,000); 6% ($100,000 to $200,000); 6.5% ($200,000 to $250,000); 6.9% ($250,000 to $500,000) and 6.9% above $500,000, the additional amounts being due by band.

name: connecticut
sentence: All salaries of Connecticut residents are subject to state income tax, even if they are earned outside the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, in these cases, Connecticut's income tax should be withheld only to the extent that Connecticut's tax exceeds the amount withheld by the other administration.

name: connecticut
sentence: Since New York has higher income tax rates than Connecticut, this means that Connecticut residents working in New York do not have any Connecticut income tax withheld.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut allows for a credit for taxes paid to other jurisdictions, but since residents working in other states are still subject to Connecticut income tax, they may be liable for taxes if the jurisdictional credit does not fully offset Connecticut's tax amount.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut collects a sales tax of 6.35% on the retail sale, rental or rental of most property.

name: connecticut
sentence: Certain articles and services in general are not subject to sales and use taxes unless they are specifically listed as taxable by law.

name: connecticut
sentence: A provision excluding clothing of less than $50 from sales tax was repealed on July 1, 2011.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are no additional sales taxes imposed by local authorities.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2001, Connecticut introduced what became an annual "holiday" sales tax of one week in August, when retailers do not have to pay sales tax on certain items and quantities of clothing that have varied from year to year.

name: connecticut
sentence: State law allows municipalities to tax property, including real property, vehicles and other personal property, with State law providing for various exemptions, credits and allowances.

name: connecticut
sentence: All contributions are at 70% of the fair market value.

name: connecticut
sentence: The maximum property tax credit is $200 per return and any surplus cannot be refunded or carried forward.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to the Tax Foundation, in fiscal year 2017, Connecticut residents paid the nation's third highest average property tax after New Hampshire and New Jersey.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of January 1, 2020, gas taxes and duties in Connecticut were 40.13 cents per gallon, the 11th highest in the United States, with a national average of 36.13 cents per gallon excluding federal taxes.

name: connecticut
sentence: In Connecticut in January 2020, taxes and charges on diesel fuel were 46.50 cents per gallon, the ninth highest nationally, with an American average of 37.91 cents.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, single-family home sales in Connecticut totaled 33,146 units, down 2.1% from total 2018 transactions.

name: connecticut
sentence: The median house sold in 2019 recorded a transaction amount of $260,000, up 0.4% from 2018.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, Connecticut recorded the country's seventh highest home foreclosure activity rate, accounting for 0.53% of total housing stock.

name: connecticut
sentence: Finance, insurance and real estate were the largest industry in Connecticut in 2018, classified by gross domestic product, generating $75.7 billion in GDP that year.

name: connecticut
sentence: The main employers in the financial sector are The Hartford, Travelers, Cigna, the Aetna subsidiary of CVS Health, Mass Mutual, People's United Financial, Bank of America, Realogy, Bridgewater Associates, GE Capital, William Raveis Real Estate and Berkshire Hathaway through residential reinsurance and real estate subsidiaries.

name: connecticut
sentence: The combined education, health and social services sector was the largest industry classified by employment, with a combined workforce of 342,600 at the end of 2019, ranking fourth of the previous year in GDP at $28.3 billion.

name: connecticut
sentence: The business and professional services sector had the second highest GDP in Connecticut in 2018, about $33.7 billion.

name: connecticut
sentence: Manufacturing was the third largest industry in 2018 with a GDP of $30.8 billion, dominated by Raytheon Technologies formed during the merger of Hartford-based United Technologies and Waltham, of Mass.-based Raytheon Co. As soon as the merger took place, Raytheon Technologies employed approximately 19,000 people in Connecticut through the Pratt & Whitney and Collins Aerospace subsidiaries.

name: connecticut
sentence: Lockheed Martin Sikorsky Aircraft's subsidiary operates Connecticut's largest manufacturing plant in Stratford, where it manufactures helicopters.

name: connecticut
sentence: Other major manufacturers include the General Dynamics division, which manufactures submarines in Groton, Boehringer Ingelheim, a pharmaceutical manufacturer based in the United States in Ridgefield, and ASML, which manufactures precision lithography machines in Wilton used to create semiconductor circuits and flat screens.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut was historically a weapons manufacturing centre, and four weapons manufacturing companies continued to operate in the state in December 2012, employing 2,000 people: Colt, Stag, Ruger and Mossberg.

name: connecticut
sentence: Marlin, owned by Remington, closed its doors in April 2011.

name: hawaii

name: hawaii

name: hawaii
sentence: The state's ocean coastline is therefore the fourth longest in the United States, about 1,210 km away.

name: hawaii
sentence: The eight main islands, from the north-west to the south-east, are Niyhau, Kauayi, Oyahu, Molokayi, Lānayi, Kahoyolawe, Maui and Hawaii, hence the name of the State, often called "Big Island" or "Hawai Island" to avoid confusion with the State or Archipelago.

name: hawaii
sentence: The uninhabited islands of northwest Hawaii constitute the largest part of the Papahānaumokuākea National Marine Monument, the largest protected area in the United States and the third largest in the world.

name: hawaii
sentence: Of the fifty American states, Hawaii is the eighth smallest in the region and the 11th least populated, but with 1.4 million residents is the 13th densest.

sentence: Two thirds of the population live on the island of O'ahu, home to the state capital and the largest city, Honolulu.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii is one of the most diverse states in the country, due to its central location in the Pacific and more than two centuries of migration; it has the only American Asian majority, the largest Buddhist community and the largest proportion of multiracial people.

name: hawaii
sentence: As a result, the State is a unique crucible of South-East Asia, East Asia and North America, in addition to its Hawaiian indigenous culture.

name: hawaii
sentence: Installed by Polynesians between 124 and 1120, Hawaii is home to many independent chiefs of staff.

name: hawaii
sentence: British explorer James Cook was the first non-Pynesian known to discover the archipelago in 1778.

name: hawaii
sentence: An influx of explorers, traders and whalers arrived shortly thereafter, introducing diseases that decimated the indigenous community once isolated.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii became a unified and internationally recognized kingdom in 1810, remaining independent until Western businessmen reversed the monarchy in 1893, leading to annexation by the United States in 1898.

name: hawaii
sentence: As a strategic American territory, Hawaii was attacked by Japan on December 7, 1941, which brought its global and historical importance, and contributed to America's decisive entry into World War II.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii became the newest state to join the union on August 21, 1959.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 1993, the U.S. government officially apologized for its role in overthrowing the Hawaiian government, which stimulated the Hawaiian sovereignty movement.

name: hawaii
sentence: Historically dominated by a plantation economy, Hawaii remains a major agricultural exporter due to its fertile soil and unique tropical climate in the United States Its economy has gradually diversified since the mid-20th century, with tourism and military defence becoming the two most important sectors.

sentence: The state attracts tourists, surfers and scientists from all over the world with its varied natural landscapes, warm tropical climate, abundance of public beaches, oceanic environment, active volcanoes and clear sky on the Grande Île.

sentence: Hawaii hosts the United States Pacific fleet, the world's largest naval command, as well as 75,000 Department of Defense employees.

name: hawaii
sentence: Although its relative isolation is reflected in one of the country's highest living costs, Hawaii is the third richest state in the United States; Honolulu ranks first in several world rankings of habitability, ranking 22nd out of 140 cities in the world in the 2019 global index of habitability, the highest of all American cities.

name: hawaii
sentence: The state of Hawaii is named after its largest island, Hawaii.

sentence: Hawaii Cognates are found in other Polynesian languages, including Maori (Hawaiki), Rarotongans (Avaiki) and Samoan (Savai)i.

name: hawaii
sentence: According to the linguists Pukui and Elbert, "everywhere in Polynesia, Hawaii or a cog is the name of the underground world or of the ancestral home, but in Hawaii, the name has no meaning."

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is a state in the Pacific Northwest Region of the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: It borders the state of Montana to the east and northeast, Wyoming to the east, Nevada and Utah to the south, and Washington and Oregon to the west.

name: idaho
sentence: To the north, it shares a small portion of the Canadian border with the province of British Columbia.

name: idaho
sentence: With a population of about 1.7 million and an area of 33,570 square miles (216,400 km2), Idaho is the 14th largest, the 12th least populated and the 7th least dense of the 50 American states.

name: idaho
sentence: The capital of the state and the largest city is Boise.

name: idaho
sentence: For thousands of years, Idaho has been inhabited by Amerindian peoples.

name: idaho
sentence: At the beginning of the 19th century, Idaho was considered to be part of Oregon, a disputed area between the United States and the British Empire.

name: idaho
sentence: It officially became American territory with the signing of the Oregon Treaty of 1846, but a separate Idaho territory was only organized in 1863, instead of being included for periods in the Oregon Territory and the Washington Territory.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho was finally admitted to the Union on 3 July 1890, becoming the 43rd state.

name: idaho
sentence: As part of the Pacific Northwest (and the associated Cascadia bioregion), Idaho is divided into several distinct geographic and climatic regions.

name: idaho
sentence: The northern state, the relatively isolated Idaho Panhandle, is closely linked to the eastern state of Washington with which it shares the Pacific Time Zone – the rest of the state uses the Mountain Time Zone.

name: idaho
sentence: The southern part of the state includes the Snake River Plain (which has most of the population and agricultural land).

name: idaho
sentence: The southeastern part of the state includes part of the Great Basin.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho is quite mountainous, and contains several expanses of the Rocky Mountains.

name: idaho
sentence: The U.S. Forest Service owns approximately 38 per cent of Idaho land, the highest proportion of all states.

name: idaho
sentence: Industries important to the state economy include manufacturing, agriculture, mining, forestry and tourism.

name: idaho
sentence: A number of scientific and technological enterprises have their headquarters in Idaho or factories there, and the State also contains the National Laboratory of Idaho, which is the country's largest energy department.

name: idaho
sentence: The agricultural sector in Idaho provides many products, but the state is best known for its potato cultivation, which accounts for about a third of the national yield.

name: idaho
sentence: The official nickname of the state is "the State of Gem", which refers to the natural beauty of Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: The origin of the name remains a mystery.

name: idaho
sentence: In the early 1860s, when the U.S. Congress envisaged organizing a new territory in the Rocky Mountains, the name "Idaho" was suggested by George M. Willing, a politician who presented himself as an unrecognized delegate of the unofficial Jefferson territory.

name: idaho
sentence: Willing claimed that the name was derived from a term Shoshone meaning "the sun comes from the mountains" or "the name of the mountains", but it was later revealed that there was no such term and Willing claimed that he was inspired to give the name when he met a little girl named "Ida".

name: idaho
sentence: As the name seemed to be made, the U.S. Congress finally decided to appoint the Colorado Territory region instead when it was created in February 1861, but by the time that decision was made, the city of Idaho Springs, Colorado had already been named according to Willing's proposal.

name: idaho
sentence: That same year, Congress established Colorado Territory, a county called Idaho County, which was established in eastern Washington.

name: idaho
sentence: The county was named after a steamship named Idaho, which was launched on the Columbia River in 1860.

name: idaho
sentence: It is not clear whether the steamship was named before or after Willing's claim was revealed.

name: idaho
sentence: In any event, part of Washington's territory, including Idaho County, was used to create Idaho's territory in 1863.

name: idaho
sentence: Finally, the name was given to the territory of Idaho, which later became the American state.

name: idaho
sentence: Despite this lack of evidence for the origin of the name, many textbooks well in the 20th century repeated as Willing's account the name "Idaho" derived from the term Shoshone "ee-da-how".

name: idaho
sentence: A 1956 Idaho history manual says:

name: idaho
sentence: Another etymology attributes the name to the word Apache of the Plains "ídaahęęę" IPA: [í.ta.h.H.H.] (enemy) which was used in reference to the Comanche.

sentence: Idaho borders six U.S. states and one Canadian province.

sentence: The landscape is rugged with some of the largest intact natural areas in the United States.

sentence: For example, at 2.3 million acres (930,000 ha), the Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness area is the largest contiguous wilderness protected area in the continental United States.

name: idaho

name: idaho
sentence: The climate of Idaho varies considerably.

name: idaho
sentence: Although the western border of the state is about 350 miles (560 km) from the Pacific Ocean, maritime influence is still felt in Idaho, especially in winter when cloud cover, humidity and precipitation are at their peak.

name: idaho
sentence: This influence has a moderate effect in winter, where temperatures are not as low as might be expected for a northern state where altitudes are primarily high.

name: idaho
sentence: Maritime influence is less pronounced in the eastern part of the state where precipitation is often reversed, with wetter summers and drier winters, and seasonal temperature differences are more extreme, showing a more semi-arid continental climate.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho may be warm, although prolonged periods of more than 98°F (37°C) are rare, with the exception of the lowest point of altitude, Lewiston, who sees little snow as a result.

name: idaho
sentence: The warm summer days are tempered by low relative humidity and cooler evenings during the summer months, since for most states, the greatest diurnal difference in temperature is often in summer.

name: idaho
sentence: Winters can be cold, although long periods of bitter cold below zero are unusual.

name: idaho
sentence: The highest temperature of Idaho at 118°F (48°C) was recorded at Orofino on July 28, 1934; the lowest temperature of Idaho at -60°F (−51°C) was recorded at Island Park Dam on January 18, 1943.

name: idaho
sentence: Humans may have been present in the Idaho region 14,500 years ago.

sentence: Approximately 68% of Illinois has coal strata from the Pennsylvania geological period.

sentence: Most of the coal produced in Illinois is exported to other states and countries.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois government, under the Illinois Constitution, has three branches of government: executive, legislative and judicial.

sentence: Illinois is a democratic bastion.

sentence: However, in recent elections, the Democratic Party has gained ground, and Illinois has become a strong "blue" state in presidential campaigns.

sentence: A local politician and a resident of Chicago Barack Obama easily won the state's 21 electoral votes in 2008, with 61.9% of the votes.

sentence: In 2014, Republican Bruce Rauner defeated Governor Quinn from 50% to 46% to become Illinois's first Republican governor in 12 years after being sworn in on January 12, 2015, while Democratic Senator Dick Durbin was re-elected with 53% of the vote.

sentence: In 2016, Hillary Clinton won Illinois with 55% of the vote, and Tammy Duckworth beat incumbent Mark Kirk 54% to 40%.

sentence: George W. Bush and Donald Trump are the only Republican candidates to win without wearing either Illinois or Vermont.

sentence: In 2018, Democratic JB Pritzker beat incumbent Bruce Rauner for the governorship with 54% of the vote.

sentence: State policy has been infamous for cases of highly visible corruption, as well as for cross-reformers, such as governors Adlai Stevenson and James R. Thompson.

sentence: In 2008, Governor Rod Blagojevich received a criminal complaint for corruption, following allegations that he had conspired to sell the seat of Senator left by President Barack Obama to the highest bidder.

sentence: In 1912 William Lorimer, the boss of the Chicago GOP, was expelled from the U.S. Senate for corruption and in 1921 Governor Len Small was found for swindling the state of a million dollars.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has shown a strong presence in the presidential elections.

name: illinois
sentence: Three presidents claimed Illinois as their political base when they came to the presidency: Abraham Lincoln, Ulysses S. Grant and more recently Barack Obama.

name: illinois
sentence: Lincoln was born in Kentucky, but moved to Illinois at the age of 21.

name: illinois
sentence: He served in the General Assembly and represented the 7th District of Congress in the United States House of Representatives before his election to the presidency in 1860.

name: illinois
sentence: Ulysse S. Grant was born in Ohio and had a military career that prevented him from settling, but on the eve of the civil war and as the middle age approached, he moved to Illinois and thus used the state as his home and political base to run for office.

name: illinois
sentence: Barack Obama was born in Hawaii and made Illinois his home after graduating from law school, then represented Illinois in the U.S. Senate.

name: illinois
sentence: He then became president in 2008, as a candidate for his Illinois base.

name: illinois
sentence: Ronald Reagan was born in Illinois, in the city of Tampico, grew up in Dixon, Illinois, and studied at Eureka College, outside Peoria.

sentence: Reagan later moved to California during his early adulthood.

name: illinois
sentence: He then became an actor and then governor of California before being elected president.

sentence: Hillary Clinton was born and raised in the suburbs of Chicago and became the first woman to represent a major political party in the general election of the American presidency.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois State Education Council (ISBE) is independent of the Governor and the legislature of the state and administers public education in the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Local municipalities and their respective school districts run individual public schools, but ISBE checks the performance of public schools with the Illinois School Report Card.

name: illinois
sentence: ISBE also makes recommendations to state leaders on education spending and policies.

name: illinois
sentence: Education is compulsory for 7-17 year olds in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Schools are generally, but not exclusively, divided into three levels of primary and secondary education: primary, secondary or secondary, and secondary.

name: illinois
sentence: The structure of district territories is often complex.

name: illinois
sentence: Many regions of the State are in fact located in two school districts, one for secondary schools and the other for primary and secondary schools.

name: illinois
sentence: And these districts do not necessarily share borders.

name: illinois
sentence: A given secondary school may have several elementary districts that feed on it, but some of these foster districts may themselves feed in several secondary school districts.

name: illinois
sentence: Using the criterion established by the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Education, there are eleven "national universities" in the State.

name: illinois
sentence: The University of Chicago is consistently ranked among the top ten universities in the world in various independent academic rankings, and its Booth School of Business, as well as the Kellogg School of Management in Northwestern, are consistently ranked among the top five business colleges in the country and top ten in the world.

name: illinois
sentence: The University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign is often ranked among the best engineering schools in the world and the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: As of August 19, 2010, six of them were at the "first level" of the nation's top 500 national universities, according to the rankings of the US News & World Report: the University of Chicago, the University of North West, the University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign, the University of Loyola Chicago, the Illinois Institute of Technology, the University of DePaul, the University of Illinois at Chicago, the University of Illinois, the University of Southern Illinois Carbondale and the University of Northern Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has over twenty other four-year-old accredited universities, both public and private, as well as dozens of small liberal arts colleges across the state.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition, Illinois supports 49 public community colleges in the Illinois community college system.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois schools are financed primarily by property tax, based on the assessment of land value by the state, rather than by direct contributions from the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Tracy Steffes described Illinois's public education as historically "inequitable," a system where one of the "richest states" is "the brightest in its support for education."There have been several attempts to reform school funding in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The most notable attempt took place in 1973 with the adoption of Illinois Resource Equalizer Formula, a measure that was hoped that funding could be collected and distributed more equitably to schools in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: However, opposition from the well-off Illinois communities who objected to having to pay for the less well-off school districts (including many black-majority communities, produced by redline, white flight and other "soft" segregation methods) led to the abolition of formulae in the late 1980s.

name: illinois
sentence: Due to its central location and proximity to the Rust Belt and Grain Belt, Illinois is a national hub for air, automobile, rail and road traffic.

sentence: From 1962 to 1998, the O'Hare International Airport in Chicago (ORD) is the busiest airport in the world, measured in terms of both flights and passengers.

sentence: It is a major hub for United Airlines and American Airlines, and a major airport expansion project is currently underway.

sentence: A large suburban train is provided in the city itself and in some immediate suburbs by the Chicago Transit Authority's "L" system.

sentence: One of the largest suburban rail networks in the United States, operated by Metra, uses existing rail lines to provide direct access to the city and beyond for hundreds of suburbs.

sentence: In addition to the state rail lines, Mississippi and Illinois offer important transportation routes for the state's agricultural interests.

name: illinois
sentence: Lake Michigan provides Illinois with access to the Atlantic Ocean through the St. Lawrence Seaway.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's interstate highways are all segments of the interstate highway system that are owned and maintained by the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has the distinction of having the most primary (two-digit) interstates pass through it among the 50 states with 13.

name: illinois
