name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is an American state located in the Midwestern and Great Lakes regions of North America.

name: indiana
sentence: It is the 38th largest by region and the 17th most populous of the 50 United States.

name: indiana
sentence: Its capital and largest city is Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was admitted to the United States as the 19th state on 11 December 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: It borders Lake Michigan to the northwest, Michigan to the north, Ohio to the east, Ohio River and Kentucky to the south and south-east, and Wabash River and Illinois to the west.

name: indiana
sentence: Before becoming a territory, various Aboriginal peoples lived in Indiana for thousands of years.

name: indiana
sentence: Since its creation as a territory, settlement models in Indiana have reflected regional cultural segmentation in the eastern United States; the northernmost level of the state has been established primarily by residents of New England and New York, Central Indiana by migrants from the states of Mid Atlantic and adjacent Ohio, and Southern Indiana by settlers from the southern states, particularly Kentucky and Tennessee.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a diversified economy with a gross revenue of $359.12 billion in 2017.

name: indiana
sentence: It has several metropolitan areas with more than 100,000 inhabitants and a number of small industrial towns.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana hosts professional sports teams, including the NFL Indianapolis Colts and the NBA Indiana Pacers, and hosts several major competitions, including the Indianapolis 500.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana means "Indian land," or simply "Indian land."

name: indiana
sentence: It also comes from Indiana's territorial history.

name: indiana
sentence: On May 7, 1800, the United States Congress passed a law to divide the Northwest Territory into two regions and named the western section of the Indiana Territory.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1816, when Congress passed enabling legislation to begin the process of establishing the state for Indiana, part of that land became the geographical area for the new state.

name: indiana
sentence: A resident of Indiana is officially known as a Hoosier.

name: indiana
sentence: The etymology of this word is contested, but the main theory, put forward by the Indiana Historical Bureau and the Indiana Historical Society, has its origin in Virginia, the Carolinas, and Tennessee (the South of Upland) as a term for a backwoodsman, a rough peasant, or a humpland.

name: indiana
sentence: The first inhabitants of what is now Indiana were the Paleo-Indians, who arrived about 8,000 B.C. after the melting of glaciers at the end of the ice age.

name: indiana
sentence: Divided into small groups, the Paleo-Indians are nomads who hunt big game like the mastodons.

name: indiana
sentence: They have created stone tools made of chips, chips and flakes.

name: indiana
sentence: The archaic period, which began between 5000 and 4000 BC, covered the next phase of Aboriginal culture.

name: indiana
sentence: People have developed new tools as well as techniques to cook food, an important step in civilization.

name: indiana
sentence: These new tools included different types of spear tips and knives, with different shapes of notches.

name: indiana
sentence: They have made ground stone tools such as stone axes, woodworking tools and grinding stones.

name: indiana
sentence: During the latter part of the period, they built mounds of land and middens, indicating that settlements became more permanent.

name: indiana
sentence: The archaic period ended about 1500 B.C., although some archaic people lived up to 700 B.C.

name: indiana
sentence: The Woodland period began around 1500 B.C., when new cultural attributes emerged.

name: indiana
sentence: The people created ceramics and pottery, and spread their cultivation of plants.

name: indiana
sentence: A wooden group named Adena had elegant burial rituals, with log tombs under the mounds of the earth.

name: indiana
sentence: In the middle of the Woodlands, the Hopewell people began to develop long-distance merchandise trade.

name: indiana
sentence: Towards the end of the stage, people developed a very productive crop and the adaptation of agriculture, cultivating crops such as corn and squash.

name: indiana
sentence: The wood period ended around 1000 AD.

name: indiana
sentence: The Mississippi culture appeared, from 1000 AD until the 15th century, shortly before the arrival of Europeans.

name: indiana
sentence: During this stage, people created large urban settlements designed according to their cosmology, with large mounds and squares defining ceremonial and public spaces.

name: indiana
sentence: The concentrated colonies depended on agricultural surpluses.

name: indiana
sentence: One of these complexes was the Angel Mounds.

name: indiana
sentence: They had vast public spaces such as platform squares and mounds, where leaders lived or conducted rituals.

name: indiana
sentence: The Mississippi civilization collapsed in Indiana in the mid-15th century for reasons that remain uncertain.

name: indiana
sentence: The historic Amerindian tribes of the region at the time of the European meeting spoke different languages of the Algonquian family.

name: indiana
sentence: They included the Shawnee, Miami and Illini.

name: indiana
sentence: The eastern refugee tribes, including the Delaware who settled in the White and Whitewater River valleys, joined them later.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1679, French explorer René-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle, was the first European to cross Indiana after reaching the current Bend Sud at the Saint Joseph River.

name: indiana
sentence: He returned the following year to learn more about the region.

name: indiana
sentence: The French-Canadian fur traders arrived soon, bringing blankets, jewellery, tools, whiskey and weapons to trade hides with the Amerindians.

name: indiana
sentence: As early as 1702, Sieur Juchereau established the first trading post near Vincennes.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1715, Sieur de Vincennes built Fort Miami in Kekionga, now Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1717, another Canadian, Picote de Beletre, built Fort Ouitatinon on the Wabash River, to attempt to control the Amerindian trade routes from Lake Erie to the Mississippi River.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1732 Sieur de Vincennes built a second fur trading post in Vincennes.

name: indiana
sentence: The French-Canadian settlers, who had left the previous post because of the hostilities, returned in more numbers.

name: indiana
sentence: In a few years, British settlers arrived from the East and opposed Canadians to control the lucrative fur trade.

name: indiana
sentence: The fighting between the French and British settlers took place throughout the 1750s.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's Amerindian tribes partnered with French Canadians during the French and Indian War (also known as the Seven Years War).

name: indiana
sentence: With the British victory in 1763, the French were forced to surrender to the British crown all their lands in North America east of the Mississippi River and north and west of the colonies.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana tribes did not give up: they seized Fort Ouiatinon and Fort Miami during the Pontiac rebellion.

name: indiana
sentence: The British Royal Proclamation of 1763 designated the land west of the Appalachians for Amerindian purposes, and excluded British settlers from the area that the Crown called "Indian territory."

name: indiana
sentence: In 1775, the American Revolutionary War began as the settlers sought British autonomy and independence.

name: indiana
sentence: The majority of the fighting took place near the east coast, but patriotic military officer George Rogers Clark called for an army to help fight the British in the west.

name: indiana
sentence: Clark's army won major battles and took over Vincennes and Fort Sackville on 25 Feb. 1779.

name: indiana
sentence: During the war Clark succeeded in cutting off British troops, who attacked the settlers in the east of the west.

name: indiana
sentence: His success is often credited for changing the course of the American revolutionary war.

name: indiana
sentence: At the end of the war, through the Treaty of Paris, the British crown transferred its rights to land south of the Great Lakes to the new United States, including Amerindian lands.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1787, the United States defined the Northwest Territory, which included the current Indiana region.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1800 Congress separated Ohio from the Northwest Territory, designating the rest of the land as the Indiana Territory.

name: indiana
sentence: President Thomas Jefferson chose William Henry Harrison as Governor of the Territory and Vincennes became the capital.

name: indiana
sentence: After the separation of Michigan territory and the formation of Illinois territory, Indiana was reduced to its present size and geography.

name: indiana
sentence: Beginning with the battle of the woods fallen in 1794 and the Treaty of Greenville in 1795, Native American titles on Indiana lands were extinguished by usurpation, purchase or war and treated.

name: indiana
sentence: About half of the state was acquired in the Treaty of St. Mary's of Miami in 1818.

name: indiana
sentence: Purchases were only completed when the Treaty of Mississinewas, in 1826, acquired the last of the American Aboriginal lands reserved in the northeast.

name: indiana
sentence: Portrait of the Indiana Border Around 1810: The boundary was defined by the Treaty of Fort Wayne in 1809, adding much of the southwestern lands around Vincennes and the southeastern lands adjacent to Cincinnati, to areas along the Ohio River as part of American territory.

name: indiana
sentence: The colonies were military outposts such as Fort Ouiatinon in the northwest and Fort Miami (later Fort Wayne) in the northeast, Fort Knox and the Vincennes settlement in the lower Wabash.

name: indiana
sentence: Other facilities include Clarksville (passing through Louisville), Vevay and Corydon along the Ohio River, Quaker Colony in Richmond on the east border, and Conner's Post (later Connersville) on the east central border.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis would not be populated for another 15 years, and the territory of central Indiana and northern Indiana remained a wilderness inhabited primarily by Aboriginal communities.

name: indiana
sentence: Only two counties in the extreme southeast, Clark and Dearborn, had been organized by European settlers.

name: indiana
sentence: There were few land titles issued by Cincinnati.

name: indiana
sentence: Settler migration occurs mainly by flat boat on the Ohio River to the west, and by car paths on the Wabash/White River (west) and Whitewater River (east) valleys.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1810, tribal leader Shawnee Tecumseh and his brother Tenskwatawa encouraged other indigenous tribes in the Territory to resist European colonization.

name: indiana
sentence: Tensions rose and the United States allowed Harrison to launch a preventive expedition against the Tecumseh Confederation; the United States won the Battle of Tippecanoe on November 7, 1811.

name: indiana
sentence: Tecumseh was killed in 1813 during the Battle of Thames.

name: indiana
sentence: After his death, the armed resistance to the control of the United States ended in the region.

name: indiana
sentence: Most of the Amerindian tribes of the state were then abducted west of Mississippi in the 1820s and 1830s after the American negotiations and the purchase of their land.

name: indiana
sentence: Corydon, a city in the extreme south of Indiana, was named the second capital of Indiana territory in May 1813 to reduce the threat of Indian raids following the Battle of Tippecanoe.

name: indiana
sentence: Two years later, a petition for the establishment of a State was approved by the general assembly of the Territory and sent to Congress.

name: indiana
sentence: Enabling legislation was passed to allow delegates to draft a constitution for Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: On June 10, 1816, delegates gathered in Corydon to draft the constitution, which was completed in 19 days.

name: indiana
sentence: Jonathan Jennings was elected first governor of the state in August 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: On December 11, 1816, President James Madison approved Indiana's admission to union as the nineteenth state.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1825, the state capital was moved from Corydon to Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: Many European immigrants went west to settle in Indiana in the early 19th century.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest group of immigrants to settle in Indiana were the Germans, as well as many immigrants from Ireland and England.

name: indiana
sentence: The Americans, who were predominantly English, migrated from northern New York and New England, as well as from the mid-Atlantic state of Pennsylvania.

name: indiana
sentence: The arrival of steamboats on the Ohio River in 1811 and the national road at Richmond in 1829 greatly facilitated the colonization of northern and western Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: After statehood, the new government worked to transform Indiana from a border into a developed, well-populated and prosperous state, starting with major demographic and economic changes.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1836, the founders of the state launched a program, the Indiana Mammouth Internal Improvement Act, which led to the construction of publicly funded roads, canals, railways and public schools.

name: indiana
sentence: The plans went bankrupt in the state and were a financial disaster, but increased the land and produced more than four times the value.

name: indiana
sentence: In response to the crisis and in order to avoid another, in 1851, a second constitution was adopted.

name: indiana
sentence: Its provisions included the prohibition of public debt, as well as the extension of the vote to African-Americans.

name: indiana
sentence: During the American Civil War, Indiana had political influence and played an important role in the affairs of the nation.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was the first Western state to mobilize for the United States in the war, and Indiana soldiers participated in all the major commitments of the war.

name: indiana
sentence: The State provided 126 infantry regiments, 26 artillery batteries and 13 cavalry regiments to the Union.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1861, Indiana received a quota of 7,500 men to join the Union Army.

name: indiana
sentence: So many volunteers in the first call that thousands had to be hijacked.

name: indiana
sentence: Before the end of the war, Indiana had paid 208,367 men.

name: indiana
sentence: Of these men, more than 35 per cent lost their lives: 24,416 lost their lives and more than 50,000 were injured.

name: indiana
sentence: The only civil war conflicts in Indiana were the Newburgh raid, a bloodless capture of the city, and the Battle of Corydon, which occurred during Morgan's raid, leaving 15 dead, 40 wounded and 355 captured.

name: indiana
sentence: After the war, Indiana remained a largely agricultural state.

name: indiana
sentence: Post-war industries included mining, including limestone extraction, meat packaging, food processing, such as grain grinding, alcohol distillation, and the construction of cars, bugs, agricultural machinery and equipment.

name: indiana
sentence: However, the discovery of natural gas in the 1880s in northern Indiana led to an economic boom: the abundant and cheap fuel attracted heavy industry; the availability of jobs in turn attracted new settlers from other parts of the country as well as from Europe.

name: indiana
sentence: This led to the rapid expansion of cities such as South Bend, Gary, Indianapolis and Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: With the beginning of the industrial revolution, Indian industry began to grow at an accelerated pace in the northern part of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: With industrialization, workers have developed trade unions and suffrage movements in relation to women's progress.

name: indiana
sentence: In the early 20th century, Indiana became a strong manufacturing state linked to the new automotive industry.

name: indiana
sentence: Haynes-Apperson, the country's first commercially successful automobile company, operates in Kokomo until 1925.

name: indiana
sentence: The construction of the Indianapolis Highway and the start-up of auto-related industries were also linked to the automotive boom.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1930s, Indiana, like the rest of the nation, was affected by the Great Depression.

name: indiana
sentence: The economic slowdown has had a significant negative impact on Indiana, such as the decline in urbanization.

name: indiana
sentence: The Dust Bowl further west led many migrants to flee to the more industrialized Midwest.

name: indiana
sentence: Governor Paul V. McNutt's administration has been working to build a publicly funded social assistance system to help overcrowded private charities.

name: indiana
sentence: During its administration, expenditures and taxes were significantly reduced in response to the depression, and the state government was completely reorganized.

name: indiana
sentence: McNutt ended the state ban and enacted the first state income tax.

name: indiana
sentence: On several occasions, he declared martial law to put an end to labour strikes.

name: indiana
sentence: The Second World War helped to revive the Indiana economy, as the war required steel, food and other goods that had been produced in the state.

name: indiana
sentence: About ten per cent of Indiana's population joined the armed forces, while hundreds of industries won war production contracts and began to make war equipment.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana manufactured 4.5% of the total U.S. military armaments produced during the Second World War, ranking eighth among the 48 states.

name: indiana
sentence: The expansion of industry to meet the demands of war has helped to end the Great Depression.

name: indiana
sentence: With the end of World War II, Indiana bounced back to pre-depression production levels.

name: indiana
sentence: The industry became the main employer, a trend that continued in the 1960s.

name: indiana
sentence: Urbanization in the 1950s and 1960s led to substantial growth in government cities.

name: indiana
sentence: The automotive, steel and pharmaceutical industry dominated the major companies in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's population continued to grow after the war, exceeding five million at the 1970 census.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1960s, Matthew E. Welsh's administration adopted its first two percent sales tax.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana schools were disaggregated in 1949.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1950, the Census Bureau reported that the population of Indiana was 95.5% white and 4.4% black.

name: indiana
sentence: The Welsh Governor also collaborated with the General Assembly on the adoption of the Indiana Civil Rights Bill, which provides equal protection for minorities seeking employment.

name: indiana
sentence: On December 8, 1964, a Convair B-58 carrying nuclear weapons slipped onto an ice runway on the basis of the Bunker Hill Air Force in Bunker Hill, Indiana, and caught fire during a training exercise.

name: indiana
sentence: The five nuclear weapons on board were set on fire, including a thermonuclear weapon of 9 megatonnes, causing radioactive contamination of the crash zone.

name: indiana
sentence: Starting in 1970, a series of amendments to the constitution of the State were proposed.

name: indiana
sentence: With the adoption, the Indiana Court of Appeal was established and the procedure for appointing judges was changed.

name: indiana
sentence: Companies such as Delco Electronics and Delphi have started a long series of cuts that have contributed to high unemployment rates in manufacturing in Anderson, Muncie and Kokomo.

name: indiana
sentence: The trend towards restructuring and deindustrialisation continued until the 1980s, when the national and state economy began to diversify and recover.

name: indiana
sentence: With a total area (land and water) of 36,418 square miles (94,320 km2), Indiana ranks 38th among the largest states.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has a maximum northern dimension to the south of 250 miles (400 km) and a maximum east-west dimension of 145 miles (233 km).

name: indiana
sentence: Located in the Midwest of the United States, Indiana is one of eight states in the Great Lakes region.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is bordered north by Michigan, east by Ohio, and west by Illinois, partially separated by the Wabash River.

name: indiana
sentence: Lake Michigan borders Indiana in the northwest and the Ohio River separates Indiana from Kentucky in the south.

name: indiana
sentence: The average altitude of Indiana is approximately 760 feet (230 m) above sea level.

name: indiana
sentence: The highest point in the state is Hoosier Hill in Wayne County at 1257 feet (383 m) above sea level.

sentence: The resulting elevation range of 937 feet (286 m) is the narrowest of any U.S. non-coastal state.

sentence: Only 2,850 square miles (7,400 km2) are above 1,000 feet (300 m) and this area is closed in 14 counties.

name: indiana
sentence: The state consists of two natural regions of the United States: the central lowlands and the inner lowlands.

name: indiana
sentence: The till plains are the northern and central regions of Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Much of its appearance is the result of elements left by glaciers.

name: indiana
sentence: The centre of Indiana is mostly flat with a few low hilly hills (except when rivers cut deep valleys across the plain, such as the Wabash River and Sugar Creek) and soil composed of glacial sands, gravel and clay, giving rise to exceptional agricultural land.

name: indiana
sentence: Northern Indiana is similar, with the exception of higher and more hilly terminal moraines and hundreds of kettle lakes.

name: indiana
sentence: In northwestern Indiana, there are various ridges of sand and dunes, some reaching nearly 200 feet in height.

name: indiana
sentence: This is the shoreline of Lake Michigan and the interior of the Kankakee Outwash Plain.

name: indiana
sentence: Southern Indiana is characterized by valleys and rugged and hilly terrain, contrasting with much of the state.

sentence: Due to Indiana limestone, the area has many caves, caves and quarries.

sentence: Indiana's main hydrographic systems include the Whitewater, White, Blue, Wabash, St. Joseph and Maumee rivers.

name: indiana
sentence: According to the Indiana Ministry of Natural Resources, there were 65 rivers, streams and streams of environmental interest or picturesque beauty, which included only a portion of approximately 24,000 nautical miles in the state.

name: indiana
sentence: The Wabash River, the longest open river east of Mississippi, is the official Indiana River.

name: indiana
sentence: At 475 miles (764 kilometres) in length, the river makes the bisect from the northeast state to the southwest, forming part of the state border with Illinois, before approaching the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: The river has been the subject of several songs, such as On the Banks of the Wabash, The Wabash Cannonball and Back Home Again, In Indiana.

sentence: There are approximately 900 lakes listed by the Indiana Ministry of Natural Resources.

name: indiana
sentence: In the northwest, Indiana borders Lake Michigan, one of five lakes including the Great Lakes, the largest group of freshwater lakes in the world.

sentence: Tippecanoe Lake, the deepest lake in the state, reaches depths of nearly 37 metres, while Wawasee Lake is the largest natural lake in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: At 10,750 acres (summer pool level), Lake Monroe is the largest lake in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: In the past, almost all of Indiana had a damp continental climate, with cold winters and warm and humid summers; only the extreme south of the state was in the humid subtropical climate, which receives more precipitation than other parts of Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: But from the 2016 update, about half of the state is now classified as subtropical wet.

name: indiana
sentence: Temperatures generally vary from the north and south sections of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: In mid-winter, mean high/low temperatures vary from about 30°F/15°F (−1°C/−10°C) in the extreme north to 41°F/24°F (5°C/−4°C) in the extreme south.

name: indiana
sentence: In mid-summer, there is generally slightly less variation across the state, as average high/low temperatures vary from about 84°F/64°F (29°C/18°C) in the extreme north to 90°F/69°F (32°C/21°C) in the extreme south.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's record temperature was 116°F (47°C) on July 14, 1936, at Collegeville.

name: indiana
sentence: The record rate was −36°F (−38°C) on 19 January 1994 in New Whiteland.

sentence: The growing season generally extends from 155 days in the north to 185 days in the south.

sentence: While droughts occasionally occur in the state, total precipitation is distributed relatively equally throughout the year.

name: indiana
sentence: Total precipitation ranges from 35 inches (89 cm) near Lake Michigan in northwest Indiana to 45 inches (110 cm) along the Ohio River in the south, while the state average is 40 inches (100 cm).

name: indiana
sentence: Annual snowfalls in Indiana vary considerably from 80 inches (200 cm) in the northwest along Lake Michigan to 14 inches (36 cm) in the extreme south.

name: indiana
sentence: The effect of the lake on snow accounts for about half of the snowfall in northwestern and north central Indiana due to the effects of moisture and relative heat from Lake Michigan to the wind.

sentence: The average wind speed is 8 miles per hour (13 km/h).

sentence: In a 2012 report, Indiana ranked eighth on a list of the top 20 tornado states, based on data from the National Weather Service from 1950 to 2011.

sentence: Population growth since 1990 has been concentrated in the counties surrounding Indianapolis, with four of the five fastest growing counties in the region: Hamilton, Hendricks, Johnson and Hancock.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a constitutional form of democratic republican government with three branches: the executive, including an elected governor and lieutenant governor; the legislature, consisting of an elected bicameral general assembly; and the judiciary, the Supreme Court of Indiana, the Indiana Court of Appeal and the circuit courts.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor of Indiana is the chief executive officer of the state and has the authority to administer the government as set out in the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor and the Lieutenant Governor are jointly elected for a four-year term, with government elections taking place at the same time as the United States presidential elections (1996, 2000, 2004, 2008, etc.).

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor may not exercise more than two consecutive terms.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor works with the Indiana General Assembly and the Indiana Supreme Court to govern the state and has the power to adjust other branches.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor may convene special sessions of the General Assembly and select and remove the leaders of almost all departments, councils and commissions of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: Other notable powers include calling the Indian Guard Reserve or the Indian National Guard in the event of an emergency or disaster, granting pardons or commuting the sentence of any criminal offender, except in the case of treason or indictment, and possession of abundant legal authority.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor is the Speaker of the Senate and ensures that the rules of the Senate are respected by its electors.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor shall vote only when necessary to break ties.

name: indiana
sentence: If the Governor dies in office, becomes permanently unfit, resigns or is indicted, the Lieutenant Governor becomes Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: If the positions of governor and lieutenant governor are unoccupied, the pro tempore president becomes governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana General Assembly consists of a 50-member Senator and a 100-member House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: The Senate is the upper house of the General Assembly and the House of Representatives is the lower house.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly has exclusive legislative power within the Government of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: Both the senator and the House can introduce a bill, except that the senator is not authorized to pass a bill that will have an impact on revenues.

name: indiana
sentence: Bills are debated and passed separately in each House, but both Houses must pass them before they can be submitted to the Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The legislator may cancel a veto of the Governor by a majority vote of all members of the Senate and the House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: Each law adopted by the General Assembly must be used without exception by the State as a whole.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly does not have the power to create legislation that targets a particular community.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly can manage the State's judicial system by organizing the size of the courts and the boundaries of their districts.

name: indiana
sentence: It can also oversee the activities of the executive branch of the state government, has limited the power to regulate county governments within the state, and has the exclusive power to initiate the method of amending the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana Supreme Court is composed of five judges and a 15-judge Court of Appeal.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor selects the judges of the Supreme Courts and Appeal Courts from a group of candidates selected by a special commission.

name: indiana
sentence: After two years, judges must obtain the support of the electorate to serve for a 10-year term.

name: indiana
sentence: In almost all cases, the Supreme Court does not have original jurisdiction and can only hear cases that have been brought before it after hearing by lower courts.

name: indiana
sentence: Local district courts are where most cases start with a trial and the consequences are decided by the jury.

name: indiana
sentence: The Supreme Court has original and exclusive jurisdiction in certain areas, including the practice of law, the discipline or exclusion of judges appointed to the lower courts of the State, and the control of the exercise of jurisdiction by other lower courts of the State.

sentence: The explanation seems to be some of the factors in the labour market.

name: indiana
sentence: First, a large part of heavy manufacturing, such as industrial machinery and steel, requires a highly skilled workforce, and companies are often willing to find where skills that are difficult to train already exist.

sentence: This allows companies to offer somewhat lower wages for these skills than they would normally be.

sentence: Indiana harbours manage three major harbours, including Burns Harbor, Jeffersonville and Mount Vernon.

name: indiana
sentence: In Evansville, three public port facilities and several private port facilities are served year-round by five main barge lines operating on the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: Evansville has been a U.S. Customs port of entry for over 125 years.

name: indiana
sentence: For this reason, it is possible to have international goods shipped to Evansville in customs.

name: indiana
sentence: International freight can then clear customs in Evansville rather than a coastal port.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's constitution of 1816 was the first in the country to establish a publicly funded public school system.

name: indiana
sentence: It also awarded a canton to a public university.

name: indiana
sentence: However, the plan proved far too idealistic for a pioneering society, as tax money was not available to its organization.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1840s Caleb Mills insisted on the need for tax-funded schools, and in 1851, his councils were included in the new state constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1843, the legislature decreed that African Americans could not attend public schools, leading to the founding of the Union Literary Institute and other schools for them, financed by donations or students themselves.

name: indiana
sentence: Although the growth of the public school system was hampered by legal entanglements, many public elementary schools were used in 1870.

name: indiana
sentence: Most Indiana children attend public schools, but nearly ten per cent attend private and parish schools.

name: indiana
sentence: About half of Indiana's students are enrolled in state-funded four-year schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's public schools have undergone several changes throughout Indiana's history.

name: indiana
sentence: The modern standards of State schools have been applied throughout the State.

name: indiana
sentence: These new standards were adopted in April 2014.

name: indiana
sentence: The overall objective of these new state standards is to ensure that Indiana students have the skills and requirements to enter the college or labour force upon graduation from high school.

name: indiana
sentence: State standards can be found for almost all major subjects taught in Indiana public schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Among the priority standards are mathematics, English and language arts, science and social studies.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2017, Indiana's Department of Education reported that the overall graduation rate was 87.19 per cent for exempt graduations and 80.10 per cent for non-graduations.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest educational institution is the University of Indiana, whose flagship campus was approved as a Seminary of Indiana in 1820.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana State University was established as the State Normal School in 1865

name: indiana
sentence: The other three independent state universities are Vincennes University (Founded in 1801 by the Indiana Territory), Ball State University (1918) and the Southern Indiana University (1965 under the name of ISU – Evansville).

name: indiana
sentence: Many private colleges and universities in Indiana are affiliated with religious groups.

name: indiana
sentence: Notre-Dame University, Marian University and Saint-François University are popular Catholic schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Universities affiliated with Protestant denominations include Anderson University, Butler University, Huntington University, Manchester University, Indiana Wesleyan University, Taylor University, Franklin College, Hanover College, DePauw University, Earlham College, Valparaiso University, Indianapolis University and Evansville University.

name: indiana
sentence: The government's community college system, the Ivy Tech Community College of Indiana, serves nearly 200,000 students annually, making it the largest public post-secondary institution in the state and the largest state-accredited community college system.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2008, the University of Indiana system agreed to transfer most of its associated diplomas (2 years) to the Ivy Tech Community College system.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has several universities ranked among the best in the 2013 US News & World Report.

name: indiana
sentence: Notre Dame University is ranked among the top 20, with Indiana Bloomington University and Purdue University ranked among the top 100.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana University – Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) has recently been one of the top 200 US News & World Report rankings.

name: indiana
sentence: Butler, Valparaiso and the University of Evansville are ranked among the top ten regional rankings at Midwest University.

name: indiana
sentence: Purdue's engineering programs rank eighth in the country.

name: indiana
sentence: In addition, Taylor University is ranked first at Midwest Rankings Regional College and the Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is considered the best undergraduate engineering school (where a PhD is not offered) for 15 consecutive years.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is a state in the Midwest of the United States, bordered by Mississippi to the east and Missouri and Big Sioux to the west.

name: iowa
sentence: It is bordered by six states: Wisconsin in the northeast, Illinois in the east and southeast, Missouri in the south, Nebraska in the west, South Dakota in the northwest and Minnesota in the north.

name: iowa
sentence: In colonial times, Iowa was part of French Louisiana and Spanish Louisiana; its state flag was inspired by the flag of France.

name: iowa
sentence: After purchasing in Louisiana, people laid the foundation for an agriculture-based economy in the heart of the Corn Belt.

name: iowa
sentence: In the second half of the 20th century, the agricultural economy of Iowa made the transition to a diversified economy of manufacturing, processing, financial services, information technology, biotechnology and green energy production.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is the 26th largest of the total area and the 30th most populous of the 50 American states.

name: iowa
sentence: The capital of the state, the most populated city, and the largest metropolitan area entirely located within the state is Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Part of the large metropolitan area of Omaha, Nebraska, lies in three counties in southwestern Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is one of the safest American states to live in.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa derives its name from the Ioway people, one of the many Amerindian nations whose territory included the future state at the time of European colonization.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa is bordered by Mississippi to the east, Missouri and Big Sioux to the west.

name: iowa
sentence: The northern limit is a line along 43 degrees, 30 minutes north latitude.

name: iowa
sentence: The southern boundary is the Des Moines River and a line not quite straight along about 40 degrees 35 minutes north, as decided by the U.S. Supreme Court in Missouri v. Iowa (1849) after a confrontation between Missouri and Iowa known as the honey war.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is the only state whose eastern and western borders are formed almost entirely by rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: Carter Lake, Iowa, is the only city in the state west of the Missouri River.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has 99 counties, but 100 counties because Lee County has two.

name: iowa
sentence: The state capital, Des Moines, is located in Polk County.

name: iowa
sentence: Geology of the Iowa bedrock generally increases from west to east.

name: iowa
sentence: In northwestern Iowa, cretaceous substrates can be 74 million years old; in eastern Iowa, Cambrian substrates are about 500 million years old.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is usually not flat

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa can be divided into eight forms of land based on glaciation, soils, topography and river drainage.

name: iowa
sentence: Loess Hills are located along the western border of the state, some of which are several hundred feet thick.

name: iowa
sentence: The northeastern Iowa along the upper Mississippi River is part of the drift-free zone, consisting of steep hills and valleys that seem almost mountainous.

name: iowa
sentence: Several natural lakes exist, including Spirit Lake, Okoboji Lake West and Okoboji Lake East in the northwest Iowa (see Great Lakes of Iowa).

name: iowa
sentence: To the east is Clear Lake.

name: iowa
sentence: Artificial lakes include Odessa Lake, Saylorville Lake, Red Rock Lake, Coralville Lake, MacBride Lake, and Rathbun Lake.

name: iowa
sentence: Prior to European colonization, 4 to 6 million acres of the state were covered by wetlands, and about 95% of these wetlands were drained.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa's natural vegetation consists of tall grass and savannah grasslands in mountainous areas, dense forests and wetlands in floodplains and protected river valleys, and hen nest wetlands in northern Prairie regions.

name: iowa
sentence: Most of Iowa is used for agriculture; crops cover 60 per cent of the state, grasslands (mainly pastures and hay with certain grasslands and wetlands) cover 30 per cent, and forests account for 7 per cent, urban areas and water account for 1 per cent more each.

name: iowa
sentence: The southern part of Iowa is categorized as the transition ecoregion between forests and central grasslands.

name: iowa
sentence: The northern, drier part of Iowa is part of the high prairies of the Centre.

name: iowa
sentence: There is a shortage of natural areas in Iowa; less than 1% of the tall grass prairies that once covered most of Iowa remain intact; only about 5% of the wetlands in the state prairies remain potholes, and most of the original forest has been lost.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2005, Iowa ranked 49th in the United States in public land.

name: iowa
sentence: Threatened or endangered animals in Iowa include the lower inner tern, the plover, the Indiana bat, the pallid sturgeon, the Pleistocene snail of Iowa, the Higgins' pearl mussel and the Topeka sturgeon.

name: iowa
sentence: Endangered or threatened plants include western prairie fringe orchids, eastern prairie fringe orchids, Mead's milkweed, prairie clover, and northern wild monks.

name: iowa
sentence: The explosion in the number of high-density livestock facilities in Iowa has led to an increase in water contamination in rural areas and a decrease in air quality.

name: iowa
sentence: Other factors that have a negative impact on the Iowa environment include the intensive use of old coal-fired power plants, the use of fertilizers and pesticides from crop production and the reduction of the Jordanian aquifer.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a humid continental climate throughout the state (Köppen climate classification Dfa) with extremes of heat and cold.

name: iowa
sentence: The average annual temperature at Des Moines is 50°F (10°C); for some locations north, such as Mason City, the value is about 45°F (7°C), while Keokuk, on the Mississippi River, is 52°F (11°C).

name: iowa
sentence: Snowfall is common, with Des Moines having about 26 days of snowfall per year, and other places, such as Shenandoah having about 11 days of snowfall per year.

name: iowa
sentence: Spring marks the beginning of the violent weather season.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has an average of about 50 days of stormy activity per year.

name: iowa
sentence: The annual average of 30 years of Tornado in Iowa is 47.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2008, 12 people were killed by tornadoes in Iowa, making it the most deadly year since 1968 and the second largest tornado in a year with 105, the total of 2001.

name: iowa
sentence: Summers of Iowa are known for heat and humidity, with diurnal temperatures sometimes close to 90 °F (32 °C) and sometimes above 100 °F (38 °C).

name: iowa
sentence: Average winters in the state are known to fall well below freezing, even below -18°F (−28°C).

name: iowa
sentence: The warmest temperature of Iowa at 118°F (48°C) was recorded at Keokuk on 20 July 1934 during a nationwide heat wave; the lowest temperature of any time of -47°F (−44°C) was recorded at Washta on 12 January 1912.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a relatively smooth gradient of variable precipitation across the state, with regions in the southeast receiving on average more than 38 inches (97 cm) of rain per year, and the northwest receiving less than 28 inches (71 cm).

name: iowa
sentence: The precipitation trend in Iowa is seasonal, with more rain in the summer months.

name: iowa
sentence: Nearly state-wide, the driest month is January or February, and the wettest month is June, due to frequent showers and thunderstorms, some of which produce hail, harmful winds and/or tornadoes.

name: iowa
sentence: In Des Moines, about in the centre of the state, more than two thirds of the 88.2 cm of rain fall from April to September, and about half of the average annual rainfall falls from May to August, reaching a peak in June.

name: iowa
sentence: When the American Indians arrived in what is now Iowa more than 13,000 years ago, they were hunters and gatherers living in a glacial landscape of the Pleistocene.

name: iowa
sentence: By the time European explorers and traders visited Iowa, American Indians were largely farmers established with complex economic, social and political systems.

name: iowa
sentence: This transformation has gradually occurred.

name: iowa
sentence: During the archaic period (10,500-2,800 years ago), American Indians adapted to local environments and ecosystems, slowly becoming more sedentary as populations increased.

name: iowa
sentence: More than 3,000 years ago, at the end of the archaic era, the American Indians of Iowa began to use domesticated plants.

name: iowa
sentence: In the ensuing period, Woodland saw increased dependence on agriculture and social complexity, with increased use of mounds, ceramics and specialized livelihoods.

name: iowa
sentence: During the late prehistoric period (from about 900 AD), increased use of corn and social changes led to flourishing and nuclinated social institutions.

name: iowa
sentence: The arrival of European goods and diseases in the protohistoric period has led to dramatic demographic changes and economic and social upheavals, with the arrival of new tribes and first European explorers and traders.

name: iowa
sentence: There were many Indian tribes living in Iowa at the time of European exploration.

name: iowa
sentence: The tribes that were probably descendants of Prehistoric Oneota include Dakota, Ho-Chunk, Ioway and Otoe.

name: iowa
sentence: Tribes that arrived in Iowa at the end of prehistoric or protohistoric periods include the Illinihek, Meskwaki, Omaha and Sauk.

name: iowa
sentence: The first European explorers known to document Iowa were Jacques Marquette and Louis Jolliet who travelled to Mississippi in 1673 and documented several indigenous villages on the Iowa side.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa region was claimed for France and remained a French territory until 1763.

name: iowa
sentence: The French, before their imminent defeat in the French and Indian war, transferred the property to their ally, Spain.

name: iowa
sentence: Spain exercised very loose control over the Iowa region, granting commercial licences to French and British traders, who established trading posts along the Mississippi and the Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa was part of a territory known as La Louisiana or Louisiana, and European traders were interested in lead and fur obtained by Aboriginal people.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sauk and Meskwaki effectively controlled trade on Mississippi in the late 18th and early 19th centuries.

name: iowa
sentence: Among the first merchants in Mississippi were Julien Dubuque, Robert de la Salle and Paul Marin.

name: iowa
sentence: Along the Missouri River, at least five French and English trading houses were built before 1808.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1800 Napoleon Bonaparte took control of Louisiana in a treaty.

name: iowa
sentence: After the purchase of Louisiana in 1803, Congress divided the purchase of Louisiana into two parts: the territory of Orleans and the Louisiana District, the present Iowa falling into the latter.

name: iowa
sentence: Indiana was established in 1800 to exercise jurisdiction over this part of the district.

name: iowa
sentence: Much of the Iowa was mapped by Zebulon Pike in 1805, but it was only when Fort Madison was built in 1808 that the United States established tenuous military control over the area.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison was built to control the trade and establish American domination over Upper Mississippi, but it was misconceived and not loved by the Sauk and Fox, many of whom were allies with the British, who had not abandoned the claims of the territory.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison was defeated by the British-backed natives in 1813 during the War of 1812, and Fort Shelby, on the Dog Prairie in Wisconsin, also fell into British hands.

name: iowa
sentence: Black Hawk took part in the siege of Fort Madison.

name: iowa
sentence: Another small military outpost was established along the Mississippi River in the current Bellevue.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1813, hundreds of Aboriginal people attacked this poorly located stockade, but it was successfully defended and then abandoned until the settlers returned to the area in the mid-1830s.

name: iowa
sentence: After the war, the United States restored control of the area through the construction of Fort Armstrong, Fort Snelling in Minnesota and Fort Atkinson in Nebraska.

name: iowa
sentence: The United States encouraged settlement on the east side of Mississippi and Indian abduction to the west.

name: iowa
sentence: A disputed treaty of 1804 between Quashquame and William Henry Harrison, which delivered much of Illinois to the United States, enraged many Sauk and led to the Black Hawk War of 1832.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sauk and Meskwaki sold their land in the Mississippi Valley in 1832 in the purchase of Black Hawk and sold their remaining land in Iowa in 1842, most of which settled in a reserve in Kansas.

name: iowa
sentence: Many Meskwaki then returned to Iowa and settled near Tama, Iowa; the Meskwaki settlement remains to date.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1856, the Iowa Legislature passed an unprecedented law allowing Meskawki to buy land.

name: iowa
sentence: However, contrary to the unprecedented act of the Iowa Legislature, the U.S. federal government, through the use of treaties, forced the Ho-Chunk of Iowa in 1848, and the Dakota of Iowa in 1858.

name: iowa
sentence: The Western Iowa around Bluffs of the Modern Council was used as an Indian reserve for the members of the Council of the Three Fires.

name: iowa
sentence: The first American settlers officially moved to Iowa in June 1833.

name: iowa
sentence: Mainly, they were families from Ohio, Pennsylvania, New York, Indiana, Kentucky and Virginia who settled along the western shores of Mississippi and founded the modern cities of Dubuque and Bellevue.

name: iowa
sentence: On July 4, 1838, the American Congress created the territory of Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: President Martin Van Buren appointed Robert Lucas Governor of the Territory, who at the time had 22 counties and a population of 23,242 inhabitants.

name: iowa
sentence: Almost immediately after obtaining territorial status, a clamor was expressed for the establishment of a State.

name: iowa
sentence: On December 28, 1846, Iowa became the 29th State of the Union when President James K. Polk signed the Iowa Admission Bill.

name: iowa
sentence: Once admitted to the Union, the State's border problems resolved, and most of its land purchased from the Aboriginal people, Iowa gave its direction to development and organized campaigns for settlers and investors, boasting the rich agricultural land of the young border state, good citizens, free and open society, and good government.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a long tradition of state and county fairs.

name: iowa
sentence: The first and second Iowa State Fairs took place in the more developed eastern part of the state in Fairfield.

name: iowa
sentence: The first fair was held from October 25 to 27, 1854, for a cost of approximately $323.

name: iowa
sentence: Subsequently, the fair moved to places closer to the centre of the state and in 1886 found a permanent house in Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Since then, the State Fair has been held every year, with a few exceptions: 1898 due to the war between Spain and America and the World Fair in Omaha, Nebraska, nearby; 1942 to 1945 due to the Second World War, because the fairs were used as a supply depot for the army; and 2020 due to the VOCID-19 pandemic in the United States.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa supported the Union during the civil war, voting strongly for Abraham Lincoln, although there was an anti-war movement "Copperhead" in the state, caused in part by a fall in crop prices caused by the war.

name: iowa
sentence: There were no battles in the state, although the Battle of Athens, the Missouri, 1861, was fought just opposite the River Des Moines of Croton, the Iowa, and the shots of the battle landed in the Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa sent great food to the armies and eastern cities.

name: iowa
sentence: Much of Iowa's support for the Union can be attributed to Samuel J. Kirkwood, his first governor in wartime.

name: iowa
sentence: Out of a total population of 675,000, approximately 116,000 men were subjected to military functions.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa contributed proportionally more men to the military service of the civil war than any other state, north or south, sending more than 75,000 volunteers to the armed forces, more than a sixth of whom were killed before the Confederates went to Appomattox.

name: iowa
sentence: Most of them fought in the large countryside in the Mississippi Valley and in the South.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa troops fought at Wilson's Creek in Missouri, Pea Ridge in Arkansas, Forts Henry and Donelson, Shiloh, Chattanooga, Chickamauga, Missionary Ridge, and Rossville Gap, as well as Vicksburg, Iuka and Corinth.

name: iowa
sentence: They served with the Potomac Army in Virginia and fought under the General Union Philip Sheridan in the Shenandoah Valley.

name: iowa
sentence: Many died and were buried in Andersonville.

name: iowa
sentence: They walked on General Nathaniel Banks' expedition to the Red River.

name: iowa
sentence: Twenty-seven Iowans received the Medal of Honour, the highest military decoration awarded by the U.S. government, which was first awarded during the civil war.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has several Brigadier Generals and four principal Generals, Grenville Mellen Dodge, Samuel R. Curtis, Francis J. Herron and Frederick Steele, and many of its generals are prominent in the state and country after the war.

name: iowa
sentence: After the civil war, the population of Iowa continued to grow considerably, from 674,913 in 1860 to 1,624,615 in 1880.

name: iowa
sentence: The American Civil War briefly brought higher profits.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1917, the United States entered the First World War, and farmers and all Iowans experienced a wartime economy.

name: iowa
sentence: For farmers, change has been important.

name: iowa
sentence: Since the beginning of the war in 1914, farmers in Iowa have enjoyed economic prosperity, which lasted until the end of the war.

name: iowa
sentence: In the economic sector, Iowa has also undergone considerable changes.

name: iowa
sentence: Starting from the first industries developed in the 1830s, mainly for the processing of materials grown in the region, Iowa experienced a gradual increase in the number of enterprises and manufacturing operations.

name: iowa
sentence: The transition from an agricultural economy to a mixed economy has been slow.

name: iowa
sentence: The Great Depression and the Second World War accelerated the transition from smallholder agriculture to larger farms, and began a trend towards urbanization.

name: iowa
sentence: The period after the Second World War was marked by a particular increase in manufacturing activities.

name: iowa
sentence: The agricultural crisis of the 1980s caused a major recession in Iowa, causing the poverty that has not been observed since the depression.

name: iowa
sentence: The crisis caused a major demographic decline, which lasted ten years.

name: iowa
sentence: After reaching its peak in the 1980s, the Iowa economy began to become less and less dependent on agriculture.

name: iowa
sentence: At the beginning of the 21st century, it was characterized by a mix of manufacturing, biotechnology, finance, insurance and government services.

name: iowa
sentence: The population of Iowa has grown faster than that of the United States as a whole, and the population of Iowa is now predominantly urban.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa Economic Development Authority, established in 2011, replaced the Iowa Department of Economic Development and its annual reports are a source of economic information.

name: iowa
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the Iowa population was 3,155,070 on July 1, 2019, an increase of 3.57% since the 2010 Census.

name: iowa
sentence: Of the Iowa residents, 70.8 per cent were born in Iowa, 23.6 per cent were born in another U.S. state, 0.6 per cent were born in Puerto Rico, the U.S. islands or abroad to U.S. parents, and 5 per cent were born abroad.

name: iowa
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 29,386 people, while migration within the country resulted in a net loss of 41,140 people.

name: iowa
sentence: 6.5% of the Iowa population were under five years of age, 22.6% were under 18 years of age and 14.7% were 65 years of age or older.

name: iowa
sentence: Men accounted for about 49.6 per cent of the population.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa banned the holy cities.

name: iowa
sentence: The population density of the State is 52.7 persons per square mile.

name: iowa
sentence: At the 2010 census, the Iowa population centre is located in Marshall County, near Melbourne.

name: iowa
sentence: At the 2010 census, the Iowa population was 3,046,355.

name: iowa
sentence: The gender composition of the State was 49.5 per cent for men and 50.5 per cent for women.

name: iowa
sentence: 23.9% of the population was under the age of 18.

name: iowa
sentence: The table below shows the racial composition of the Iowa population in 2018.

name: iowa
sentence: According to the 2016 U.S. Community Survey, 5.6% of the Iowa population were of Hispanic or Latin origin (of any race): Mexican (4.3%), Puerto Rican (0.2%), Cuban (0.1%) and other Hispanic or Latin origin (1.0%).

name: iowa
sentence: The five largest ancestry groups were German (35.1%), Irish (13.5%), English (8.2%), American (5.8%) and Norwegian (5.0%).

name: iowa
sentence: The population of Iowa is more urban than rural, with 61 per cent living in urban areas in 2000, a trend that began in the early twentieth century.

name: iowa
sentence: Urban counties in Iowa increased by 8.5 per cent between 2000 and 2008, while rural counties decreased by 4.2 per cent.

name: iowa
sentence: The shift from rural to urban has led to an increase in population in more urbanized counties such as Dallas, Johnson, Linn, Polk and Scott, to the detriment of more rural counties.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa, like other Midwestern states (especially Kansas, Nebraska, North Dakota and South Dakota), has felt the strongest of rural flights, although Iowa has been gaining population since about 1990.

name: iowa
sentence: Some smaller communities, such as Denison and Storm Lake, have mitigated this population loss through earnings among immigrant workers.

name: iowa
sentence: Another demographic problem for Iowa is the brain drain, in which educated young adults leave the state looking for better prospects in higher education or employment.

name: iowa
sentence: During the 1990s, Iowa experienced the second highest rate of exodus for young single and educated adults, after only North Dakota.

name: iowa
sentence: Note: Births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnicity and race, giving a higher overall number.

name: iowa
sentence: A 2014 Pew Research Center survey revealed that 60% of Iowans are Protestant, 18% Catholic and 1% non-Christian.

name: iowa
sentence: 21% responded with non-religious ones, and 1% did not respond.

name: iowa
sentence: An investigation by the Association of Religion Data Archives (ARDA) in 2010 revealed that the largest Protestant denominations were the United Methodist Church with 235,190 adherents and the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America with 229,557.

name: iowa
sentence: The largest non-Protestant religion was Catholicism with 503,080 adherents.

name: iowa
sentence: The State has a large number of reformed denominations.

name: iowa
sentence: The Presbyterian Church (USA) had nearly 290 congregations and 51,380 members, followed by the Reformed Church in America, 80 churches and 40,000 members, and the United Church of Christ, 180 churches and 39,000 members.

name: iowa
sentence: The Study Religious Congregations & Composition: 2000 found in the two southernmost levels of Iowa counties and in other central counties of the State, the largest religious group was the United Methodist Church; in the northeastern part of the State, including the counties of Dubuque and Linn (where Cedar Rapids is located), the Catholic Church was the largest; and in ten counties, three of which in the north, the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America was the largest.

name: iowa
sentence: The study also revealed a rapid growth of Christian evangelical confessions.

name: iowa
sentence: Dubuque is home to the Archdiocese of Dubuque, which serves as an ecclesiastical province for the other three dioceses of the state and for all Catholics in the entire state of Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Historically, sects and religious orders that wanted to live away from the rest of society were established in Iowa, such as Amish and Mennonites near Kalona and other parts of Eastern Iowa, such as Davis County and Buchanan County.

name: iowa
sentence: Other sects and religious orders living apart are the Quakers around West Branch and The Great, the German pietists who founded the Amana Colonies, the adherents of the Transcendental Meditation who founded Maharishi Vedic City, and the Order of Cistercians of monks and religious strict observation at the New Melleray and Notre-Dame des Abbies du Mississippi near Dubuque.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2016, about 6,000 Jews lived in Iowa, including about 3,000 in Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: English is the most common language in Iowa, used by 94% of the population.

name: iowa
sentence: William Labov and his colleagues, in the monumental Atlas of North American English, discovered that English spoken in Iowa is divided into several linguistic regions.

name: iowa
sentence: The natives of Northern Iowa – including Sioux City, Fort Dodge and the Waterloo area – intend to speak to dialect linguists called English from North America, which is also found in North and South Dakota, Minnesota, Wisconsin and Michigan.

name: iowa
sentence: The natives of central and southern Iowa, including cities such as Council Bluffs, Davenport, Des Moines and Iowa City, speak the Midland-North dialect also found in eastern Nebraska, central Illinois, and central Indiana.

name: iowa
sentence: Indigenous people in central Eastern Iowa, including cities such as Cedar Rapids, Dubuque and Clinton, tend to speak with northern cities Vowel Shift, a dialect that extends from this region and east across the Great Lakes region.

name: iowa
sentence: After English, Spanish is the second most common language spoken in Iowa, with 120,000 people in Iowa of Hispanic or Latin origin and 47,000 people born in Latin America.

name: iowa
sentence: The third most common language is German, spoken by 17,000 people in Iowa; two notable German dialects used in Iowa include German Amana spoken around the Amana colonies, and German Pennsylvania, spoken among the Amish in Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: The proclamation of Babel in 1918 prohibited speaking German in public.

name: iowa
sentence: Around Pella, people of Dutch origin once spoke of the Dutch dialect of Pella.

name: iowa
sentence: No other language is spoken by more than 0.5% of the Iowa population.

name: iowa
sentence: The only native language regularly used in Iowa is Meskwaki, used around the Meskwaki settlement.

name: iowa
sentence: Ames is the headquarters of the Iowa State University, the Iowa State Centre and the Reiman Gardens.

name: iowa
sentence: Des Moines is the largest city and metropolitan area of Iowa and the political and economic center of the state.

name: iowa
sentence: It is home to the Iowa State Capitol, the Iowa Museum Historical State Corporation, Drake University, the Moines Art Centre, the Grand Des Moines Botanical Garden, the Riverwalk Main Drive, the Iowa State Fair, Terrace Hill and the World Food Prize.

sentence: Although Iowa is often regarded as an agricultural state, agriculture is a relatively small part of the state's diversified economy, with manufacturing, biotechnology, financial and insurance services and government services contributing substantially to the Iowa economy.

name: iowa

sentence: Manufacturing is the largest sector in the Iowa economy, accounting for $20.8 billion (21%) of Iowa's gross domestic product in 2003.

sentence: In Iowa, the term "political party" refers to political organizations that obtained at least two per cent of the votes cast for the President or Governor in the "last general election".

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa recognizes three political parties, the Republican Party, the Democratic Party and the Libertarian Party.

name: iowa
sentence: Third parties, officially referred to as "non-partite political organizations", may also appear on the ballot paper.

sentence: Four of them have been candidates for the Iowa elections since 2004 for various positions: the Constitutional Party, the Green Party, the Piracy Party and the Socialist Workers' Party.

sentence: The State receives considerable attention every four years because the Iowa caucus, which brings together voters to select delegates to state conventions, is the country's first presidential caucus.

name: iowa
sentence: Caucuses, held in January or February of the election year, involve people who meet in public homes or places and choose their candidates, rather than voting by secret ballot as is the case in a primary presidential election.The following week, the Iowa caucuses became the starting point for the choice of the two main candidates for the position of president.

name: iowa
sentence: In the 19th century, Iowa was one of the first States to enact prohibitions against racial discrimination, particularly in the field of education, but was slow to achieve full integration in the 20th century.

name: iowa
sentence: In the first decision of the Iowa Supreme Court — in Re the Matter of Ralph, rendered in July 1839 — the Court rejected slavery in a decision that found a slave named free Ralph when he walked on Iowa soil, 26 years before the end of the civil war.

name: iowa
sentence: The state had removed racial barriers to marriage in 1851, more than 100 years before the United States Supreme Court prohibited deception laws throughout the country.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa Supreme Court rendered a decision in Clark v. The Board of Directors in 1868, ruling that "separate but equal" schools of a racial nature did not belong in Iowa, 85 years before Brown v. Board of Education.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1875, a number of additional court decisions effectively ended segregation in Iowa schools.

name: iowa
sentence: Discrimination against Blacks in state universities continued until the 1950s.

name: iowa
sentence: The Court heard Coger v. The North Western Union Packet Co. in 1873, ruling against racial discrimination in public institutions 91 years before the United States Supreme Court rendered the same decision.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1884, the Iowa Civil Rights Act apparently prohibited discrimination by businesses, saying: "Everyone in that State has the right to the full and equal enjoyment of accommodation, benefits, facilities and privileges of inns, restaurants, cellars, dining houses, dining counters and all other places where refreshments are served, public transportation, hairdressing salons, baths, theatres and all other places of fun".

name: iowa
sentence: However, the courts had chosen to strictly apply the Act, which had allowed de facto discrimination to be prosecuted.

name: iowa
sentence: Racial discrimination in public enterprises was found illegal only in 1949, when the court ruled in Iowa v. Katz that companies should serve their clients regardless of their race; the case began when Edna Griffin was denied service at a Des Moines pharmacy.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa Civil Rights Act 1965 codifies all racial civil rights.

name: iowa
sentence: Like racial equality, Iowa was the vanguard of women's rights in the mid-19th century, but did not allow women to vote until the nineteenth amendment to the United States Constitution was ratified in 1920, with Iowa being one of the ratification votes.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1847, the University of Iowa became the first public university in the United States to admit men and women on an equal footing.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1869, Iowa became the first State of the Union to admit women to the practice of law, the Court ruling that women cannot be denied the right to practice law in Iowa and to admit Arabella A. Mansfield into the practice of law.

name: iowa
sentence: Several attempts to grant full voting rights to Iowa women were defeated between 1870 and 1919.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1894, women were granted "partial suffrage", allowing them to vote on questions, but not for candidates.

name: iowa
sentence: It is only upon ratification of the nineteenth amendment that women have the right to vote in their own right in Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Although Iowa supported the federal amendment on equal rights, in 1980 and 1992, Iowa voters rejected an amendment to the State Constitution on equal rights.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa added the word "women" to the Iowa Constitution in 1998.

name: iowa
sentence: After the amendment, it reads as follows: "All men and women are, by nature, free and equal, and have certain inalienable rights, including those to enjoy and defend life and freedom, to acquire, possess and protect property, and to seek and obtain security and happiness".

name: iowa
sentence: In May 2018, Iowa signed one of the country's most restrictive abortion bans: the obligation for a doctor not to perform abortion if he detects a heartbeat, which in many cases would limit pregnancies of less than six weeks.

name: iowa
sentence: It was annulled in January 2019, when a state judge in Iowa ruled that the "fetal heartbeat" law was unconstitutional.

name: iowa
sentence: The State Act criminalizing same-sex sexual activity was repealed in June 1976, 27 years before Lawrence v. Texas.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2007, the Iowa Legislature added "sexual orientation" and "sexual identity" to the protected classes listed in the Iowa Civil Rights Act.

name: iowa
sentence: On 3 April 2009, the Supreme Court of Iowa ruled that Varnum v. Brien, acting unanimously, the State law prohibiting homosexual marriage was unconstitutional.

name: iowa
sentence: This made Iowa the third state in the United States and the first in the Midwest to allow same-sex marriage.

name: maine
sentence: The Constitution of Maine forms the government of the State of Maine, composed of three co-equal branches: executive, legislative and judicial.

name: maine
sentence: The State of Maine also has three constitutional officials (the Secretary of State, the Treasurer of State and the Attorney-General of the State) and one statutory official (the Auditor of the State).

name: maine
sentence: The legislature is the Maine Legislative Assembly, a bicameral body composed of the Maine House of Representatives, with 151 members, and the Maine Senate, with 35 members.

name: maine
sentence: The legislative branch is responsible for the adoption and adoption of laws.

name: maine
sentence: The executive branch is responsible for the enforcement of laws created by the Legislative Assembly and is headed by the Governor of Maine (currently Janet Mills).

sentence: In the 1930s, Maine was one of the few states that retained Republican sentiments.

sentence: In the 1936 presidential election, Franklin D. Roosevelt received the votes of all states other than Maine and Vermont; they were the only two states in the nation that had never voted for Roosevelt in any of his presidential campaigns, although Maine was closely fought in 1940 and 1944.

sentence: An organized municipality has a form of elected local government that administers and provides local services, maintains records, collects licence fees and may issue local binding orders, including self-government responsibilities.
