name: massachusetts
sentence: The project included making the Central Artery a tunnel under downtown Boston, in addition to rerouting several other major highways.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Often controversial, with many claims of graft and mismanagement, and with its initial price of $2.5 billion increasing to a final total of more than $15 billion, the Big Dig nevertheless changed the face of Downtown Boston.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It connects areas once divided by an elevated road (a good part of the old raised central artery has been replaced by the Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy Greenway), and improves traffic conditions as well as several routes.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Kennedy family was important in Massachusetts politics in the 20th century.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The children of a businessman and Ambassador Joseph P. Kennedy Sr. included John F. Kennedy, who was a senator and president of the United States prior to his assassination in 1963, Robert F. Kennedy, who was a senator, Attorney General of the United States and a presidential candidate prior to his assassination in 1968, Ted Kennedy, a senator from 1962 to his death in 2009, and Eunice Kennedy Shriver, co-founder of the Special Olympics.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1966, Massachusetts became the first state to directly elect an African American to the U.S. Senate with Edward Brooke.

name: massachusetts
sentence: George H W Bush, 41st President of the United States (1989-1993) was born in Milton in 1924.

name: massachusetts
sentence: John W. McCormack, Speaker of the House in the 1960s, and Tip O'Neill, whose position as Speaker of the House from 1977 to 1987 was the longest-standing term in the history of the United States, were among the leading politicians of Bay State at the national level.

name: massachusetts
sentence: On 17 May 2004, Massachusetts became the first state in the United States to legalize same-sex marriage after the Massachusetts Supreme Court ruled in November 2003 that the exclusion of same-sex couples from the right to civil marriage was unconstitutional.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This decision was eventually replaced by the U.S. Supreme Court's assertion on same-sex marriage in the U.S. in 2015.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2004, Massachusetts Senator John Kerry, who won the democratic nomination as President of the United States, was slightly lost by George W. Bush.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Eight years later, the former governor of Massachusetts Mitt Romney (named Republic) lost to Barack Obama in 2012.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Eight years later, Massachusetts Senator Elizabeth Warren played a leading role in the democratic primaries for the 2020 presidential election, but suspended her campaign and then approved the alleged candidate Joe Biden.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Two pressure cooker bombs exploded near the Boston Marathon finish line on April 15, 2013, at approximately 1449 EDT.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The explosions killed three people and injured approximately 264 others.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) later identified the suspects as brothers Dzhokhar Tsarnaev and Tamerlan Tsarnaev.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The subsequent manhunt ended on 19 April, when thousands of law enforcement officers searched an area of 20 dams near Watertown.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Dzhokhar later declared that he was motivated by Islamic extremist beliefs and learned to build explosive devices from Inspire, Al-Qaeda's online magazine on the Arabian Peninsula.

name: massachusetts
sentence: On November 8, 2016, Massachusetts voted in favour of the Massachusetts marijuana legalization initiative, also known as Question 4.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It was included in the US presidential election 2016 in Massachusetts as an indirectly initiated state law.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is the 7th smallest state in the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It is located in the New England region of the northeastern United States and has an area of 10,555 square miles (27,340 km2), of which 25.7% is water.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Several large bays distinctly shape its coast.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston is the largest city at the end of Massachusetts Bay and the mouth of the Charles River.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Despite its small size, Massachusetts has many distinctive topographical regions.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The great coastal plain of the Atlantic Ocean in the eastern part of the state contains Greater Boston, as well as most of the population of the state, as well as the characteristic Cape Cod Peninsula.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To the west is the hilly and rural area of central Massachusetts and beyond, the Connecticut River Valley.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Along the western border of Western Massachusetts lies the highest part of the state, the Berkshires.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The U.S. National Park Service administers a number of natural and historical sites in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition to twelve national historic sites, regions and corridors, the National Parks Service also manages the Cape Cod National Marine Coastal and the Boston Harbor Islands National Recreation Area.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition, the Department of Conservation and Recreation maintains a number of parks, trails and beaches throughout Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Although much of Massachusetts has been cleared for agriculture, leaving only traces of old forest in isolated pockets, secondary growth has regenerating in many rural areas, with farms abandoned.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Currently, forests cover about 62% of Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The areas most affected by human development are the Greater Boston area to the east and the Springfield metropolitan area to the west, although the latter includes agricultural areas throughout the Connecticut River Valley.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts currently has 219 endangered species.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A number of species are doing well in the increasingly urbanized Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Peregrine hawks use office towers in large cities as nesting areas, and the population of coyotes, whose diet may include garbage and garbage, has increased in recent decades.

name: massachusetts
sentence: White-tailed deer, raccoons, wild turkeys and eastern grey squirrels are also found throughout Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the more rural areas of western Massachusetts, large mammals such as moose and black bears have returned, largely due to reforestation as a result of the regional decline in agriculture.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is located along the Atlantic Flyway, an important road for migratory waterfowl along the east coast.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The lakes in central Massachusetts provide habitat for many species of fish and waterfowl, but some species such as common loon become rare.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A large population of long-tailed ducks winters off Nantucket.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Small islands and beaches at sea are home to reed terns and are important breeding grounds for the locally threatened pipeline plover.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Protected areas such as the Monomoy National Wildlife Sanctuary provide critical breeding habitat for shorebirds and a variety of marine wildlife, including a large population of grey seals.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Since 2009, the number of Great White Sharks spotted and marked in coastal waters off Cape Cod has increased significantly.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Freshwater fish species in Massachusetts include bass, carp, catfish and trout, while saltwater species such as Atlantic cod, haddock and American lobster inhabit offshore waters.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other marine species include harbour seals, endangered North Atlantic right whales, humpback whales, fin whales, communal whales, and Atlantic white-sided dolphins.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Corn borer, a major agricultural pest, was first found in North America near Boston, Massachusetts, in 1917.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Most Massachusetts has a humid continental climate, with cold winters and warm summers.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The coastal areas of the extreme southeast constitute the vast transition zone to humid subtropical climates.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Hot to hot summers make the ocean climate rare in this transition, applying only to exposed coastal areas such as the Barnstable County Peninsula.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Boston climate is fairly representative for the commonwealth, characterized by summer peaks of about 81°F (27°C) and winter peaks of 35°F (2°C), and is quite humid.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Frosts are common all winter, even in coastal areas due to prevailing internal winds.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Because of its location near the Atlantic, Massachusetts is not vulnerable to easterners, hurricanes and tropical storms.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Climate change in Massachusetts will affect urban and rural environments, including forestry, fisheries, agriculture and coastal development.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The northeast is expected to warm faster than the global average; by 2035, the northeast is expected to be warmer on average at more than 3.6°F (2°C) than in the pre-industrial era.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In August 2016, EPA reported that Massachusetts warmed up by more than two degrees Fahrenheit, or 1.1 degrees Celsius.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This is almost double the average of the United States contiguous.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Temperature change also results in a change in precipitation patterns and an increase in precipitation.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To this end, average precipitation in the northeastern United States increased by 10 per cent between 1895 and 2011, and the number of high precipitation events increased by 70 per cent during this period.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These increased precipitation trends are concentrated in winter and spring.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Increased temperatures and increased precipitation will result in earlier snowfalls and drier soils in the summer months.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Climate change in Massachusetts will result in a significant change in the built environment and ecosystems.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In Boston alone, the costs of climate change storms will result in damages of $5-100 billion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These costs are attributable to the expected damage to coastal homes, the destruction of roads and the current exposure to utilities infrastructure.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Warmer temperatures will also disrupt bird migration and flowering.

name: massachusetts
sentence: With these changes, deer populations are expected to increase, resulting in a decrease in the undergrowth used as camouflage by smaller wildlife.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition, rising temperatures will increase the number of reported cases of Lyme disease in the state.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Ticks can transmit the disease once temperatures reach 45 degrees, so shorter winters will increase the transmission window.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These warmer temperatures will also increase the prevalence of mosquitoes carrying West Nile virus.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To combat this change, the state of Massachusetts Executive Office of Energy and Environmental Affairs has set a course towards decarbonizing the state economy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: On April 22, 2020, Massachusetts Secretary of Energy and Environmental Affairs Kathleen A. Theoharides published a state-wide emission limit determination for 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In its letter, Theoharides points out that as of 2020, the Commonwealth has suffered material damage due to climate change of more than $60 billion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To ensure that the Commonwealth does not warm up more than 1.5°C of pre-industrial levels, the state will strive to achieve zero net emissions and an overall reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 85% by 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The State of Massachusetts has developed a plethora of incentives to encourage the implementation of renewable energy, appliances and efficient domestic facilities.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mass Save was formed in collaboration with the state by Berkshire Gas, Blackstone Gas Company, Cape Light Compact, Eversource, Liberty Utilities, National Grid and Unitil to offer homeowners and tenants incentives to upgrade their homes with efficient HVAC equipment and other household appliances.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For example, up to a $100 discount can be obtained for upgrading an ENERGY STAR certified smart or programmable thermostat.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other appliances, such as water heaters, air conditioners, washers and dryers, as well as heat pumps, are eligible for additional discounts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The concept of Mass Save was created in 2008 by the adoption of the Green Communities Act 2008 during Deval Patrick's term.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The main objective of the Green Communities Act was to reduce the consumption of fossil fuels in the State and to encourage the adoption of new and more efficient technologies.

name: massachusetts
sentence: One of the outcomes of the Act was that public service program administrators should invest in energy saving, rather than buying and producing additional energy where economically feasible.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In Massachusetts, eleven program administrators, including NStar, National Grid, Western Massachusetts Electric, Cape Light Compact, Till and Berkshire Gas, jointly hold the program rights, in collaboration with the Ministry of Energy Resources (DOER) and the Advisory Council on Energy Efficiency (CAEE).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mass Save also conducts home energy assessments at no cost so that homeowners, tenants and small business owners can learn about energy efficiency home improvements and find opportunities to save money and energy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: During the home evaluation, Mass Save provides ENERGY STAR certified LED bulbs, power bands, low-flow shower heads, faucet aerators and effective thermostats for free.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition, leaks of air will be detected in the house or building and corrected, and recommendations will be made to install additional insulation to reduce the loss of heated or cooled air.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Reductions of 75% or more are available on these insulation improvements.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Thanks to VOCID-19, Mass Save is currently conducting remote assessments.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residents can plan a remote evaluation using the program's website or telephone line.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The State Income Service provides incentives for the installation of solar panels.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition to the federal residential renewable energy credit, residents of Massachusetts may be eligible for a tax credit of up to 15 per cent of the project.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Once installed, the tables are eligible for net measurement.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Some municipalities will offer up to $1.20 per watt, up to 50% of the cost of the system on photovoltaic networks of 25 kW or less.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts Department of Energy also provides low interest rate fixed-rate financing with loan support to low-income residents.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The programme is expected to end on 31 December 2020.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As part of efforts by the Massachusetts Department of Energy Resources (Massachusetts Department of Energy Resources) to encourage the use of renewable energy, the MOR-EV (Massachusetts Offers Rebates for Electric Vehicles) initiative was established.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Through this incentive measure, residents may be entitled to a government incentive of up to $2,500 for the purchase or rental of an electric vehicle, or $1,500 for the purchase or rental of a plug-in hybrid vehicle.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This rebate is in addition to the tax credits offered by the U.S. Department of Energy for the purchase of electric vehicles and plug-in hybrids.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For income-eligible residents, Mass Save has partnered with the Massachusetts Community Action Program and LEAN (Low-Income Energy Affordability Network) to provide residents with assistance in improving their housing, which will allow for more efficient use of energy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residents may be eligible to replace their heating system, insulation system, appliances and thermostats if they meet the income conditions set out on the Mass Save website.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For residents of more than 5 family residential buildings, there are additional benefits limited by disposable income through the LEAN.

name: massachusetts
sentence: If at least 50 per cent of building residents are eligible for low income, energy efficiency improvements such as those available through Mass Save are available.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residential structures managed by non-profit organizations, for gainful activities or housing organizations can benefit from these programs.

name: massachusetts
sentence: At the end of 2020, the Baker Administration released a roadmap on decarbonization that targets net greenhouse gas emissions by zero by 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The plan foresees significant investments in offshore wind and solar energy and would require all new cars sold to be zero-emission (electric or hydrogen-fired) by 2035.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimated that the Massachusetts population was 6,892,503 as of 1 July 2019, an increase of 5.27 per cent over the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2015, Massachusetts was estimated to be the third most populous U.S. state, with 871.0 people per square kilometre behind New Jersey and Rhode Island.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2014, there were 1,011,811 foreign-born residents in Massachusetts, representing 15% of the population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Most residents of Bay State live in the Boston metropolitan area, also known as Grand Boston, which includes Boston and its surrounding environment, but also extends to the Grand Lowell and Worcester.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Springfield Metropolitan Area, also known as Grand Springfield, is also an important population centre.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Demographically, the population centre of Massachusetts is located in the town of Natick.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Like the rest of the northeastern United States, the population of Massachusetts continued to grow in the late 20th and early 21st centuries.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is the fastest growing state in New England and the 25th fastest growing state in the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Population growth is largely due to a relatively high quality of life and a large higher education system in the State.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Foreign immigration is also a factor in the population growth of the state, which means that the population of the state continues to grow from the 2010 census (especially in cities in Massachusetts where the cost of living is lower).

name: massachusetts
sentence: 40 per cent of foreign immigrants came from Central or South America, according to a 2005 Census Bureau study, and many from Asia.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Many residents who settled in the Grand Springfield claim Puerto Rican origin.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Many parts of Massachusetts showed relatively stable demographic trends between 2000 and 2010.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The fastest-growing coastal and urban areas of the city of Boston, while Berkshire County in the extreme west of Massachusetts and Barnstable County in Cape Cod, were the only counties to have lost population at the 2010 census.

name: massachusetts
sentence: By sex, 48.4% were men and 51.6% of women in 2014.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In terms of age, 79.2% were over the age of 18 and 14.8% over the age of 65.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2014, in terms of race and ethnicity, Massachusetts was 83.2% White (73.7% non-Hispanic whites), 8.8% Blacks or African Americans, 0.5% Alaska Native Americans, 6.3% Native Americans, <0.1% Hawaii Native Americans and other Pacific Islanders, 2.1% other races and 3.1% two or more races.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Hispanics and Latinos of all races accounted for 11.2% of the population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The most populous ethnic group in the state, non-Hispanic white, rose from 95.4% in 1970 to 73.7% in 2014.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2011, non-Hispanic whites were involved in 63.6% of all births, while 36.4% of the population of Massachusetts under the age of 1 was a minority (at least one non-Hispanic white parent).

name: massachusetts
sentence: One of the main reasons is that non-Hispanic whites in Massachusetts had a total fertility rate of 1.36 in 2017, the second lowest in the country after neighbouring Rhode Island.

name: massachusetts
sentence: By 1795, the population of Massachusetts was almost 95% of English ancestry.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the early and mid-19th centuries, immigrant groups began to arrive in large numbers in Massachusetts; first in Ireland in the 1840s; now Irish and Irish are the largest group of ancestry in the state, with nearly 25% of the total population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Others later arrived from Quebec as well as places in Europe such as Italy, Portugal and Poland.

name: massachusetts
sentence: At the beginning of the 20th century, a number of African Americans emigrated to Massachusetts, although in a slightly smaller number than many other northern states.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Later in the 20th century, immigration from Latin America increased considerably.

name: massachusetts
sentence: More than 156,000 American Chinese made their home in Massachusetts in 2014, and Boston is hosting an expanding Chinatown that hosts Chinese-owned bus lines to and from Chinatown, Manhattan, New York.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts also has large Dominican, Puerto Rican, Haitian, Cape Verdean and Brazilian populations.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston's South End and Jamaica Plain are two gay villages, just as is nearby Provincetown, Massachusetts on Cape Cod.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The largest ancestry group in Massachusetts is that of the Irish (22.5 per cent of the population), who live in large numbers throughout the state, but make up more than 40 per cent of the population along the South Shore in the counties of Norfolk and Plymouth (in both counties, Irish Americans make up more than 30 per cent of the population).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Italians are the second largest ethnic group in the state (13.5%), but they form a plurality only in some suburbs north of Boston and in some Berkshire cities.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The English-Americans, the third group (11.4%) lived there the longest, but only form a plurality in some western cities.

name: massachusetts
sentence: French and French Canadians also account for a significant share (10.7%), with large populations in the counties of Bristol, Hampden and Worcester.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Lowell is home to the second largest Cambodian community in the nation.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts also houses a small community of Greek Americans, which, according to the American Community Survey, has 83,701 scattered along the state (1.2% of the total population of the state).

name: massachusetts
sentence: There are also several Amerindian populations in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Wampanoag tribe maintains reserves in Aquinnah on Martha's Vineyard and in Mashpee on Cape Cod, with a project to revive the mother tongue in progress since 1993, while the Nipmuc maintains two reservations recognized by the State in the central part of the State, one in Grafton.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts avoided many forms of racial conflict seen elsewhere in the United States, but examples such as the successful electoral demonstrations of the nativist (mainly anti-Catholic) knew nothing in the 1850s, the controversial executions of Sacco and Vanzetti in the 1920s, and Boston's opposition to desegregation in the 1970s showed that the ethnic history of Massachusetts was not completely harmonious.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The most common varieties of American English spoken in Massachusetts, with the exception of General American, are the distinct, rhotic dialect of western Massachusetts and the merged, non-rhotic dialect of eastern Massachusetts (called the Boston accent).

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2010, 78.93% (4,823,127) of residents of Massachusetts aged 5 and over spoke English at home as their mother tongue, while 7.50% (458,256) spoke Spanish, 2.97% (181,437) Portuguese, 1.59% (96,690) Chinese (which includes Cantonese and Mandarin), 1.11% (67,788) French, 0.89% (54,456) French Creole, 0.72% (43,798) Italian, 0.62% (37,865) Russian and Vietnamese were spoken as their primary language by 0.58% (35,283) of the population over 5.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A total of 21.07 per cent (1,287,419) of the population aged 5 and over in Massachusetts spoke a mother tongue other than English.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts was founded and established by the Puritan brownists in 1620 and shortly thereafter by other groups of separatists/dissidents, non-conformists and independents of 17th century England.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Today, the majority of the people of Massachusetts remain Christians.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The descendants of the Puritans belong to many different churches; in the direct line of the inheritance are the different Congregational Churches, the United Church of Christ and the Congregations of the Unitarian Universalist Association.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The headquarters of the United Universalist Association, long located on Beacon Hill, is now located in the south of Boston.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Many Puritan descendants have also dispersed into other Protestant denominations.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Some are disaffiliated with Roman Catholics and other Christian groups as a result of modern secularization.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Today, Christians make up 57 per cent of the population of the State, and Protestants 21 per cent of them.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Roman Catholics account for 34% of the population and today predominate because of massive immigration from mainly Catholic countries and regions, mainly Ireland, Italy, Poland, Portugal, Quebec and Latin America.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Roman Protestant and Catholic communities have been in decline since the end of the 20th century, due to the increase in Irreligion in New England.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It is the country's most unreligious region, with the Western United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A large Jewish population immigrated to the Boston and Springfield areas between 1880 and 1920.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Jews currently account for 3% of the population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mary Baker Eddy made the Boston Mother Church of Christian Science the global headquarters of this new religious movement.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Buddhists, pagans, Hindus, Seventh-day Adventists, Muslims and Mormons can also be found.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Kripalu Centre in Stockbridge, the Shaolin Meditation Temple in Springfield and the Insight Meditation Centre in Barre are examples of non-abramic religious centres in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: According to 2010 data from the Association of Religion Data Archives (ARDA), the largest unique denominations are the Catholic Church with 2,940,199 members, the United Church of Christ with 86,639 members and the Episcopal Church with 81,999 members.

name: massachusetts
sentence: 32% of the population identifies themselves as having no religion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2018, Massachusetts' general education system was ranked first among the 50 U.S. states by US News & World Report.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts was the first state in North America to require municipalities to appoint a teacher or establish a secondary school with the passage of the Massachusetts Education Act of 1647, and the 19th-century reforms initiated by Horace Mann laid much of the foundation for contemporary universal public education that was established in 1852.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is home to the oldest continuing school in North America (Roxbury's Latin School, founded in 1645), as well as the oldest public primary school in the country (Mather School, founded in 1639), its oldest secondary school (Boston's Latin School, founded in 1635), its oldest continuing boarding school (Governor's Academy, founded in 1763), its oldest college (Harvard University, founded in 1636) and its oldest women's college (Mont Holyoke College, founded in 1837).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is also home to the highest private high school in the United States, Phillips Academy in Andover, Massachusetts, which was founded in 1778.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts' public spending per student for primary and secondary schools was eighth in the country in 2012, at $14,844.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2013, Massachusetts achieved the highest score of all states in mathematics and the third highest in reading on the national assessment of progress in education.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Students in Massachusetts public schools are among the highest levels of academic performance in the world.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is home to 121 higher education institutions.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, both located in Cambridge, consistently rank among the best private universities and universities in the world in general.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition to Harvard and MIT, several other Massachusetts universities are currently ranked in the top 50 national undergraduates in the widely cited rankings of US News and World Report: Tufts University (#27), Boston College (#32), Brandeis University (#34), Boston University (#37) and Northeastern University (#40).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is also home to three of the top five liberal arts colleges in the US News and World Report: Williams College (#1), Amherst College (#2) and Wellesley College (#4).

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts Public University (also known as UMass) has five campuses in the state, with its flagship campus in Amherst, which is over 25,000.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The United States Bureau of Economic Analysis estimates that Massachusetts' gross national product in 2017 was $527 billion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Personal per capita income in 2012 was $53,221, making it the third highest state in the nation.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In January 2020, the general minimum wage for the State of Massachusetts is $13.50 per hour, while the minimum wage for workers with a tip is $5.55 per hour.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2015, 12 Fortune 500 companies were located in Massachusetts: Liberty Mutual, Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company, TJX Companies, General Electric, Raytheon, American Tower, Global Partners, Thermo Fisher Scientific, State Street Corporation, Biogen, Eversource Energy and Boston Scientific.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The list of "Top States for Business for 2014" by CNBC recognized Massachusetts as the 25th best state in the country for business, and for the second consecutive year, the state was ranked by Bloomberg as the most innovative state in America.

name: massachusetts
sentence: According to a 2013 study by Phoenix Marketing International, Massachusetts had the sixth largest number of millionaires per capita in the United States, with a ratio of 6.73 per cent.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Among the billionaires living in the state, there are past and current leaders (and a related family) of local companies such as Fidelity Investments, New Balance, Kraft Group, Boston Scientific and the former Continental Cablevision.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has three foreign trade zones, the Boston Massachusetts Port Authority, the New Bedford Harbour and the City of Holyoke.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston-Logan International Airport is the busiest airport in New England, serving 33.4 million passengers in 2015 and showing rapid growth in international air traffic since 2010.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The sectors essential to Massachusetts' economy include higher education, biotechnology, information technology, finance, health care, tourism, manufacturing and defence.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Highway 128 corridor and Greater Boston continue to be an important venture capital investment centre, and high technology remains an important sector.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In recent years, tourism has played an increasingly important role in the state economy, with Boston and Cape Cod being the main destinations.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other popular tourist destinations include Salem, Plymouth and Berkshires.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is the sixth most popular tourist destination for foreign travellers.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2010, the Great Places in Massachusetts Commission published "1,000 Great Places in Massachusetts" which identified 1,000 sites across the Commonwealth to showcase various historical, cultural and natural attractions.

name: massachusetts
sentence: While manufacturing accounted for less than 10% of Massachusetts' gross national product in 2016, the Commonwealth ranked 16th in the country's total manufacturing output in the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It is a diverse range of manufactured products such as medical devices, paper articles, specialized chemicals and plastics, telecommunications and electronics equipment and machined components.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2012, Massachusetts had 7,755 farms totalling 523,517 acres (2,120 km2), an average of 67.5 acres (0.273 km2) each.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Special agricultural products to be noted include green house products that account for more than a third of the state's agricultural production, cranberries, sweet corn and apples are also major production sectors.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is the second largest producer of cranberries in the Union after Wisconsin.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Over 33,000 not-for-profits in Massachusetts employ one-sixth of the government's workforce.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2007, Governor Deval Patrick signed a State Holiday, the Not-for-Profit Awareness Day.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In February 2017, US News & World Report ranked Massachusetts as the best state in the United States based on 60 measures, including health care, education, crime, infrastructure, opportunities, economy and government.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Bay State ranks first in education, second in health care and fifth in economic management.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Depending on how it is calculated, the tax burden of states and local authorities in Massachusetts was estimated among the U.S. states and Washington, D.C. as the 21st highest ($11.44% or $6,163 per year for a household with a national median income) or the 25th highest overall with lower-than-average corporate taxes (39th higher), higher-than-average personal income taxes, (13th higher), higher-than-average sales tax (18th higher) and lower-than-average property taxes (46th higher).

sentence: There are 11,037 inland lakes, a total of 3,380 km2 of inland water of 1,305 square miles, in addition to 38,575 square miles (99,910 km2) of Great Lakes water.

name: michigan
sentence: In Michigan, no point is located more than six miles (9.7 km) from an inland lake or more than 85 miles (137 km) from one of the Great Lakes.

name: michigan
sentence: The state is home to several areas maintained by the National Parks Service, including Isle Royale National Park in Lake Superior, approximately 48 km southeast of Thunder Bay, Ontario.

name: michigan
sentence: Other national protected areas include Keweenaw National Historic Park, illustrated Rocks National Side Lake, sleeping Dunes Bear National Lake, Huron National Forest, Manist National Forest, Hiawatha National Forest, Ottawa National Forest, and Father Marquette's National Memorial.

name: michigan
sentence: The largest stretch of the North Country National Scenography Trail crosses Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: With 78 state parks, 19 state recreation areas and six state forests, Michigan has the largest state park and state forest system in any state.

name: michigan
sentence: These parks and forests include Holland State Park, Mackinac Island State Park, Sand State Forest and Mackinaw State Forest.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has a continental climate, although there are two distinct regions.

name: michigan
sentence: The southern and central parts of the Lower Peninsula (south of Saginaw Bay and the Grand Rapids region southward) have a warmer climate (Köppen Dfa climate classification) with warm summers and cold winters.

name: michigan
sentence: The northern part of the Lower Peninsula and the entire Upper Peninsula has a more severe climate (Köppen Dfb), with warm summers, but shorter and longer, cold to very cold winters.

name: michigan
sentence: Some parts of the state mean high temperatures under freezing from December to February, and until early March in remote northern areas.

name: michigan
sentence: During the winter until mid-February, the state is often subject to heavy snowfall.

name: michigan
sentence: The average condition ranges from 30 to 40 inches (76 to 102 cm) of precipitation per year; however, some areas of the lower north and upper peninsula have an average of nearly 160 inches (4,100 mm) of snowfall per year.

name: michigan
sentence: The highest recorded temperature in Michigan was 112°F (44°C) at Mio on 13 July 1936, and the coldest recorded temperature was −51°F (−46°C) at Vanderbilt on 9 February 1934.

name: michigan
sentence: The State has an average of 30 days of stormy activity per year.

name: michigan
sentence: These may be severe, particularly in the southern part of the State.

name: michigan
sentence: The State has an average of 17 tornadoes per year, which are more frequent in the extreme south of the State.

name: michigan
sentence: Portions of the southern border have been almost as vulnerable historically as states to the west and in the direction of Tornado.

name: michigan
sentence: For this reason, many communities in the very southern regions of the state have tornado sirens to warn residents of the tornado approach.

name: michigan
sentence: Further north, in central Michigan, northern Michigan and the upper peninsula, tornadoes are rare.

name: michigan
sentence: The state's geological formation is very varied, with the Michigan Basin being the most important formation.

name: michigan
sentence: Primary blocks are found throughout the upper peninsula (primarily of primitive origin), while secondary deposits cover the entire lower peninsula.

name: michigan
sentence: The upper peninsula has lower Silurian sandstones, limestones, copper and iron-bearing rocks, which is consistent with Canada's Huron system.

name: michigan
sentence: The central part of the Lower Peninsula contains measurements of coal and rocks from the Pennsylvanian period.

name: michigan
sentence: Devonian and sub-carboniferous deposits are dispersed throughout the state.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan rarely experiences earthquakes, so far mainly smaller earthquakes that do not cause significant damage.

name: michigan
sentence: An earthquake of 4.6 magnitude struck in August 1947.

name: michigan
sentence: More recently, an earthquake of 4.2 magnitude occurred on Saturday, May 2, 2015, shortly after noon, approximately five miles south of Galesburg, Michigan (9 miles southeast of Kalamazoo) in central Michigan, approximately 140 miles west of Detroit, according to the US Geological Survey's Earthquake Information Centre in Colorado.

name: michigan
sentence: According to Governor Rick Snyder's office, no major damage or injury has been reported.

name: michigan
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that Michigan's population was 9,986,857 as at 1 July 2019, an increase of 1.04 per cent from 9,883,635 registered at the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: michigan
sentence: This includes a natural increase since the last census of 177,254 people (i.e. 1,043,213 births minus 865,959 deaths) and a decrease due to net migration of 73,053 people.

name: michigan
sentence: Immigration resulted in a net increase of 193,031 people, and migration from the United States resulted in a net decrease of 266,084 people.

name: michigan
sentence: The central population of Michigan is located in Shiawassee County, in the southeast corner of the civil township of Bennington, which is northwest of the village of Morrice.

name: michigan
sentence: According to the 2010 American Community Survey for the U.S. Census, there were 592,212 foreign-born residents in the state, or 6.0 per cent of the total.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has the largest Dutch, Finnish and Macedonian populations in the United States.

name: michigan

name: michigan
sentence: In the same year, Hispanics or Latinos (of any race) accounted for 4.4% of the population.

name: michigan
sentence: The vast majority of Michigan's population is white.

name: michigan
sentence: Americans of European origin live throughout Michigan and most of Metro Detroit.

name: michigan
sentence: The major American European groups include those of German, British, Irish, Polish and Belgian origin.

name: michigan
sentence: People of Scandinavian origin, and those of Finnish descent, have a notable presence on the upper peninsula.

name: michigan
sentence: Western Michigan is known for the Dutch heritage of many residents (the highest concentration in any state), particularly in Holland and the Greater Metropolitan Rapids.

name: michigan
sentence: The African-Americans, who came to Detroit and other northern cities in the Great Migration of the early 20th century, make up a majority of the population of the city of Detroit and other cities, including Flint and Benton Harbor.

name: michigan
sentence: Dearborn has an important Arab community, with many Assyrians/Chaldeans/Syriacs, and Lebanese who immigrated for jobs in the automobile industry in the 1920s as well as more recent Yemenis and Iraqis.

name: michigan
sentence: In 2007, nearly 8,000 Hmongs lived in Michigan, approximately twice their presence in 1999.

sentence: In 2007, most of them lived in the northeast of Detroit, but were increasingly settling in Pontiac and Warren.

sentence: Lansing hosts a national Hmong New Year festival.

name: michigan
sentence: The Hmong community also had an important performance in the 2008 film Gran Torino, which was staged in Detroit.

name: michigan
sentence: In 2015, 80% of the Japanese population of Michigan lived in the counties of Macomb, Oakland, Washtenaw and Wayne in the Detroit and Ann Arbor regions.

name: michigan
sentence: In April 2013, Japan's largest national population was in Novi, with 2,666 Japanese residents, and the other largest populations were in Ann Arbor, West Bloomfield Township, Farmington Hills and Battle Creek, respectively.

sentence: The State has 481 Japanese employment structures offering 35,554 local jobs.

name: michigan

name: michigan
sentence: According to the Japanese Direct Investment Survey of the Consulate General of Japan, Detroit reported that more than 2,208 other Japanese residents were employed in the State of Michigan as of October 1, 2012, compared to 2011.

name: michigan
sentence: During the 1990s, the Japanese population of Michigan increased, and many Japanese with children moved to particular areas for their proximity to Japanese grocery stores and high-performance schools.

name: michigan
sentence: A person from Michigan is called a Michigander or Michiganian; also sometimes, but rarely, a "Michiganite".

name: michigan
sentence: Residents of the upper peninsula are sometimes called "Yoopers" (a phonetic pronunciation of the "U.P.ers"), and they sometimes refer to those of the lower peninsula as "rolls" because they live under the bridge (see Three Billy Goats Gruff).

name: michigan
sentence: In 2011, 34.3% of children in Michigan under one year of age belonged to racial or ethnic minority groups, meaning that they had at least one non-Hispanic white parent.

sentence: Note: The percentages in the table may exceed 100% because Hispanics are counted both by ethnicity and race.

name: michigan
sentence: In 2010, 91.11 per cent of Michigan residents aged five and over spoke English only at home, while 2.93 per cent (273,981) spoke Spanish, 1.04 per cent (97,559) Arabic, 0.44 per cent (41,189) German, 0.36 per cent (33,648) Chinese (including Mandarin), 0.31 per cent (28,891) French, 0.29 per cent (27,019) Polish and Syriac languages (such as modern Aramaic and North-East New Aramaic) were spoken as the main language by 0.25 per cent (23,420) of the population over five years of age.

name: michigan
sentence: A total of 8.89% (830,281) of Michigan's population aged five years and older spoke a mother tongue other than English.

name: michigan
sentence: The Roman Catholic Church has six dioceses and an archdiocese in Michigan; Gaylord, Grand Rapids, Kalamazoo, Lansing, Marquette, Saginaw and Detroit.

name: michigan
sentence: According to the 2010 survey of the Association of Religion Data Archives (ARDA), the Roman Catholic Church is the largest denomination by the number of adherents, with 1,717,296 adherents.

name: michigan
sentence: The Roman Catholic Church was the only religion organized in Michigan until the 19th century, reflecting the French colonial roots of the territory.

name: michigan
sentence: The parish of Sainte-Anne de Detroit, founded in 1701 by Antoine de la Mothe Cadillac, is the second Roman Catholic parish in the United States.

name: michigan
sentence: On March 8, 1833, the Holy See officially established a diocese in the territory of Michigan, which included all of Michigan, Wisconsin, Minnesota and the Dakotas east of the Mississippi River.

name: michigan
sentence: When Michigan became a state in 1837, the boundary of the diocese of Detroit was redesigned to coincide with that of the state; the other dioceses were then carved into the diocese of Detroit, but remained in the ecclesiastical province of Detroit.

name: michigan
sentence: In 2010, the largest Protestant denominations were the United Methodist Church with 228,521 members; followed by the Synod of the Lutheran Church-Missouri with 219618, and the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America with 120,598 members.

name: michigan
sentence: The Reformed Christian Church in North America had nearly 100,000 members and more than 230 congregations in Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: The Reformed Church in America had 76,000 members and 154 congregations in the state.

name: michigan
sentence: In the same survey, Jewish followers of the state of Michigan were estimated at 44,382 and Muslims at 120,351.

name: michigan
sentence: The Lutheran Church was introduced by German and Scandinavian immigrants

name: michigan
sentence: The first Jewish synagogue in the state was Beth El Temple, founded by twelve German Jewish families in Detroit in 1850.

name: michigan
sentence: In western Michigan, Dutch immigrants fled the spectre of religious persecution and famine in the Netherlands around 1850 and settled in and around what is now Holland, Michigan, establishing a "colony" on American soil that fervently clings to Calvinist doctrine that established a significant presence of reformed churches.

name: michigan
sentence: Islam was introduced by immigrants from the Middle East during the 20th century.

sentence: Michigan is home to the largest mosque in North America, the Islamic Center of America in Dearborn.

name: michigan
sentence: Battle Creek, Michigan, is also the birthplace of the Seventh-day Adventist Church, founded on May 21, 1863.

sentence: In 2017, 3,859,949 people in Michigan worked in 222,553, according to the U.S. Census Bureau.

name: michigan
sentence: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, in December 2018 the seasonally adjusted unemployment rate for the state was estimated at 4.0%.

name: michigan
sentence: Products and services include automobiles, food products, information technology, aerospace, military equipment, furniture and the extraction of copper and iron ore. Michigan is the third largest producer of Christmas trees with 60,520 acres (345 km2) of Christmas tree land.

sentence: The Vernors drink was invented in Michigan in 1866, sharing the title of the oldest soft drink with Hires' root beer.

sentence: Two of the four main pizza chains were founded in Michigan and have their headquarters: Tom Monaghan's Domino's Pizza and Mike Ilich's Little Caesars Pizza.

sentence: Michigan became the 24th state of the right to work in the United States in 2012.

sentence: The State is an important source of employment opportunities in the field of engineering.

name: michigan
sentence: The domestic automotive industry directly and indirectly represents one in ten jobs in the United States.

sentence: Michigan was second in the United States in 2004 for new facilities and business expansions.

sentence: From 1997 to 2004, Michigan was the only state to have reached the top of 10,000 points for major new developments; however, the effects of the recession of the late 2000s slowed the state economy.

name: michigan
sentence: In 2008, Michigan ranked third in a state site selection survey to attract new businesses that measured capital investment and job creation for a million people.

sentence: In August 2009, the Michigan and Detroit automotive industry received $1.36 billion in subsidies from the U.S. Department of Energy for the manufacture of electric vehicle technologies that are expected to generate 6,800 immediate jobs and employ 40,000 people in the state by 2020.

name: michigan
sentence: From 2007 to 2009, Michigan ranked third in the United States for its new facilities and expansions.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan personal income tax is a flat rate of 4.25%.

name: michigan
sentence: In addition, 22 cities impose income taxes; rates are set at 1 per cent for residents and 0.5 per cent for non-residents in all but four cities.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan's sales tax is 6%, although items such as food and drugs are exempt.

name: michigan
sentence: Property taxes are calculated at the local level, but each owner contributes to the government's education tax of six mills ($6 per $1,000).

name: michigan
sentence: Property taxes are subject to appeal to local review boards and must be approved by the local electorate to exceed the vintage rates prescribed by state law and local charters.

name: michigan
sentence: In 2011, the government repealed its business tax and replaced it with a 6% corporate income tax that significantly reduced business taxes.

name: michigan
sentence: Section IX of the Michigan Constitution also provides for restrictions on the extent to which the state may impose taxes.

name: michigan
sentence: A 6% user tax is levied on goods purchased outside the State (which are introduced and used in the State), in parity with the sales tax.

name: michigan
sentence: The user tax applies to Internet sales/purchases outside Michigan and is equivalent to sales tax.

name: michigan
sentence: A wide variety of commodities, fruits and vegetables are grown in Michigan, which is only behind California among the U.S. states in the diversity of its agriculture.

name: michigan
sentence: There are 54,800 farms in the state that use 10 million acres (40,000 km2) of land that sold $6.49 billion worth of commodities in 2010.

name: michigan
sentence: The most valuable agricultural product is milk.

name: michigan
sentence: The main crops are maize, soybeans, flowers, wheat, sugar beet and potatoes.

name: michigan
sentence: The state's livestock included 78,000 sheep, one million cattle, one million pigs and more than three million chickens.

name: michigan
sentence: Livestock products accounted for 38 per cent of the value of agricultural products, while crops accounted for the majority.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan is one of the leading fruit producers in the United States, including blueberries, pie cherries, apples, grapes and peaches.

name: michigan
sentence: Plums, pears and strawberries are also grown in Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: There is also significant fruit production, particularly cherries, but also grapes, apples and other fruits, in northwestern Michigan along Lake Michigan.

sentence: Michigan produces wines, beers and a multitude of processed food products.

sentence: Destinations attract vacationers, hunters and nature lovers from across the United States and Canada.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan is a forest land of 50%, most of which is quite remote.

name: michigan
sentence: Forests, lakes and thousands of kilometres of beaches are the main attractions.

sentence: In 2006, the Michigan State Board of Education commissioned all state public schools to hold their first school day after Labour Day, in accordance with the new Labour Day Act.

name: michigan
sentence: A survey revealed that 70% of all tourism businesses come directly from residents of Michigan, and that the Michigan Hotel, Motel and Resort Association claimed that the shorter summer between school years was reduced to the annual tourist season.

sentence: The metro area offers four main casinos, MGM Grand Detroit, Greektown, Motor City and Caesars Windsor in Windsor, Ontario, Canada, and Detroit is the largest city and metropolitan area in the United States to offer casino stations.

sentence: The economy is based primarily on agriculture, including livestock and grain farming.

sentence: The name Montana comes from the Spanish word montaña, which in turn comes from the Latin word montanea, meaning "mountain" or more widely "mountainous land".

sentence: The name Montana was added in 1863 to a bill of the United States House Committee on Territories (then chaired by James Ashley of Ohio) for the territory that would become the territory of Idaho.

name: montana
sentence: The name was changed by representatives Henry Wilson (Massachusetts) and Benjamin F. Harding (Oregon), who complained Montana had "no meaning."

sentence: When Ashley introduced a bill to establish a temporary government in 1864 for a new territory to be cut off from Idaho, he again chose the territory of Montana.

name: montana

sentence: Montana's personal income tax consists of seven tranches, ranging from 1.0 to 6.9 per cent.

name: montana
sentence: Montana has no sales tax* and household property is exempt from property tax.

name: montana
sentence: However, property taxes are levied on livestock, agricultural machinery, heavy equipment, automobiles, trucks and business equipment.

name: montana
sentence: The amount of property tax owing is not determined solely by the value of the property.

name: montana

name: montana

name: montana
sentence: * In the 1980s, the absence of a sales tax became economically harmful to the communities associated with the State's tourism industry, as income and property tax revenues from residents were grossly insignificant in terms of the payment of the impact of non-residential travel, in particular road repairs.

name: montana
sentence: In 1985, the Montana Legislative Assembly passed a law allowing cities of less than 5,500 inhabitants and unincorporated communities of less than 2,500 to levy a residence tax if more than half of the community's income came from tourism.

name: montana
sentence: The residence tax is a sales tax that applies to hotels, motels and other accommodation and camping facilities; restaurants, fast food shops and other food service establishments; taverns, bars, nightclubs, lounges or other public establishments serving alcohol; and destination ski resorts or other recreational facilities of destination.

name: montana
sentence: It also applies to "luxuries" - defined by law as any item that is normally sold to the public or to visitors or visiting tourists who do not include unprepared or unserved purchased foods, drugs, medical supplies and services, household appliances, supplies and equipment or any need for life.

sentence: Approximately 12.2 million non-residents visited Montana in 2018 and the population was estimated at 1.06 million.

sentence: The territory of Montana was formed on April 26, 1864, when the United States adopted the Organic Act.

name: montana
sentence: The first quarter began in early winter and lasted only until February 28.

name: montana
sentence: The courses were given by Mr. Robinson.

name: montana
sentence: In this school, students were charged $1.75 a week.

name: montana
sentence: The Territorial Legislative Assembly of Montana held its inaugural meeting in 1864.

name: montana
sentence: The first legislature allowed the counties to levy taxes on schools, which laid the foundation for public education.

name: montana
sentence: Madison County was the first to benefit from the newly authorized taxes and formed the first public school in Virginia City in 1886.

name: montana
sentence: The first school year was to begin in January 1866, but the violent weather postponed its opening to March.

name: montana
sentence: The first school year lasted the summer and ended only on August 17.

name: montana
sentence: One of the first teachers at the school was Sarah Raymond.

name: montana
sentence: She was a 25-year-old woman who had travelled to Virginia City by car in 1865.

name: montana
sentence: To become a certified teacher, Raymond took a test at home and paid $6 in gold dust to obtain a teaching certificate.

name: montana
sentence: With the help of an assistant teacher, Ms. Farley, Raymond was responsible for teaching 50 to 60 students each day out of 81 students enrolled in school.

name: montana
sentence: Sarah Raymond was paid $125 a month, and Ms. Farley was paid $75 a month.

name: montana
sentence: No textbooks were used at school.

name: montana
sentence: In their place was an assortment of books brought by various emigrants.

name: montana
sentence: Sarah stopped teaching the following year, but later became Madison County School Director.

name: montana
sentence: Montana offers residents and visitors outdoor recreation opportunities throughout the year.

name: montana
sentence: Hiking, fishing, hunting, water sports, camping, golf, cycling, horseback riding and skiing are popular activities.

name: montana
sentence: Since the 1930s, Montana has been a world-class trout fishing destination.

name: montana
sentence: Fly fishing for several species of native trout introduced into rivers and lakes is popular for both residents and tourists throughout the state.

name: montana
sentence: Montana is home to the Federation of Fly Fishermen and hosts several of the organizations' annual conclaves.

name: montana
sentence: The state has robust recreational fisheries for lake trout and kokanee salmon in the west, yellow walleye can be found in many parts of the state, while northern pike, smallmouth and largemouth bass, and catfish and spatular can be found in the waters of eastern Montana.

name: montana
sentence: The 1992 film by Robert Redford of Norman Mclean's novel, A River Runs Through It, was filmed in Montana and drew national attention to fly fishing and the state.

sentence: Montana is home to the Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation and has a historic tradition of hunting big game.

sentence: A lot draw grants a limited number of permits for moose, mountain goats and large-horned sheep.

name: montana
sentence: There is a spring hunting season for the Black Bear and, in most years, limited bison hunting from Yellowstone National Park is permitted.

sentence: The current law allows both hunters and trappers the specified numbers ("limits") of wolves and mountain lions.

name: montana
sentence: The trapping of fur animals is permitted in certain seasons and there are many opportunities for hunting migratory waterfowl and upland birds.

name: montana
sentence: Downhill and cross-country skiing are popular in Montana, which has developed 15 downhill ski areas open to the public, including:

sentence: Snowmobiles are popular in Montana, which has more than 4,000 miles of frozen trails and lakes available in winter.

sentence: Montana doesn't have a Trauma I hospital, but it has Trauma II hospitals in Missoula, Billings and Great Falls.

name: montana
sentence: Railways have been an important means of transportation in Montana since the 1880s.

name: montana
sentence: Historically, the state has been crossed by the main lines of three transcontinental east-west roads: the Milwaukee Highway, the Great North and the North Pacific.

name: montana
sentence: Today, the BNSF Railway is the largest railway in the state, its main transcontinental route integrating the former Great Northern main line across the state.

name: montana

name: montana
sentence: In addition, Amtrak's Empire Builder train crosses the north of the state, stopping at Libby, Whitefish, Western Glacier, Essex, East Glacier Park, Browning, Cut Bank, Shelby, Havre, Malta, Glasgow and Wolf Point.

name: montana
sentence: The Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport is the busiest airport in Montana, passing Billings Logan International Airport in the spring of 2013.

name: montana
sentence: Eight small communities have designated airports for commercial service under the Essential Air Services Program.

name: montana
sentence: Montana is governed by a constitution.

name: montana
sentence: The first constitution was drafted by a constitutional convention in 1889, in preparation for state status.

name: montana
sentence: Ninety per cent of its language comes from a constitution of 1884 that was never applied by Congress for national political reasons.

name: montana
sentence: The Constitution of 1889 imitated the structure of the United States Constitution, as well as the same civil and political rights for citizens.

name: montana
sentence: However, the Constitution of Montana of 1889 severely restricted the power of the state government, the legislative power was much more powerful than the executive power, and the jurisdiction of the district courts was very precisely described.

name: montana
sentence: The electors of Montana amended the constitution of 1889 37 times between 1889 and 1972.

name: montana
sentence: In 1914, Montana granted women the right to vote.

name: montana
sentence: In 1916, Montana became the first state to elect a woman, Progressive Republican Jeannette Rankin, to Congress.

name: montana
sentence: In 1971, the voters of Montana approved the call for a constitutional convention of the state.

name: montana
sentence: A new constitution had been drafted, which had made the legislative and executive powers much more equal in power and had been much less normative in the definition of powers, duties and powers.

name: montana
sentence: The project includes an expanded and more progressive list of civil and political rights, extends these rights to children for the first time, transfers property tax administration to state counties, enforces new water rights, eliminates sovereign immunity and gives legislators more power to spend tax revenues.

name: montana
sentence: The Constitution was narrowly approved, 116,415 to 113,883 and declared ratified on 20 June 1972.

name: montana
sentence: Three issues that the constitutional convention could not resolve were submitted to voters at the same time as the draft constitution.

name: montana
sentence: Voters approved the legalization of the game, a bicameral legislature and the maintenance of the death penalty.

name: montana
sentence: The Constitution of 1972 was amended 31 times in 2015.

name: montana
sentence: Major amendments include the establishment of a rehabilitation trust (funded by natural resource extraction taxes) to restore mined land (1974); the restoration of sovereign immunity, when approved by a two-thirds vote in each chamber (1974); the establishment of a 90-day (rather than annual) biennial legislative session (1974); the establishment of a coal tax trust fund, financed by a coal mining tax (1976); the transformation of the compulsory 10-year review of the county government into a voluntary review, which will be approved or refused by the residents of each county (1978); the transformation of public aid from a compulsory civil right into a non-fundamental legislative prerogative (1988); a new constitutional right to hunt and fish (2004); the prohibition of homosexual marriage (2004); and the prohibition of new taxes on the sale or transfer of real property (2010).

name: montana
sentence: In 1992, electors approved a constitutional amendment implementing time limits for certain government-wide elected executive positions (Governor, Lieutenant Governor, Secretary of State, Auditor of State, Attorney General, Superintendent of Public Education) and for members of the Montana Legislative Assembly.

name: montana
sentence: New and expanded constitutional rights for victims of crime were approved in 2016.

name: montana
sentence: The 1972 Constitution requires voters to determine every 20 years whether to hold a new constitutional convention.

name: montana
sentence: Voters refused a new convention in 1990 (84 percent no) and again in 2010 (58.6 percent no).

name: montana
sentence: Montana has three branches of government: legislative, executive and judicial.

name: montana
sentence: The executive branch is headed by an elected governor.

name: montana
sentence: The governor is Greg Gianforte, a Republican elected in 2020.

name: montana
sentence: The Executive also has nine other Crown-wide offices: the Lieutenant Governor, the Attorney General, the Secretary of State, the Auditor of State (who is also Commissioner of Securities and Insurance) and the Superintendent of Public Instruction.

name: montana
sentence: Five public service commissioners are elected on a regional basis.

name: montana
sentence: (The jurisdiction of the Civil Service Commission extends to the entire State.)

name: montana
sentence: There are 18 departments and offices that make up the executive branch: Administration; Agriculture; Auditor (Safety and Insurance); Trade; Correctional Services; Environmental Quality; Fish, Wildlife and Parks; Justice; Labour and Industry; Livestock; Military Affairs; Natural Resources and Conservation; Public Health and Human Services; Revenue; State; and Transport.

name: montana
sentence: Primary and secondary education are supervised by the Public Education Office (led by the elected Director of Public Education), in collaboration with the Public Education Council appointed by the Governor.

name: montana
sentence: Higher education is supervised by a council of regents appointed by the governor, who in turn appoints a commissioner of higher education.

name: montana
sentence: The Office of the Commissioner for Higher Education acts in an executive capacity on behalf of the regents and supervises the university system of Montana run by the State.

name: montana
sentence: Independent state agencies that are not part of a department or office include the Montana Arts Council, the Montana Board of Crime Control, the Montana Historical Society, the Montana Public Employees Retirement Administration, the Commissioner of Political Practices, Montana Lottery, the Office of the Public Defender of the State, the Public Service Commission, the Montana School for the Deaf and the Blind, the Montana State Fund (which manages state unemployment insurance, workers' compensation and self-insurance operations), the Montana State Library and the Montana Teachers Retirement System.

name: montana
sentence: Montana is a state of control for alcoholic beverages.

name: montana
sentence: This is a fair distribution and a state of divorce without fault.

name: montana
sentence: It is one of the five states that do not have sales tax.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana Legislative Assembly is bicameral and consists of 50 Senators from Montana and 100 MPs from the Montana House of Representatives.

name: montana
sentence: Parliament meets in the Capitol of the State of Montana in Helena in odd years for 90 days, starting on the first day of the week of the year.

name: montana
sentence: The deadline for the introduction of a draft general law by a legislator is the 40th legislative day.

name: montana
sentence: The deadline for the introduction of a bill on appropriations, revenues or referendums by a legislator is the 62nd legislative day.

name: montana
sentence: Senators are appointed for a four-year term, while representatives are appointed for a two-year term.

name: montana
sentence: All members are limited to serving no more than eight years in a single period of 16 years.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana courts are established by the Constitution of Montana.

name: montana
sentence: The Constitution requires the establishment of a Montana Supreme Court and Montana District Courts, and allows the legislator to create courts of justice, municipal courts, municipal courts and other lower courts, as the legislator considers appropriate.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana Supreme Court is the final jurisdiction of the Montana judicial system.

name: montana
sentence: The 1889 constitution provided for the election of at least three Supreme Court judges and one Chief Justice.

name: montana
sentence: Each member of the court served a six-year term.

name: montana
sentence: The legislature increased the number of judges to five in 1919.

name: montana
sentence: The 1972 Constitution extended the term of office to eight years and established the minimum number of judges to five.

name: montana
sentence: It allowed the legislator to increase the number of judges by two, which he did in 1979.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana Supreme Court has the power to declare legislative and executive acts unconstitutional under the Constitutions of Montana or the United States.

name: montana
sentence: Its decisions can be appealed directly to the Supreme Court of the United States.

name: montana
sentence: The Registrar of the Supreme Court is also an elected office and holds a six-year term.

name: montana
sentence: Neither the Judges nor the Registrar shall have a limited duration.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana District Courts are the courts of general jurisdiction of Montana.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has a bifurcated executive power, composed of the governor and a five-member executive council that votes on government contracts worth more than $5,000 and "advises and consents" to the governor's appointments to important state posts such as department heads, all judicial functions and all requests for pardons.
