sentence: From 19 to 20 May, the western part of New York and the capital area entered phase 1 of the reopening.

name: new_york
sentence: On 26 May, the Hudson Valley began Phase 1 and New York reopened partially on 8 June.

name: new_york
sentence: During the pandemic, one federal judge ruled that Cuomo and De Blasio exceeded authority by limiting religious gatherings to 25% when others operated to 50%.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York government issued a new seal, coat of arms and flag in April during the pandemic, adding "E pluribus unum" below the state's motto.

name: new_york
sentence: A bill using the newly designed flag, weapons and seal came into force in September.

name: new_york
sentence: New York covers 54,555 square miles (141,300 km2) and ranks 27th among the largest states by size.

name: new_york
sentence: The highest altitude in New York is Mount Marcy in the Adirondacks, 5,344 feet (1,629 metres) above sea level; while the lowest point in the state is at sea level on the Atlantic Ocean.

name: new_york
sentence: Unlike the urban landscape of New York, the vast majority of the state's geographic region is dominated by grasslands, forests, rivers, farms, mountains and lakes.

name: new_york
sentence: Most of the southern part of the State is based on the Allegheny Plateau, which extends from the southeastern United States to the Catskill Mountains; the New York State section is known as the Southern Tier.

name: new_york
sentence: The Adirondack Mountains, with vast wilderness areas, are located west of the Lake Champlain Valley.

name: new_york
sentence: The large Appalachian Valley dominates eastern New York and houses the Lake Champlain Valley as its northern half and the Hudson Valley as its southern half within the state.

name: new_york
sentence: The Tug Hill area is a cuesta located east of Lake Ontario.

name: new_york
sentence: The upper and lower states are often used informally to distinguish New York City or its largest metropolitan area from the rest of New York State.

name: new_york
sentence: The location of a boundary between the two is a matter of great discord.

name: new_york
sentence: Unofficial and poorly defined areas of Upstate New York include the Southern Tier, which often includes counties along the border with Pennsylvania, and the Northern Country, which can mean anything from the band along Canada-U.S.

name: new_york
sentence: border all north of the Mohawk River.

name: new_york
sentence: New York contains a portion of the schist Marcellus, which extends into Ohio and Pennsylvania.

name: new_york
sentence: Of the total area of New York State, 13.6 per cent consists of water.

name: new_york
sentence: Much of New York's borders are in the water, as is the case for New York City: four of its five boroughs are located on three islands at the mouth of the Hudson River: Manhattan Island, Staten Island and Long Island, which contains Brooklyn and Queens at its western end.

name: new_york
sentence: State boundaries include a water limit in (hourly from the west) two Great Lakes (Lake Erie and Lake Ontario, which are connected by the Niagara River); the provinces of Ontario and Quebec in Canada, with New York and Ontario sharing the Mille-Îles archipelago within the St. Lawrence River, while most of its border with Quebec is on land; it shares Lake Champlain with the State of Vermont, in New England; the State of Massachusetts, in New England, has primarily a land boundary; New York extends to Long Island Sound and the Atlantic Ocean, sharing a water boundary with Rhode Island, while Connecticut has land and maritime boundaries.

name: new_york
sentence: With the exception of areas near New York Harbour and the Upper Delaware River, New York has a predominantly land border with two Mid-Atlantic states, New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is the only state that includes within its borders parts of the Great Lakes and the Atlantic Ocean.

name: new_york
sentence: The Hudson River begins near Tear Lake from the clouds and flows south into the eastern part of the state, without draining George or Champlain Lakes.

name: new_york
sentence: Lake George flows at its north end into Lake Champlain, whose north end extends to Canada, where it flows through the Richelieu River, and eventually into the St. Lawrence River.

name: new_york
sentence: The western part of the state is drained by the Allegheny River and the Susquehanna and Delaware rivers.

name: new_york
sentence: Niagara Falls are shared between New York and Ontario as they flow over the Niagara River from Lake Erie to Lake Ontario.

name: new_york
sentence: The Delaware River Basin Compact, signed in 1961 by New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Delaware and the federal government, regulates the use of water in the Delaware system.

name: new_york
sentence: In general, New York has a humid continental climate, although under the climate classification of Köppen, New York City has a humid subtropical climate.

name: new_york
sentence: The weather in New York is strongly influenced by two continental air masses: a warm and humid southwest and a cold and dry northwest.

name: new_york
sentence: The lower part of New York State, which includes New York City, Long Island and the lower parts of the Hudson Valley, has rather warm summers with some periods of high humidity and cold and humid winters that are relatively mild compared to temperatures at Upstate New York due to lower elevations in the region of the descending state, proximity to the Atlantic Ocean and relatively lower latitude.

name: new_york
sentence: In New York, summers are warm, marked by short and occasional intervals of sultic conditions, with long and cold winters.

name: new_york
sentence: The western part of New York, particularly the Tug Hill area, receives heavy lake-effect snow, especially during the early winter months, before the surface of Lake Ontario itself is covered with ice.

name: new_york
sentence: The summer climate is cool in the Adirondacks, Catskills and at higher altitudes of the South Tier.

name: new_york
sentence: Buffalo and its metropolitan area are described as climate change shelters because of their meteorological configuration in western New York.

name: new_york
sentence: Summer daytime temperatures range from the high 1970s to the low 1980s (25-28 °C), over most of the state.

name: new_york
sentence: In the majority of winter seasons, temperatures can be expected to be −13°F (−25°C) or lower in the northern highlands (northern plateau) and 5°F (−15°C) or colder in the southwest and east-central South Tier highlands.

name: new_york
sentence: New York had a record temperature of 108°F (42.2°C) on 22 July 1926.

name: new_york
sentence: Its lowest temperature in winter was -52°F (−46.7°C) in 1979.

name: new_york
sentence: Some species that can be found in this state are American ginseng, starred stonewort, waterthym, water chestnut, eastern poisoned ivy, poisoned sumac, giant seaweed, cow parsnip and common nettle.

name: new_york
sentence: There are more than 20 species of mammals, more than 20 species of birds, some species of amphibians and several species of reptiles.

name: new_york
sentence: The species of mammals that are part of New York are white-footed mice, North American shrew, small brown bat, muskrat, eastern grey squirrel, eastern cotton tail, killer whale, striped snout, fisherman, North American river otter, raccoon, bobcat, coyote, red fox, white-tailed deer, moose and American black bear.

name: new_york
sentence: Some of New York's bird species are the collared pheasant, northern bobwhite, ruffed grouse, wild turkey, blue jay, eastern blue bird, American robin and black chichade.

name: new_york
sentence: Birds of prey that are present in the state are large horny owls, bald eagles, red-tailed hawks, American kestrels and northern herring.

name: new_york
sentence: Waterfowl, such as mallards, wooden ducks, canvases, American black ducks, Canadian geese and blue-winged cetaceans, are found in the area.

name: new_york
sentence: New York's marine or coastal birds are large blue herons, killer deer, northern cardinals, American herring gulls and common terns.

name: new_york
sentence: The reptiles that can be seen in the land areas of New York are the queen snake, the massasauga, the master of hell, the diamond-backed terrapin, the spotted turtle and the speckled turtle.

name: new_york
sentence: The species of turtles found in the sea are the Green Sea Turtle, the Borgerhead Sea Turtle, the Leatherback Sea Turtle and the Kemp Ridley Sea Turtle.

name: new_york
sentence: New York Harbour and the Hudson River are an estuary, making New York State a place for a rich marine life, including shellfish, such as oysters and clams, as well as fish, microorganisms and seabirds.

name: new_york
sentence: Because of its long history, New York has several overlapping and often contradictory definitions of regions within the state.

name: new_york
sentence: Nor are the regions fully defined because of the collective use of regional labels.

name: new_york
sentence: The Department of Economic Development of New York State provides two separate definitions of these regions.

name: new_york
sentence: It divides the state into ten economic regions, which corresponds approximately to the terminology used by residents:

name: new_york
sentence: The department also groups the counties into eleven regions for tourism purposes:

name: new_york
sentence: New York has many state parks and two major forest reserves.

name: new_york
sentence: The Niagara Falls State Park, founded in 1885, is the oldest state park in the United States and the first to be established through a prominent estate.

name: new_york
sentence: In 1892, Adirondack Park, approximately the size of the state of Vermont and the largest state park in the United States, was established and received constitutional protection from the state to remain "forever wild" in 1894.

name: new_york
sentence: The park is larger than the combined Yellowstone, Everglades, Glacier and Grand Canyon National Parks.

name: new_york
sentence: It is larger than Yellowstone, Yosemite, Grand Canyon, Glacier and Olympic National Parks.

name: new_york
sentence: Catskill Park is protected by a law passed in 1885, which states that its lands must be preserved and never be offered for sale or leased.

name: new_york
sentence: Composed of 700,000 acres (2,800 km2) of land, the park is a habitat for deer, mink and fishermen.

name: new_york
sentence: Some 400 black bears live in the area.

name: new_york
sentence: The state operates many campgrounds, and there are more than 300 miles (480 km) of multi-purpose trails in the park.

name: new_york
sentence: The 1797 Montauk Lighthouse, commanded by President George Washington, is a major tourist attraction in Montauk State Park, at the eastern end of Long Island.

name: new_york
sentence: Hither Hills State Park, also on the southern fork of Long Island, offers camping and is a popular destination with surfcasting sports fishermen.

name: new_york
sentence: New York State is well represented in the national park system, with 22 national parks, which welcomed 16,349,381 visitors in 2011.

name: new_york
sentence: In addition, there are four national heritage areas, 27 national natural sites, 262 national historic sites and 5,379 entries in the National Historic Sites Registry.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is divided into 62 counties.

name: new_york
sentence: In addition to the five counties of New York, each of these counties is subdivided into cities under state law.

name: new_york
sentence: Cities may contain unincorporated villages or hamlets.

name: new_york
sentence: New York City is divided into five boroughs, each coterminating with a county.

name: new_york
sentence: The main cities of the state developed along the main transport and trade routes of the early 19th century, including the Erie Canal and the railways along it.

name: new_york
sentence: Today, the New York Thruway serves as a modern counterpart to commercial waterways.

name: new_york
sentence: Central New York (New York, Long Island, and southern Hudson Valley) is considered to be the centre of the northeast megalopolis, an urbanized region extending from New Hampshire to Virginia.

name: new_york
sentence: There are 62 cities in New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The largest and most populous city in the U.S. is New York City, which consists of five counties (each coextensive county with a borough): Bronx, New York County (Manhattan), Queens, Kings County (Brooklyn), and Richmond County (Staten Island).

name: new_york
sentence: The city of New York is home to more than two-fifths of the population of the state.

name: new_york
sentence: Albany, the capital of the state, is the sixth largest city in New York State.

name: new_york
sentence: The smallest town is Sherrill, New York, in Oneida County.

name: new_york
sentence: Hempstead is the most populated city in the state; if it were a city, it would be the second largest city in the state of New York, with more than 700,000 inhabitants.

name: new_york
sentence: New York contains 13 metropolitan areas, as defined by the United States Census Bureau.

name: new_york
sentence: Major metro areas include New York, Buffalo, Rochester, the Capital District (Albany, Schenectady and Troy), Poughkeepsie, Syracuse, Utica and Binghamton.

name: new_york
sentence: The nation's most populous state until the 1960s, New York is now the fourth most populous state.

name: new_york
sentence: The distribution of changes in population growth is uneven in the state of New York; the metropolitan area of New York is growing, with Saratoga County, while cities such as Buffalo, Rochester, and Syracuse and many others have lost population for decades.

name: new_york
sentence: New York City won more residents between April 2010 and July 2018 (223,615 inhabitants) than any other American city.

name: new_york
sentence: Conversely, outside the Ithaca region, population growth in much of western New York is almost stagnant.

name: new_york
sentence: According to immigration statistics, the State is one of the main recipients of migrants from all over the world.

name: new_york
sentence: Between 2000 and 2005, immigration did not exceed emigration to other parts of the United States, a trend that has been reversed since 2006.

name: new_york
sentence: New York State lost two seats in the 2011 Congress after relatively slow growth compared to the rest of the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2000 and 2005, more people moved from New York to Florida than from one state to another, contributing to New York becoming the fourth most populous state in 2015 behind Florida, Texas and California.

name: new_york
sentence: However, New York State has the second largest international immigrant population among American states, with 4.2 million in 2008; most of them live in and around New York City, due to its size, high profile, economic dynamics and cosmopolitan culture.

name: new_york
sentence: New York has a pro-sanctuary law of the city.

name: new_york
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of New York City was 19,453,561 on 1 July 2019, an increase of 0.39 per cent over the 2010 United States Census.

name: new_york
sentence: Despite open state land, the population of New York City is very urban, with 92 per cent of the population living in urban areas, mainly in the New York metropolitan area.

name: new_york
sentence: Two-thirds of the population of New York State resides in the New York metropolitan area.

name: new_york
sentence: New York City is the most populous city in the United States, with an estimated record population of 8,622,698 in 2017, integrating more immigration into the city than emigration since the 2010 United States Census.

name: new_york
sentence: At least twice as many people live in New York City as in the second most populous city in the United States (Los Angeles), and in a smaller area.

name: new_york
sentence: Long Island alone had an estimated 7,838,722 residents in 2015, representing 39.6 per cent of the population of New York State.

name: new_york
sentence: 6.5 per cent of New York's population was under five years of age, 24.7 per cent under 18 years of age and 12.9 per cent 65 years of age or older.

name: new_york
sentence: Hispanics or Latinos of all races accounted for 17.6 per cent of the population in 2010: 2.4 per cent were Mexican, 5.5 per cent Puerto Rican, 0.4 per cent Cuban and 9.4 per cent from other Hispanic and Latin backgrounds.

name: new_york
sentence: According to the American Community Survey 2010-2015, the largest ancestry groups were Italian (13.0%), Irish (12.1%), German (10.3%), American (5.4%) and English (5.2%).

name: new_york
sentence: The most populous racial group in the state, non-Hispanic white, declined in proportion to the population of the state, from 94.6% in 1940 to 58.3% in 2010.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2011, 55.6 per cent of New York City's population under 1 year of age were minorities.

name: new_york
sentence: The largest growing Jewish population in New York, the largest outside of Israel, was the highest among states, both in percentage and absolute numbers, in 2012.

name: new_york
sentence: It is motivated by the high rate of reproduction of Orthodox Jewish families, particularly in Brooklyn and the Hudson Valley communities.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is home to the largest African-American population and the second largest African-American population (after California) in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: The Black population in New York increased by 2.0 per cent between 2000 and 2010, reaching 3,073,800.

name: new_york
sentence: The black population is in a state of flux, as New York is the largest recipient of immigrants from Africa, while the settled African Americans migrate from New York to the south of the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: The Harlem neighbourhood in New York City has historically been a major cultural capital for African Americans of sub-Saharan origin, and Bedford-Stuyvesant in Brooklyn has the largest such population in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: Meanwhile, the Asian population in New York increased by 36 per cent from 2000 to 2010, reaching 1,420,244.

name: new_york
sentence: Queens in New York City is home to the largest Afro-American population in the state and is the most ethnically diverse county in the United States and the most ethnically diverse urban area in the world.

name: new_york
sentence: The growing Hispanic or Latin population of New York was 3,416,922 in 2010, an increase of 19 per cent over the 2,867,583 recorded in 2000.

name: new_york
sentence: Queens is home to the largest Andean populations (Colombian, Ecuadorian, Peruvian and Bolivian) in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: In addition, New York has the largest Puerto Rican, Dominican and Jamaican populations in the continental United States.The Chinese population is the fastest growing nationality in New York State, which is the most important destination for new Chinese immigrants, and large-scale Chinese immigration continues into the state.

name: new_york
sentence: Several satellites in the original Manhattan Chinatown, Brooklyn, and around Flushing, Queens, thrive as traditional urban enclaves, while developing rapidly eastward in the suburb of Nassau County on Long Island.

name: new_york
sentence: Long Island, including Queens and Nassau County, is also home to several Little Indias and a large city in Korea, with large and growing populations of Korean Indians and Americans, respectively.

name: new_york
sentence: Brooklyn was a destination for West African immigrants, as well as Asian Indian immigrants.

name: new_york
sentence: The annual New York City India Day parade, which took place on or about every August 15th since 1981, is the largest parade of Indian Independence Day outside India.

name: new_york
sentence: At the 2000 census, New York had the largest Italian population in America, constituting the largest self-identified ancestral group on Staten Island and Long Island, followed by the Irish Americans.

name: new_york
sentence: Albany and the Mohawk Valley also have large communities of ethnic Italians and American Irish, reflecting 19th and early 20th century immigration.

name: new_york
sentence: According to the American Community Survey, New York also had the largest Greek American population of 148,637 (0.7% of the state).

name: new_york
sentence: In Buffalo and western New York, Germans are the greatest ancestry.

name: new_york
sentence: In Northern New York, French Canadians are the main ethnic group, given the proximity of the region to Quebec.

name: new_york
sentence: Americans of English ancestry are present throughout the northern part of New York State, reflecting the first colonial immigrants and later.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2010, the most commonly spoken American English dialects in New York, in addition to general American English, were the dialect of the New York City region (including New York's Latin English and Northern Jersey's English), the accent of Western New England around Albany, and the English of the inner North American in Buffalo and western New York State.

name: new_york
sentence: Up to 800 languages are spoken in New York, making it the most linguistically diverse city in the world.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2010, 70.72% (12,788,233) of New York residents aged five and over reported speaking only English at home, while 14.44% (2,611,903) spoke Spanish, 2.61% (472,955) Chinese (which includes Cantonese and Mandarin), 1.2% (216,468) Russian, 1.18% (213,785) Italian, 0.79% (142,169) French Creole, 0.75% (135,789) French, 0.67% (121,917) Yiddish, 0.63% (114,574) Korean and Polish were spoken by 0.53% (95,413) of the population over five years of age.

name: new_york
sentence: A total of 29.28 per cent (5 295 016) of New York City's population aged five and over reported speaking a language other than English.

name: new_york
sentence: According to the 2017 American Community Survey, nearly six million residents spoke a language other than English.

name: new_york
sentence: About 1,249,541 New York residents spoke Spanish, 386,290 Chinese, 122,150 Russian, 63,615 Haitian Creoles, 62,219 Bengali and 60,405 Koreans.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2018, 12,756,975 people aged 5 years and older spoke English alone and 10,415,395 people aged 18 years and older spoke only English.

name: new_york
sentence: The majority of Spanish-speaking households were not very English-speaking.

name: new_york
sentence: It is estimated that 2.7 million households with residents aged 5 and over spoke Spanish.

name: new_york
sentence: The Chinese, Slavic and French languages were the largest languages spoken by households in 2018.

name: new_york
sentence: The majority of New York's religious population is Christian (60%), followed by irreligious (27%), Judaism (7%), Islam (2%), Buddhism and Hinduism (1% each), and other religions (0.5%).

name: new_york
sentence: Before the 1800s Protestant sects dominated New York's religious life, although religion did not play as important a role in Nova Scotia's public life as it did in New England, with its Puritan population.

name: new_york
sentence: Historically, New York served as the foundation for new Christian confessions in the second great awakening.

name: new_york
sentence: Non-Western Christian traditions and non-Christian religions did not grow in much of the State's history because immigration came mainly from Western Europe (which at the time was dominated by Western Christianity and favoured by quotas in the Federal Immigration Act).

name: new_york
sentence: The Immigration and Nationality Act 1965 abolished quotas, which allowed the growth of other religious groups.

name: new_york
sentence: The Roman Catholic Church is the largest Christian denomination in New York (31%).

name: new_york
sentence: The largest Catholic diocese is the Archdiocese of the Latin Church of New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The largest Eastern Catholic diocese is the Ruthenian Catholic Eparchy of Passaic of the Ruthenian Greek Catholic Church.

name: new_york
sentence: The United Methodist Church is the largest main Protestant denomination and the second largest in the whole, followed by the Episcopal Church in the United States and other continuing Anglican organizations.

name: new_york
sentence: The Presbyterian Church (USA), the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America and the American Baptist Church were the following major denominations.

name: new_york
sentence: The main Protestants together make up 11% of the state's Christians.

name: new_york
sentence: In evangelical Protestantism, Baptists, non-denominational Protestants and Pentecostals were the largest groups.

name: new_york
sentence: The National Baptist Convention (USA) and the Progressive National Baptist Convention were the largest historically black Protestant churches in New York.

name: new_york
sentence: About 10% of New York Christians are evangelical Protestants.

name: new_york
sentence: Eastern Orthodox and Eastern Orthodox collectively accounted for 1% of the religious population alongside Jehovah's Witnesses and other Christians.

name: new_york
sentence: Non-Christian religions account for 12% of the religious population.

name: new_york
sentence: Judaism has been the second most important religion since 2014.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2010, 588,500 people practiced Orthodox Judaism.

name: new_york
sentence: Just over 392,953 professed Islam.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is home to the oldest temple of Zoroastrian fire in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: Less than 1% of New York's population practise New Age and contemporary paganism.

name: new_york
sentence: Amerindian religions are also an important minority.

name: new_york
sentence: Irreligiousism is a growing community in the New York metropolitan area.

name: new_york
sentence: At the state level, 17 per cent do nothing in particular and 5 per cent are atheistic and agnostic.

name: new_york
sentence: Approximately 3.8% of the adult population in the state identifies as lesbian, gay, bisexual or transgender.

name: new_york
sentence: This is a total population of 570,388 LGBT adults.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2010, the number of same-sex households was approximately 48,932.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is the fifth state to allow homosexual marriages, after New Hampshire.

name: new_york
sentence: Michael Bloomberg, Mayor of New York City, said that "same-sex marriages in New York generated approximately $259 million in economic impact and $16 million in municipal revenue" in the first year after the passage of the Marriage Equality Act.

name: new_york
sentence: Same-sex marriages in New York were legalized on 24 June 2011 and were allowed to begin 30 days thereafter.

name: new_york
sentence: The city of New York is also home to the largest transgender population in the United States, estimated at 25,000 in 2016.

name: new_york
sentence: The annual New York Pride March (or gay pride parade) crosses 5th Avenue in Manhattan, ending at Greenwich Village, and rivals the Sao Paulo Gay Pride Parade as the largest pride parade in the world, attracting tens of thousands of participants and millions of spectators on the sidewalks each June.

name: new_york
sentence: The Stonewall riots were a series of spontaneous and violent demonstrations by members of the gay community against a police raid that took place in the early morning of June 28, 1969, at Stonewall Inn, Greenwich Village, Lower Manhattan.

name: new_york
sentence: They are widely regarded as the most important event leading to the gay liberation movement and the modern struggle for LGBT rights.

name: new_york
sentence: In June 2017, plans were announced for the first official LGBT monument commissioned by the State of New York, unlike the Stonewall National Monument, commissioned by the US federal government.

name: new_york
sentence: The State Monument should be built in the Hudson River Park in Manhattan, near the Hudson River wharves, which have served as important historical symbols of New York's central role as a meeting place and refuge for LGBT communities.

name: new_york
sentence: Starting in 2017, New York also planned to host the largest international celebration of LGBT pride in 2019, known as Stonewall 50 – WorldPride NYC 2019, to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the Stonewall riots.

name: new_york
sentence: In New York, the 2019 Stonewall 50–WorldPride NYC events produced by Heritage of Pride were enhanced through a partnership with the LGBT division of the I LOVE NY program and included a welcome centre during the weeks surrounding the Stonewall 50 / WorldPride events, which was open to all.

name: new_york
sentence: Other commemorative, cultural and educational arts programs on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the rebellion at Stonewall Inn took place throughout the city and around the world; Stonewall 50 – WorldPride NYC 2019 was the largest celebration of LGBT pride in history, attracting about five million people.

name: new_york
sentence: Brooklyn Liberation March, the largest event on transgender rights in LGBTQ history, took place on June 14, 2020, from Grand Army Plaza to Fort Greene, Brooklyn, and focused on supporting the lives of black transgender people, attracting between 15,000 and 20,000 participants.

name: new_york
sentence: New York's gross national product in 2018 was $1.7 trillion.

name: new_york
sentence: If the State of New York were an independent nation, it would be ranked 11th in the world.

name: new_york
sentence: However, in 2013, the multi-state metropolitan statistical area, centred on the city of New York, produced a gross metropolitan product (GMP) of nearly $1.4 trillion, while in 2012, the corresponding combined statistical area produced a GMP of more than $1.7 trillion, both of which ranked first in the country with a wide margin and behind the GDP of only nine countries.

name: new_york
sentence: Anchored by Wall Street in Lower Manhattan's financial district, New York City has been called both the most economical city and the world's leading financial centre.

name: new_york
sentence: The Lower Manhattan is the third largest business district in the United States and is home to the New York Stock Exchange on Wall Street, and the NASDAQ, 165 Broadway, representing the largest and second largest stock exchanges in the world, measured by both the average volume of daily transactions and the total market capitalization of their listed companies in 2013.

name: new_york
sentence: Wall Street investment charges totalled approximately $40 billion in 2012, while in 2013, New York bank executives who manage risk management and compliance functions earned up to $324,000 per year.

name: new_york
sentence: During the 2013–14 fiscal year, the Wall Street securities industry generated 19% of New York State's tax revenues.

name: new_york
sentence: The city of New York remains the world's largest trading centre in the public capital and debt markets, partly because of the size and financial development of the American economy.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is also a leader in hedge fund management

name: new_york
sentence: Several investment banks and investment managers based in Manhattan are important participants in other global financial centres.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is also the largest commercial banking centre in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: Many of the world's largest media conglomerates are also based in the city.

name: new_york
sentence: Manhattan had approximately 520 million square feet (48.1 million square feet) of office space in 2013, making it the largest office market in the United States, while Midtown Manhattan is the nation's largest central business district.

name: new_york
sentence: Silicon Alley, centered in New York, became a metanym for the sphere encompassing the high-tech and entrepreneurship ecosystem of the New York metropolitan area; in 2015, Silicon Alley generated more than $7.3 billion in venture capital investments.

name: new_york
sentence: High-tech industries, including digital media, biotechnology, software development, game design and other areas in the field of information technology, are growing, supported by New York's position at the terminus of several transatlantic fibre optic circuit lines, its intellectual capital, as well as its growing external wireless connectivity.

name: new_york
sentence: In December 2014, the State of New York announced a $50 million venture capital fund to encourage companies working in biotechnology and advanced materials; according to Governor Andrew Cuomo, start-up money would make it easier for entrepreneurs to market their research.

name: new_york
sentence: On December 19, 2011, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg announced his choice of Cornell University and Technion-Israel Institute of Technology to build a $2 billion Graduate School of Applied Sciences on Roosevelt Island in Manhattan, to transform New York into the world's first technology capital.

name: new_york
sentence: Albany, Saratoga County, Rensselaer County, and the Hudson Valley, collectively recognized as the Eastern New York Technology Valley, have experienced significant growth in high-tech computer hardware, with significant advances in nanotechnology, digital electronic design, and integrated manufacturing of water and power chip circuits, including companies including IBM and its Thomas J. Watson Research Centre, as well as the three foreign companies, GlobalFoundries, Samsung and Taiwan Semiconductor.

name: new_york
sentence: The region's high-tech ecosystem is supported by technology-based academic institutions, including the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute and the SUNY Polytechnic Institute.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2015, Tech Valley, which straddles both sides of the Adirondack Northway and the New York Thruway, generated more than $163 million in venture capital investments.

name: new_york
sentence: The Rochester region is important in the field of photographic processing and imaging, as well as in the incubation of an increasingly diverse high-tech sphere encompassing STEM domains, as well as the results of private start-up companies working with major academic institutions, including the University of Rochester and Cornell University.

name: new_york
sentence: Westchester County has developed a booming biotechnology sector in the 21st century, with more than $1 billion in private investment expected to begin in 2016.

name: new_york
sentence: Creative industries, which are involved in the production and dissemination of knowledge and information, such as new media, digital media, film and television production, advertising, fashion, design and architecture, account for an increasing share of employment, with the city of New York having a strong competitive advantage in these industries.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2014, the State of New York offered tax incentives of up to $420 million per year for film production within the state, the most generous of U.S. tax cuts.

name: new_york
sentence: New York also attracted higher visual effects jobs by further increasing its tax credit to a maximum of 35% for post-film production in Upstate New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The filmed entertainment industry has grown in New York, contributing nearly $9 billion to the New York economy in 2015.

name: new_york
sentence: I Love New York is a slogan, logo and state song that are the basis of an advertising campaign and has been used since 1977 to promote tourism in New York State, including New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The brand logo is owned by New York State Empire State Development.

name: new_york
sentence: The Broadway League reported that Broadway's programming sold approximately $1.27 billion in tickets for the 2013–14 season, an increase of 11.4% from $1.39 billion for the 2012–13 season.

name: new_york
sentence: Participation in 2013–14 was $12.21 million, an increase of 5.5% over the $11.57 million in the 2012–13 season.

name: new_york
sentence: New York exports a wide variety of products such as prepared foods, computers and electronics, cut diamonds and other products.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2007, the Government exported a total of $71.1 billion of goods, with Canada ($15 billion), Switzerland ($5.9 billion), Israel ($4.9 billion) and Hong Kong ($3.4 billion) the top five foreign export markets.

name: new_york
sentence: New York's largest imports are oil, gold, aluminum, natural gas, electricity, rough diamonds and lumber.

name: new_york
sentence: The state also has a large manufacturing sector that includes clothing printing and production, primarily in New York; and furs, railway equipment, automotive parts and bus line vehicles, concentrated in Upstate areas.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is the third largest producer of grapes in the country, and the second largest producer of wine in volume, behind California.

name: new_york
sentence: The southern hills of Finger Lakes, the Hudson Valley, the northern fork of Long Island and the southern shore of Lake Erie are the main wine-growing and wine-growing areas of New York, with many vineyards.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2012, New York had 320 wineries and 37,000 hectares of vines, generating full-time jobs for nearly 25,000 people and annual wages over $1.1 billion, and producing $4.8 billion in direct economic impact of grapes, grape juice and wine and grape products.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York agricultural industry is one of the largest producers overall, ranking among the top five states for agricultural products, including maple syrup, apples, cherries, cabbage, dairy products, onions and potatoes.

name: new_york
sentence: The state is the largest cabbage producer in the United States

name: new_york
sentence: The state owns about a quarter of its agricultural land and produced $3.4 billion in agricultural products in 2001.

name: new_york
sentence: The southern shore of Lake Ontario offers the right mix of soils and microclimates for many apple, cherries, plums, pears and peaches.

name: new_york
sentence: Apples are also grown in the Hudson Valley and near Lake Champlain.

name: new_york
sentence: A medium-sized commercial saltwater fishery is located along the Atlantic side of Long Island.

name: new_york
sentence: The main catches are clams, lobsters, squid and folds.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2017, New York State consumed 156,370 gigawatt hours (GWh) of electrical energy.

name: new_york
sentence: Lower-state areas (Hudson Valley, New York and Long Island) consumed 66% of this amount.

name: new_york
sentence: The outermost regions produced 50 % of this amount.

name: new_york
sentence: The maximum load in 2017 was 29,699 MW.

name: new_york
sentence: Resource capacity in 2017 was 42,839 MW.

name: new_york
sentence: The NYISO market monitor described the overall average price of electricity as a range (a single value was not provided) from $25 per MWh to $53 per MWh in 2017.

name: new_york
sentence: At the post-secondary level, the state-wide public university system is the State University of New York (SUNY).

name: new_york
sentence: SUNY consists of 64 community colleges, technical colleges, undergraduate colleges and doctoral institutions, including several universities.

name: new_york
sentence: New York's flagship university is the University of Buffalo, founded by U.S. President Billard Fillmore.

name: new_york
sentence: Along with Buffalo University, the University of Binghamton also ranks high in the rankings of the best public universities in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: New York City has its own City University of New York (CUNY) system, which is funded by the city.

name: new_york
sentence: Columbia University, Cornell University and New York University are among the most important higher education institutions in New York, all world-renowned private universities and members of the Association of American Universities, the first group of research universities in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: Other notable private universities include Syracuse University and Fordham University.

name: new_york
sentence: The smallest private institutions of higher education include Rockefeller University, Mercy College, New York Institute of Technology, Renselaer Polytechnic Institute, Yeshiva University and Hofstra University.

name: new_york
sentence: There are also a multitude of postgraduate schools in New York State, including schools of medicine, law and engineering.

name: new_york
sentence: West Point, the U.S. Army Service Academy, is located just south of Newburgh, on the west bank of the Hudson River.

name: new_york
sentence: The Federal Merchant Navy Academy is at Kings Point on Long Island.

name: new_york
sentence: A number of private, selective liberal arts institutions are located in New York.

name: new_york
sentence: These include Bard College, Barnard College, Colgate University, Hamilton College, Hobart and William Smith Colleges, Marist College, Sarah Lawrence College, Skidmore College, Union College and Vassar College.

name: new_york
sentence: Two of these schools, Barnard and Vassar, are members of the Seven Sisters elite, originally all female schools with links to the Ivy League.

name: new_york
sentence: Barnard was affiliated with Columbia University, its neighbour in Manhattan, and Vassar became a co-educator in 1969 after refusing a merger offer with Yale University.

name: new_york
sentence: New York also houses what is widely regarded as the best performing arts schools in the world.

name: new_york
sentence: The Juilliard School, located in Manhattan's Upper West Side, is one of the world's leading music and dance schools.

name: new_york
sentence: The Eastman School of Music, a professional school at the University of Rochester, was ranked first among American music schools by US News & World Report for five consecutive years.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York State University accredits and establishes standards for primary, middle and secondary education in the State, while the New York State Department of Education supervises public schools and monitors their standardized tests.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York City Department of Education operates the New York City Public School System.

name: new_york
sentence: In 1894, reflecting general racial discrimination, the State passed a law allowing communities to establish separate schools for children of African-American descent.

name: new_york
sentence: In 1900, the state passed another law requiring integrated schools.

name: new_york
sentence: In fiscal year 2013, New York spent more money on public education per student than any other state, according to U.S. Census Bureau statistics.

name: new_york
sentence: New York has one of the largest and oldest transportation infrastructure in the country.

name: new_york
sentence: The engineering problems posed by the complex terrain of the state and the unique infrastructure problems of the city of New York caused by urban congestion had to be overcome forever.

name: new_york
sentence: The population expansion of the state followed the path of the first waterways, first the Hudson River and the Mohawk River, and then the Erie Canal.

name: new_york
sentence: In the 19th century, railways were built along river valleys, followed by the New York State Thruway in the 20th century.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York State Department of Transport (NYSDOT) is the New York Government Department responsible for the establishment and operation of highways, railways, public transport systems, ports, waterways and air facilities in New York State.

name: new_york
sentence: The NYSDOT has its head office at 50 Wolf Road, Colonie, Albany County.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York and New Jersey Port Authority (PANYNJ) is a joint venture between the States of New York and New Jersey and authorized by the American Congress, created in 1921 by an inter-State pact, which oversees much of the regional transportation infrastructure, including bridges, tunnels, airports and seaports, within the geographic jurisdiction of the Port of New York and New Jersey.

name: new_york
sentence: This harbour area of 1,500 km2 (3,900 km2) is generally covered within a 25 km (40 km) radius of the National Monument of the Statue of Liberty.

name: new_york
sentence: The Port Authority's headquarters are located at the 4 World Trade Center in Lower Manhattan.

name: new_york
sentence: In addition to the well-known New York Metro system, which is confined to New York City, four suburban rail networks enter and exit the city: the Long Island Railway, the Metro-North Railway, the Trans-Hudson Harbour Authority and five of the New Jersey Transit rail lines.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York City Department of Transportation (NYCDOT) is the New York City government agency responsible for managing much of New York's transportation infrastructure.

name: new_york
sentence: Other cities in New York have urban and regional public transport.

name: new_york
sentence: In Buffalo, the Niagara Frontier Transportation Authority manages Buffalo Metro Rail's light rail system; in Rochester, Rochester Metro operated from 1927 to 1956, but fell out of date as the state and the federal government invested in roads.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York State Department of Motor Vehicles (NYSDMV or DMV) is the government agency responsible for registering and inspecting motor vehicles and other motor vehicles, as well as authorizing drivers in New York State.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2008, NYSDMV had 11,284,546 driver's licences and 10,697,644 vehicle registrations in force.

name: new_york
sentence: All gasoline vehicles registered in New York State must be inspected for emissions every 12 months to ensure that environmental quality controls prevent air pollution.

name: new_york
sentence: Diesel-powered vehicles with a gross weight of more than 8,500 pounds registered in most counties of Downstate New York are subject to an annual emission inspection.

name: new_york
sentence: All vehicles registered in New York State must undergo an annual safety inspection.

name: new_york
sentence: Portions of the transportation system are intermodal, allowing passengers to switch easily from one mode of transport to another.

name: new_york
sentence: One of the most notable examples is AirTrain JFK, which allows rail passengers to travel directly to the John F. Kennedy International Airport terminals and to the New York Underground Metro.

name: new_york
sentence: The Government of New York embodies the Government structure of the State of New York as established by the Constitution of the State of New York.

name: new_york
sentence: It is composed of three branches: executive, legislative and judicial.

name: new_york
sentence: The Governor is the head of the executive of the State and is assisted by the Lieutenant Governor.

name: new_york
sentence: Both are elected on the same ticket.

name: new_york
sentence: Other elected members include the Attorney General and the Comptroller.

name: new_york
sentence: The Secretary of State, a former elected official, is currently appointed by the Governor.

name: new_york
sentence: The New York State Legislative Assembly is bicameral and consists of the New York State Senate and the New York State Assembly.

name: new_york
sentence: The Assembly is composed of 150 members, while the Senate varies in its membership, which currently has 63 members.

name: new_york
sentence: The Legislative Assembly is empowered to make laws, subject to the Governor's power to veto a bill.

name: new_york
sentence: However, the veto may be cancelled by the legislator if there is a two-thirds majority in favour of winning in each chamber.

name: new_york
sentence: Permanent laws of a general nature are codified in the consolidated laws of New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The highest court of appeal in the unified judicial system is the Court of Appeal, while the first court of first instance is the County Court (or the Supreme Court of New York).

name: new_york
sentence: The Supreme Court also acts as an intermediate court of appeal for many cases, and local courts deal with a variety of other issues, including small claims, traffic ticket procedures and local zoning issues, and are the starting point for all criminal cases.

name: new_york
sentence: The courts in New York City are the largest local judicial system.

name: new_york
sentence: The State is divided into counties, cities, towns and villages, all of which are municipal corporations with respect to their own governments, as well as various corporations that serve for unique purposes that are also local governments, such as school districts, fire districts and public utility corporations in New York State, often known as development authorities or corporations.

name: new_york
sentence: Each municipal corporation is given different home government powers, as provided for in the New York Constitution.

name: new_york
sentence: The State also has 10 Indian reserves.

name: new_york
sentence: There have been several secession movements in New York State.

name: new_york
sentence: Proposals include a State of Long Island, which includes everything on the island outside New York; a State called Niagara, the counties of western New York State; the counties of northern New York State called Upstate New York; making New York City a State; a proposal to create a new County of Peconic in eastern Long Island; and the borough of Staten Island to leave New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The death penalty was reintroduced in 1995 under the administration of Pataki, but the law was declared unconstitutional in 2004, when the New York Court of Appeal ruled in People v. LaValle that it violated the State Constitution.

name: new_york
sentence: The remaining death penalty was commuted by the court to life imprisonment in 2007, in People v. John Taylor, and death row was dissolved in 2008, by an order of Governor David Paterson.

name: new_york
sentence: No executions have taken place in New York since 1963.

name: new_york
sentence: Legislative efforts to amend the law had failed and the death penalty was no longer required at the state level, although some crimes falling within the federal government's jurisdiction were punishable by the federal death penalty.

name: new_york
sentence: New York City is represented by Chuck Schumer and Kirsten Gillibrand in the United States Senate.

name: new_york
sentence: There are 27 Congressional districts, the third largest number of Congressional districts, equal to Florida and behind California's 53 and 36.

name: new_york
sentence: In 2019, 21 districts were represented by members of the Democratic Party, while 6 were represented by Republicans.

name: new_york
sentence: Representation was reduced by 29 in 2013 due to the slowdown in the overall population growth of the State compared to the overall national population growth.

name: new_york
sentence: New York had 29 votes in the national presidential elections, down from its 47-vote summit from 1933 to 1953.

name: new_york
sentence: The state has a significant imbalance in payments with the federal government.

name: new_york
sentence: According to the New York State Comptroller's Office, New York received 91 cents of services for every dollar it sent in taxes to the United States federal government in fiscal year 2013; New York ranked 46th in the federal balance of payments to the state on a per capita basis.

name: new_york
sentence: In April 2016, Democrats represented a plurality of voters in New York State, more than double the number of registered voters than any other political party.

name: new_york
sentence: Since the second half of the twentieth century, New York has generally supported Democratic Party candidates in national elections.

name: new_york
sentence: Democratic presidential candidate Barack Obama won the state of New York by more than 25 percentage points in 2012 and 2008.

name: new_york
sentence: New York, along with the other major cities of the state, including Albany, Buffalo, Rochester, Yonkers and Syracuse, are important democratic strongholds, with liberal politics.

name: new_york
sentence: However, rural areas in New York State are generally more conservative than cities and tend to favour Republicans.

name: new_york
sentence: Suburban areas with large populations, such as Westchester County and Long Island, have crossed the main parties since the 1980s, but most often they support the Democrats.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is the largest source of political fund-raising in the United States for the two major parties.

name: new_york
sentence: Four of the nation's top five postal codes for political contributions are located in Manhattan.

name: new_york
sentence: The Upper East Side postal code 10021 generated the most money for the 2000 presidential campaigns of George W. Bush and Al Gore.

name: new_york
sentence: The State of New York has the distinction of being the State of origin of the two major parties designated in three presidential elections.

name: new_york
sentence: The 1904 presidential election saw former New York governor and outgoing president Theodore Roosevelt face Alton B. Parker, Chief Justice of the New York Court of Appeal.

name: new_york
sentence: The 1944 presidential election had Franklin D. Roosevelt, following in the footsteps of his cousin Theodore as former governor of New York and outgoing president running for re-election against the current governor of New York Thomas E. Dewey.

name: new_york
sentence: In the 2016 presidential election, the former U.S. Senator of New York Hillary Clinton, a resident of Chappaqua, was the Democratic Party candidate.

name: new_york
sentence: The Republican Party candidate was businessman Donald Trump, a Manhattan resident and a Queens native.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is an important centre for international diplomacy.

name: new_york
sentence: United Nations Headquarters has been located on the east side of Midtown Manhattan since 1952.

name: new_york
sentence: The state of New York is geographically home to a National Football League team, the Buffalo Bills, based in the Buffalo suburb of Orchard Park.

name: new_york
sentence: Although the New York Giants and the New York Jets represent the New York metropolitan area and were previously located in New York City, they play at the MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey.

name: new_york
sentence: New York also has two major League baseball teams, the New York Yankees (based in the Bronx) and the New York Mets (based in the Queens).

name: new_york
sentence: Minor league baseball teams also play in New York State, including Long Island Ducks, Brooklyn Cyclones and Staten Island Yankees, as well as Rochester Red Wings, Binghamton Rumble Ponies, Syracuse Mets, Auburn Doubledays, Batavia Muckdogs, Hudson Valley Renegades and Buffalo Bisons.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is home to three National Hockey League franchises: the New York Rangers in Manhattan, the New York Islanders in Brooklyn and Nassau County in Long Island, and the Buffalo Sabres.

name: new_york
sentence: New York has two teams from the National Basketball Association, the New York Knicks in Manhattan, and the Brooklyn Nets in Brooklyn.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is the seat of a Major League soccer franchise, New York City FC, currently playing in the Bronx.

name: new_york
sentence: Although the New York Red Bulls represent the New York metropolitan area, they play Red Bull Arena in Harrison, New Jersey.

name: new_york
sentence: New York hosted the 1932 and 1980 Olympic Winter Games in Lake Placid.

name: new_york
sentence: The 1980 Games are known for the ice hockey game between the United States and the United States, nicknamed the Miracle on Ice, during which a group of American students and amateurs beat the highly favoured Soviet 4-3 national ice hockey team and won the gold medal against Finland.

name: new_york
sentence: With St. Moritz, Switzerland and Innsbruck, Austria, Lake Placid is one of three cities that hosted the Olympic Winter Games twice.

name: new_york
sentence: New York City bid for the 2012 Summer Olympics, but lost to London.

name: new_york
sentence: Several U.S. national sports venues are or have been located in New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum is located in Cooperstown, Otsego County.

name: new_york
sentence: The Saratoga Springs National Race and Hall of Fame Museum in Saratoga County honours achievements in the sport of pure-bred horse racing.

name: new_york
sentence: The physical installation of the National Soccer Hall of Fame in Oneonta, also in Otsego County, was closed in 2010, although the organization itself continued its inductions.

name: new_york
sentence: The United States Open Tennis Championships are one of four Grand Slam tennis tournaments in the world and take place at the National Tennis Center in Flushing Meadows–Corona Park, Queens District, New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The State of New York is also home to many Division 1 inter-collegial sports programs.

name: new_york
sentence: The flagship University of New York State University in Buffalo is the Buffalo Bulls.

name: new_york
sentence: The intercollegial teams of Syracuse University are the Orange Syracuse.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina is a state in the southeastern United States of America.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina is the 28th largest and the 9th most populous of the 50 United States.

name: north_carolina
sentence: It is bordered by Virginia to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the east, Georgia and South Carolina to the south, and Tennessee to the west.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Raleigh is the capital of the state and Charlotte is its largest city.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Charlotte's metropolitan area, with an estimated population of 2,569,213 in 2018, is the most populated metropolitan area of North Carolina, the 23rd most populated in the United States, and the nation's largest banking centre after New York City.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The Raleigh metropolitan area is the second largest metropolitan area in the state, with an estimated population of 1,362,540 in 2018, and is home to the largest research park in the United States, Research Triangle Park.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina was founded in 1729 as a royal colony and is one of the 13 original colonies.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina was named in honour of King Charles I of England who first formed the English colony, Carolus being Latin for "Charles".

name: north_carolina
sentence: On November 21, 1789, North Carolina became the 12th state to ratify the United States Constitution.

name: north_carolina
sentence: On the eve of the American civil war, North Carolina declared its secession from the Union on 20 May 1861, becoming the last of the eleven states to join the Confederate States.

name: north_carolina
sentence: After the civil war, the state was restored to the Union on 25 June 1868.

name: north_carolina
sentence: On December 17, 1903, Orville and Wilbur Wright successfully flew the world's first controlled and sustained flight of a heavier-than-air motorized aircraft at Kill Devil Hills, on the outer shores of North Carolina.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina uses the slogan "First in Flight" on state license plates to commemorate this achievement, as well as a new alternative design bearing the slogan "First in Freedom" with reference to the Mecklenburg Declaration and the Halifax resolutions.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina is defined by a wide range of altitudes and landscapes.

name: north_carolina
sentence: From the west to the east, the elevation of North Carolina descends from the Appalachians to the coastal plain of Piedmont and the Atlantic.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Mount Mitchell of North Carolina, 2,037 metres away, is the highest point in North America east of Mississippi.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Most of the state falls into the humid subtropical climate zone; however, the mountainous western part of the state has a high subtropical altitude climate.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina has been inhabited for at least ten thousand years by prehistoric native cultures.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The Hardaway site has experienced significant periods of occupation dating back to 10,000 years B.C.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Before 200 AD, people built earth mounds, which were used for ceremonial and religious purposes.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The successful peoples, including those of the Appalachian culture of southern Mississippi, established by 1000 AD in the Piedmont and Mountain region, continued to build this mound style.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Unlike some of the largest centres of classical Mississippi culture (as shown below), in what became known as West Carolinas, northeastern Georgia and southeastern Tennessee, most of the major cities had only one central platform.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Small settlements did not have one, but developed near the most important cities.

name: north_carolina
sentence: This region has become the homeland of the Cherokee, who would have migrated over time from the Great Lakes region.

name: north_carolina
sentence: In the 500-700 years leading up to contact with Europe, Mississippi culture has built large, complex cities and maintained distant regional trade networks.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Its largest city was Cahokia, which had many mounds for different purposes, a highly stratified company, and was located in the present southwest of Illinois near the Mississippi River.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Indigenous policies in Mississippi culture have dissociated and reformed as new groups, such as the Catawba, due to a series of destabilizing events known as the "Missipian Breakout Zone".

name: north_carolina
sentence: As the anthropologist Robbie Ethridge described, the Mississippi break-up zone was an area of great instability, in what is now the South American, caused by the instability of the Mississippi chiefdoms, high mortality due to new Eurasian diseases, the construction of a world capitalist economy based on the trade of Amerindian slaves, and the emergence of indigenous "military slave societies".

name: north_carolina
sentence: Historically documented tribes in the North Carolina region include the Algonquian tribes of Carolina in coastal areas, such as Chowanoke, Roanoke, Pamelico, Machapunga, Korea, and Cape Fear, which were the first to be met by the English; Meherrin, Cherokee, and Tuscarora Indians speaking Iroquoian from within; and the Southeast Siwan tribes, such as Cheraw, Waxhaw, Saponi, Waccamaw, and Catawba from Piedmont.

name: north_carolina
sentence: At the end of the 16th century, the first Spanish explorers travelling inland met people of Missipis culture in Joara, a regional chiefdom near what later developed as Morganton.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Hernando de Soto's archives attest to his meeting with them in 1540.

name: north_carolina
sentence: In 1567, Captain Juan Pardo led an expedition to claim the area of the Spanish colony and establish another road to reach the silver mines in Mexico.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Pardo made a winter base in Joara, which he renamed Cuenca.

name: north_carolina
sentence: His expedition built Fort San Juan and left there a contingent of 30 men, while Pardo went further.

name: north_carolina
sentence: His forces built and Garnished five other forts.

name: north_carolina
sentence: He returned by another road to Santa Elena on Parris Island, South Carolina, then a center of Spanish Florida.

name: north_carolina
sentence: In the spring of 1568, the natives killed all but one of the Spanish soldiers and burned the six forts inside, including that of Fort San Juan.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Although the Spaniards have never returned to the interior, this effort marked the first European attempt to colonize the interior of what became the United States.

name: north_carolina
sentence: A 16th-century diary of Pardo Bandera's scribe, and archaeological discoveries since 1986 in Joara, confirmed the colony.

name: north_carolina
sentence: In 1584, Elizabeth I granted a charter to Sir Walter Raleigh, for whom the state capital is named, for lands in present-day North Carolina (then part of Virginia's territory).

name: north_carolina
sentence: It was the second American territory that the English attempted to colonize.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Raleigh established two colonies on the coast in the late 1580s, but both failed.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The fate of the "Lost Colony" on Roanoke Island remains one of the most widely debated mysteries in American history.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Virginia Dare, the first English child to be born in North America, was born on Roanoke Island on August 18, 1587; Dare County was named in her name.

name: north_carolina
sentence: As early as 1650, settlers from the colony of Virginia settled in the Albemarle Strait area.

name: north_carolina
sentence: In 1663 King Charles II of England granted a charter for the creation of a new colony on the North American continent; he generally established the borders of North Carolina.

name: north_carolina
sentence: He named her Caroline in honor of his father, Charles I.

name: north_carolina

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina consists of three major geographic areas: the Atlantic Coastal Plain, which occupies the eastern part of the state, the central Piedmont region, and the western mountainous region, which is part of the Appalachians.

name: north_carolina

name: north_carolina

name: north_carolina
sentence: It consists of a gently sloping countryside often broken by low hills or mountain ridges.

name: north_carolina

name: north_carolina

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina has 17 major watersheds.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Of the 17 basins, 11 are from the state of North Carolina, but only four are entirely within the state border: Cap Peur, the Neuse, the White Oak and the Tar-Pamlico basin.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Elevation above sea level is the main cause of temperature change throughout the state, with the mountainous region being the coolest all year round.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The climate is also influenced by the Atlantic Ocean and the Gulf Stream, particularly in the coastal plain.

name: north_carolina
sentence: These influences tend to cause warmer winter temperatures along the coast, where temperatures fall only occasionally below freezing at night.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The coastal plain averages about 2.5 cm of snow or ice per year, and there may be no snow or ice for many years.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The Atlantic Ocean has less influence on the climate of the Piedmont region, which has warmer summers and colder winters than along the coast, although the average daily maximum is still less than 90°F (32°C) in most locations.

name: north_carolina
sentence: North Carolina is experiencing severe weather, both in summer and winter, with the threat of hurricanes, tropical storms, heavy rains and floods.

name: north_carolina

name: north_carolina

sentence: In 2010, 89.66 per cent (7,750,904) of North Carolina residents aged five and over spoke English at home as their primary language, while 6.93% (598,756) spoke Spanish, 0.32% (27,310) French, 0.27% (23,204) German and Chinese (including Mandarin) were spoken as their main language by 0.27% (23,072) of the population aged five and over.

name: north_carolina
sentence: A total of 10.34% (893,735) of the North Carolina population aged five years and older spoke a mother tongue other than English.

sentence: North Carolina is also home to a spectrum of different dialects of South American English and Appalachian English.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The residents of North Carolina since colonial times have always been very Protestant – first Anglicans, then Baptists and Methodists.

name: north_carolina
sentence: In 1845 the Baptists were divided into regional associations in the North and the South, on the issue of slavery.

name: north_carolina
sentence: At the end of the 19th century, North Carolina's largest Protestant denomination was Baptist.

name: north_carolina
sentence: After emancipation, black Baptists quickly established their own independent congregations in North Carolina and other southern states because they wanted to be free from white supervision.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Black Baptists have developed their own state and national associations, such as the National Baptist Convention USA, Inc.

name: north_carolina
sentence: While the Baptists maintained the majority Protestant denomination in this part of the country (called the Biblical Belt), other residents of the state practice a wide variety of religions, including Judaism, Islam, Baháís, Buddhism and Hinduism.

name: north_carolina
sentence: In 2010, the Southern Baptist Convention was the largest denomination, with 4,241 churches and 1,513 000 members.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The second largest was the United Methodist Church, with 660,000 members and 1,923 churches.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The third was the Roman Catholic Church, with 428,000 members in 190 parishes.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The fourth largest was the Presbyterian Church (USA), with 186,000 members and 710 congregations; this name was brought by Scottish-Irish immigrants who established the hinterland in colonial times.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The state also has a special history with the Moravian Church, as the settlers of this faith (mainly of German origin) settled in the Winston-Salem region in the 18th and 19th centuries.

name: north_carolina
sentence: Presbyterians, historically Scottish-Irish, had a strong presence in Charlotte and Scotland County.

name: north_carolina
sentence: At present, the rapid influx of Northerners and immigrants from Latin America continues to increase ethnic and religious diversity.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The number of Roman Catholics and Jews in the state has increased, as has the general religious diversity.

name: north_carolina
sentence: The second largest Protestant denomination in North Carolina, according to Baptist traditions, is Methodism.

name: north_carolina
sentence: This trend tends to be strong in northern Piedmont, particularly in Guilford County.

name: north_carolina
sentence: There are also a significant number of Quakers in Guilford County and Northeastern North Carolina.

sentence: The state also has several important seminars, including the Southeast Baptist Theological Seminary in Wake Forest, and the Hood Theological Seminary (AME Zion) in Salisbury.

sentence: The state has a very diversified economy due to its high availability of hydroelectric power, its pleasant climate and its wide variety of soils.

sentence: The State ranks third among the South Atlantic states in terms of population, but leads the region in the fields of industry and agriculture.

sentence: North Carolina leads the country in the production of tobacco, textiles and furniture.
