sentence: The port ships more than two million tonnes of goods per year and is a designated foreign trade area.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Oklahoma is a constitutional republic with a government inspired by the federal government of the United States, with executive, legislative and judicial powers.

name: oklahoma
sentence: The state has 77 counties with jurisdiction over most of the local government functions in each area, five districts of Congress, and a plurality voting base within the Republican Party.

name: oklahoma
sentence: State representatives are elected by a pluralist vote in the State of Oklahoma.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Oklahoma has the death penalty as a legal penalty, and the state has had (between 1976 and mid-2011) the highest per capita execution rate in the nation.

name: oklahoma
sentence: The Legislative Assembly of Oklahoma consists of the Senate and the House of Representatives.

name: oklahoma
sentence: As the legislative branch of the state government, it is responsible for collecting and distributing the funds needed to manage the government.

name: oklahoma
sentence: The Senator has 48 members for a four-year term, while the House has 101 members for a two-year term.

name: oklahoma
sentence: The State has a statutory term limit which limits any person to twelve cumulative years of service between the two legislative branches.

name: oklahoma
sentence: The judiciary of Oklahoma consists of the Supreme Court of Oklahoma, the Criminal Appeal Court of Oklahoma and 77 district courts each serving a county.

name: oklahoma
sentence: The judiciary of Oklahoma also includes two independent courts: an indictment court and the Oklahoma court on the judiciary.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Oklahoma has two courts of last resort: the State Supreme Court hears civil cases and the State Criminal Court of Appeal hears criminal cases (this system of distribution exists only in Oklahoma and nearby Texas).

name: oklahoma
sentence: The judges of these two courts, as well as the Court of Civil Appeal, are appointed by the Governor on the recommendation of the National Commission for the Appointment of Judges and are subject to a non-partisan retention vote on a rotational schedule of six years.

name: oklahoma
sentence: The Executive is composed of the Governor, his staff and other elected officials.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Head of Government, the Governor is the head of the Oklahoma Executive, who is the Commander-in-Chief of the Oklahoma National Guard when he is not called for federal use and reserves the power of veto to bills passed by the Legislative Assembly.

name: oklahoma
sentence: The executive branch's responsibilities include the submission of the budget, the enforcement of State laws and the maintenance of peace within the State.

name: oklahoma
sentence: The state is divided into 77 counties that govern locally, each headed by a three-member council of elected commissioners, a tax assessor, a clerk, a clerk, a treasurer and a sheriff.

name: oklahoma
sentence: While each municipality operates as a separate and independent local government with executive, legislative and judicial powers, county governments retain jurisdiction over incorporated cities and unincorporated areas within their borders, but have executive but no legislative or judicial powers.

name: oklahoma
sentence: County and municipal governments collect taxes, employ a separate police force, organize elections and manage emergency response services within their jurisdiction.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Other local governments include school districts, technology centre districts, community college districts, rural fire departments, rural water districts and other special-purpose districts.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Thirty-nine Amerindian tribal governments are based in Oklahoma, each with limited powers in designated areas.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Although typical Indian reserves in most of the United States are not present in Oklahoma, tribal governments hold land granted during the time of Indian territory, but with limited jurisdiction and no control over government governing bodies such as municipalities and counties.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Tribal governments are recognized by the United States as quasi-sovereign entities with executive, judicial and legislative powers over tribal members and functions, but are subject to the power of the United States Congress to revoke or deny certain powers.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Tribal governments are required to submit a constitution and any subsequent amendments to the United States Congress for approval.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Oklahoma has 11 sub-state districts, including the two major government councils, INCOG in Tulsa (Council of Indian Governments) and ACOG (Association of Central Oklahoma Governments).

name: oklahoma
sentence: During the first half-century of the state, Oklahoma was considered a democratic bastion, being carried by the Republican Party in only two presidential elections (1920 and 1928).

name: oklahoma
sentence: After the 1948 elections, the state became firmly republican.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Although the registered Republicans were a minority in the state until 2015, Oklahoma was carried by Republican presidential candidates in all but one election since 1952: the victory of Lyndon B. Johnson 1964 shaken.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Every county in Oklahoma has been won by Republican candidates in the presidential elections since 2004.

name: oklahoma
sentence: In general, Republicans are the strongest in the suburbs of Oklahoma City and Tulsa, as well as in the Panhandle.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Democrats are the strongest in the eastern part of the state and Little Dixie, as well as in the most African-American and inner parts of Oklahoma City and Tulsa.

name: oklahoma
sentence: With a population of 8.6 per cent of Amerindians in the state, it is also interesting to note that most Amerindian constituencies vote Democratic on the margins surpassed only by African Americans.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Following the 2000 census, the delegation of Oklahoma to the United States House of Representatives was reduced from six to five representatives, each serving a Congressional district.

name: oklahoma
sentence: In the current Congress, the Republicans include the entire delegation of Oklahoma.

name: oklahoma
sentence: In 2010, Oklahoma had 598 places incorporated, including four cities with more than 100,000 inhabitants and 43 with more than 10,000 inhabitants.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Two of the fifty largest cities in the United States are in Oklahoma, Oklahoma City and Tulsa, and 65% of Oklahomans live in their metropolitan areas, or in spheres of economic and social influence defined by the U.S. Census Bureau as a metropolitan statistical area.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Oklahoma City, the capital of the state and the largest city, had the largest metropolitan area of the state in 2010, with 1.252,987 people, and the metropolitan area of Tulsa had 937,478 residents.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Between 2000 and 2010, Blanchard (172.4 per cent), Elgin (78.2 per cent), Jenks (77.0%), Piedmont (56.7 per cent), Bixby (56.6 per cent) and Owasso (56.3 per cent) were the main growing cities.

name: oklahoma
sentence: In descending order of population, the largest cities in Oklahoma in 2010 were: Oklahoma City (579,999, +14.6%), Tulsa (391,906, -0.3%), Norman (110,925, +15.9%), Broken Arrow (98,850, +32.0%), Lawton (96,867, +4.4%), Edmond (81,405, +19.2%), Moore (55,081, +33.9%), Midwest City (54,371, +0.5 %), Enid (49,379, +5.0 %), and Stillwater (45,688, +17.0%).

name: oklahoma
sentence: Of the ten largest cities in the state, three are outside the metropolitan areas of Oklahoma City and Tulsa, and only Lawton has a metropolitan statistical area as designated by the U.S. Census Bureau, although the Fort Smith Metropolitan Statistics Area, Arkansas, extends to the state.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Under the Oklahoma Act, municipalities are divided into two categories: cities, defined as having more than 1,000 inhabitants, and cities, which have fewer than 1,000 inhabitants.

name: oklahoma
sentence: Both have legislative, judicial and public powers within their borders, but cities can choose between a mayor, council, mayor or strong government, while cities operate through a system of elected leaders.

name: oklahoma
sentence: State law codifies the State emblems and honorary positions of Oklahoma

name: oklahoma
sentence: In 2012, the Chamber passed HR1024, which would change the motto of the state from "Labor Omnia Vincit" to "Oklahoma—In God we trust!"

name: oklahoma
sentence: The author of the resolution stated that a constituent had researched the Constitution of Oklahoma and found no "official" vote on "Labor Omnia Vincit", thus opening the door to an entirely new motto.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is a state in the Pacific Northwest Region on the west coast of the United States of America.

name: oregon
sentence: The Columbia River demarcates much of Oregon's northern border with Washington, while the Snake River demarcates much of its eastern border with Idaho.

name: oregon
sentence: The north parallel of 42° demarcates the southern border with California and Nevada.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon has been home to many Aboriginal nations for thousands of years.

name: oregon
sentence: The first European merchants, explorers and settlers began exploring what is now the Pacific coast of Oregon in the early 1500s.

name: oregon
sentence: As early as 1565, the Spaniards began sending ships from the north-east of the Philippines, using the Kuroshio Current in a circular track that crosses the northern part of the Pacific.

name: oregon
sentence: In 1592 Juan de Fuca undertook detailed mapping and studies of ocean currents in the northwest Pacific, including the Oregon coast and the strait that now bears his name.

name: oregon
sentence: Spanish ships – 250 in as many years – did not usually land before reaching Cape Mendocino in California, but some landed or wrecked in what is now Oregon.

name: oregon
sentence: Nehalem's tales tell strangers and the discovery of objects such as pieces of beeswax and a smooth silver vase, probably linked to the wreck of San Francisco Xavier in 1707.

name: oregon
sentence: In 1843, an autonomous government was formed in the country of Oregon, and the territory of Oregon was created in 1848.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon became the 33rd state of the United States on February 14, 1859.

name: oregon
sentence: Today, with 4 million people over 98,000 square miles (250,000 km2), Oregon is the ninth and 27th most populous American state.

name: oregon
sentence: The capital, Salem, is the second most populated city in Oregon, with 169,798 inhabitants.

name: oregon
sentence: Portland, with 647,805, ranks 26th among American cities.

name: oregon
sentence: The metropolitan area of Portland, which also includes the city of Vancouver, Washington, to the north, is the 25th largest metropolitan area in the country, with a population of 2,453,168.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is one of the most geographically diverse states in the United States, characterized by volcanoes, abundant water bodies, dense, evergreen and mixed forests, as well as high deserts and semi-arid shrubs.

name: oregon
sentence: At 11,249 feet (3,429 m), Mount Hood, a stratovolcan, is the highest point in the state.

name: oregon
sentence: The only Oregon National Park, Crater Lake National Park, includes the caldera surrounding Crater Lake, the deepest lake in the United States.

name: oregon
sentence: The state is also home to the world's largest organism, Armillaria ostoyae, a fungus that flows under 2,200 acres (8.9 km2) of the national forest of Malheur.

name: oregon
sentence: Due to the diversity of its landscapes and waterways, Oregon's economy is largely fuelled by various forms of agriculture, fishing and hydroelectric power.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is also the largest contiguous US wood producer, and the wood industry dominated the state economy in the 20th century.

name: oregon
sentence: Technology is another major economic force in Oregon, starting in the 1970s with the creation of Silicon Forest and the expansion of Tektronix and Intel.

name: oregon
sentence: Nike, Inc., a sportswear company headquartered in Beverton, is the largest public corporation in the state with an annual turnover of $30.6 billion.

name: oregon
sentence: The first evidence of the name Oregon has Spanish origins.

name: oregon
sentence: The term "orejón" (which means "great ear") comes from the historical chronicle Relación de la Alta y Baja California (1598) written by the new Spanish Rodrigo Montezuma and refers to the Columbia River when Spanish explorers entered the current North American territory which became part of the Vice-royalty of New Spain.

name: oregon
sentence: This chronicle is the first topographical and linguistic source of the name Oregon place.

name: oregon
sentence: There are also two other sources of Spanish origin, such as the word oregano, which refers to a plant growing in the southern part of the region.

name: oregon
sentence: It is possible that the American territory was named by the Spaniards, because there is a stream in Spain called "Arroyo del Oregón" (which is located in the province of Ciudad Real); it is also possible that the "j" in the Spanish expression "El Orejón" was later corrupted into a "g", and in the context could refer to the "aurore" of the massive Columbia River at its mouth.

name: oregon
sentence: Another early use of the name, spelled Ouragon, was by Major Robert Rogers in a 1765 petition to the Kingdom of Great Britain.

name: oregon
sentence: The term refers to the then mythical West River (the Columbia River).

name: oregon
sentence: In 1778, the spelling had moved to Oregon.

name: oregon
sentence: Rogers wrote:

name: oregon

sentence: Cranberry cultivation in Oregon uses approximately 27,000 acres (110 square kilometres) in southern Coos and northern Curry counties, centred around the coastal town of Bandon.

name: oregon
sentence: In the northeastern part of the state, particularly around Pendleton, both irrigated and dry wheat are grown.

name: oregon
sentence: Farmers and farmers in Oregon also produce livestock, sheep, dairy products, eggs and poultry.

name: oregon
sentence: Large forests have historically made Oregon one of the country's leading timber and logging states, but forest fires (such as Tillamook Burn), overexploitation and prosecution for proper management of large federal forest operations have reduced the timber produced.

name: oregon
sentence: Between 1989 and 2011, the amount of timber harvested on Oregon federal lands decreased by approximately 90%, although harvest levels on private lands remained relatively constant.

name: oregon
sentence: Even the transition in recent years to finished products such as paper and construction materials has not slowed down the decline of the wood industry in the state.

name: oregon
sentence: The effects of this decline include the acquisition by Weyerhaeuser of Willamette Industries, based in Portland, in January 2002, the relocation of the headquarters of Louisiana Pacific from Portland to Nashville, and the decline of former cities of lumber companies such as Gilchrist.

name: oregon
sentence: Despite these changes, Oregon continues to lead the United States in timber production; in 2011, 4,134 million board feet (9,760,000 m3) were produced in Oregon, compared to 3,685 million board feet (8,700,000 m3) in Washington, D.C., 1,914 million board feet (4,520,000 m3) in Georgia and 1,708 million board feet (4,030,000 m3) in Mississippi.

name: oregon
sentence: The slowdown in the timber and lumber industry has led to high unemployment rates in rural areas.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon has one of the largest salmon fishing industries in the world, although ocean fisheries have reduced river fisheries in recent years.

name: oregon
sentence: Due to the abundance of the state's waterways, it is also a major producer of hydroelectric power.

name: oregon
sentence: Tourism is also a strong industry in the state.

name: oregon
sentence: Tourism focuses on the natural features of the state – mountains, forests, waterfalls, rivers, beaches and lakes, including Crater Lake National Park, Multnomah Falls, painted hills, Deschutes River and Oregon Caves.

name: oregon
sentence: Mount Hood and Mount Bachelor also attract visitors all year round for skiing and other snow activities.

name: oregon
sentence: Portland houses the Oregon Science and Industry Museum, the Portland Art Museum and the Oregon Zoo, which is the oldest zoo west of Mississippi.

name: oregon
sentence: The International Rose Test Garden is another important attraction in the city.

name: oregon
sentence: Portland has also been named the best city in the world for street food through several publications, including the US News & World Report and CNN.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is home to many breweries, and Portland has the largest number of breweries in every city in the world.

name: oregon
sentence: The coastal region of the State also produces important tourism.

name: oregon
sentence: The Oregon Coast Aquarium has 23 acres (9.3 ha) along Yaquina Bay in Newport and also houses Keiko the Orca Whale.

name: oregon
sentence: It has been noted as one of the top ten aquariums in North America.

name: oregon
sentence: Fort Clatsop of Warrenton houses a replica of the Lewis and Clark camp at the mouth of the Columbia River in 1805.

name: oregon
sentence: The sea lion caves in Florence are the largest system of sea caves in the United States, and also attract many visitors.

name: oregon
sentence: In southern Oregon, the Oregon Shakespeare Festival, held in Ashland, is also a tourist print, as is the Oregon Vortex and the Wolf Creek Inn State Heritage Site, a historic inn where Jack London wrote his 1913 Valley of the Moon novel.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon has also historically been a popular area for film shoots due to its diverse landscapes, as well as its proximity to Hollywood (see List of films shot in Oregon).

name: oregon
sentence: Movies filmed in Oregon include Animal House, Free Willy, The General, The Goonies, Kindergarten Cop, One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest, and Stand By Me.

name: oregon
sentence: Matt Groening, from Oregon, creator of the Simpsons, has incorporated many references from his hometown of Portland into the television series.

name: oregon
sentence: In addition, several television programmes have been filmed throughout the State, including Portlandia, Grimm, Bates Motel and Leverage.

name: oregon
sentence: The Oregon Film Museum is located in the former prison of Clatsop County in Astoria.

name: oregon
sentence: High-tech industries in Silicon Forest have been an important employer since the 1970s.

name: oregon
sentence: Tektronix was the largest private employer in Oregon until the late 1980s.

name: oregon
sentence: Intel's creation and expansion of several facilities in eastern Washington County continued the growth that Tektronix had begun.

name: oregon
sentence: Intel, the government's largest for-profit private employer, operates four large facilities, with Ronler Acres, Jones Farm and Hawthorn Farm all located in Hillsboro.

name: oregon
sentence: The spinoffs and startups produced by these two companies led to the creation of the so-called Silicon Forest.

name: oregon
sentence: The recession and collapse of 2001 hit the region hard.

name: oregon
sentence: Open Source Development Labs made news in 2004 when they hired Linus Torvalds, developer of the Linux kernel.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2010, the biotechnology giant Genentech opened a $400 million facility in Hillsboro to develop its production capacity.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is home to several large data centers that benefit from cheap energy and a climate conducive to reducing cooling costs.

name: oregon
sentence: Google operates a large data center in the Dalles, and Facebook built a large data center near Prineville in 2010.

name: oregon
sentence: Amazon opened a data centre near Boardman in 2011, and an execution centre in Troutdale in 2018.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is also home to large companies in other industries.

name: oregon
sentence: Nike's headquarters are located near Beaverton.

name: oregon
sentence: Medford is home to Harry and David, who sell gift items under several brands.

name: oregon
sentence: Medford is also home to Lithia Motors' national headquarters.

name: oregon
sentence: Portland is home to one of the largest book publishing houses in the West, Graphic Arts Center Publishing.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is also home to Mentor Graphics Corporation, a world leader in electronic design automation located in Wilsonville and employs approximately 4,500 people worldwide.

name: oregon
sentence: Adidas Corporations American Head Office is located in Portland and employs approximately 900 full-time workers on its Portland campus.

name: oregon
sentence: Nike, located in Beaverton, employs approximately 5,000 full-time employees on her 200-acre campus (81 ha).

name: oregon
sentence: Nike's Beaverton campus is continually ranked as a leading employer in the Portland area-with competitor Adidas.

name: oregon
sentence: Intel Corporation employs 18,600 people in Oregon, with the majority of these employees on Hillsboro campus approximately 30 minutes west of Portland.

name: oregon
sentence: Intel has been a leading employer in Oregon since 1974.

name: oregon
sentence: The health systems of the U.S. federal government and Providence are candidates for the best employers in Oregon, with approximately 12,000 federal workers and 14,000 Providence health workers.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2015, seven companies with headquarters in Oregon landed in Fortune 1000: Nike, at 106; Precision Castparts Corp. at 302; Lithia Motors at 482; StanCorp Financial Group at 804; Schnitzer Steel Industries at 853; The Greenbrier Companies at 948; and Columbia Sportswear at 982.

name: oregon
sentence: The state of Oregon's two-year budget of $2.6 billion in 2017 includes general funds, federal funds, lottery funds and other funds.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is one of the five states that do not have sales tax.

name: oregon
sentence: The Oregon voters were resolved in their opposition to a sales tax, voting on proposals each of the nine times they were presented.

name: oregon
sentence: The last vote for measure 1 in 1993 was rejected by a margin of 75 to 25 per cent.

name: oregon
sentence: The Government also has a minimum corporate tax of $150 per year, or 5.6 per cent of the General Fund for the biennium 2005-2007; data on companies that pay the minimum are not publicly available.

name: oregon
sentence: Consequently, the State relies on property tax and income tax for its revenues.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon has the fifth highest personal income tax in the nation.

name: oregon
sentence: According to the U.S. Census Bureau, Oregon ranked 41st among the 50 states in per capita taxes in 2005, with an average of $1,791.45.

name: oregon
sentence: Some local governments impose sales taxes on services: the city of Ashland, for example, collects a 5% sales tax on prepared foods.

name: oregon
sentence: The City of Portland imposes a tax on artistic education and access to income on residents over 18 years of age, a flat-rate tax of $35 on individuals who earn $1,000 or more per year and reside in a household whose annual income exceeds the level of federal poverty.

name: oregon
sentence: The tax finances teachers at the Portland School and not-for-profit arts organizations in Portland.

name: oregon
sentence: The State of Oregon also authorizes the transit district to levy income tax on employers and self-employed persons.

name: oregon
sentence: The State currently collects the tax for TriMet and the transit district of Lane.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is one of six states with income limits.

name: oregon
sentence: The "kicker law" states that where income tax collections exceed the estimates of government economists by two per cent or more, any surplus must be returned to taxpayers.

name: oregon
sentence: Since the enactment of the Act in 1979, refunds have been granted for seven of the eleven bienniums.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2000, Ballot Measure 86 converted the law's "kicker" law into the Constitution of Oregon and amended some of its provisions.

name: oregon
sentence: Federal payments to county governments that were made to replace softwood lumber revenues when logging in national forests was restricted in the 1990s have been at risk of suspension for several years.

name: oregon
sentence: This issue dominates the future income of rural counties, which now depend on payments for essential services.

name: oregon
sentence: 55 per cent of public revenues are spent on public education, 23 per cent on human services (child welfare services, Medicaid and high-level services), 17 per cent on public security and 5 per cent on other services.

name: oregon
sentence: With respect to health insurance, Cambia Health Solutions in 2018 has the highest market share at 21%, followed by Providence Health.

name: oregon
sentence: In the Portland area, Kaiser Permanente leads.

name: oregon
sentence: Providence and Kaiser are vertically integrated delivery systems that operate hospitals and offer insurance plans.

name: oregon
sentence: Apart from Providence and Kaiser, hospital systems that are mainly based in Oregon include Legacy Health covering mainly Portland, Samaritan Health Services with five hospitals in different parts of the state, and Tuality Healthcare in the western Portland metropolitan area.

name: oregon
sentence: In southern Oregon, Asante runs several hospitals, including the Rogue Regional Medical Centre.

name: oregon
sentence: Some hospitals are run by multi-state organizations such as PeaceHealth and CommonSpirit Health.

name: oregon
sentence: Some hospitals such as Salem Hospital operate independently of larger systems.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon Health & Science University is a medical school in Portland that runs two hospitals and clinics.

name: oregon
sentence: The Oregon Health Plan is the government's Medicaid-managed care plan, and is known for its innovations.

name: oregon
sentence: The Portland Region is a well-managed health care centre and two-thirds of all health insurance registrants are part of the Medicare Advantage plans.

name: oregon
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the population of Oregon was 4,217,737 on July 1, 2019, an increase of 10.09 per cent over the 2010 census.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2014, Oregon was the country's "best move destination", with two families settling in the state for each family (from 66.4% to 33.6%).

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon was also the first mobile destination in 2013, and the second most popular destination in 2010-2012.

name: oregon
sentence: At the 2010 census, the population of Oregon was 3,831,074.

name: oregon
sentence: The gender composition of the State was 49.5 per cent for men and 50.5 per cent for women.

name: oregon
sentence: 22.6% of the population was under the age of 18.

name: oregon
sentence: The table below shows the racial composition of the Oregon population in 2016.

name: oregon
sentence: According to the 2016 U.S. Community Survey, 12.4% of the population of Oregon were of Hispanic or Latin origin (of any race): Mexican (10.4%), Puerto Rican (0.3%), Cuban (0.1%) and other Hispanic or Latin origin (1.5%).

name: oregon
sentence: The five largest ancestry groups were German (19.1%), Irish (11.7%), English (11.3%), American (5.3%) and Norwegian (3.8%).

name: oregon
sentence: The most populous ethnic group in the state, non-Hispanic white, increased from 95.8% in 1970 to 77.8% in 2012.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2011, 38.7% of children under one year of age in Oregon belonged to minority groups, which means that they had at least one parent who was not a non-Hispanic white.

name: oregon
sentence: Of the total population of the State, 22.6 per cent were under 18 years of age and 77.4 per cent were 18 years of age or older.

name: oregon
sentence: The population centre of Oregon is located in the county of Linn, in the city of Lyon.

name: oregon
sentence: About 60% of Oregon's population lives in the Portland metropolitan area.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2009, the population of Oregon had 361,393 foreign-born residents.

name: oregon
sentence: Among foreign-born residents, the three largest groups originated from countries: Latin America (47.8 per cent), Asia (27.4 per cent) and Europe (16.5 per cent).

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon has often been cited by statistical agencies as having a lower percentage of religious communities than other American states.

name: oregon
sentence: According to a 2009 Gallup poll, Oregon was paired in Vermont as the two "less religious" states in the United States.

name: oregon
sentence: In the same Gallup 2009 poll, 69% of Oregonans identified themselves as Christians.

name: oregon
sentence: The largest Christian denominations in Oregon by the number of adherents in 2010 were the Roman Catholic Church with 398,738; the Church of Jesus Christ of the saints of the last days with 147,965; and the assemblies of God with 45,492.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon also contains the largest community of old Russian believers in the United States.

name: oregon
sentence: Judaism is the largest non-Christian religion in Oregon with more than 50,000 adherents, of whom 47,000 live in the Portland region.

name: oregon
sentence: Recently, new kosher foods and Jewish educational offerings have led to a rapid increase in the Orthodox Jewish population of Portland.

name: oregon
sentence: The Tibetan Cultural Association of the Northwest has its headquarters in Portland.

name: oregon
sentence: It is estimated that there are between 6,000 and 10,000 Muslims in Oregon, most of whom live in and around Portland.

name: oregon
sentence: Most of the rest of the population had no religious affiliation; the 2008 American Religious Identification Survey (ARIS) placed Oregon as the fifth largest non-religious state in the United States, with the highest percentage of residents declaring themselves "non-religious" at 24 per cent.

name: oregon
sentence: Secular organizations include the Investigation Centre (CFI), the Humanists of the Greater Portland (HGP) and the Atheists of the United States (USA).

name: oregon
sentence: During most of the 1990s, a group of conservative Christians formed the Oregon Citizens Alliance, and unsuccessfully tried to pass a law to prevent "gay sensitivity training" in public schools and legal advantages for homosexual couples.

name: oregon
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau projections show that Oregon's population has increased to 4,833,918 by 2030, an increase of 41.3 per cent from the state population of 3,421,399 in 2000.

name: oregon
sentence: The State projections estimate a total population of 5,425,408 in 2040.

name: oregon
sentence: During the 2013–14 school year, there were 567,000 students in public schools.

name: oregon
sentence: There were 197 public school districts served by 19 educational services districts.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2016, the largest school districts in the state were Portland Public Schools, with 47,323 students; Salem-Keizer School District, with 40,565 students; Beaverton School District, with 39,625 students; Hillsboro School District, with 21,118 students; and North Clackamas School District, with 17,053 students.

name: oregon
sentence: Approximately 90.5% of Oregon high school students completed their studies, which improved from the national average of 88.3% as of the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: oregon
sentence: In particular, since the adoption in 1990 of measure 5, which sets limits to property tax levels, Oregon has made efforts to finance higher education.

name: oregon
sentence: Since then, Oregon has reduced its higher education budget and is now ranked 46th in the country in state spending per student.

name: oregon
sentence: However, the 2007 legislation funded the university system well beyond the budget requested by the Governor, although it continues to cap tuition fee increases to 3% per year.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon supports a total of seven public universities and one subsidiary.

name: oregon
sentence: It is home to three public research universities: the University of Oregon (UO) in Eugene and the University of Oregon (OSU) in Corvallis, both classified as research universities with a very high research activity, and the State University of Portland, which is classified as a research university with a high research activity.

name: oregon
sentence: UO is the highest national public university and the most selective in the state by US News & World Report and Forbes.

name: oregon
sentence: The USO is the only state university to receive land grants, has the highest state registration in the fall of 2014, and is the highest university in the state according to the academic rankings of world universities, Washington Monthly and QS World University Rankings.

name: oregon
sentence: The SSO receives more annual research funding than all other public higher education institutions in Oregon.

name: oregon
sentence: The Portland State Urban University of the State has the second largest number of enrolments in Oregon.

name: oregon
sentence: The state has three regional universities: Western Oregon University in Monmouth, Southern Oregon University in Ashland and Eastern Oregon University in La Grande.

name: oregon
sentence: The Oregon Institute of Technology has its campus in Klamath Falls.

name: oregon
sentence: The quasi-public Oregon Health & Science University (OHSU) includes medical, dental and nursing schools, as well as graduate programs in biomedical sciences in Portland and a science and engineering school in Hillsboro.

name: oregon
sentence: The state also supports 17 community colleges.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is home to a wide variety of private colleges, most of which are located in the Portland area.

name: oregon
sentence: The University of Portland and Marylhurst University are two Catholic universities located in or near Portland, affiliated with the Congregation of the Holy Cross, and the Sisters of the Holy Names of Jesus and Mary, respectively.

name: oregon
sentence: Reed College, a rigorous liberal arts college in Portland, was ranked by Forbes as the 52nd best college in the country in 2015.

name: oregon
sentence: Other private institutions in Portland include Lewis & Clark College; Multnomah University; Portland Bible College; Warner Pacific College; Cascade College; National University of Natural Medicine; and Western Seminary, a graduate school in theology.

name: oregon
sentence: The University of the Pacific is located in the suburbs of Portland, Forest Grove.

name: oregon
sentence: There are also private colleges to the south in the Willamette Valley.

name: oregon
sentence: McMinnville is home to Linfield College, while Newberg is home to George Fox University.

name: oregon
sentence: Salem is home to two private schools: Willamette University (the oldest in the state, established during the provisional period) and Corban University.

name: oregon
sentence: Also located near Salem is Mount Angel Seminary, one of the largest Roman Catholic seminars in America.

name: oregon
sentence: The second state medical school, the Pacific College of Osteopathic Medicine, in the Northwest, is located in Lebanon.

name: oregon
sentence: Eugene is home to three private colleges: Northwest Christian University, New Hope Christian College and Gutenberg College.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is home to three major professional sports teams: the NBA Portland Trail Blazers, the NWSL Portland Thorns and the MLS Portland Timbers.

name: oregon
sentence: Until 2011, the only major professional sports team in Oregon was the Portland Trail Blazers of the National Basketball Association.

name: oregon
sentence: Between the 1970s and the 1990s, the Blazers were one of the NBA's most successful teams in terms of victories and participation.

name: oregon
sentence: At the beginning of the 21st century, the popularity of the team declined due to staff and financial problems, but resumed after the departure of controversial players and the acquisition of new players such as Brandon Roy and LaMarcus Aldridge, and even later Damian Lillard.

name: oregon
sentence: The Blazers play in the Moda Center in the Lloyd District of Portland, which is also home to the Portland Winterhawks of the Western Junior Hockey League.

name: oregon
sentence: The Portland Timbers play at Providence Park, just west of downtown Portland.

name: oregon
sentence: The Timbers have a strong track, the team regularly sells its games.

name: oregon
sentence: In the fall of 2010, the Timbers reorganized the old multi-purpose stadium into a soccer-specific stadium, increasing the number of seats.

name: oregon
sentence: The Timbers operate Portland Thorns FC, a women's soccer team that has played in the National Women's Soccer League since the first season of the league in 2013.

name: oregon
sentence: The Thorns, who also play at Providence Park, won two league championships during the inaugural 2013 season and also in 2017, and were by far the leader of the NWSL's presence in each of the league's seasons.

name: oregon
sentence: Eugene, Salem and Hillsboro have minor baseball teams: Emeralds Eugene, Volcans Salem-Keizer and Hillsboro Hops all play in the Northwest League.

name: oregon
sentence: Portland has already had minor baseball teams in the past, including the Portland Beavers and the Portland Rockies, who played most recently at Providence Park when it was known as PGE Park.

name: oregon
sentence: The football teams of the Beavers of the state of Oregon and the Ducks of the University of Oregon of the conference Pac-12 meet each year during the civil war.

name: oregon
sentence: The two schools also had recent success in other sports: the state of Oregon won consecutive college baseball championships in 2006 and 2007, winning a third in 2018; and the University of Oregon won consecutive NCAA men's cross-country championships in 2007 and 2008.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania (German: Pennsilfaani), officially the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, is a state in the Middle Atlantic, Appalachian and Great Lakes regions of the Northeastern United States.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Commonwealth is bordered by Delaware in the southeast, Maryland in the south, West Virginia in the southwest, Ohio in the west, Lake Erie and the Canadian province of Ontario in the northwest, New York in the north, and New Jersey in the east, while Appalachians cross its middle.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania is the 33rd state by region and the 5th most populous state according to the last official census of the United States in 2010.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: It is the ninth densely populated of the 50 states.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The two most populous cities in Pennsylvania are Philadelphia (1,580,863) and Pittsburgh (302,407).

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The capital of the state and its 13th largest city is Harrisburg.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania has 225 kilometres of seafront along Lake Erie and the Delaware River.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The state was one of the 13 original founding states of the United States; it was born in 1681 following a royal grant of land to William Penn, the son of the name of the state.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Part of Pennsylvania (along the Delaware River), as well as the present state of Delaware, had already been organized as the colony of New Sweden.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: It was the second state to ratify the United States Constitution on 12 December 1787.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Independence Hall, where the United States Declaration of Independence and the United States Constitution have been drafted, is located in Philadelphia, the largest city in the state.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: During the American Civil War, the Battle of Gettysburg was conducted in the southern central region of the state.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Valley Forge near Philadelphia was the seat of General Washington during the bitter winter of 1777–78.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania is 274 km north to south and 455 km east to west.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Of a total of 46,055 square miles (119,282 km2), 44,817 square miles (116,075 km2) are land, 490 square miles (1,269 km2) are inland waters and 749 square miles (1,940 km2) are waters of Lake Erie.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: It is the 33rd state of the United States.Pennsylvania has 82 km of coastline along Lake Erie and 92 km of coastline along the Delaware estuary.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Of the 13 colonies of origin, Pennsylvania is the only state not bordering the Atlantic Ocean.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The boundaries of the state are the Mason-Dixon line (39°43'N) to the south, the 12-mile circle on the Pennsylvania-Delaware border, the Delaware River to the east, 80°31'W to the west and 42°N to the north, except for a short segment at the west end, where a triangle extends north to Lake Erie.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The cities include Philadelphia, Reading, Lebanon and Lancaster in the southeast, Pittsburgh in the southwest, the three cities of Allentown, Bethlehem and Easton in the east (called the Lehigh Valley).

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The northeast includes the former coal towns of Scranton, Wilkes-Barre, Pittston, Nanticoke and Hazleton.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Erie is located in the northwest.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: State College serves the central region while Williamsport serves the north-central Commonwealth region, as well as Chambersburg, the north-central region, with York, Carlisle, and the state capital Harrisburg, on the Susquehanna River, in the eastern central Commonwealth region, and Altoona and Johnstown, in the north-eastern central region.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The state has five geographical regions, namely the Allegheny plateau, the ridge and valley, the Atlantic coastal plain, Piedmont and the Erie plain.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania's diverse topography also produces a variety of climates, although the entire state is experiencing cold winters and wet summers.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: With the exception of the southeast corner, the continental climate is humid (Köppen Dfa climate classification).

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The southern part of the state has a humid subtropical climate.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The largest city, Philadelphia, has some features of the wet subtropical climate (Köppen Cfa) which covers much of Delaware and Maryland to the south.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Summers are usually warm and humid.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Towards the mountainous interior of the state, the winter climate becomes colder, the number of cloudy days increases and snowfall is greater.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The western regions of the state, particularly those near Lake Erie, can receive more than 100 inches (250 cm) of snow each year, and the entire state receives heavy rainfall throughout the year.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The condition can be subjected to extreme weather conditions from spring to summer to fall.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: tornadoes occur every year in the state, sometimes in large numbers, like 30 tornadoes recorded in 2011; in general, these tornadoes do not cause significant damage.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Historically, from 1600 onward, the tribes living in Pennsylvania were the Algonquians Lenape (also Delaware), the Iroquoians Susquehannock, and Petun (also Tiontati, Kentatentonga, Tobacco, Wenro) and probably Siouan Monongahela Culture, which may have been the same as a little-known tribe called Calicua, or Cali.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The other tribes that entered the region during the colonial era were the Trockwae, Tutelo, Saponi, Shawnee, Nanticoke, Conoy Piscataway, Iroquois Confederacy, probably among others.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Other tribes, such as the Erie, may have once held land in Pennsylvania, but have not done so by 1600.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Both the Dutch and the English claim the two banks of the Delaware River as part of their colonial lands in America.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Dutch were the first to take possession.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: On 3 June 1631 the Dutch had begun to settle in the Delmarva peninsula by establishing the Zwaanendael settlement at the current Lewes site, Delaware.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: In 1638, Sweden established the colony of New Sweden in the Fort Christina area at the current Wilmington site in Delaware.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: New Sweden has claimed and, for the most part, controlled the lower Delaware area (parts of the current Delaware, New Jersey and Pennsylvania) but has established few settlers there.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: On 12 March 1664 King Charles II of England granted James, Duke of York, a concession incorporating all the lands included in the Virginia Company of Plymouth Grant and other lands.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: This subsidy was in conflict with the Dutch claim for New Netherlands, which included parts of today's Pennsylvania.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: On June 24, 1664, the Duke of York sold to John Berkeley and George Carter and the portion of his grand concession that included the present-day New Jersey for an exclusive colony.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The land was not yet in British possession, but the sale was boxed in the part of New Newfoundland on the west side of the Delaware River.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The British conquest of New Netherlands began on August 29, 1664, when New Amsterdam was forced to surrender while facing guns on British ships in New York Harbor.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: This conquest continued, and ended in October 1664, when the British captured Fort Casimir in what is now the New Castle, Delaware.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Breda's peace between England, France and the Netherlands confirmed the English conquest on 21 July 1667, although there were temporary reversions.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: On 12 Sept. 1672, during the Third Anglo-Dutch War, the Dutch regained the colony of New York/New Amsterdam, creating three county courts, which became counties of origin in the present Delaware and Pennsylvania.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The one that was then transferred to Pennsylvania was Upland.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: This was partially reversed on February 9, 1674, when the Treaty of Westminster ended the Third Anglo-Dutch War, and returned all political situations to the status quo ante bellum.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The British kept Dutch counties with their Dutch names.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: On 11 June 1674 New York renewed control over the outlying colonies, including Upland, but the names began to be changed to British names on 11 November 1674.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Upland was partitioned on November 12, 1674, producing the general outline of the current border between Pennsylvania and Delaware.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: On 28 Feb. 1681 Charles II granted a land charter to William Penn to repay a debt of £16,000 (about £2,100,000 in 2008, retail inflation adjustment) due to William's father, Admiral William Penn.

sentence: Residents paid a total of $83.7 billion in state and local taxes, with an average per capita of $4,589 per year.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Residents share 76% of the total tax burden.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Many state politicians have tried to increase the share of taxes paid by public sources.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Suggested revenue sources include taxation of natural gas drilling since Pennsylvania is the only state without such a gas drilling tax.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Other revenue prospects include the imposition of tolls on interstate highways, in particular Interstate 80, which is widely used by out-of-state commuters with high maintenance costs.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Sales taxes account for 39% of Commonwealth revenues, personal income taxes 34%, motor vehicle taxes about 12% and taxes on cigarettes and alcoholic beverages 5%.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Personal income tax is 3.07 per cent.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: An individual's taxable income is based on the following eight types of income: remuneration (salary); interest; dividends; net profits from the operation of a business, profession or farm; net gains or income from the disposition of property; net gains or income from rents, royalties, patents and copyrights; income from estates or trusts; and gambling and lottery gains (other than Pennsylvania lottery gains).

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Counties, municipalities and school districts collect property taxes.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: In addition, some local bodies apply a salary tax on the income of natural persons.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: In general, the total wage tax rate is capped at 1% of income, but some municipalities with housing charters may require more than 1%.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Thirty-two of the sixty-seven Commonwealth counties impose a personal property tax on shares, bonds and similar assets.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: With the exception of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, municipalities and school districts are authorized to enact a local income tax under Act 32.

name: pennsylvania

name: pennsylvania

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Residents of Philadelphia who have self-employment income are required to file a Net Profit Tax (NFT) return, while those with business income from Philadelphia are required to obtain a Commercial Activity Licence (CAL) and pay the Business Income and Revenue Tax (BITT) and the NPT.

name: pennsylvania

sentence: Pennsylvania has been known as the state of Keystone since 1802, partly based on its central location among the 13 colonies of origin forming the United States, and partly due to the number of important American documents signed in the state (such as the Declaration of Independence).

name: rhode_island
sentence: Rhode Island is a state in the New England region of the United States of America.

name: rhode_island
sentence: It is the smallest U.S. state by region and the seventh least populous (1,059,361 in 2019), but it is also the second most populous state behind New Jersey.

name: rhode_island
sentence: The state takes its name from Rhode Island; however, most of the state is located on the continent.

name: rhode_island
sentence: The state has land borders with Connecticut to the west, Massachusetts to the north and east, and the Atlantic Ocean to the south via Rhode Island Sound and Block Island Sound.

name: rhode_island
sentence: It also shares a small maritime border with New York.

name: rhode_island
sentence: Providence is the capital of the state and the most populated city of Rhode Island.

name: rhode_island
sentence: On 4 May 1776 the colony of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations was the first of the thirteen colonies to renounce allegiance to the British Crown, and it was the fourth state to ratify the statutes of Confederation on 9 Feb. 1778.

name: rhode_island
sentence: The State boycotted the convention of 1787, which established the United States Constitution and refused to ratify it; it was the last of the 13 States of origin to do so on 29 May 1790.

name: rhode_island
sentence: State of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations since joining the Union in 1790, state voters approved an amendment to the state constitution in November 2020, renamed Rhode Island State.

name: rhode_island
sentence: This change came into effect when the results were certified on November 30, 2020.

name: rhode_island
sentence: Rhode Island's official nickname is "The Ocean State", a reference to large bays and entrances that account for about 14 percent of its total area.

name: rhode_island
sentence: Despite its name, most of Rhode Island is located on the American continent.

name: rhode_island
sentence: Prior to 2020, the state's official name was State of Rhode Island and Providence Plants, which resulted from the merger of four colonial colonies.

name: rhode_island
sentence: The Newport and Portsmouth colonies were located on what is now known as Aquidneck Island, but were called Rhode Island in colonial times.

name: rhode_island
sentence: Providence Plantation was the name of the colony founded by Roger Williams in the capital of the State of Providence.

name: rhode_island
sentence: This was joined by the Warwick colony

name: rhode_island
sentence: It is not clear how the island became Rhode Island, but two historical events may have been of influence:

name: rhode_island
sentence: The first documented use of the name "Rhode Island" for Aquidneck was in 1637 by Roger Williams.

name: rhode_island
sentence: The name was officially applied to the island in 1644 with these words: "Aquethneck will now be called the island of Rodes or Rhode-Island."

name: rhode_island
sentence: The name "Isle of Rodes" was used in a legal document as early as 1646.

name: rhode_island
sentence: The Dutch maps from 1659 called the island "Red Island" (Roodt Eylant).

name: rhode_island
sentence: The first English colony on Rhode Island was the town of Providence, which Narragansett granted to Roger Williams in 1636.

name: rhode_island
sentence: At that time Williams did not obtain any permission from the English crown, because he believed that the English had no legitimate claims on the territory of Narragansett and Wampanoag.

name: rhode_island
sentence: In 1643, however, he asked Charles I of England to grant Providence and neighbouring cities a colonial patent because of the threats of invasion of the Boston and Plymouth colonies.

name: rhode_island
sentence: He used the name "Providence Plantations" in his petition, the plantation being the English term for a colony.

name: rhode_island
sentence: "Providence Plantations" was therefore the official name of the colony from 1643 to 1663, when a new charter was issued.

name: rhode_island
sentence: In 1790, following the American Revolution, the new state incorporated both Rhode Island and Providence Plants, becoming known as the State of Rhode Island and Providence Plants.

name: rhode_island
sentence: The word plantation in the name of the state became a disputed issue during the 20th century and the increased awareness of slavery and its role in the history of Rhode Island.

name: rhode_island
sentence: The General Assembly voted on 25 June 2009 to hold a general referendum scheduled for November 2010 to determine whether "and the plantations of Providence" would be abandoned by the official name.

name: rhode_island
sentence: Supporters of plantation excision claimed that the word symbolized an alleged legacy of the abandonment of the right to vote for many inhabitants of Rhode Island, as well as the proliferation of slavery in the colonies and in the post-colonial United States.

name: rhode_island
sentence: The supporters of maintaining the name maintained that the plantation was an archaic synonym of colony and had no connection with slavery.

name: rhode_island
sentence: Referendum elections were held on 2 November 2010 and the majority of the people voted (78% to 22%) to retain the original name as a whole.

name: rhode_island
sentence: On June 19, 2020, Senator Harold Metts introduced a resolution for another referendum on the vote to delete the words "and Providence Plants" from the name of the state, saying, "Whatever the meaning of the term "plantations" in the context of Rhode Island's history, it bears a horrific connotation when we consider the tragic and racist history of our nation."

name: rhode_island
sentence: On 22 June 2020, the Governor of Rhode Island, Gina Raimondo, issued a decree to remove the "plantations of evidence" from a series of official documents and government websites.On 16 July 2020, in the midst of George Floyd's demonstrations and national calls to combat systemic racism, the resolution referring the issue to voters was adopted by the two chambers of the Rhode Island General Assembly.

name: rhode_island
sentence: The vote was 69-1 in the House of Representatives and 35-0 in the Senate.

name: rhode_island
sentence: The change was approved by voters 52.8 per cent to 47.2 per cent in the US 2020 elections, and will take effect on the final certification of election results.

name: rhode_island
sentence: In 1636 Roger Williams was banished from the Massachusetts Bay colony for his religious opinions, and he settled at the top of Narragansett Bay on land sold or donated by Narragansett sachem Canonicus.

name: rhode_island
sentence: He named the Providence site, "having a sense of the merciful providence of God for me in my distress," and it became a place of religious freedom where all were welcome.

name: rhode_island
sentence: In 1638 Anne Hutchinson, William Codington, John Clarke, Philip Sherman and other religious dissidents settled on Aquidneck Island (then called Rhode Island), which was purchased from local tribes that called it Pocasset.

name: rhode_island
sentence: The colony was called Portsmouth and was governed by the Portsmouth Compact.

name: rhode_island

sentence: The government's main agricultural products are tobacco, poultry, cotton, livestock, dairy products, soybeans, hay, rice and pork.

sentence: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, as of March 2012, South Carolina had 1,852,700 non-agricultural jobs, including 12 per cent in manufacturing, 11.5 per cent in recreation and hospitality, 19 per cent in trade, transport and public services, and 11.8 per cent in education and health services.

name: south_carolina
sentence: The service sector accounts for 83.7% of South Carolina's economy.

name: south_carolina
sentence: Many large companies have moved their location to South Carolina.

name: south_carolina
sentence: Boeing opened an aircraft manufacturing plant in Charleston in 2011, which is one of the last two assembly sites at 787 Dreamliner.

name: south_carolina
sentence: South Carolina is a state of the right to work and many companies use recruitment agencies to temporarily fill positions.

name: south_carolina
sentence: Domtar, Rock Hill, is the only Fortune 500 company based in South Carolina.

name: south_carolina
sentence: The list of Fortune 1000 includes SCANA, Sonoco Products and ScanSource.

name: south_carolina
sentence: South Carolina also benefits from foreign investment.

name: south_carolina
sentence: There are 1,950 foreign companies in South Carolina employing nearly 135,000 people.

name: south_carolina
sentence: Foreign direct investment (FDI) contributed $1.06 billion to the government economy in 2010.

name: south_carolina
sentence: Since 1994, BMW has owned a production plant in Spartanburg County near Greer and since 1996, the Zapp Group has operated in Summerville near Charleston.

name: south_carolina
sentence: There are 36 television channels (including PBS affiliates) serving South Carolina with terrestrial access, and some online streaming.

name: south_carolina
sentence: The markets in which the stations are located include Columbia, Florence, Allendale, Myrtle Beach, Greenville, Charleston, Conway, Beaufort, Hardeeville, Spartanburg, Greenwood, Anderson and Sumter.

name: south_carolina
sentence: The State has the fourth largest state system in the country, consisting of 11 Interstates, numbered highways, State roads and secondary roads, totalling approximately 41,500 miles.

name: south_carolina
sentence: On secondary roads, South Carolina uses a numbering system to follow all non-interstate and primary roads maintained by the Department of Transport of South Carolina.

name: south_carolina
sentence: Secondary roads are numbered by the county number followed by a unique number for the particular road.

name: south_carolina
sentence: Amtrak passenger train operates four passenger routes in South Carolina: Crescent, Palmetto, Silver Meteor and Silver Star.

name: south_carolina
sentence: The Crescent Road serves the cities of Upstate, the silver star serves the cities of Midlands, and the Palmetto and Silver Meteor roads serve the towns of Lower Countries.

name: south_carolina
sentence: Station stops

name: south_carolina
sentence: FreightCSX Transportation and Norfolk Southern are the only Class I railway companies in South Carolina, as other state freight companies are short lines.

name: south_carolina
sentence: There are seven major airports in South Carolina, all regional airport centres.

name: south_carolina
sentence: Charleston International Airport is the most frequented by passengers.

name: south_carolina
sentence: In North Carolina, Charlotte/Douglas International Airport is the 30th busiest airport in the world, in terms of passengers.

name: south_carolina
sentence: In 2010, South Carolina was one of three states that did not agree to use competitive international mathematics and language standards.

name: south_carolina
sentence: In 2014, the South Carolina Supreme Court ruled that the State had failed to provide "minimally adequate" education to children in all parts of the State, as required by the constitution of the State.

name: south_carolina
sentence: South Carolina has 1,144 K-12 schools in 85 school districts, of which 712,244 were enrolled in the fall of 2009.

name: south_carolina
sentence: Since the 2008-2009 school year, South Carolina has spent $9,450 per student, placing it 31st in the country for expenditures per student.

name: south_carolina
sentence: In 2015, the national SAT average was 1490 and the South Carolina average was 1442, 48 points below the national average.

name: south_carolina
sentence: South Carolina is the only state that owns and operates a state-wide school bus system.

name: south_carolina
sentence: As of December 2016, the State had a fleet of 5,582 buses, the average vehicle in service being 15 years old (the national average is six) having travelled 236 000 miles.

name: south_carolina
sentence: Half of the state's school buses are over 15 years old and some would be up to 30 years old.

name: south_carolina
sentence: In 2017, in the proposed budget, Education Superintendent Molly Spearman asked the government lease to buy 1,000 buses to replace the most decrepit vehicles.

name: south_carolina
sentence: An additional 175 buses could be purchased immediately under the Crown Treasurer's Master Lease Program.

name: south_carolina
sentence: On January 5, 2017, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency granted South Carolina more than $1.1 million to replace 57 school buses with new cleaner models through its Diesel Emissions Reduction Act.

name: south_carolina
sentence: South Carolina has a variety of institutions, ranging from large state-funded research universities to small colleges that cultivate liberal arts, religious or military traditions.

name: south_carolina
sentence: For all health care, South Carolina ranks 33rd out of 50 states, according to the Commonwealth Fund, a private health foundation that strives to improve the health care system.

name: south_carolina
sentence: According to the Kaiser Family Foundation, the teenage birth rate was 53 births per 1,000 adolescents, compared with the national average of 41.9 births.

name: south_carolina
sentence: The State infant mortality rate was 9.4 deaths per 1,000 births, compared with a national average of 6.9 deaths.

name: south_carolina
sentence: There were 2.6 physicians per 1,000 people compared to the national average of 3.2 physicians.

name: south_carolina
sentence: Spending of $5,114 on per capita health expenditures in the government was compared to the national average of $5,283.

name: south_carolina
sentence: There were 26 per cent of children and 13 per cent of seniors living in poverty in the state, compared to 23 per cent and 13 per cent, respectively, in the United States and 34 per cent of children were overweight or obese, compared to the national average of 32 per cent.

name: south_carolina
