name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is an American state located in the Midwest region of the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: It bears the names of the indigenous tribes Lakota and Dakota Sioux, which make up a large part of the population and historically dominate the territory.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is the seventeenth largest by region, but the fifth least populated, and the fifth least dense of the 50 United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: As a southern part of the former Dakota territory, South Dakota became a state on November 2, 1889, along with North Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: It is the 39th or 40th State admitted to union.

name: south_dakota
sentence: President Benjamin Harrison modified the state documents before signing them so that no one would know who became a state first.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Pierre is the capital of the state and Sioux Falls, with a population of about 187,200 inhabitants, is the largest city in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is bordered by the states of North Dakota (north), Minnesota (east), Iowa (southeast), Nebraska (south), Wyoming (west) and Montana (northwest).

name: south_dakota
sentence: The state is divided by the Missouri River, dividing South Dakota into two geographically and socially distinct halves, known to residents as "East" and "West".

name: south_dakota
sentence: Eastern South Dakota is home to most of the state's population, and fertile soil in the region is used to cultivate a variety of crops.

name: south_dakota
sentence: To the west of Missouri, livestock is the predominant agricultural activity and the economy is more dependent on tourism and defence spending.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Most of the Amerindian reserves are in the West River.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Black Hills, a group of low-covered mountains of sacred pines in the Sioux, are located in the southwest part of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Mount Rushmore, a major tourist destination, is here.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has a temperate continental climate, with four distinct seasons and moderate precipitation in the east to semi-arids in the west.

name: south_dakota
sentence: State ecology presents species typical of a biome of the North American prairies.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Humans lived in the area for several millennia, with Sioux becoming dominant in the early 19th century.

name: south_dakota
sentence: At the end of the 19th century, Euro-American colonization intensified after a gold rush in the Black Hills and the construction of eastern railways.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Minors and enlisted settlers triggered a number of Indian wars, ending in the wounding of the knee in 1890.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The main events of the 20th century were the Dust Bowl and the Great Depression, the increase in federal spending in the 1940s and 1950s for agriculture and defence, and an industrialization of agriculture that reduced family farming.

name: south_dakota
sentence: While several Democrats have represented South Dakota for multiple terms in both chambers of Congress, the government of the state is largely controlled by the Republican Party, whose candidates have carried South Dakota to each of the last 13 presidential elections.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Historically dominated by an agricultural economy and a rural lifestyle, South Dakota has recently sought to diversify its economy in the regions to attract and retain residents.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The history and rural character of South Dakota still strongly influence the culture of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is located in the north central United States and is considered to be part of the Midwest by the United States Census Bureau and is also part of the Great Plains region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Western South Dakota's culture, economy and geography have more in common with the west than the Midwest.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has a total area of 77 116 square miles (199730 km2), making the State the 17th largest in the Union.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Black Elk Peak, formerly called Harney Peak, with an altitude of 7,242 ft (2,207 m), is the highest point in the state, while the shore of Big Stone Lake is the lowest, with an altitude of 966 ft (294 m).

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is bordered to the north by North Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The geographic center of the United States is 27 km west of Castle Rock in Butte County.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The North American continental pole of inaccessibility is located between Allen and Kyle, 1024 mi (1,648 km) from the nearest coastline.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Missouri River is the largest and longest river in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Cheyenne, James, Big Sioux and White rivers are other important rivers in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The eastern South Dakota has many natural lakes, created mainly by periods of glaciation.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In addition, the Missouri River dams create four large reservoirs: Oahe Lake, Sharpe Lake, Francis Case Lake, Lewis Lake and Clark Lake.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is generally divided into three regions: Eastern South Dakota, Western South Dakota and Black Hills.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Missouri River serves as a boundary in terms of geographic, social and political differences between eastern and western South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The geography of the Black Hills, long considered sacred by the Amerindians, differs from its environment to such an extent that it can be considered distinct from the rest of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Sometimes, the black hills are combined with the rest of western South Dakota, and people often refer to the two resulting regions, divided by the Missouri River, the West River and the East River.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Eastern South Dakota generally has higher precipitation and lower topography than the western part of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The smaller geographic areas of this region include the Prairie Coteau, the Dissolved Till Plains and the James River Valley.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Prairie Coteau is a plateau bordered to the east by the Minnesota River Valley and to the west by the James River Basin.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Further to the west, the James River basin is mainly low, flat and heavily eroded land, following the James River flow through South Dakota from north to south.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Till Dissected Plains, an area of hilly hills and fertile soils that cover much of Iowa and Nebraska, extend into the southeast corner of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The layers deposited during the Pleistocene era, about two million years ago, cover most of eastern South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: These are the youngest rock and sedimentary layers of the state, the product of successive periods of glaciation that have deposited a large amount of rock and soil, known as till, on the region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Great Plains cover most of the two-thirds west of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: To the west of Missouri, the landscape becomes more arid and more rugged, consisting of hilly hills, plains, ravines and flat steep hills called hillies.

name: south_dakota
sentence: To the south, east of the Black Hills, are the Badlands of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The erosion of the Black Hills, marine skeletons fallen to the bottom of a deep, deep sea that once covered the area, and volcanic material all contribute to the geology of this region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Black Hills are located in the southwest part of South Dakota and extend to Wyoming.

name: south_dakota
sentence: This range of low mountains covers 6,000 km2 (16 000 km2), with peaks rising from 2,000 to 4,000 feet (600 to 1,200 m) above their bases.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Black Hills are the highest point in South Dakota and the highest point in the United States east of the Rocky Mountains.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The two billion-year-old Precambrian formations, the oldest rocks in the state, form the central nucleus of the Black Hills.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Paleozoic formations form the outer ring of the Black Hills

name: south_dakota
sentence: This region presents rocks such as limestone, which were deposited here when the area formed the shore of an ancient inland sea.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Much of South Dakota (with the exception of the Black Hills area) is dominated by a temperate prairie biome.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Although grasses and crops cover most of this region, deciduous trees such as cottonwood, elms and willows are common near rivers and in shelter belts.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The state bird, the collared pheasant, adapted well to the region after being introduced from China.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Growing populations of bald eagles spread throughout the state, particularly near the Missouri River.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Prairie rivers and lakes are home to populations of walleye, carp, pike, bass and other species.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Missouri River also contains the prehistoric spatular.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Due to higher elevations and precipitation levels, the Black Hills ecology differs significantly from that of the plains.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The mountains are covered with different types of pines, including ponderosa and lodgepole pines, as well as spruce.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Black Hills mammals include deer, elk, sheep, mountain goats, pine martens and mountain lions, while streams and lakes contain several species of trout.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has a continental climate with four distinct seasons, ranging from cold and dry winters to warm and semi-wet summers.

name: south_dakota
sentence: During summers, the average state temperature is often close to 90°F (32°C), although it cools to nearly 60°F (16°C) at night.

name: south_dakota
sentence: It is not uncommon for South Dakota to have severe hot and dry periods in summer with temperatures rising above 100°F (38°C) several times a year.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Winters are cold, with high January temperatures on average below freezing and low temperatures on average below 10°F (−12°C) in most of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The highest recorded temperature was 120 °F (49 °C) at Usta on 15 July 2006 and the lowest recorded temperature was −58 °F (−50 °C) at McIntosh on 17 February 1936.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Average annual precipitation in South Dakota ranges from semi-arid conditions in the northwestern part of the state (approximately 15 inches or 380 mm) to semi-humid conditions around the southeastern part of the state (approximately 25 inches or 640 mm), although a small lead-centered area in the black hills has the highest precipitation at nearly 30 inches (760 mm) per year.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The summers of South Dakota cause frequent, sometimes severe, thunderstorms with violent winds, thunders and hail.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The eastern part of the State is often considered to be part of the Tornado gangway, and South Dakota suffers an average of 30 tornadoes each year.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Serious blizzards and ice storms often occur in winter.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has several sites administered by the National Parks Service.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Two national parks have been established in the state, both in the southwestern region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Wind Cave National Park, founded in 1903 in the Black Hills, has a vast network of caves and a large herd of bison.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Badlands National Park was established in 1978 and has an eroded landscape with bright colours surrounded by semi-arid meadows.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The National Rushmore Mountain Memorial in the Black Hills was created in 1925.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The sculpture of four American presidents was carved in the mountainside by sculptor Gutzon Borglum.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other areas managed by the National Parks Service include the Jewel Cave National Monument near Custer, the Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail, Minuteman Missile National Historic Site, which includes a decommissioned nuclear silo and a separate missile control area several kilometres away, and the Missouri National Recreational River.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Crazy Horse Memorial is a large mountainside sculpture near Mount Rushmore under construction using private funds.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Mammouth site near Hot Springs is another private attraction in the Black Hills.

name: south_dakota
sentence: It is a functioning paleontological excavation that has one of the world's largest concentrations of mammoth remains.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Humans have been living in what is now South Dakota for thousands of years.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The first inhabitants were Paleoindian hunter-gatherers and disappeared from the area around 5000 B.C.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Between 500 and 800 AD, a semi-nomadic people known as Mound Builders lived in central and eastern South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In the 14th century, there was the Crow Creek massacre, in which several hundred men, women and children were killed near the Missouri River.

name: south_dakota
sentence: By 1500, the Arikara (or Ree) had settled in much of the Missouri Valley.

name: south_dakota
sentence: European contact with the region began in 1743, when the LaVérendrye brothers explored the region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The LaVérendrye group buried a plaque near the site of modern Pierre, claiming the region for France as part of the Greater Louisiana.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1762, the whole region was part of the Spanish Louisiana until 1802.

name: south_dakota
sentence: At the beginning of the 19th century, the Sioux had largely replaced the Arikara as a dominant group in the region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1803 the United States purchased the territory of Louisiana, a region that included most of Napoleon Bonaparte's South Dakota, and President Thomas Jefferson organized a group commonly known as the Lewis and Clark Expedition to explore the area.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1817, an American fur trade post was established at the present Fort Pierre, which began the continued American colonization of the region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1855, the American army purchased Fort Pierre, but abandoned it in 1857, in favour of Fort Randall to the south.

name: south_dakota
sentence: At that time, the establishment by the Americans and Europeans was rapidly increasing and, in 1858, the Yankton Sioux signed the 1858 treaty, giving the United States most of the present South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Speculators founded two of the largest cities in South Dakota today: Sioux Falls in 1856 and Yankton in 1859.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1861, the territory of Dakota was created by the United States government (it originally included North Dakota, South Dakota and parts of Montana and Wyoming).

name: south_dakota
sentence: Colonization of the region, mainly by residents of the eastern United States and western and northern Europe, increased rapidly, especially after the completion of an eastern rail link with Yankton in 1873.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1874, gold was discovered in the Black Hills during a military expedition led by George A. Custer and miners and explorers began illegally entering the land promised to the Lakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Custer expedition took place despite the fact that the Sioux had received in 1868 the entire western half of the present South Dakota (West River) by the treaty of Laramie under the Great Sioux Reserve.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Sioux refused to grant mining rights or land in the Black Hills, and the war broke out after the United States did not prevent white miners and settlers from entering the area.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Finally, the United States won and separated the Sioux Great Reserve into five reserves, settling the Lakota there.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1980, the Supreme Court and Congress ordered compensation, but the Lakota still refused to accept it, insisting on the return of their land.

name: south_dakota
sentence: A growing population and political concerns (the accession of two states meant the arrival of four new senators for the Republican Party) led to the division of Dakota territory into two, and President Benjamin Harrison signed proclamations that officially admitted South Dakota and North Dakota to union on November 2, 1889.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Harrison made sure the papers were tight to hide which was signed first and the order went unnoticed.

name: south_dakota
sentence: On December 29, 1890, the massacre of the injured knee occurred in the Pine Ridge Indian Reserve.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Considered the last major armed conflict between the United States and the Lakota Sioux nation, the massacre resulted in the death of at least 146 Sioux, including a large number of women and children.

name: south_dakota
sentence: 31 American soldiers were also killed in the conflict.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In the 1930s, several economic and climatic conditions combined with disastrous results for South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Lack of precipitation, extremely high temperatures and inappropriate cultivation techniques produced what was known as the Dust Bowl in South Dakota and several other plain states.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The fertile soil was blown into massive dust storms, and several crops were completely ruined.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Dust Bowl's experiences, combined with the seizure of local banks and the general economic effects of the Great Depression, have led many South Dakota to leave the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The population of South Dakota declined by more than 7% between 1930 and 1940.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Economic stability returned with the entry of the United States into the Second World War in 1941, when demand for state agricultural and industrial products increased as the nation mobilized for the war.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1944, the Pick–Sloan Plan was adopted by the U.S. Congress as part of the 1944 Flood Control Act, resulting in the construction of six major dams on the Missouri River, four of which are at least partially located in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The control of floods, hydropower and recreational activities such as boating and fishing is ensured by dams and their reservoirs.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In recent decades, South Dakota has moved from an agricultural-dominated state to a more diversified state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The tourism industry has grown considerably since the completion of the interstate system in the 1960s, with Black Hills becoming an increasingly important destination.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The financial services industry also began to grow in the state, with Citibank transferring its credit card operations from New York to Sioux Falls in 1981, a movement that was followed by several other financial companies.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota was the first state to eliminate interest rate ceilings.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2007, the recently closed Homestake gold mine near Lead was selected as a site for a new underground research facility, the Deep Underground Science and Engineering Laboratory.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Despite the increase in the population of the State and recent economic development, many rural areas have struggled over the past 50 years with the decline of local populations and the emigration of educated young adults to major cities in South Dakota, such as Rapid City or Sioux Falls, or to other states.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Mechanization and consolidation of agriculture have greatly contributed to the reduction in the number of small family farms and the resulting economic and demographic difficulties for rural cities.

name: south_dakota
sentence: However, the state often ranks first for its way of life, and Gallup's 2018 Well-Being Index named South Dakota the happiest and healthier state in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the population of South Dakota was 884,659 on July 1, 2019, an increase of 8.66 per cent since the 2010 U.S. census, while only North Dakota, Alaska, Vermont and Wyoming have fewer residents.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2019, the population of South Dakota was estimated at 884,659, an increase of 70,479 or 8.66% since 2010.

name: south_dakota
sentence: 7.3% of the South Dakota population was under the age of 5, 24% under the age of 18 and 14.3% 65 years of age or older.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Women account for about 50.2 per cent of the population.

name: south_dakota
sentence: At the 2000 census, South Dakota was the fifth lowest of the nation in terms of population and population density.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Of South Dakota's inhabitants, 65.7 per cent were born in South Dakota, 31.4 per cent were born in another U.S. state, 0.6 per cent were born in Puerto Rico, the U.S. islands or abroad to U.S. parents, and 2.3 per cent were born in another country.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The population centre of South Dakota is located in Buffalo County, in the unincorporated county seat of Gann Valley County.

name: south_dakota
sentence: According to the 2010 census, the racial composition of the population was as follows:

name: south_dakota
sentence: Ethnically, 2.7% of the population of South Dakota was of Hispanic, Latin or Spanish origin (they can be of any race).

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2011, 25.4% of the population of South Dakota under 1 years of age were minorities, meaning that they had at least one non-Hispanic white parent.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2000, the five largest ancestry groups in South Dakota were German (40.7%), Norwegian (15.3%), Irish (10.4%), Amerindian (8.3%), and English (7.1%).

name: south_dakota
sentence: American Germans are the largest group of ancestry in most parts of the state, especially in the eastern part of the river (Eastern Missouri), although there are also large Scandinavian populations in some counties.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has the largest population of Hutterites, a communal group of Anabaptists who emigrated in 1874 from Europe, mainly from German-speaking regions.

name: south_dakota
sentence: American Indians, largely Lakota, Dakota and Nakota (Sioux), predominate in several counties and account for 20% of the West River population.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The seven large Indian reserves of the state occupy a much smaller area than the former Sioux Reserve of the West, which the federal government had previously allocated to the Sioux tribes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has the third highest proportion of Indians in any state, behind Alaska and New Mexico.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Five of the state's counties are entirely within the boundaries of sovereign Indian reserves.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Due to the limitations of climate and land, and the isolation of urban areas with higher employment opportunities, the standard of living on many South Dakota reserves is often well below the national average; Ziebach County ranked as the poorest county in the nation in 2009.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The unemployment rate in Fort Thompson, Crow Creek Reserve, is 70% and 21% of households do not have plumbing or basic kitchen appliances.

name: south_dakota
sentence: A 1995 study by the U.S. Census Office found that 58 per cent of households on the Pine Ridge Indian Reserve did not have a telephone.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The isolation of reserves also hinders their ability to generate income from gambling casinos, an avenue that has proved profitable for many tribes closer to urban centres.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1995, the legislator passed a law to make English the "common language" of the State.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Since 2019, "the language of the Great Sioux Nation, consisting of three dialects, Dakota, Lakota and Nakota" is an official language.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In the 2000 census, 1.90 per cent of the population aged 5 or older speak German at home, 1.51 per cent speak Lakota or Dakota and 1.43 per cent speak Spanish.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2010, 93.46% (692,504) of South Dakota residents aged 5 years and older spoke English as their main language.

name: south_dakota
sentence: 6.54% of the population spoke a language other than English.

name: south_dakota
sentence: 2.06 % (15,292) of the population spoke Spanish, 1.39 % (10,282) Dakota and 1.37% (10,140) German.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other languages spoken included Vietnamese (0.16 per cent), Chinese (0.12 per cent) and Russian (0.10 per cent).

name: south_dakota
sentence: In recent decades, the population of many rural areas has declined in South Dakota, as in other states of the Great Plains.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The change was described as "rural flight" as family farming declined.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Young people have settled in cities for other jobs.

name: south_dakota
sentence: This trend has continued in recent years, with 30 counties in South Dakota losing their population between 1990 and 2000.

name: south_dakota
sentence: During this period, nine counties experienced a population loss of more than 10 per cent, with Harding County in the northwest corner of the state losing nearly 19 per cent of its population.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Low birth rates and lack of young immigrants have led to an increase in the median age of many of these counties.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 24 counties, at least 20 per cent of the population is over the age of 65, compared to a national rate of 12.8 per cent.

name: south_dakota
sentence: However, the effect of rural leakage has not been uniformly distributed in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Although most rural counties and small towns have lost population, the Sioux Falls area, the largest counties along Interstate 29, the Black Hills and many Indian reserves have all gained population.

name: south_dakota
sentence: As the reserves exercised more sovereignty, some Sioux returned from urban areas.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Lincoln County near Sioux Falls was the fastest growing seventh (percentage) county in the United States in 2010.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Growth in these regions offset losses in the rest of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The total population of South Dakota continues to grow steadily, but at a slower rate than the national average.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The largest denominations by number of adherents in 2010 were the Roman Catholic Church with 148,883 members; the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (ELCA) with 112,649 members; and the United Methodist Church (UMC) with 36,020 members.

name: south_dakota
sentence: (ELCA and UMC are specific names in the broader terms "Lutheran" and "methodist", respectively.

name: south_dakota
sentence: )The results of a 2001 survey in which the Southern Dakotas were invited to identify their religion include:

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota's current gross national product in 2010 was $39.8 billion, the fifth lowest state output in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Per capita personal income was $38,865 in 2010, ranking 25th in the United States, and 12.5 per cent of the population was below the poverty line in 2008.The list of the CNBC's Top States for Business for 2010 recognized South Dakota as the seventh best state of the nation.

name: south_dakota
sentence: As of July 2011, the state unemployment rate was 4.7 per cent.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The service industry is the largest economic contributor to South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: This sector includes the retail, finance and health care industries.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Citibank, which was the largest banking holding company in the United States at one time, established domestic banking operations in South Dakota in 1981 to take advantage of favourable banking regulations.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Public spending is another important segment of the government economy, accounting for more than 10 per cent of gross national product.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Ellsworth Air Force Base, near Rapid City, is the second largest employer in the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Agriculture has always been a key component of the South Dakota economy.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Although other industries have expanded rapidly in recent decades, agricultural production remains very important for the state economy, particularly in rural areas.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The five most valuable agricultural products in South Dakota are cattle, maize, soybeans, wheat and pigs.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Agriculture-related industries such as meat packaging and ethanol production also have a significant economic impact on the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is the sixth-largest ethanol producer in the country.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Another important sector of the South Dakota economy is tourism.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Many travel to see the attractions of the state, especially those of the Black Hills area, such as the historic Deadwood, Rushmore Mount and neighbouring national and state parks.

name: south_dakota
sentence: One of the biggest tourist events in the state is the annual Sturgis Motorcycle Rally.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The five-day event attracted more than 739,000 participants in 2015; considering the state has a total population of 850,000.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2006, tourism provided approximately 33,000 jobs in the state and contributed more than $2 billion to the South Dakota economy.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has 83,609 miles (13,4556 km) of highways, roads and streets, as well as 679 miles (1,093 km) of interstate highways.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Two major interstates cross South Dakota: Interstate 90, which crosses the southern half of the state to the east and west, and Interstate 29, which runs north and south in the eastern part of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Corridor I-29 generally has higher population and economic growth rates than eastern South Dakota regions more distant from the interstate.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Interstates 190, a spur in the centre of Rapid City, and 229, a loop around the south and east of Sioux Falls, are also in the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Several major U.S. highways cross the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: U.S. roads 12, 14, 16, 18 and 212 travel east and west, while U.S. roads 81, 83, 85 and 281 travel north and south.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota and Montana are the only states sharing a land border that is not crossed by an asphalt road.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota contains two national access routes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Peter Norbeck Scenic Byway National Trail is located in the Black Hills, while the Amerindian Scenic Byway National Trail runs along the Missouri River in the northern central part of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other scenic passages include the Badlands Loop Scenic Byway, the Spearfish Canyon Scenic Byway, and the Wildlife Loop Road Scenic Byway.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Railways have played an important role in transportation in South Dakota since the mid-19th century.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Some 7,110 kilometres of railway were built in South Dakota in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, but only 2,960 kilometres are active.

name: south_dakota
sentence: BNSF Railway is the largest railway in South Dakota; Rapid City, Pierre and Eastern Railroad (formerly Dakota, Minnesota and East) are the other major carriers in the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other Crown carriers include Dakota Southern Railway, Dakota and Iowa Railroad, Ellis and Eastern Railroad, Sunfloor Railroad, Canadian Pacific Railway and the Sisseton Milbank Railroad.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Rail transportation in the state is mainly freight, but there are two historic passenger railways: Black Hills Central and Prairie Village, Herman and Milwaukee.

name: south_dakota
sentence: However, South Dakota is one of two contiguous states that do not have an Amtrak service.

name: south_dakota
sentence: (South Dakota is the only contiguous state that has ever had Amtrak—Wyoming was served by San Francisco Zephyr and Pioneer.)

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota's largest commercial airports in terms of passenger traffic are Sioux Falls Regional Airport and Rapid City Regional Airport.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Delta Air Lines, Frontier Airlines and Allegiant Airlines, as well as the suburban airlines that use the affiliate brand with the major airlines, serve the two largest airports.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Several other cities in the state also have commercial air services: Aberdeen Regional Airport, Pierre Regional Airport and Watertown Regional Airport, some of which are subsidized by the essential air services program.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Like other American states, the structure of the South Dakota government follows the same separation of powers as the federal government, with executive, legislative and judicial powers.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The structure of the state government is set out in the Constitution of South Dakota, the highest law of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Constitution may be amended by a majority vote of both Houses of Parliament or by electoral initiative.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Governor of South Dakota occupies the executive power of the state government.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The current governor is Kristi Noem, a Republican.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Constitution of the State gives the Governor the power to sign laws or veto bills adopted by the State legislature, to act as commander-in-chief of the National Guard of South Dakota, to appoint a cabinet, to commute criminal penalties or to pardon persons convicted of crimes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Governor shall be appointed for a term of four years and may not serve more than two consecutive terms.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The State Parliament consists of two bodies, the 35-member Senate and the 70-member House of Representatives.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is divided into 35 legislative districts, with voters electing two representatives and one senator per district.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Parliament meets for an annual session which begins on the second Tuesday in January and lasts 30 days

name: south_dakota
sentence: The judiciary is composed of several levels.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The State Supreme Court, with four judges and one chief justice, is the highest court in the State.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Below the Supreme Court are the circuit courts

name: south_dakota
sentence: Below the district courts are the courts of first instance, which deal with less important criminal and civil cases.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2005, South Dakota had the lowest domestic tax rate in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Crown does not collect personal or corporate income taxes, estate taxes or taxes on intangible personal property.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The State sales tax rate is 4.5%.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Various localities have local levies, so in some areas the rate is 6%.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The state sales tax does not apply to Indian sales on Indian reserves, but many reserves have an agreement with the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: On-reserve businesses collect the tax and government refunds from Indian tribes the percentage of sales tax collected in relation to the ratio of the Indian population to the total population of the affected county or region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Ad valorem property taxes are local taxes and are an important source of funding for school systems, counties, municipalities and other local governments.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The South Dakota Special Tax Division regulates certain taxes, including cigarette and alcohol taxes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is represented at the federal level by Senator John Thune, Senator Mike Rounds and representative Dusty Johnson.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The three are Republicans.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is one of seven states with one seat in the United States House of Representatives.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In the United States presidential elections, South Dakota received three out of 538 votes in the Electoral College.

name: south_dakota
sentence: As in all other states with the exception of the neighbouring Maine and Nebraska, South Dakota's electoral votes are granted as part of a system of capture of all victors.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota politics is generally dominated by the Republican Party.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Since the creation of the state, the Republicans have won state electoral votes in all but five presidential elections: 1896, 1912 (by the Progressive Party of Theodore Roosevelt), 1932, 1936 and 1964.

name: south_dakota
sentence: (Democrat George McGovern, from South Dakota, did not wear his home state in 1972.)

name: south_dakota
sentence: Only Alaska was worn fewer times by a democrat.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Moreover, a democrat has not won the post of governor since 1974.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2016, the Republicans had a 15% advantage over the Democrats and held large majorities in the House of State and the Senator of State.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Despite the republican and conservative general tendencies of the state, Democrats have been successful in various state-wide elections, including those involving representatives of the South Dakota Congress in Washington.

name: south_dakota
sentence: American Indians have become more active in state and county electoral policy.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In the 2002 election, the American Indian vote carried Tim Johnson as a Democratic candidate by a margin of 532 votes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Until his election defeat in 2004, Senator Tom Daschle was the Senators' minority leader (and briefly his majority leader during the democratic control of the Senators in 2001-2002).

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other prominent South Dakota Democrats include former presidential candidates George McGovern and Hubert Humphrey.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2016, South Dakota voted for Republican candidate Donald Trump against democratic candidate Hillary Clinton with a 30% margin.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2018, Republican MP Kristi Noem defeated Democrat Billie Sutton in the Gubernatoria elections by a small margin, and Republican Dusty Johnson defeated Democrat Tim Bjorkman for the seat of state in the United States House of Representatives.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The contemporary political issues of South Dakota include the costs and benefits of the state lottery, the relatively low ranking of South Dakota in education spending (especially teachers' compensation – the state sales tax has recently been increased from 4% to 4.5% to finance an increase in teachers' remuneration) and recent legislative and electoral attempts to ban abortion in the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: A bill supported by the Republicans passed in March 2019 requires all public schools to display "In God we have confidence" in a prominent place.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The South Dakota culture reflects the Indian, rural, western and European roots of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: A number of annual events celebrating the state's ethnic and historical heritage take place around the state, such as Days of '76 in Deadwood, Czech Days in Tabor, and the annual festivities of St. Patrick and Cinco de Mayo in Sioux Falls.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The various tribes hold many annual pow wows on their reserves throughout the state, to which non-Aboriginal Americans are sometimes invited.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Custer State Park holds an annual Buffalo Roundup, in which horse volunteers gather the park's herd of about 1,500 bison.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Black Elk (Lakota) was a man of medicine and heyokha, whose life extended to the transition to reserves.

name: south_dakota
sentence: His stories of the Indian War movement and 19th-century phantom dance, as well as his deep thoughts on personal visions and Amerindian religion, formed the basis of the book Black Elk Speaks, first published in 1932.

name: south_dakota
sentence: (Among several editions, a first annotated edition was published in 2008.)

name: south_dakota
sentence: Paul Goble, author and illustrator of award-winning children's books, has been based in the Black Hills since 1977.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Laura Ingalls Wilder, whose semi-autobiographical books are based on her experiences as a child and young adult at the border, is one of the most well-known writers in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: She drew from her life from a house near De Smet as the basis of five of her novels: By the Shores of Silver Lake, The Long Winter, Little Town on the Prairie, This Happy Golden Years and The First Four Years.

name: south_dakota
sentence: They gained renewed popularity in the United States when Little House on the Prairie was adapted and produced as a television series in 1974.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Wilder's daughter, Rose Wilder Lane, was born near De Smet in 1886.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has also produced several remarkable artists.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Harvey Dunn grew up in a house near Manchester in the late 19th century.

name: south_dakota
sentence: While Dunn worked most of his career as a commercial illustrator, his most famous works showed various scenes of border life; he finished these near the end of his career.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Oscar Howe (Crow) was born on Crow Creek Indian Reserve and won fame for his watercolour paintings.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Howe was one of the first Amerindian painters to adopt techniques and style strongly influenced by the mid-20th century abstraction movement, rather than relying on traditional Amerindian styles.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Terry Redlin, originally from Watertown, was an accomplished painter of rural scenes and wildlife.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Many of his works are exhibited at the Redlin Art Center in Watertown.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Sioux Falls is the largest city in South Dakota, with a population of 153,888 in 2010 and a metropolitan area of 238,122 inhabitants.The city, founded in 1856, is located in the southeast corner of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Retail, finance and health care became more important in Sioux Falls, where the economy was originally focused on agro-industry and careers.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Rapid City, with a population of 67,956 in 2010 and a metropolitan area of 124,766 inhabitants, is the second largest city in the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: It is located at the eastern end of the Black Hills, and was founded in 1876.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Rapid City's economy is largely based on tourism and defence spending, due to the proximity of many tourist attractions in the Black Hills and Ellsworth Air Force Base.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Aberdeen (26,091), Brookings (22,056), Watertown (21,482), Mitchell (15,254), Yankton (14,454), Pierre (13,646), Huron (12,592) and Vermillion (10,571).

name: south_dakota
sentence: Pierre is the capital of the state, and Brookings and Vermillion are the sites of the two largest universities in the state (South Dakota State University and South Dakota University, respectively).

name: south_dakota
sentence: With a population of about 14,000, Pierre is the second smallest state capital in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Of the ten largest cities in the state, only Rapid City is located west of Missouri.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The first South Dakota newspaper, the Democratic Dakota, began publishing in Yankton in 1858.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Today, the largest newspaper in the state is the Sioux Falls Argus Leader, with a Sunday draw of 63,701 and a weekday draw of 44,334 copies.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Rapid City Journal, with a Sunday draw of 32,638 and a weekday draw of 27,827, is the second largest newspaper in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The other four largest newspapers in the state are the Aberdeen American News, the Watertown Public Opinion, the Huron Plainsman and the Brookings Register.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1981, Tim Giago founded the Lakota Times as a newspaper for the local American Indian community on the Pine Ridge Indian Reserve.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The newspaper, now published in New York and known as Indian Country Today, is available in all states of the country.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Sioux City Journal also covers parts of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Nine television stations are broadcast in South Dakota; South Dakota public television is broadcast in a number of locations around the state, while the other stations are broadcast by Sioux Falls or Rapid City.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The two largest television markets in South Dakota are Sioux Falls-Mitchell, with a hearing of 246,020, and Rapid City, with a hearing of 91,070.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Both markets rank 114th and 177th largest in the United States, respectively.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The first state television station, KELO-TV, began broadcasting in Sioux Falls in 1953.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Among the first KELO programs was Captain 11, an afternoon children's program.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Captain 11 ran from 1955 to 1996, making it the longest children's television program in the country.

name: south_dakota
sentence: A number of South Dakotas are famous for their work in television and publishing.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The former anchor and author of NBC Nightly News Tom Brokaw is from Webster and Yankton, USA Today the founder Al Neuharth was from Eureka and Alpena, the game host Bob Barker spent much of his childhood in Mission, and entertainment guests Pat O'Brien and Mary Hart are from Sioux Falls.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2006, there were 136,872 students enrolled in primary and secondary schools in South Dakota, 120,278 of whom were enrolled in the public school system.

name: south_dakota
sentence: There are 703 public schools in 168 school districts, giving South Dakota the largest number of schools per capita in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The current high school graduation rate is 89.9%, and the average TCA score is 21.8, slightly higher than the national average of 21.1.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Of the adult population, 89.8% had at least one high school diploma and 25.8% had one or more bachelor's degrees.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2008, the average salary of teachers in South Dakota public schools was $36,674, the lowest in the country (the national average was $52,308).

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2007, South Dakota passed a law inspired by the Indian Education for All Act (1999) of Montana, under which all residents of the state received education on the history, culture and heritage of Amerindian tribes in all schools, from kindergarten to college, in order to increase their knowledge and appreciation of Indian culture and to enhance understanding of Indian students' contributions to their own culture.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Council of Regents of South Dakota, whose members are appointed by the Governor, controls the six public universities of the State.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota State University (SDSU) in Brookings is the largest university in the state with a registration of 12,831.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The University of South Dakota (USD) in Vermillion is the oldest university in the state and has the only school of law and medicine in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota also has several private universities, the largest of which is the Augustana University of Sioux Falls.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Due to its small population, South Dakota does not host large professional sports franchises.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The state has minor leagues and independent leagues, all playing in Sioux Falls or Rapid City.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Sioux Falls has four teams: Sioux Falls Canaries (baseball), Sioux Falls Skyforce (basketball), Sioux Falls Stampede (hockey) and Sioux Falls Storm (inner American football).

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Canary Islands play in the American Association, and their original field is Sioux Falls Stadium.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Skyforces play in the NBA G League and are owned by Miami Heat of the NBA.

name: south_dakota
sentence: They're playing the Sanford Pentagon.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Stampede and Storm share the Denny Sanford Premier Center.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Stampede plays in the USHL, and the Storm plays in the IFL.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Rapid City has a hockey team named Rapid City Rush playing in the ECHL.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Rush began its inaugural season in 2008 at the Rushmore Plaza Civic Center.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota universities organize various sports programmes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: For many years, South Dakota has been one of the only states in the country without a NCAA Division I football or basketball team.

name: south_dakota
sentence: However, several years ago, the SDSU decided to transfer its teams from Division II to Division I, a move followed by the University of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other government universities compete at the NCAA or NAIA Division II or III levels.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The famous South Dakota athletes are Billy Mills, Mike Miller, Mark Ellis, Becky Hammon, Brock Lesnar, Chad Greenway and Adam Vinatieri.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Mills is from Pine Ridge and competed at the 1964 Summer Olympics in Tokyo, becoming the only American to win a gold medal in the 10,000-metre event.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Mitchell's Miller is a two-time NBA champion who played university basketball at the University of Florida, leading them to the 2000 NCAA Championship game in his second year, and won the 2001 NBA rookie of the year.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Ellis of Rapid City played for the University of Florida and four MLB teams before retiring in 2015.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Hammon, from Rapid City, played for WNBA's New York Liberty and San Antonio Silver Stars before becoming assistant coach for the NBA San Antonio Spurs in 2014.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Webster's Lesnar is a former UFC and WWE heavyweight champion.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Vinatieri is an NFL placekicker who grew up in Rapid City and attended SDSU.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Fishing and hunting are popular outdoor activities in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Fishing contributes more than $224 million to the economy of South Dakota and hunting more than $303 million.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2007, more than 275,000 hunting permits and 175,000 fishing permits were sold in the state; approximately half of the hunting permits and more than two thirds of the fishing licences were purchased by South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The most popular game species are pheasants, white-tailed deer, mule deer and turkeys, as well as waterfowl such as Canada geese, snow geese and mallards.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Targets for anglers include walleye in the eastern glacial lakes and the Missouri River reservoirs, chinook salmon in Oahe Lake and trout in the Black Hills.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other sports, such as cycling and running, are also popular in the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1991, the state opened the George S. Mickelson Trail, a 175 km railway trail in the Black Hills.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In addition to being used by cyclists, the trail is also the site of part of the annual Rushmore Mountain marathon; the entire marathon route is at an altitude of more than 4,000 feet (1,200 m).

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other events in the state include the Tour de Kota, a 478 miles (769 km), the six-day cycling event covering much of eastern and central South Dakota, and the annual Sturgis Motorcycle Rally, which attracts hundreds of thousands of participants from across the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Some of the official symbols of the State of South Dakota include:

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee is a state in the southeastern United States of America.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee is the 36th largest by region and the 16th most populous of the 50 states.

name: tennessee
sentence: It is bordered by eight states, Kentucky in the north, Virginia in the northeast, North Carolina in the east, Georgia, Alabama and Mississippi in the south, Arkansas in the west and Missouri in the northwest.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Appalachians dominate the eastern part of the state and Mississippi forms its western border.

name: tennessee
sentence: Nashville is the capital of the state and the largest city, with a 2019 population of 670,820 and a 2019 metro population of 1,934,317.

name: tennessee
sentence: The second largest city in Tennessee is Memphis, which had a population of 651,073 and a metro population of 1,346,045 in 2019.

name: tennessee
sentence: The state of Tennessee is rooted in the Watauga Association, a border pact of 1772 generally regarded as the first constitutional government west of the Appalachians.

name: tennessee
sentence: What is now Tennessee was originally part of North Carolina, then of the Southwest Territory.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee was admitted to the Union as 16th State on 1 June 1796.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee was the last state to leave the Union and join Confederation at the beginning of the American Civil War in 1861.

name: tennessee
sentence: Occupied by the Union forces from 1862 onwards, he was the first State to be re-admitted to the Union at the end of the war.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee has provided more soldiers for the Confederate Army than any other state except Virginia, and more soldiers for the Union Army than the rest of the combined Confederation.

name: tennessee
sentence: From the reconstruction he had a competitive party policy, but a democratic takeover in the late 1880s had led to the adoption of laws on the abandonment of the right to vote that excluded most blacks and many poor whites from the right to vote.

name: tennessee
sentence: This reduced competition in politics in the state until after the adoption of civil rights legislation in the mid-20th century, although unlike in the deep South, the Republicans of Tennessee still expected at least one third of the state-wide vote via the East Tennessee and the Highland Rim Unionists.

name: tennessee
sentence: In the 20th century, Tennessee moved from an agrarian economy to a more diversified economy, assisted by massive federal investments in the Tennessee Valley Authority and, in the early 1940s, in the city of Oak Ridge.

name: tennessee
sentence: This city was founded just outside Knoxville to house the uranium enrichment facilities of the Manhattan project, helping to build the world's first atomic bombs, two of which were dropped on Imperial Japan towards the end of World War II.

name: tennessee
sentence: After the war, the Oak Ridge National Laboratory became and remains a key centre for scientific research.

name: tennessee
sentence: In 2016, the tennessine element was named for the state, largely in recognition of the roles played by Oak Ridge, Vanderbilt University and the University of Tennessee in the discovery of the element.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee's main industries include agriculture, manufacturing and tourism.

name: tennessee
sentence: Poultry, soybeans and livestock are the government's main agricultural products, and major manufacturing exports include chemicals, transportation equipment and electrical equipment.

name: tennessee
sentence: Great Smoky Mountain National Park, the country's most visited national park, is located in the eastern part of the state, and part of the Appalachian Trail follows roughly the border between Tennessee and North Carolina.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Aquarium du Tennessee and the Hotel Chattanooga Choo-Choo in Chattanooga, Dollywood in Pigeon Forge, the Aquarium de Ripley des Smokies and Ober Gatlinburg in Gatlinburg, the Parthenon, the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum, and the Ryman Auditorium in Nashville, the Jack Daniel Distillery in Lynchburg, the residence and tomb of Elvis Presley, the Memphis Zoo, the National Museum of Civil Rights in Memphis and the Bristol Highway in Bristol are other major tourist attractions.

name: tennessee
sentence: The first variant of the name that became Tennessee was recorded by Captain Juan Pardo, the Spanish explorer, when he and his men passed through an American Indian village named "Tanasqui" in 1567 while traveling inland of South Carolina.

name: tennessee
sentence: At the beginning of the 18th century, British traders met a city called Tanasi (or "Tanase", in the syllable : "") in the present Monroe County, Tennessee.

name: tennessee

sentence: After decades of under-representation of urban populations in many state legislatures, this important decision has led to increased (and proportional) importance in the policy of the State by cities and, ultimately, the suburbs, legislators and state officials in relation to their population within the State.

name: tennessee
sentence: The decision also applied to many other states that had long been controlled by rural minorities, such as Alabama, Vermont and Montana.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee maintains four law enforcement entities: Tennessee Road Patrol, Tennessee Wildlife Agency, Tennessee Investigation Bureau and Tennessee Environment and Conservation Department.

sentence: The Highway Patrol is the main enforcement entity that focuses on road safety regulation and the enforcement of the general law of non-wild States and is under the responsibility of the Tennessee Department of Safety.

name: tennessee
sentence: TWRA is an independent agency responsible for the enforcement of all wildlife, navigation and fishing regulations outside state parks.

name: tennessee
sentence: The IBT has state-of-the-art investigative facilities and is the leading criminal investigation service at the state level.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Rangers of Tennessee National Park are responsible for all activities and enforcement in the Tennessee Park System.

name: tennessee
sentence: Local law enforcement services are distributed between the county sheriff's offices and municipal police services.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Tennessee Constitution requires every county to have an elected sheriff.

name: tennessee
sentence: In 94 of the 95 counties, the sheriff is the chief of law enforcement in the county and has jurisdiction over the entire county.

name: tennessee
sentence: Each sheriff's office is responsible for the service of warrants, court security, prison operations and primary law enforcement in unincorporated areas of a county, as well as support to municipal police services.

name: tennessee
sentence: Incorporated municipalities are required to maintain a police service to provide police services within the limits of their organization.

name: tennessee
sentence: The three counties of Tennessee to adopt metropolitan governments have adopted different approaches to resolve the conflict that a metropolitan government presents with the requirement to have an elected sheriff.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee's firearms laws regulate the sale, possession and use of firearms and ammunition.

sentence: The carrying and opening of a handgun is permitted with a Tennessee weapon licence or an equivalent alternative condition permit.

sentence: Effective July 1, 2014, a licence is no longer required to possess a handgun loaded in a motor vehicle.

name: tennessee
sentence: The death penalty exists in Tennessee at various times since the establishment of the State.

name: tennessee
sentence: Prior to 1913, the method of execution was suspended.

name: tennessee
sentence: From 1913 to 1915, there was an interruption of executions, but they were restored in 1916 when electrocution became the new method.

name: tennessee
sentence: From 1972 to 1978, after the Supreme Court ruled (Furman v. Georgia) that the death penalty was unconstitutional, there were no other executions.

name: tennessee
sentence: The death penalty was resumed in 1978, although prisoners awaiting execution between 1960 and 1978 were mostly sentenced to life imprisonment.

name: tennessee
sentence: From 1916 to 1960, the State executed 125 detainees.

name: tennessee
sentence: For various reasons, there were no other executions until 2000.

name: tennessee
sentence: Since 2000, Tennessee has executed seven prisoners.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee has 59 persons sentenced to death (in October 2018).

name: tennessee
sentence: The lethal injection was approved by the legislator in 1998, although those who were sentenced to death before 1 January 1999 may request electrocution.
