sentence: Virginia has many professional golf courses, including the Greg Norman course at Lansdowne Resort and Kingsmill Resort, the home of the Kingsmill Championship, a LPGA Tour tournament.

sentence: NASCAR is currently planning Monster Energy NASCAR Cup races on two tracks in Virginia: Martinsville Speedway and Richmond Raceway.

name: virginia
sentence: Among the Virginia natives currently participating in the series are Denny Hamlin and Elliott Sadler.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia does not authorize the state to use appropriate funds for operational or capital expenditures for intercollegial athletics.

name: virginia

name: virginia
sentence: Historically, three Black schools participate in Division II of the Central Intercollegiate Athletic Association, and two others (Hampton and Norfolk State) participate in Division I.

name: virginia

name: virginia
sentence: The state nickname is its oldest symbol, although it has never been made official by law.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia received the title of "Dominion" by King Charles II of England at the time of the Restoration, because he had remained faithful to the crown during the English civil war, and the current moniker, "Old Dominion" is a reference to this title.

name: virginia
sentence: Charles' supporters were called Cavaliers, and the nickname "The Cavalier State" was popularized after the American civil war to novelize the antebellum.

name: virginia
sentence: The University of Virginia sports teams are called the Horsemen.

name: virginia
sentence: The other nickname, "Mother of Presidents", is also historic, as eight Virginians were President of the United States, four of whom were of the first five.

name: virginia
sentence: The state currency, Sic Semper Tyrannis, translates Latin as "Thus Always to Tyrans", and is used on the state seal, which is then used on the flag.

name: virginia
sentence: While the seal was designed in 1776 and the flag was first used in the 1830s, both were made official in 1930.

name: virginia
sentence: The majority of the other symbols were made official at the end of the twentieth century.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia's reel is among the square dances classified as state dance.

name: virginia
sentence: In 1940, Virginia made "Carry Me Back to Old Virginny" the state song, but it was withdrawn in 1997 because of her references to slavery.

name: virginia
sentence: In March 2015, Virginia named "Our Great Virginia", which uses the song of "Oh Shenandoah", as the traditional state song and "Sweet Virginia Breeze" as the popular state song.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is a state in the Pacific Northwest Region of the United States of America.

name: washington
sentence: Named for George Washington, the first president of the United States, the state was formed from the western part of the territory of Washington, which was ceded by the British Empire in 1846, in accordance with the Oregon Treaty in the settlement of the Oregon border dispute.

name: washington
sentence: The state, which is bordered to the west by the Pacific Ocean, Oregon to the south, Idaho to the east and the Canadian province of British Columbia to the north, was admitted to the Union as the 42nd state in 1889.

name: washington
sentence: Olympia is the capital of the state

name: washington
sentence: Washington is often called Washington State to distinguish it from the nation's capital, Washington, D.C.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is the 18th largest state, with an area of 71,362 square miles (184,827 km2), and the 13th most populous state, with more than 7,6 million people.

name: washington
sentence: About 60 per cent of Washington's people live in the Seattle metropolitan area, the centre of transportation, business and industry along Puget Sound, a Pacific Ocean entrance consisting of many islands, deep fjords and glacier-drilled bays.

name: washington
sentence: The rest of the state consists of deep temperate rainforests to the west; mountain ranges to the west, the centre, the northeast and the east; and a semi-arid basin region to the east, the centre and the south, ceded to intensive agriculture.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is the second most populous state on the west and west coasts of the United States, after California.

name: washington
sentence: Mount Rainier, an active stratovolcan, is the highest altitude in the state, at nearly 14,411 feet (4,392 metres), and is the most topographically prominent mountain in the adjacent United States.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is a major producer of lumber; its rugged surface is rich in Douglas-fir stands, hemlock, ponderosa pine, white pine, spruce, larch and cedar.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is the country's largest producer of apples, hops, pears, red raspberries, mint oil and sweet cherries and ranks first in the production of apricots, asparagus, dried peas, grapes, lentils, peppermint oil and potatoes.

name: washington
sentence: Livestock and livestock products contribute significantly to overall farm revenues, and commercial salmon, halibut and groundfish fisheries make a significant contribution to the government economy.

name: washington
sentence: Washington ranks second in wine production in California.

name: washington
sentence: Manufacturing in Washington includes aircraft and missiles, shipbuilding and other transportation equipment, food processing, metals and metal products, chemicals and machinery.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has more than a thousand dams, including the Grand Coulee Dam, built for various purposes, including irrigation, electricity, flood control and water storage.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is one of the richest and most socially liberal states in the country.

name: washington
sentence: The State is consistently among the best for life expectancy and low unemployment.

name: washington
sentence: With Colorado, Washington was one of the first to legalize medicinal and recreational cannabis, was one of the first 36 states to legalize same-sex marriage, doing so in 2012, and was one of the only four states in the United States to provide legal abortions on request prior to the Supreme Court decision of 1973 in the Roe v. Canada case.

name: washington
sentence: Similarly, voters in Washington approved a 2008 referendum on the legalization of physician-assisted suicide and are currently one of the nine states, as well as the District of Columbia, for legalizing this practice.

name: washington
sentence: The state is also one of eight in the country for criminalizing the sale, possession and transfer of hump stocks, with California, Florida, New Jersey, New York, Vermont, Maryland and Massachusetts also banning these devices.

name: washington
sentence: Washington was named in honour of President George Washington by a law of the United States Congress when the Washington Territory was created in 1853.

name: washington
sentence: The territory was to be named "Columbia" for the Columbia River and the District of Columbia, but the representative of Kentucky Richard H. Stanton found the name too similar to the District of Columbia (the national capital, itself containing the City of Washington), and proposed to appoint the new territory after President Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is the only US state named after a president.

name: washington
sentence: The confusion over the state of Washington and the city of Washington, D.C., led to the renaming of proposals during the state process for Washington in 1889, including David Dudley Field II's suggestion to name the new state "Tacoma".

name: washington
sentence: There was no support for these proposals.

name: washington
sentence: Washington, D.C., own state movement in the 21st century includes a proposal to use the name "State of Washington, Douglass Commonwealth", which would be in conflict with the current state of Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Residents of Washington (known as "Washingtonians") and the Pacific Northwest simply refer to the state as "Washington", and the capital of the country "Washington, D.C.", "the other Washington", or simply "D.C."

name: washington
sentence: Washington is the most northwestern state in the contiguous United States.

name: washington
sentence: It borders the Idaho to the east, bounded primarily by the meridian flowing north from the confluence of the Snake River and the Clearwater River (approximately 117°02'23" to the west), with the exception of the southernmost section where the boundary follows the Snake River.

name: washington
sentence: Oregon is to the south, with the Columbia River forming the western part and the 46th parallel forming the eastern part of the Oregon-Washington border.

name: washington
sentence: During the Washington partition of Oregon, the initial boundary plan followed the Columbia River east to the confluence with the snake, then followed the Snake River east; this was modified to keep the fertile lands of Walla Walla in Washington.

name: washington
sentence: West of Washington lies the Pacific Ocean.

name: washington
sentence: Its northern border lies mainly along the 49th parallel, then by sea across the Strait of Georgia, Haro Strait and Juan de Fuca Strait, with the Canadian province of British Columbia to the north.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is part of an area known as Pacific Northwest, a term that always refers to at least Washington and Oregon, and which may or may not include some or all of the following, as intended by the user: Idaho, Western Montana, Northern California, British Columbia and Alaska.

name: washington
sentence: The high mountains of the Cascade chain extend north-south, bisecting the state.

name: washington
sentence: In addition to the west of Washington and east of Washington, residents call both parts of the state the west and east side, the wet side and the dry side, or the "Timberland" and the "Wheatland", the latter couple more often in the names of regional-specific businesses and institutions.

name: washington
sentence: These terms reflect geography, climate, and the land industry on both sides of the Cascades.

name: washington
sentence: From the Cascade Mountains westward, Western Washington has a predominantly Mediterranean climate, with mild temperatures and humid winters, autumns and springs, and relatively dry summers.

name: washington
sentence: The Cascade chain has several volcanoes, which reach significantly higher altitudes than the rest of the mountains.

name: washington
sentence: From north to south, these major volcanoes are Mount Baker, the Glacier Peak, Mount Rainier, Mount Sainte-Hélène and Mount Adams.

name: washington
sentence: All are active volcanoes.

name: washington
sentence: Mount Rainier, the highest mountain in the state, is 80 km south of Seattle City, from which it is visible.

name: washington
sentence: The USGS considers 14,411 feet (4,392 m) Mt.

name: washington
sentence: Rainier the most dangerous volcano in the Cascade chain, due to its proximity to the Seattle metropolitan area, and the most dangerous in the American continent according to the list of volcanoes of the decade.

name: washington
sentence: It is also covered with glacial ice larger than any other peak in the 48 contiguous states.

name: washington
sentence: Western Washington is also home to the Olympic Mountains, well west of the Olympic Peninsula, which are home to dense coniferous forests and temperate rainforest areas.

name: washington
sentence: These deep forests, such as the Hoh rainforest, are among the only rainforests on the American continent.

name: washington
sentence: Indeed, although Western Washington does not always suffer from a high amount of rain measured in inches of rain per year, it always has more rainy days per year than most other places in the country.

name: washington
sentence: " Seattle's raining reputation is well deserved."

name: washington
sentence: 15 October 2016.

name: washington
sentence: Excerpted on January 17, 2021.

name: washington
sentence: Frequent rain and cloud cover in western Washington is a major plot point in the popular Twilight book, which is located in western Washington precisely because of its relative lack of sun.

name: washington
sentence: The eastern part of Washington – the eastern part of the state of the Cascades – has a relatively dry climate, which contrasts sharply with the western side.

name: washington
sentence: It includes large areas of semi-arid steppe and some really arid deserts in the rain shadow of the Cascades

name: washington
sentence: Despite limited rainfall, agriculture is an extremely important activity in much of eastern Washington, as the soil is very productive and irrigation, supported by dams along the Columbia River, is quite widespread.

name: washington
sentence: Population spread in eastern Washington is dominated by access to water, particularly to rivers.

name: washington
sentence: The main cities are all located next to rivers or lakes, most of which are named after the river or lake they adhere to.

name: washington
sentence: More to the east, the climate becomes less arid, and annual precipitation increases as we go east to 21.2 inches (54 mm) at Pullman, near the Washington-Idaho border.

name: washington
sentence: The Okanogan Highlands and the rugged massif of Kettle River and the Selkirk Mountains cover much of the northeastern quadrant of the state.

name: washington
sentence: The Palous area south-east of Washington was a prairie that was primarily converted to agricultural land and extends to the blue mountains.

name: washington
sentence: As noted above, Washington's climate varies considerably from west to east.

name: washington
sentence: A Mediterranean climate predominates in western Washington, and a much drier semi-arid climate prevails east of the Cascade chain.

name: washington
sentence: Major factors that determine Washington's climate include the large, low-pressure, high-pressure, semi-permanent systems of the North Pacific Ocean, the continental air masses of North America, and the Olympic and Cascade Mountains.

name: washington
sentence: In spring and summer, a high-pressure anticyclone system dominates the northern Pacific Ocean, causing a clockwise spiral of air.

name: washington
sentence: For Washington, this means that prevailing northwestern winds bring relatively fresh air and a predictable dry season.

name: washington
sentence: In autumn and winter, a low-pressure cyclone system takes over in the northern Pacific Ocean.

name: washington
sentence: Inward spiral air in the opposite direction of clockwise motion brings the dominant winds from Washington to the southwest, bringing relatively warm and humid air masses and a predictable wet season.

name: washington
sentence: The term "Pineapple Express" is commonly used to describe the events of the atmospheric river, where repeated storm systems are led by this persistent cyclone in the tropical and near-tropical Pacific regions of the Pacific Northwest.

name: washington
sentence: Despite the existence of a marine climate similar to that of many coastal cities in Western Washington, there are exceptions such as the events of 1880, 1881, 1893 and 1916, and the winters of 1883–84, 1915–1916, 1949–1950 and 1955–1956, among others.

name: washington
sentence: During these events, western Washington experienced up to 1,800 metres of snow, temperatures below 18°C, three months of snow on the ground, and frozen lakes and rivers for weeks.

name: washington
sentence: The lowest officially recorded temperature in Seattle is 0°F (−18°C) set on January 31, 1950, but low-lying areas at about three hours from Seattle recorded lows as cold as −48°F (−44°C).

name: washington
sentence: The oscillation of the south greatly influences the weather during the cold season.

name: washington
sentence: During the El Niño phase, the jet enters the United States further south through California, so late fall and winter are drier than normal with less snow.

name: washington
sentence: The La Niña phase reinforces the jet in the northwest Pacific, so Washington has more rain and snow than average.

name: washington
sentence: In 2006, the University of Washington's Climate Impacts Group published The Impacts of Climate Change in Washington's Economy, a preliminary assessment of the risks and opportunities presented, given the potential for rising global temperatures and their effects on Washington's state.

name: washington
sentence: Precipitation in Washington varies considerably from east to west.

name: washington
sentence: The western part of the Olympic Peninsula receives up to 160 inches (4,100 mm) of precipitation each year, making it the wettest area of the 48 neighbouring states and a temperate rainforest.

name: washington
sentence: Weeks can pass without a clear day.

name: washington
sentence: The west slopes of the Cascade Range receive some of the largest annual snowfalls (in some places more than 200 inches or 5,100 millimetres of water equivalent) in the country.

name: washington
sentence: In the rain shadow area east of the Cascades, annual precipitation is only 6 inches (150 mm).

name: washington
sentence: Precipitation then increased eastward towards the Rocky Mountains (approximately 120 miles east of the Idaho border).

name: washington
sentence: The Olympic mountains and waterfalls aggravate this climate pattern by causing an orographical uplift of blowing air masses inside the Pacific Ocean, resulting in high levels of precipitation on the wind side of the mountains and low levels on the left side.

name: washington
sentence: This occurs most dramatically around the Olympic mountains and the Cascade chain.

name: washington
sentence: In both cases, slopes from the southwest to the wind receive high precipitation and mild and cool temperatures.

name: washington
sentence: Although the Puget Sound lowlands are known for clouds and rain in winter, the western slopes of the Cascades receive larger amounts of precipitation, often as snow at higher altitudes.

name: washington
sentence: Mount Baker, near the northern border of the state, is one of the most snowy places in the world.

name: washington
sentence: In 1999, it set the world record for snowfall in a single season: 1,140 inches (95 ft; 29 m).

name: washington
sentence: To the east of the Cascades, a large area has strong rain shadow effects.

name: washington
sentence: Semi-arid conditions occur in much of eastern Washington State, with the strongest effects of rain shadow at relatively low elevations on the central Columbia Plateau, especially in the area just east of the Columbia River, from the Snake River to the Okanagan Highland.

name: washington
sentence: Thus, instead of rainforests, much of eastern Washington is covered with dry meadows, shrub steppe and sand dunes.

name: washington
sentence: The average annual temperature ranges from 51°F (11°C) on the Pacific coast to 40°F (4°C) in the northeast.

name: washington
sentence: The lowest temperature recorded in the state was -48°F (−44°C) in Winthrop and Mazama.

name: washington
sentence: The highest temperature recorded in the state was 118°F (48°C) at the ice port dam.

name: washington
sentence: The two records were set east of the Cascades.

name: washington
sentence: Western Washington is known for its mild climate, considerable fog, frequent cloud cover, long-lasting drizzles in winter and warm temperate summers.

name: washington
sentence: The Eastern region, which does not enjoy the general moderating effect of the Pacific Ocean, sometimes experiences an extreme climate.

name: washington
sentence: Cold Arctic fronts in winter and heat waves in summer are not uncommon.

name: washington
sentence: Temperatures in the western region were only 107°F (42°C) in Centralia and up to 6°F (−21°C) in Longview.

name: washington
sentence: Forests cover about half of the land area of the state, mainly west of the Northern Cascades.

name: washington
sentence: About two-thirds of Washington's forest area is owned by the state, 64% of which is federal land.

name: washington
sentence: Common trees and plants in the area are camassia, Douglas-fir, hemlock, penstemon, ponderosa pine, western red cedar, and many ferns.

name: washington
sentence: The various wild areas of the state provide a sanctuary, with large populations of shorebirds and marine mammals.

name: washington
sentence: The Pacific coast surrounding the San Juan Islands is heavily populated by white-headed, grey-headed and humpback whales.

name: washington
sentence: In eastern Washington, the flora is very different.

name: washington
sentence: Tumbleweeds and sage dominate the landscape through large parts of the countryside.

name: washington
sentence: Russian olive trees and other trees are common on the banks of rivers; however, apart from the banks of rivers, huge parts of eastern Washington have no natural trees at all (although many trees have been planted and are irrigated by people, of course).

name: washington
sentence: There is a greater variety of flora in the Blue Mountains and in the eastern slopes of the Cascades.

name: washington
sentence: Native state mammals include bat, black bear, bobcat, cougar, coyote, deer, elk, grey wolf, hare, moose, mountain beaver, muskrat, opossum, pocket gopher, rabbit, raccoon, river otter, squirrel and squirrel.

name: washington
sentence: Due to the extent of geography, Washington State is home to several different ecoregions, allowing for a variety of bird species.

name: washington
sentence: This range includes raptors, shorebirds, woodbirds, prairie birds, ducks and others.

name: washington
sentence: There have also been a large number of species introduced in Washington, D.C., dating back to the early 18th century, including horses and burros.

name: washington
sentence: Channel catfish, lamprey and sturgeon are among the 400 known freshwater fish.

name: washington
sentence: With the Cascade Frog, there are several forms of snakes that define the most prominent reptiles and amphibians.

name: washington
sentence: Coastal bays and islands are often inhabited by abundant quantities of molluscs and whales.

name: washington
sentence: There are five species of salmon that go up in the western Washington area, from streams to spawning grounds.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has a variety of National Parks Service units.

name: washington
sentence: These include Alta State National Park, Roosevelt Lake National Recreation Area, San Juan Islands National Wildlife Refuge, and three national parks - Olympic National Park, Northern Cascade National Park and Mount Rainier National Park.

name: washington
sentence: The three national parks were established between 1899 and 1968.

name: washington
sentence: Nearly 95 per cent (876,517 acres, 354,714 hectares, 3,547.14 square kilometres) of the Olympic National Park area has been designated "Wild Nature" under the National Nature Conservation System.

name: washington
sentence: In addition, 143 state parks and 9 national forests are managed by the Washington State Park System and the United States Forest Service.

name: washington
sentence: Okanogan National Forest is the largest national forest on the west coast, covering 1,499,023 acres (606,633 ha).

name: washington
sentence: It is managed together as the Okanogan-Wenatchee National Forest, covering a considerably larger area of approximately 3,239,404 acres (1,310,940 ha).

name: washington
sentence: The skeletal remains of Kennewick Man, one of the oldest and most complete human remains found in North America, were discovered in Washington.

name: washington
sentence: The region has been known to host megathrust earthquakes in the past, the last being the Cascadia earthquake of 1700.

name: washington
sentence: Prior to the arrival of Europeans, the region had many Aboriginal tribes, remarkable for their totem poles and their adorned canoes and masks.

name: washington
sentence: Their industries include salmon fishing and, in particular, whaling in Makah.

name: washington
sentence: The peoples of the interior had a very different subsistence culture based on hunting, food collection and certain forms of agriculture, as well as on the dependence of the salmon of Colombia and its tributaries.

name: washington
sentence: The smallpox epidemic of the 1770s devastated the Amerindian population.

name: washington
sentence: The first European landing recorded on the Washington coast was by Spanish captain Don Bruno de Heceta in 1775, aboard Santiago, part of a fleet of two ships with the Sonora.

name: washington
sentence: He claims the coastal lands to Prince William Strait for Spain as part of their rights under the Treaty of Tordesillas, which they maintain to make the Pacific a "Spanish lake" and all its shores are part of the Spanish Empire.

name: washington
sentence: In 1778 the British explorer, Captain James Cook, saw Cape Flattery at the entrance to the Strait of Juan de Fuca, but Cook did not understand that the Strait existed.

name: washington
sentence: It was not discovered until Charles William Barkley, captain of the imperial eagle, saw it in 1787.

name: washington
sentence: The straits were explored by Spanish explorers Manuel Quimper in 1790 and Francisco de Eliza in 1791, and British explorer George Vancouver in 1792.

name: washington
sentence: The Spanish-British Nootka convention of 1790 ended Spanish exclusivity claims and opened the Northwest Coast to explorers and traders from other nations, including Great Britain and Russia, as well as the new United States.

name: washington
sentence: American captain Robert Gray (for which Grays Harbor County is named) then discovered the mouth of the Columbia River.

name: washington
sentence: He named the river after his ship, the Columbia.

name: washington
sentence: From 1792 Gray established the trade in sea otter hides.

name: washington
sentence: The Lewis and Clark expedition entered the state on October 10, 1805.

name: washington
sentence: Explorer David Thompson, on his trip to the Columbia River, camped at the confluence with the Snake River on July 9, 1811, erected a post and notice claiming the country for Great Britain and stating the intention of the North West Company to build a trading post on the site.

name: washington
sentence: Britain and the United States have accepted what has since been described as the "joint occupation" of land west of the continental ditch to the Pacific Ocean under the Anglo-American Convention of 1818, which establishes the 49th parallel as the international boundary west of Lake of the Woods to the Rocky Mountains.

name: washington
sentence: The resolution of territorial and treaty issues in the western Pacific has been postponed to a later date.

name: washington
sentence: In 1819, Spain ceded its rights north of the 42nd parallel to the United States, although these rights did not include possession.

name: washington
sentence: Negotiations with Great Britain over the next few decades have failed to resolve a compromise border and the Oregon border dispute has been strongly contested between Great Britain and the United States.

name: washington
sentence: The joint occupation between Britain and the United States lasted several decades.

name: washington
sentence: The Hudson's Bay Company, which had previously discouraged the establishment because it was in conflict with the fur trade, reversed its position in an attempt to maintain British control of the Columbia District.

name: washington
sentence: James Sinclair, by order of Sir George Simpson, governor of the Hudson's Bay Company, led some 200 settlers from the Red River colony to settle on Hudson's Bay Company farms near Fort Vancouver in 1841.

name: washington
sentence: The group crossed the Rocky Mountains in the Columbia Valley, near Radium Hot Springs, British Columbia, and then travelled southwest down the Kootenai River and the Columbia River.

name: washington
sentence: Despite these efforts, Britain finally ceded all land claims south of the 49th parallel to the United States in the Oregon Treaty on June 15, 1846.

name: washington
sentence: In 1836, a group of missionaries, including Marcus Whitman, established several missions and the own colony of Whitman Waiilatpu, in what is now the state of southeast Washington, near Walla Walla County, today, on the territory of the Cayuse and Nez Perce Indian tribes.

name: washington
sentence: Whitman's settlement in 1843 would help the Oregon Trail, the land-emigration route to the west, settle for thousands of emigrants in the following decades.

name: washington
sentence: Marcus provided medical care to the Amerindians, but when Indian patients, who did not have immunity from new "European" diseases, died in striking numbers, while at the same time many white patients recovered, they held the "medical man" Marcus Whitman personally responsible, and killed Whitman and twelve other white settlers in the Whitman massacre in 1847.

name: washington
sentence: This event triggered the Cayuse War between colonists and Indians.

name: washington
sentence: Fort Nisqually, a farm and trading post of the Hudson's Bay Company and the first European settlement in the Puget Sound area, was founded in 1833.

name: washington
sentence: Black pioneer George Washington Bush and his Caucasian wife, Isabella James Bush of Missouri and Tennessee, respectively, led four white families into the territory and founded New Market, now Tumwater, in 1846.

name: washington
sentence: They settled in Washington to avoid Oregon's black exclusion law, which prohibits African Americans from entering the country while prohibiting slavery.

name: washington
sentence: After them, many other settlers, who migrated along the Oregon Trail, wandered north to settle in the Puget Sound area.

name: washington
sentence: The growing population of Oregon north of the Columbia River has formally requested a new territory.

name: washington
sentence: Following the Monticello Convention, held today in Cowlitz County, Congress passed a law and President Millard Fillmore signed a law on 2 March 1853, creating a new territory in Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Initially, the border of Washington territory extended more east than that of the present state, including what is now the Idaho Panhandle and parts of western Montana.

name: washington
sentence: The creation of the Idaho territory in 1863 established the last eastern border.

name: washington
sentence: A constitution of the state of Washington was drafted and ratified in 1878, but it was never formally adopted.

name: washington
sentence: Although never approved by Congress, the 1878 constitution is an important historical document that shows the political thinking of the time.

name: washington
sentence: It was widely used in the drafting of the constitution of the state of Washington of 1889, the only official constitution of the state of Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Washington became the 42nd state in the United States on November 11, 1889.

name: washington
sentence: The government's first major industries included agriculture and softwood lumber.

name: washington
sentence: In eastern Washington, the Yakima River Valley is known for its apple orchards, while wheat growth using dry growing techniques has become particularly productive.

name: washington
sentence: Heavy precipitation west of the Cascade chain produces dense forests, and harbours along Puget Sound thrive through the manufacture and shipping of lumber products, particularly Douglas-fir.

name: washington
sentence: Other industries that have developed in the state include fishing, salmon canning and mining.

name: washington
sentence: For a long time Tacoma had large smelters where gold, silver, copper and lead were treated.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle was the main port of trade with Alaska and the rest of the country, and for some time it had a large shipbuilding industry.

name: washington
sentence: The area around the east of Puget Sound developed heavy industry during the period including World War I and World War II, and Boeing became an icon established in the region.

name: washington
sentence: During the Great Depression, a series of hydroelectric dams were built along the Columbia River as part of a project to increase electricity generation.

name: washington
sentence: This culminated in 1941 with the completion of the Grand Coulee Dam, the largest concrete structure in the United States.

name: washington
sentence: During the Second World War, the state focused on the war industries.

name: washington
sentence: Although the Boeing Company produced many heavy bombers, ports in Seattle, Bremerton, Vancouver and Tacoma were available for the manufacture of warships.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle was the starting point for many soldiers in the Pacific, a number of whom were confined to Golden Gardens Park.

name: washington
sentence: In eastern Washington, the Hanford Works nuclear power plant was inaugurated in 1943 and played a major role in building the country's atomic bombs.

name: washington
sentence: On May 18, 1980, following a period of tremor and small eruptions, the north face of Mount St. Helena moved away from the largest landslide in history, before bursting violently, destroying much of the volcano's summit.

name: washington
sentence: The eruption flattened the forest up to 20 km north of the volcano, killed 57 people, flooded the Columbia River and its tributaries with ash and mud, and covered large parts of Washington eastward and other surrounding states in ashes, making the day look like night.

name: washington
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that Washington's population was 7,614,893 on July 1, 2019, an increase of 13.24 per cent over the 2010 census.

name: washington
sentence: In 2018, the state ranked 13th in the total population and was the third most populous, after California and Texas, west of Mississippi.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has the largest population in the Pacific Northwest, followed by Oregon and then Idaho.

name: washington
sentence: The Washington State Financial Management Office has set the population of the state at 7,656,200 as of April 1, 2020.

name: washington
sentence: At the 2010 census, the population of Washington was 6,724,540.

name: washington
sentence: The population of the Seattle-Tacoma-Bellevue metropolitan area was 3,439,809 at the 2010 census, half of the total state.

name: washington
sentence: The centre of the Washington population in 2010 was 47.33°N 121.62°W / 47.33; -121.62, in an unpopulated part of the Cascade Mountains in the eastern rural county of King, southeast of North Bend, northeast of Enumclaw, and west of Snoqualmie Pass.

name: washington
sentence: The proportion of residents under the age of 5 in Washington was 6.7 per cent, and 25.7 per cent, under the age of 18 and 11.2 per cent, 65 years of age or older.

name: washington
sentence: The racial composition of the Washington population in 2016 was as follows:

name: washington
sentence: According to the 2016 U.S. Community Survey, 12.1% of Washington's population were of Hispanic or Latin origin (of any race): Mexican (9.7%), Puerto Rican (0.4%), Cuban (0.1%) and other Hispanic or Latin origin (1.8%).

name: washington
sentence: The five largest ancestry groups were German (17.8 per cent), Irish (10.8 per cent), English (10.4 per cent), Norwegian (5.4 per cent) and American (4.6 per cent).

name: washington
sentence: In 2011, 44.3 per cent of Washington's population under 1 year of age were minorities.

name: washington
sentence: Note: Births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnicity and race, giving a higher overall number.

name: washington
sentence: Although the population of Afro-Americans in the Pacific Northwest is generally low, it is concentrated mainly in areas of the southern tip and central Seattle district and the interior Tacoma.

name: washington
sentence: The Black community of Seattle consisted of an individual in 1858, Manuel Lopes, and grew up to a population of 406 in 1900.

name: washington
sentence: It developed considerably during and after the Second World War when the war industries and the American armed forces employed and recruited tens of thousands of American Africans from the South-East of the United States.

name: washington
sentence: They moved west in the second wave of the Great Migration left a great influence in rock music on the west coast and R&B and soul in the 1960s, including Seattle native Jimi Hendrix, a pioneer of hard rock, who was of African-American and Indian Cherokee origin.

name: washington
sentence: The Amerindians lived on Indian reserves or on legal lands such as the Colville Indian Reserve, Makah Indian Reserve, Muckleshoot Indian Reserve, Quinault Indian Reserve, Salish, Spokane Indian Reserve and Yakama Indian Reserve.

name: washington
sentence: The western and Pacific coasts are dominated by American Indian communities such as Chinook, Lummi and Salish.

name: washington
sentence: Since the end of World War II, urban Indian communities formed by the relocation programs of the United States Bureau of Indian Affairs in Seattle have brought various Amerindian peoples to this diverse metropolis.

name: washington
sentence: The city was named in honour of Chief Seattle in the early 1850s when European Americans established the sound.

name: washington
sentence: Asia's Americans and Pacific Islanders are concentrated primarily in the state's Seattle-Tacoma metropolitan area.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle, Bellevue and Redmond, all in King County, have important Chinese communities (including Taiwanese), as well as important Indian and Japanese communities.

name: washington
sentence: The Chinatown-International district in Seattle has a historical Chinese population dating back to the 1860s, which mainly emigrated from Guangdong province to southern China, and which is home to a diverse community in East and South-East Asia.

name: washington
sentence: Koreans are heavily concentrated in the suburban cities of Federal Way and Auburn in the south, and Lynnwood in the north.

name: washington
sentence: Tacoma is home to thousands of Cambodians and has one of the largest Cambodian and American communities in the United States, as well as Long Beach, California, and Lowell, Massachusetts.

name: washington
sentence: The Vietnamese and Filipino populations of Washington are mainly concentrated in the Seattle metropolitan area.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has the second highest percentage of Pacific Islanders in the continental United States (behind Utah); the Seattle-Tacoma region is home to more than 15,000 people of Samoan ancestry, mainly residing in southeastern Seattle, Tacoma, Federal Way and SeaTac.

name: washington
sentence: The most numerous (ethnic, non-racial, group) are the 11 per cent Latinos, as Mexican Americans form a large ethnic group in the Chehalis Valley, the agricultural areas of the Yakima Valley and the east of Washington.

name: washington
sentence: They were reported at least until the 1800s.

name: washington
sentence: But it was at the end of the 20th century that large-scale Mexican immigration and other Latinos settled in the southern suburbs of Seattle, with limited concentrations in the counties of King, Pierce and Snohomish during the booms in the area's real estate construction in the 1980s and 1990s.

name: washington
sentence: In addition, Washington has a large Ethiopian community, with many Eritrean residents as well.

name: washington
sentence: Both appeared in the late 1960s and have developed since 1980.

name: washington
sentence: There are an estimated 30,000 Somali immigrants residing in the Seattle area.

name: washington
sentence: In 2010, 82.51 per cent (5,060,313) of Washington residents aged 5 and over spoke English at home as a primary language, while 7.79% (477,566) spoke Spanish, 1.19% (72,552) Chinese (which includes Cantonese and Mandarin), 0.94% (57,895) Vietnamese, 0.84% (51,301) Tagalog, 0.83% (50,757) Korean, 0.80% (49,282) Russian and German, 0.55% (33,744).

name: washington
sentence: A total of 17.49% (1,073,002) of Washington's population aged 5 and over spoke a mother tongue other than English.

name: washington
sentence: The main religious affiliations of the Washington people are:

name: washington
sentence: The largest denominations by number of adherents in 2010 were the Roman Catholic Church, with 784 332; the Church of Jesus Christ of the last-day saints, with 282 356; and the Assemblies of God, with 125 005.

name: washington
sentence: Aquarian Tabernacle Church is the largest wiccan church in the country.

name: washington
sentence: Like other West Coast states, the percentage of Washington's population that identifies as "non-religious" is higher than the national average.

name: washington
sentence: The percentage of non-religious people in Washington is one of the highest in the United States.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has a relatively strong economy, with a total gross domestic product of $569.449 billion in 2018, placing it 10th in the country and increasing by 5.7 percent per year – the fastest rate in the United States.

name: washington
sentence: The minimum wage on January 1, 2020 was $13.50 per hour, the second highest in any state or district in the country behind Washington D.C. at $14 per hour.

name: washington
sentence: Important government activities include the design and manufacture of aircraft (Boeing), automobiles (Paccar), computer software (Microsoft, Bungie, Amazon, Nintendo of America, Valve, ArenaNet), telecommunications (T-Mobile US), electronics, biotechnology, aluminum, lumber and wood products (Weyerhaeuser), mining, beverages (Starbucks, Jones Soda), real estate (John L. Scott, Colliers International, Windermere Real Estate, Kidder Mathews), retail (Nordstrom, Eddie Bauer, Car Toys, Costco, R.E.I.

name: washington
sentence: ) and tourism (Alaska Airlines, Expedia, Inc.).

name: washington
sentence: A survey of Fortune magazine of the 20 largest companies admired in the United States has four companies based in Washington: Amazon, Starbucks, Microsoft and Costco.

name: washington
sentence: At more than 80 per cent, the state has large amounts of hydroelectric power.

name: washington
sentence: In addition, large quantities of trade with Asia transit through the ports of the Puget Sound, leading to a ranking number six of the U.S. ports (the ranking combines the displaced 20-foot equivalent units (EUTs) and the infrastructure index).

name: washington
sentence: With the adoption of the 1183 Initiative, the Washington State Liquor Control Board (WSLCB) ended its monopoly on the distribution of beverages and liquor stores throughout the state on 1 June 2012.

name: washington
sentence: Among the billionaires resident in Washington, in December 2017, were both the first and second richest people in the world: Jeff Bezos of Amazon, with a net value of $99.6 billion, and Bill Gates of Microsoft, at $91.3 billion.

name: washington
sentence: In April 2014, other billionaires from Washington State included Microsoft's Paul Allen, Steve Ballmer, and Charles Simonyi, and Craig McCaw of McCaw Cellular Communications, James Jannard of Oakley, and Howard Schultz of Starbucks.

name: washington
sentence: In December 2018, the state unemployment rate was 4.3%.

name: washington
sentence: The State of Washington is one of seven states that do not levy personal income tax.

name: washington
sentence: The Crown also does not collect corporate income tax or tax on deductibles.

name: washington
sentence: Washington companies are responsible for various other government levies, including business and occupation tax (B & O), a gross revenue tax that imposes variable rates for different types of businesses.

name: washington
sentence: The Washington State sales tax is 6.5%, which is combined with a local sales tax that varies by locality.

name: washington
sentence: The combined rates of State sales tax and local retail sales tax increase the taxes paid by consumers, depending on the variable rates of local sales tax, usually between 7.5% and 10%.

name: washington
sentence: In March 2017, the combined sales tax rate in Seattle and Tacoma was 10.1%.

name: washington
sentence: The cities of Lynnwood and Mill Creek have the highest sales tax rate in the state at 10.5%.

name: washington
sentence: These taxes apply to both services and products.

name: washington
sentence: Most foods are exempt from sales tax.

name: washington
sentence: However, prepared foods, food supplements and soft drinks remain taxable.

name: washington
sentence: An excise tax applies to certain products such as gasoline, cigarettes and alcoholic beverages.

name: washington
sentence: Property tax was the first tax levied in Washington State, and its collection accounts for about 30 per cent of the total revenue of Washington State and local governments.

name: washington
sentence: It continues to be the main source of income for public schools, fire protection, libraries, parks and recreation, and other special-purpose districts.

name: washington
sentence: All real and personal property is subject to tax, unless specifically exempted by law.

name: washington
sentence: Most personal property owned by individuals is exempt from tax.

name: washington
sentence: The personal property tax applies to movable property used in the conduct of a business or to other personal property not exempt by law.

name: washington
sentence: All property taxes are paid to the treasurer's office in the county where the property is located.

name: washington
sentence: Washington does not impose taxes on intangible assets such as bank accounts, shares or bonds.

name: washington
sentence: The State also does not assess the tax on retirement income earned and received from another State.

name: washington
sentence: Washington does not collect taxes on estates.

name: washington
sentence: However, estate tax is decoupled from federal estate tax laws and, as a result, the Crown imposes its own estate tax.

name: washington
sentence: The state of Washington has the 18th highest effective per capita tax rate in the United States in 2017.

name: washington
sentence: Their tax policy differs from that of neighbouring Oregon, which does not collect any sales tax, but imposes a personal income tax.

name: washington
sentence: This leads to border economic anomalies in the metropolitan area of Portland-Vancouver.

name: washington
sentence: There are other border economies with British Columbia and Idaho.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is a leading agricultural state.

name: washington
sentence: The following figures are provided by the State Department of Agriculture in Washington and the USDA, National Agricultural Statistics Service, Washington Field Office.

name: washington
sentence: For 2013, the total value of Washington's agricultural products was $10.2 billion.In 2013, Washington ranked first among the countries producing red raspberries (92.7% of total U.S. production), hops (79.2%), spearmint oil (72.9%), wrinkled seed peas (60 %), apples (57%), sweet cherries (50.9%), pears (49.5%), Concord grapes (36.5%), carrots for processing (36.5%), green peas for processing (34.4%) and peppermint oil (31.4%).

name: washington
sentence: Washington is also the second largest producer of autumn potatoes (one quarter of domestic production), nectarines, apricots, grapes (all varieties), sweet corn for processing (one quarter of domestic production) and summer onions (one fifth of domestic production).

name: washington
sentence: The apple industry is of particular importance to Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Due to the favourable climate of dry and hot summers and cold winters in central Washington, the state has led the United States in apple production since the 1920s.

name: washington
sentence: Two regions account for the vast majority of state apple cultivation: the Wenatchee-Okanogan region (including Chelan, Okanogan, Douglas, and Grant counties) and the Yakima region (including Yakima, Benton, and Kittitas counties).

name: washington
sentence: Washington produces seven main varieties of apples that are exported to more than sixty countries.

name: washington
sentence: Washington ranks second in the United States in wine production, behind only California.

name: washington
sentence: In 2006, the State had more than 31,000 acres (130 km2) of vineyards, a harvest of 120,000 short tons of grapes (109,000 t) and exports to more than forty countries around the world from the state's 600 wineries.

name: washington
sentence: Although there are some wine-growing activities in the coldest, the western half of the state is wetter, almost all (99%) of the wine grape production takes place in the eastern half of the desert.

name: washington
sentence: The rain shadow of the Cascade chain leaves the Columbia River basin with about 8 inches (200 mm) of annual rain falling, making irrigation and water rights of paramount interest to the Washington wine industry.

name: washington
sentence: Viticulture in the state is also influenced by long hours of sun (on average, two more hours per day than in California during the growing season) and constant temperatures.

name: washington
sentence: As of December 2014, 124 broadband service providers offer services to the state of Washington; 93% of consumers have access to broadband speeds of 25/3Mbit/s or more.

name: washington
sentence: From 2009 to 2014, the Washington State broadband project received $7.3 million in federal grants, but the program was discontinued in 2014.

name: washington
sentence: In terms of infrastructure, an additional $166 million has been provided since 2011 for broadband infrastructure projects in Washington State.

name: washington
sentence: US News & World Report ranked Washington 2nd nationally for household Internet access, and 6th for online download speed, based on 2014 and 2015 data.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has a state highway system called State Roads, as well as a vast ferry network that is the largest in the nation and the third largest in the world.

name: washington
sentence: There are 140 public airfields in Washington, including 16 public airports owned by the Washington State Department of Transportation.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle-Tacoma International Airport (Sea-Tac) is the main commercial airport in the major city of Seattle.

name: washington
sentence: Boeing Field in Seattle is one of the busiest primary airports in the United States.

name: washington
sentence: There are extensive waterways around Washington's largest cities, including Seattle, Bellevue, Tacoma and Olympia.

name: washington
sentence: Public roads include an extensive network of bridges and the largest ferry network in the United States to meet transportation needs in the Puget Sound area.

name: washington
sentence: The Washington Seaway is a fleet of twenty-eight ferries operating on Puget Sound and its inland waterways up to 20 different ports of call, making nearly 147,000 sails each year.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is home to four of the world's five longest floating bridges: the Evergreen Point Floating Bridge, the Lacey V. Murrow Memorial Bridge, and the Homer M. Hadley Memorial Bridge over Lake Washington, and the Hood Canal Bridge between the Olympic Peninsula and the Kitsap Peninsula.

name: washington
sentence: Among its most famous bridges is the Tacoma Narrows Bridge, which collapsed in 1940 and was rebuilt.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has several seaports on the Pacific Ocean, including Seattle, Tacoma, Kalama, Anacortes, Vancouver, Longview, Grays Harbor, Olympia and Port Angeles.

name: washington
sentence: The Cascade mountain range also impedes transport.

name: washington
sentence: Washington operates and maintains roads on seven major mountain passes and eight minor passes.

name: washington
sentence: During the winter months, some of these passes are ploughed, sanded and protected from avalanches.

name: washington
sentence: Not all remain open during the winter.

name: washington
sentence: The North Cascades Highway, State Route 20, closes every year due to snowfall and avalanches in the Washington Pass area.

name: washington
sentence: The Cayuse and Chinook pass east of Mount Rainier also close in winter.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is crossed by a number of freight railways, and the Amtrak Cascade passenger route between Eugene, Oregon and Vancouver, B.C. is the eighth busiest Amtrak service on the US Seattle King Street Station, Washington's busiest station, and the 15th busiest in the United States, serves as a terminus for the two long-distance Amtrak routes in Washington, the Empire Builder in Chicago and the Coast Starlight in Los Angeles.

name: washington
sentence: Sounder commuter rail service operates in Seattle and surrounding cities between Everett and Lakewood.

name: washington
sentence: The long distance network includes the Cascade Tunnel, the longest rail tunnel in the United States, which is part of the Stevens Pass on the BNSF Northern Transcom.

name: washington
sentence: The Sound Transit Link light train is currently operating in the Seattle area 32 km long and in Tacoma 2.6 km long.

name: washington
sentence: The entire system has a funded expansion plan that will extend the light rail to a total of 116 miles by 2041.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle also has a 6.1 km tram network with two lines and plans for further expansion by 2025.

name: washington
sentence: Bus systems exist across the state, the busiest being King County Metro, located in Seattle and King County, with just over 122 million runners in 2017.

name: washington
sentence: Vancouver residents resisted proposals to expand the transit system from Portland to Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Hanford Nuclear Reservation is currently the most contaminated nuclear site in the United States and is the object of the largest environmental clean-up in the country.

name: washington
sentence: Radioactive materials are known to leak from Hanford into the environment.

name: washington
sentence: In 2007, Washington became the first state in the country to target all forms of highly toxic brominated flame retardants known as PBDEs with a view to eliminating the many common household products in which they are used.

name: washington
sentence: A 2004 study of 40 mothers in Oregon, Washington, British Columbia and Montana found PBDEs in the breast milk of each woman tested.

name: washington
sentence: Three recent studies by the Washington State Department of Ecology have shown that toxic chemicals banned decades ago linger in the environment and are concentrated in the food chain.

name: washington
sentence: In one of these studies, state government scientists found unacceptable levels of toxic substances in 93 freshwater fish samples from 45 sites.

name: washington
sentence: Toxic substances included PCBs, dioxins, two chlorinated pesticides, DDE, dieldrin and PBDEs.

name: washington
sentence: As a result of the study, the Department will investigate sources of PCBs in the Wenatchee River, where unhealthy concentrations of PCBs have been found in mountain whitefish.

name: washington
sentence: Based on 2007 information and an ecological study conducted in 2004, the Washington State Department of Health advises the public not to eat mountain whitefish from the Wenatchee River, from Lavenworth downstream to the point where the river reaches Colombia, due to unsafe levels of PCBs.

name: washington
sentence: The results of the study also showed high levels of contaminants in fish tissues collected by scientists in Lake Washington and the Spokane River, where fish consumption advisories are already in effect.

name: washington
sentence: On March 27, 2006, Governor Christine Gregoire signed the recently approved Bill 2322.

name: washington
sentence: This bill would limit the phosphorus content of detergents to dishes throughout the state to 0.5 per cent over the next six years.

name: washington
sentence: Although the ban was effective throughout the state in 2010, it would take place in Whatcom County, Spokane County and Clark County in 2008.

name: washington
sentence: A recent discovery has associated a high phosphorus content in water with a boom in the algal population.

name: washington
sentence: An invasive amount of algae in water bodies would lead to a variety of excessive ecological and technological problems.

name: washington
sentence: The executive branch of Washington is headed by a Governor elected for a four-year term.

name: washington
sentence: The current state-wide elected representatives are:

name: washington
sentence: The bicameral legislature of the state of Washington is the legislative power of the state.

name: washington
sentence: The State Parliament is composed of a lower House of Representatives and a higher Senate of State.

name: washington
sentence: The state is divided into 49 legislative districts of equal population, each electing two representatives and one senator.

name: washington
sentence: Representatives have a two-year term, while senators have a four-year term.

name: washington
sentence: There is no time limit.

name: washington
sentence: The Democratic Party has a majority in the House and Senate.

name: washington
sentence: The Washington Supreme Court is the highest court in the state.

name: washington
sentence: Nine judges sit on the bench and are elected State-wide.

name: washington
sentence: The two current US senators in Washington are Patty Murray and Maria Cantwell, the two Democrats.

name: washington
sentence: Murray has been representing the state since 1993, while Cantwell was first elected in 2001.

name: washington
sentence: The state is one of four with two women senators.

name: washington
sentence: The ten representatives of Washington in the United States House of Representatives (see map of the districts) from the 2020 election were Suzan DelBene (D-1), Rick Larsen (D-2), Jaime Herrera Beutler (R-3), Dan Newhouse (R-4), Cathy McMorris Rodgers (R-5), Derek Kilmer (D-6), Pramila Jayapal (D-7), Kim Schrier (D-8), Adam Smith (D-9) and Marilyn Strickland (D-10).

name: washington
sentence: As a result of the reshuffle of Congress following the 2010 census, Washington obtained a seat in the United States House of Representatives.

name: washington
sentence: With an additional seat, Washington also obtained an electoral vote, bringing its total to 12.

name: washington
sentence: The state is generally considered politically divided by the Cascade Mountains, with the west of Washington being liberal (especially Corridor I-5) and the east of Washington being conservative.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has voted for the democratic presidential candidate in every election since 1988.

name: washington
sentence: Because of the large population in Western Washington, Democrats are generally doing better at the state level.

name: washington
sentence: The combined Seattle statistical area, home to nearly two-thirds of Washington's population, generally offers stronger democratic margins than most other parts of western Washington.

name: washington
sentence: This is particularly true in King County, where Seattle and nearly a third of the state's population are located.

name: washington
sentence: Washington was considered a pivotal state in 1968, and it was the only Western state to give its electoral votes to democratic candidate Hubert Humphrey over his Republican opponent Richard Nixon.

name: washington
sentence: Washington was considered a part of the 1994 Republican Revolution and had the largest pick-up in the house for the Republicans, who took seven of the nine seats in the Washington House.

name: washington
sentence: However, this domination did not last long, since the Democrats took a seat in the 1996 elections and two in 1998, giving the Democrats a majority of 5 to 4.

name: washington
sentence: The position of Governor is held by Democratic Jay Inslee, who was elected in his first term in the 2012 elections.

name: washington
sentence: In 2013 and 2014, the two chambers of the Washington State Legislative Assembly (the Washington Senate and the Washington House of Representatives) were controlled by the Democrats.

name: washington
sentence: The State Senate was under Republican control, due to the accession of two Republican Democrats to form the caucus of the majority coalition.

name: washington
sentence: After the 2014 elections, the Democrats retained control of the House, while the Republicans took a majority in the Senate without the need for a coalition.

name: washington
sentence: In November 2017, a special election gave the Democrats a majority of one seat in the Senate and total control over the state government.

name: washington
sentence: Since then, in the 2018 elections, the Democrats have only expanded their majorities.

name: washington
sentence: No state has gone any longer without a Republican governor than Washington.

name: washington
sentence: The Democrats have controlled the Governor of Washington's Mansion for 36 years; the last Republican governor is John Spellman, who left office in 1985.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has not voted for a Republican senator, governor, or presidential candidate since 1994, linking Delaware for the longest series in the country.

name: washington
sentence: Washington uses the general non-partisan primary system after the 872 Initiative was approved in 2004.

name: washington
sentence: All candidates run in the same ballot in the primary election and the first two candidates advance in the November general election, regardless of party membership.

name: washington
sentence: This resulted in several general election matches for the same party.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is one of three states that has legalized assisted suicide.

name: washington
sentence: In 2008, the Washington Death with Dignity Act was passed and became law.

name: washington
sentence: In November 2009, voters in Washington approved comprehensive national partnerships through referendum 71, marking the first time that voters in any state more widely recognize same-sex relations in the ballot box.

name: washington
sentence: Three years later, in November 2012, same-sex marriage was confirmed by referendum 74, making Washington one of the only three states to have approved same-sex marriage by popular vote.

name: washington
sentence: Also in November 2012, Washington was one of the first two states to approve the sale and legal possession of cannabis for both recreational uses with the 502 Initiative.

name: washington
sentence: Although marijuana is still illegal under U.S. federal law, people 21 years of age and older in Washington State can own up to one ounce of marijuana, 16 ounces of solid marijuana products, 72 ounces of liquid marijuana products, or any combination of the three, and legally consume marijuana and marijuana products.

name: washington
sentence: In November 2016, voters approved the 1433 Initiative, which requires employers to guarantee sick leave with pay to most workers.

name: washington
sentence: On January 1, 2018, the law came into force, with Washington becoming the seventh state with paid sick leave.

name: washington
sentence: With the adoption of the 1639 Initiative in the 2018 elections, Washington passed stricter firearms laws.

name: washington
sentence: Washington enacted in May 2019 a measure in favour of sanctuary cities, similar to the laws of California and Oregon, which are among the strongest state-wide mandates in the nation.

name: washington
sentence: In 2019, legislators passed the Clean Energy Transformation Act, which requires that all electricity sales come from zero carbon sources by 2045 and zero net by 2030.

name: washington
sentence: During the 2008-2009 school year, 1,040,750 students were enrolled in primary and secondary schools in Washington, D.C., and 59,562 teachers were employed to educate them.

name: washington
sentence: As of August 2009, there were 295 school districts in the State, served by nine districts of educational services.

name: washington
sentence: The Washington School Information Processing Cooperative provides information management systems for financial and human resources and student data.

name: washington
sentence: Primary and secondary schools are under the jurisdiction of the Washington State Office of the Superintendent of Public Education (OSPI).

name: washington
sentence: High school students and the elderly in Washington have the opportunity to use the state's Running Start program.

name: washington
